the fulton county grand jury said friday an investigation of atlanta ' s recent primary election produced `` no evidence ' ' that any irregularities took place .	75.244156
the jury further said in term-end presentments that the city executive committee , which had over-all charge of the election , `` deserves the praise and thanks of the city of atlanta ' ' for the manner in which the election was conducted .	55.813786
the september-october term jury had been charged by fulton superior court judge durwood pye to investigate reports of possible `` irregularities ' ' in the hard-fought primary which was won by mayor-nominate ivan allen jr . .	30.908485
`` only a relative handful of such reports was received ' ' , the jury said , `` considering the widespread interest in the election , the number of voters and the size of this city ' ' .	35.943478
the jury said it did find that many of georgia ' s registration and election laws `` are outmoded or inadequate and often ambiguous ' ' .	45.65082
it recommended that fulton legislators act `` to have these laws studied and revised to the end of modernizing and improving them ' ' .	69.62552
the grand jury commented on a number of other topics , among them the atlanta and fulton county purchasing departments which it said `` are well operated and follow generally accepted practices which inure to the best interest of both governments ' ' .	115.64972
however , the jury said it believes `` these two offices should be combined to achieve greater efficiency and reduce the cost of administration ' ' .	60.64144
the city purchasing department , the jury said , `` is lacking in experienced clerical personnel as a result of city personnel policies ' ' .	56.827507
it urged that the city `` take steps to remedy ' ' this problem .	33.072838
implementation of georgia ' s automobile title law was also recommended by the outgoing jury .	48.90071
it urged that the next legislature `` provide enabling funds and re-set the effective date so that an orderly implementation of the law may be effected ' ' .	45.216835
the grand jury took a swipe at the state welfare department ' s handling of federal funds granted for child welfare services in foster homes .	64.76985
`` this is one of the major items in the fulton county general assistance program ' ' , the jury said , but the state welfare department `` has seen fit to distribute these funds through the welfare departments of all the counties in the state with the exception of fulton county , which receives none of this money .	40.57115
the jurors said they realize `` a proportionate distribution of these funds might disable this program in our less populous counties ' ' .	129.75763
nevertheless , `` we feel that in the future fulton county should receive some portion of these available funds ' ' , the jurors said .	59.8533
`` failure to do this will continue to place a disproportionate burden ' ' on fulton taxpayers .	118.16532
the jury also commented on the fulton ordinary ' s court which has been under fire for its practices in the appointment of appraisers , guardians and administrators and the awarding of fees and compensation .	44.55523
the jury said it found the court `` has incorporated into its operating procedures the recommendations ' ' of two previous grand juries , the atlanta bar association and an interim citizens committee .	103.97136
`` these actions should serve to protect in fact and in effect the court ' s wards from undue costs and its appointed and elected servants from unmeritorious criticisms ' ' , the jury said .	65.77361
regarding atlanta ' s new multi-million-dollar airport , the jury recommended `` that when the new management takes charge jan . 1 the airport be operated in a manner that will eliminate political influences ' ' .	85.720314
the jury did not elaborate , but it added that `` there should be periodic surveillance of the pricing practices of the concessionaires for the purpose of keeping the prices reasonable ' ' .	65.588234
on other matters , the jury recommended that ( 1 )	11.285671
four additional deputies be employed at the fulton county jail and `` a doctor , medical intern or extern be employed for night and weekend duty at the jail ' ' .	54.4401
fulton legislators `` work with city officials to pass enabling legislation that will permit the establishment of a fair and equitable ' ' pension plan for city employes .	50.396255
the jury praised the administration and operation of the atlanta police department , the fulton tax commissioner ' s office , the bellwood and alpharetta prison farms , grady hospital and the fulton health department .	52.61934
mayor william b . hartsfield filed suit for divorce from his wife , pearl williams hartsfield , in fulton superior court friday .	100.14903
the couple was married aug . 2 , 1913 .	23.107246
they have a son , william berry jr . , and a daughter , mrs . j . m . cheshire of griffin .	14.788055
attorneys for the mayor said that an amicable property settlement has been agreed upon .	110.43686
the petition listed the mayor ' s occupation as `` attorney ' ' and his age as 71 .	61.095295
it listed his wife ' s age as 74 and place of birth as opelika , ala . .	87.50595
the petition said that the couple has not lived together as man and wife for more than a year .	64.35182
the hartsfield home is at 637 e . pelham rd . aj .	14.803213
henry l . bowden was listed on the petition as the mayor ' s attorney .	18.223255
hartsfield has been mayor of atlanta , with exception of one brief interlude , since 1937 .	176.49939
his political career goes back to his election to city council in 1923 .	95.628784
the mayor ' s present term of office expires jan . 1 .	8.843911
he will be succeeded by ivan allen jr . , who became a candidate in the sept . 13 primary after mayor hartsfield announced that he would not run for reelection .	29.446182
georgia republicans are getting strong encouragement to enter a candidate in the 1962 governor ' s race , a top official said wednesday .	74.241936
robert snodgrass , state gop chairman , said a meeting held tuesday night in blue ridge brought enthusiastic responses from the audience .	88.05264
state party chairman james w . dorsey added that enthusiasm was picking up for a state rally to be held sept . 8 in savannah at which newly elected texas sen . john tower will be the featured speaker .	59.196537
in the blue ridge meeting , the audience was warned that entering a candidate for governor would force it to take petitions out into voting precincts to obtain the signatures of registered voters .	112.449005
despite the warning , there was a unanimous vote to enter a candidate , according to republicans who attended .	86.4005
when the crowd was asked whether it wanted to wait one more term to make the race , it voted no -- and there were no dissents .	103.46586
the largest hurdle the republicans would have to face is a state law which says that before making a first race , one of two alternative courses must be taken 1	195.28477
five per cent of the voters in each county must sign petitions requesting that the republicans be allowed to place names of candidates on the general election ballot , or 2	101.81471
the republicans must hold a primary under the county unit system -- a system which the party opposes in its platform .	93.15547
sam caldwell , state highway department public relations director , resigned tuesday to work for lt . gov . garland byrd ' s campaign .	32.892525
caldwell ' s resignation had been expected for some time .	23.561783
he will be succeeded by rob ledford of gainesville , who has been an assistant more than three years .	30.845404
when the gubernatorial campaign starts , caldwell is expected to become a campaign coordinator for byrd .	65.88348
the georgia legislature will wind up its 1961 session monday and head for home -- where some of the highway bond money it approved will follow shortly .	224.52524
before adjournment monday afternoon , the senate is expected to approve a study of the number of legislators allotted to rural and urban areas to determine what adjustments should be made .	31.922352
gov . vandiver is expected to make the traditional visit to both chambers as they work toward adjournment .	132.1736
vandiver likely will mention the $100 million highway bond issue approved earlier in the session as his first priority item .	128.80539
meanwhile , it was learned the state highway department is very near being ready to issue the first $30 million worth of highway reconstruction bonds .	128.91838
the bond issue will go to the state courts for a friendly test suit to test the validity of the act , and then the sales will begin and contracts let for repair work on some of georgia ' s most heavily traveled highways .	92.89238
a highway department source said there also is a plan there to issue some $3 million to $4 million worth of rural roads authority bonds for rural road construction work .	95.024734
the department apparently intends to make the rural roads authority a revolving fund under which new bonds would be issued every time a portion of the old ones are paid off by tax authorities .	145.34334
vandiver opened his race for governor in 1958 with a battle in the legislature against the issuance of $50 million worth of additional rural roads bonds proposed by then gov . marvin griffin .	51.072384
the highway department source told the constitution , however , that vandiver has not been consulted yet about the plans to issue the new rural roads bonds .	131.5441
schley county rep . b . d . pelham will offer a resolution monday in the house to rescind the body ' s action of friday in voting itself a $10 per day increase in expense allowances .	124.87925
pelham said sunday night there was research being done on whether the `` quickie ' ' vote on the increase can be repealed outright or whether notice would have to first be given that reconsideration of the action would be sought .	109.5976
while emphasizing that technical details were not fully worked out , pelham said his resolution would seek to set aside the privilege resolution which the house voted through 87-31 .	140.02568
a similar resolution passed in the senate by a vote of 29-5 .	21.84242
as of sunday night , there was no word of a resolution being offered there to rescind the action .	150.86374
pelham pointed out that georgia voters last november rejected a constitutional amendment to allow legislators to vote on pay raises for future legislature sessions .	135.8554
a veteran jackson county legislator will ask the georgia house monday to back federal aid to education , something it has consistently opposed in the past .	162.02026
rep . mac barber of commerce is asking the house in a privilege resolution to `` endorse increased federal support for public education , provided that such funds be received and expended ' ' as state funds .	106.63223
barber , who is in his 13th year as a legislator , said there `` are some members of our congressional delegation in washington who would like to see it ( the resolution ) passed ' ' .	80.48306
but he added that none of georgia ' s congressmen specifically asked him to offer the resolution .	61.919838
the resolution , which barber tossed into the house hopper friday , will be formally read monday .	310.64365
it says that `` in the event congress does provide this increase in federal funds ' ' , the state board of education should be directed to `` give priority ' ' to teacher pay raises .	59.256237
-- after a long , hot controversy , miller county has a new school superintendent , elected , as a policeman put it , in the `` coolest election i ever saw in this county ' ' .	56.00437
the new school superintendent is harry davis , a veteran agriculture teacher , who defeated felix bush , a school principal and chairman of the miller county democratic executive committee .	51.067394
davis received 1 , 119 votes in saturday ' s election , and bush got 402 .	90.11621
ordinary carey williams , armed with a pistol , stood by at the polls to insure order .	179.57909
`` this was the coolest , calmest election i ever saw ' ' , colquitt policeman tom williams said .	32.01296
`` being at the polls was just like being at church .	165.99188
i didn ' t smell a drop of liquor , and we didn ' t have a bit of trouble ' ' .	13.500322
the campaign leading to the election was not so quiet , however .	147.32079
it was marked by controversy , anonymous midnight phone calls and veiled threats of violence .	52.561176
the former county school superintendent , george p . callan , shot himself to death march 18 , four days after he resigned his post in a dispute with the county school board .	55.704556
during the election campaign , both candidates , davis and bush , reportedly received anonymous telephone calls .	91.87979
ordinary williams said he , too , was subjected to anonymous calls soon after he scheduled the election .	221.38046
many local citizens feared that there would be irregularities at the polls , and williams got himself a permit to carry a gun and promised an orderly election .	143.0913
sheriff felix tabb said the ordinary apparently made good his promise .	224.38716
`` everything went real smooth ' ' , the sheriff said .	22.77908
`` there wasn ' t a bit of trouble ' ' .	11.382192
-- committee approval of gov . price daniel ' s `` abandoned property ' ' act seemed certain thursday despite the adamant protests of texas bankers .	173.68481
daniel personally led the fight for the measure , which he had watered down considerably since its rejection by two previous legislatures , in a public hearing before the house committee on revenue and taxation .	79.49797
under committee rules , it went automatically to a subcommittee for one week .	61.830593
but questions with which committee members taunted bankers appearing as witnesses left little doubt that they will recommend passage of it .	125.43146
daniel termed `` extremely conservative ' ' his estimate that it would produce 17 million dollars to help erase an anticipated deficit of 63 million dollars at the end of the current fiscal year next aug . 31 .	40.617752
he told the committee the measure would merely provide means of enforcing the escheat law which has been on the books `` since texas was a republic ' ' .	90.21854
it permits the state to take over bank accounts , stocks and other personal property of persons missing for seven years or more .	121.68659
the bill , which daniel said he drafted personally , would force banks , insurance firms , pipeline companies and other corporations to report such property to the state treasurer .	94.342186
the escheat law cannot be enforced now because it is almost impossible to locate such property , daniel declared .	65.1574
dewey lawrence , a tyler lawyer representing the texas bankers association , sounded the opposition keynote when he said it would force banks to violate their contractual obligations with depositors and undermine the confidence of bank customers .	90.6904
`` if you destroy confidence in banks , you do something to the economy ' ' , he said .	13.75188
`` you take out of circulation many millions of dollars ' ' .	5.0988173
rep . charles e . hughes of sherman , sponsor of the bill , said a failure to enact it would amount `` to making a gift out of the taxpayers ' pockets to banks , insurance and pipeline companies ' ' .	55.847195
his contention was denied by several bankers , including scott hudson of sherman , gaynor b . jones of houston , j . b . brady of harlingen and howard cox of austin .	32.14814
cox argued that the bill is `` probably unconstitutional ' ' since , he said , it would impair contracts .	41.974594
he also complained that not enough notice was given on the hearing , since the bill was introduced only last monday .	67.25593
-- senators unanimously approved thursday the bill of sen . george parkhouse of dallas authorizing establishment of day schools for the deaf in dallas and the four other largest counties .	58.9262
the bill is designed to provide special schooling for more deaf students in the scholastic age at a reduced cost to the state .	50.357567
there was no debate as the senate passed the bill on to the house .	34.55004
it would authorize the texas education agency to establish county-wide day schools for the deaf in counties of 300 , 000 or more population , require deaf children between 6 and 13 years of age to attend the day schools , permitting older ones to attend the residential texas school for the deaf here .	74.7117
operating budget for the day schools in the five counties of dallas , harris , bexar , tarrant and el paso would be $451 , 500 , which would be a savings of $157 , 460 yearly after the first year ' s capital outlay of $88 , 000 was absorbed , parkhouse told the senate .	46.826004
the tea estimated there would be 182 scholastics to attend the day school in dallas county , saving them from coming to austin to live in the state deaf school .	60.83265
dallas may get to hear a debate on horse race parimutuels soon between reps . v . e . ( red ) berry and joe ratcliff .	57.438152
while details are still to be worked out , ratcliff said he expects to tell home folks in dallas why he thinks berry ' s proposed constitutional amendment should be rejected .	123.71149
`` we ' re getting more ' pro ' letters than ' con ' on horse race betting ' ' , said ratcliff .	71.41415
`` but i believe if people were better informed on this question , most of them would oppose it also .	77.17205
i ' m willing to stake my political career on it ' ' .	17.425589
rep . berry , an ex-gambler from san antonio , got elected on his advocacy of betting on the ponies .	76.2015
a house committee which heard his local option proposal is expected to give it a favorable report , although the resolution faces hard sledding later .	82.486595
the house passed finally , and sent to the senate , a bill extending the state health department ' s authority to give planning assistance to cities .	50.787777
the senate quickly whipped through its meager fare of house bills approved by committees , passing the three on the calendar .	137.24913
another enlarged authority of the beaumont navigation district .	3.8855357
the third amended the enabling act for creation of the lamar county hospital district , for which a special constitutional amendment previously was adopted .	116.55411
without dissent , senators passed a bill by sen . a . r . schwartz of galveston authorizing establishment in the future of a school for the mentally retarded in the gulf coast district .	35.72253
money for its construction will be sought later on but in the meantime the state hospital board can accept gifts and donations of a site .	137.73003
one , by sen . louis crump of san saba , would aid more than 17 , 000 retailers who pay a group of miscellaneous excise taxes by eliminating the requirement that each return be notarized .	63.348675
instead , retailers would sign a certificate of correctness , violation of which would carry a penalty of one to five years in prison , plus a $1 , 000 fine .	46.25571
it was one of a series of recommendations by the texas research league .	88.485535
the other bill , by sen . a . m . aikin jr . of paris , would relieve real estate brokers , who pay their own annual licensing fee , from the $12 annual occupation license on brokers in such as stocks and bonds .	49.751087
natural gas public utility companies would be given the right of eminent domain , under a bill by sen . frank owen 3 , of el paso , to acquire sites for underground storage reservoirs for gas .	83.928635
marshall formby of plainview , former chairman of the texas highway commission , suggested a plan to fill by appointment future vacancies in the legislature and congress , eliminating the need for costly special elections .	82.77126
under formby ' s plan , an appointee would be selected by a board composed of the governor , lieutenant governor , speaker of the house , attorney general and chief justice of the texas supreme court .	28.824862
-- state representatives decided thursday against taking a poll on what kind of taxes texans would prefer to pay .	133.49773
an adverse vote of 81 to 65 kept in the state affairs committee a bill which would order the referendum on the april 4 ballot , when texas votes on a u . s . senator .	58.054947
rep . wesley roberts of seminole , sponsor of the poll idea , said that further delay in the committee can kill the bill .	108.43471
the west texan reported that he had finally gotten chairman bill hollowell of the committee to set it for public hearing on feb . 22 .	82.799644
the proposal would have to receive final legislative approval , by two-thirds majorities , before march 1 to be printed on the april 4 ballot , roberts said .	48.040108
opponents generally argued that the ballot couldn ' t give enough information about tax proposals for the voters to make an intelligent choice .	61.68847
all dallas members voted with roberts , except rep . bill jones , who was absent .	48.03826
-- paradise lost to the alleged water needs of texas ' big cities thursday .	236.15863
rep . james cotten of weatherford insisted that a water development bill passed by the texas house of representatives was an effort by big cities like dallas and fort worth to cover up places like paradise , a wise county hamlet of 250 people .	156.10234
when the shouting ended , the bill passed , 114 to 4 , sending it to the senate , where a similar proposal is being sponsored by sen . george parkhouse of dallas .	40.83628
most of the fire was directed by cotten against dallas and sen . parkhouse .	45.399204
the bill would increase from $5 , 000 , 000 to $15 , 000 , 000 the maximum loan the state could make to a local water project .	42.16119
cotten construed this as a veiled effort by parkhouse to help dallas and other large cities get money which cotten felt could better be spent providing water for rural texas .	308.60815
statements by other legislators that dallas is paying for all its water program by local bonds , and that less populous places would benefit most by the pending bill , did not sway cotten ' s attack .	92.37246
the bill ' s defenders were mostly small-town legislators like j . w . buchanan of dumas , eligio ( kika ) de la garza of mission , sam f . collins of newton and joe chapman of sulphur springs .	38.760086
`` this is a poor boy ' s bill ' ' , said chapman .	34.888985
`` dallas and fort worth can vote bonds .	9.381771
this would help the little peanut districts ' ' .	2.0062451
-- a houston teacher , now serving in the legislature , proposed thursday a law reducing the time spent learning `` educational methods ' ' .	191.35364
rep . henry c . grover , who teaches history in the houston public schools , would reduce from 24 to 12 semester hours the so-called `` teaching methods ' ' courses required to obtain a junior or senior high school teaching certificate .	85.647835
a normal year ' s work in college is 30 semester hours .	141.96529
grover also would require junior-senior high teachers to have at least 24 semester hours credit in the subject they are teaching .	116.05288
the remainder of the 4-year college requirement would be in general subjects .	67.63591
`` a person with a master ' s degree in physics , chemistry , math or english , yet who has not taken education courses , is not permitted to teach in the public schools ' ' , said grover .	44.564163
college teachers in texas are not required to have the education courses .	31.82115
fifty-three of the 150 representatives immediately joined grover as co-signers of the proposal .	27.242449
-- the board of regents of paris junior college has named dr . clarence charles clark of hays , kan . as the school ' s new president .	52.96866
dr . clark will succeed dr . j . r . mclemore , who will retire at the close of the present school term .	28.11917
dr . clark holds an earned doctor of education degree from the university of oklahoma .	27.978647
he also received a master of science degree from texas a & i college and a bachelor of science degree from southwestern state college , weatherford , okla . .	60.474976
in addition , dr . clark has studied at rhode island state college and massachusetts institute of technology .	29.546108
during his college career , dr . clark was captain of his basketball team and was a football letterman .	38.43663
dr . clark has served as teacher and principal in oklahoma high schools , as teacher and athletic director at raymondville , texas , high school , as an instructor at the university of oklahoma , and as an associate professor of education at fort hays , kan . , state college .	37.432407
he has served as a border patrolman and was in the signal corps of the u . s . army .	20.592878
-- principals of the 13 schools in the denton independent school district have been re-elected for the 1961-62 session upon the recommendation of supt . chester o . strickland .	73.99613
state and federal legislation against racial discrimination in employment was called for yesterday in a report of a `` blue ribbon ' ' citizens committee on the aid to dependent children program .	77.24307
the report , culminating a year long study of the adc program in cook county by a new york city welfare consulting firm , listed 10 long range recommendations designed to reduce the soaring adc case load .	136.69455
the report called racial discrimination in employment `` one of the most serious causes of family breakdown , desertion , and adc dependency ' ' .	27.252903
the monthly cost of adc to more than 100 , 000 recipients in the county is 4 . 4 million dollars , said c . virgil martin , president of carson pirie scott & co . , committee chairman .	35.230335
`` we must solve the problems which have forced these people to depend upon adc for subsistence ' ' , martin said .	90.25012
the volume of adc cases will decrease , martin reported , when the community is able to deal effectively with two problems relatively limited skills and discrimination in employment because of color .	141.50854
these , he said , are `` two of the principal underlying causes for family breakups leading to adc ' ' .	90.624695
extension of the adc program to all children in need living with any relatives , including both parents , as a means of preserving family unity .	68.81994
research projects as soon as possible on the causes and prevention of dependency and illegitimacy .	87.2518
several defendants in the summerdale police burglary trial made statements indicating their guilt at the time of their arrest , judge james b . parsons was told in criminal court yesterday .	85.03137
the disclosure by charles bellows , chief defense counsel , startled observers and was viewed as the prelude to a quarrel between the six attorneys representing the eight former policemen now on trial .	84.82561
bellows made the disclosure when he asked judge parsons to grant his client , alan clements , 30 , a separate trial .	76.57993
bellows made the request while the all-woman jury was out of the courtroom .	36.800964
`` the statements may be highly prejudicial to my client ' ' , bellows told the court .	38.894836
`` some of the defendants strongly indicated they knew they were receiving stolen property .	279.65518
it is impossible to get a fair trial when some of the defendants made statements involving themselves and others ' ' .	52.454662
judge parsons leaned over the bench and inquired , `` you mean some of the defendants made statements admitting this ' ' ? ?	39.993347
`` yes , your honor ' ' , replied bellows .	72.868065
`` what this amounts to , if true , is that there will be a free-for-all fight in this case .	24.838709
there is a conflict among the defendants ' ' .	1.6138103
-- president kennedy today pushed aside other white house business to devote all his time and attention to working on the berlin crisis address he will deliver tomorrow night to the american people over nationwide television and radio .	150.1735
the president spent much of the week-end at his summer home on cape cod writing the first drafts of portions of the address with the help of white house aids in washington with whom he talked by telephone .	115.754166
shortly after the chief executive returned to washington in midmorning from hyannis port , mass . , a white house spokesman said the address text still had `` quite a way to go ' ' toward completion .	78.58723
asked to elaborate , pierre salinger , white house press secretary , replied , `` i would say it ' s got to go thru several more drafts ' ' .	36.09916
salinger said the work president kennedy , advisers , and members of his staff were doing on the address involved composition and wording , rather than last minute decisions on administration plans to meet the latest berlin crisis precipitated by russia ' s demands and proposals for the city .	83.829765
the last 10 cases in the investigation of the nov . 8 election were dismissed yesterday by acting judge john m . karns , who charged that the prosecution obtained evidence `` by unfair and fundamentally illegal means ' ' .	57.77762
karns said that the cases involved a matter `` of even greater significance than the guilt or innocence ' ' of the 50 persons .	124.516655
he said evidence was obtained `` in violation of the legal rights of citizens ' ' .	17.434452
karns ' ruling pertained to eight of the 10 cases .	194.12822
in the two other cases he ruled that the state had been `` unable to make a case ' ' .	24.74606
contempt proceedings originally had been brought against 677 persons in 133 precincts by morris j . wexler , special prosecutor .	45.062824
wexler admitted in earlier court hearings that he issued grand jury subpenas to about 200 persons involved in the election investigation , questioned the individuals in the criminal courts building , but did not take them before the grand jury .	70.58094
mayer goldberg , attorney for election judges in the 58th precinct of the 23d ward , argued this procedure constituted intimidation .	43.256668
wexler has denied repeatedly that coercion was used in questioning .	67.694016
karns said it was a `` wrongful act ' ' for wexler to take statements `` privately and outside of the grand jury room ' ' .	67.683495
he said this constituted a `` very serious misuse ' ' of the criminal court processes .	20.766184
`` actually , the abuse of the process may have constituted a contempt of the criminal court of cook county , altho vindication of the authority of that court is not the function of this court ' ' , said karns , who is a city judge in east st . louis sitting in cook county court .	66.654335
karns had been scheduled this week to hear seven cases involving 35 persons .	120.99194
wexler had charged the precinct judges in these cases with `` complementary ' ' miscount of the vote , in which votes would be taken from one candidate and given to another .	64.32213
the cases involved judges in the 33d , 24th , and 42d precincts of the 31st ward , the 21st and 28th precincts of the 29th ward , the 18th precinct of the 4th ward , and the 9th precinct of the 23d ward .	16.057795
the case of the judges in the 58th precinct of the 23d ward had been heard previously and taken under advisement by karns .	35.89728
after reading his statement discharging the 23d ward case , karns told wexler that if the seven cases scheduled for trial also involved persons who had been subpenaed , he would dismiss them .	149.64252
-- president kennedy today proposed a mammoth new medical care program whereby social security taxes on 70 million american workers would be raised to pay the hospital and some other medical bills of 14 . 2 million americans over 65 who are covered by social security or railroad retirement programs .	112.73006
the president , in a special message to congress , tied in with his aged care plan requests for large federal grants to finance medical and dental scholarships , build 20 new medical and 20 new dental schools , and expand child health care and general medical research .	127.74129
the aged care plan , similar to one the president sponsored last year as a senator , a fight on capitol hill .	80.29558
it would be financed by boosting the social security payroll tax by as much as $37 a year for each of the workers now paying such taxes .	67.56512
the social security payroll tax is now 6 per cent -- 3 per cent on each worker and employer -- on the first $4 , 800 of pay per year .	60.5476
the kennedy plan alone would boost the base to $5 , 000 a year and the payroll tax to 6 . 5 per cent -- 3 . 25 per cent each .	20.448257
similar payroll tax boosts would be imposed on those under the railroad retirement system .	83.783936
the payroll tax would actually rise to 7 . 5 per cent starting jan . 1 , 1963 , if the plan is approved , because the levy is already scheduled to go up by 1 per cent on that date to pay for other social security costs .	39.98429
officials estimated the annual tax boost for the medical plan would amount to 1 . 5 billion dollars and that medical benefits paid out would run 1 billion or more in the first year , 1963 .	92.971794
both figures would go higher in later years .	5.5259204
other parts of the kennedy health plan would entail federal grants of 750 million to 1 billion dollars over the next 10 years .	57.893204
these would be paid for out of general , not payroll , taxes .	151.05434
the aged care plan carries these benefits for persons over 65 who are under the social security and railroad retirement systems 1	168.99023
full payment of hospital bills for stays up to 90 days for each illness , except that the patient would pay $10 a day of the cost for the first nine days .	43.721207
full payment of nursing home bills for up to 180 days following discharge from a hospital .	87.53279
a patient could receive up to 300 days paid-for nursing home care under a `` unit formula ' ' allowing more of such care for those who use none or only part of the hospital-care credit .	118.76546
hospital outpatient clinic diagnostic service for all costs in excess of $20 a patient .	87.57304
community visiting nurse services at home for up to 240 days an illness .	62.859222
the president noted that congress last year passed a law providing grants to states to help pay medical bills of the needy aged .	66.65901
he said his plan is designed to `` meet the needs of those millions who have no wish to receive care at the taxpayers ' expense , but who are nevertheless staggered by the drain on their savings -- or those of their children -- caused by an extended hospital stay ' ' .	88.571144
`` this is a very modest proposal cut to meet absolutely essential needs ' ' , he said , `` and with sufficient ' deductible ' requirements to discourage any malingering or unnecessary overcrowding of our hospitals .	55.365124
`` this is not a program of socialized medicine .	15.712057
it is a program of prepayment of health costs with absolute freedom of choice guaranteed .	157.15385
every person will choose his own doctor and hospital ' ' .	43.0665
they would still be paid by the patient .	8.117493
apart from the aged care plan the president ' s most ambitious and costly proposals were for federal scholarships , and grants to build or enlarge medical and dental schools .	41.286243
the president said the nation ' s 92 medical and 47 dental schools cannot now handle the student load needed to meet the rising need for health care .	97.75764
moreover , he said , many qualified young people are not going into medicine and dentistry because they can ' t afford the schooling costs .	45.176785
the scholarship plan would provide federal contributions to each medical and dental school equal to $1 , 500 a year for one-fourth of the first year students .	69.31689
the schools could use the money to pay 4-year scholarships , based on need , of up to $2 , 000 a year per student .	79.36987
in addition , the government would pay a $1 , 000 `` cost of education ' ' grant to the schools for each $1 , 500 in scholarship grants .	46.632336
officials estimated the combined programs would cost 5 . 1 million dollars the first year and would go up to 21 millions by 1966 .	52.587723
the president recommended federal `` matching grants ' ' totaling 700 million dollars in 10 years for constructing new medical and dental schools or enlarging the capacity of existing ones .	37.20122
in the area of `` community health services ' ' , the president called for doubling the present 10 million dollar a year federal grants for nursing home construction .	44.016888
he asked for another 10 million dollar `` initial ' ' appropriation for `` stimulatory grants ' ' to states to improve nursing homes .	36.79988
he further proposed grants of an unspecified sum for experimental hospitals .	190.5759
in the child health field , the president said he will recommend later an increase in funds for programs under the children ' s bureau .	64.624146
he also asked congress to approve establishment of a national child health institute .	122.59299
the president said he will ask congress to increase grants to states for vocational rehabilitation .	54.057224
for medical research he asked a 20 million dollar a year increase , from 30 to 50 millions , in matching grants for building research facilities .	96.85149
the president said he will also propose increasing , by an unspecified amount , the 540 million dollars in the 1961-62 budget for direct government research in medicine .	59.761868
the president said his proposals combine the `` indispensable elements in a sound health program -- people , knowledge , services , facilities , and the means to pay for them ' ' .	95.666374
congressional reaction to the message was along expected lines .	417.5404
legislators who last year opposed placing aged-care under the social security system criticized the president ' s plan .	31.414928
those who backed a similar plan last year hailed the message .	188.95807
senate republican leader dirksen ( ill . ) and house republican leader charles halleck ( ind . ) said the message did not persuade them to change their opposition to compulsory medical insurance .	95.66756
halleck said the voluntary care plan enacted last year should be given a fair trial first .	56.613647
house speaker sam rayburn ( d . , tex . ) called the kennedy program `` a mighty fine thing ' ' , but made no prediction on its fate in the house .	61.52188
-- acting hastily under white house pressure , the senate tonight confirmed robert c . weaver as the nation ' s federal housing chief .	91.30691
only 11 senators were on the floor and there was no record vote .	71.423004
a number of scattered `` ayes ' ' and `` noes ' ' was heard .	14.552125
customary senate rules were ignored in order to speed approval of the negro leader as administrator of the housing and home finance agency .	71.24426
in the last eight years , all presidential appointments , including those of cabinet rank , have been denied immediate action because of a senate rule requiring at least a 24 hour delay after they are reported to the floor .	73.35873
the rule was enforced by demand of sen . wayne morse ( d . , ore . ) in connection with president eisenhower ' s cabinet selections in 1953 and president kennedy ' s in 1961 .	37.331314
the most positive element to emerge from the oslo meeting of north atlantic treaty organization foreign ministers has been the freer , franker , and wider discussions , animated by much better mutual understanding than in past meetings .	98.130196
this has been a working session of an organization that , by its very nature , can only proceed along its route step by step and without dramatic changes .	161.27089
in oslo , the ministers have met in a climate of candor , and made a genuine attempt to get information and understanding one another ' s problems .	72.553215
this atmosphere of understanding has been particularly noticeable where relations are concerned between the `` colonialist ' ' powers and those who have never , or not for a long time , had such problems .	70.459915
the nightmare of a clash between those in trouble in africa , exacerbated by the difficulties , changes , and tragedies facing them , and other allies who intellectually and emotionally disapprove of the circumstances that have brought these troubles about , has been conspicuous by its absence .	103.5235
in the case of portugal , which a few weeks ago was rumored ready to walk out of the nato council should critics of its angola policy prove harsh , there has been a noticeable relaxation of tension .	100.18801
the general , remarkably courteous , explanation has left basic positions unchanged , but there has been no explosion in the council .	73.04908
there should even be no more bitter surprises in the un general assembly as to nato members ' votes , since a new ad hoc nato committee has been set up so that in the future such topics as angola will be discussed in advance .	70.48643
canada alone has been somewhat out of step with the oslo attempt to get all the allied cars back on the track behind the nato locomotive .	82.21957
even norway , despite daily but limited manifestations against atomic arms in the heart of this northernmost capital of the alliance , is today closer to the nato line .	77.84377
on the negative side of the balance sheet must be set some disappointment that the united states leadership has not been as much in evidence as hoped for .	103.47208
one diplomat described the tenor of secretary of state dean rusk ' s speeches as `` inconclusive ' ' .	13.982936
but he hastened to add that , if united states policies were not always clear , despite mr . rusk ' s analysis of the various global danger points and setbacks for the west , this may merely mean the new administration has not yet firmly fixed its policy .	83.44308
a certain vagueness may also be caused by tactical appreciation of the fact that the present council meeting is a semipublic affair , with no fewer than six soviet correspondents accredited .	50.51777
the impression has nevertheless been given during these three days , despite mr . rusk ' s personal popularity , that the united states delegation came to oslo in a somewhat tentative and exploratory frame of mind , more ready to listen and learn than to enunciate firm policy on a global scale with detailed application to individual danger spots .	95.19635
the secretary of state himself , in his first speech , gave some idea of the tremendous march of events inside and outside the united states that has preoccupied the new administration in the past four months .	72.156075
but where the core of nato is concerned , the secretary of state has not only reiterated the united states ' profound attachment to the alliance , `` cornerstone ' ' of its foreign policy , but has announced that five nuclear submarines will eventually be at nato ' s disposal in european waters .	42.73342
the secretary of state has also solemnly repeated a warning to the soviet union that the united states will not stand for another setback in berlin , an affirmation once again taken up by the council as a whole .	60.21726
the secretary ' s greatest achievement is perhaps the rekindling of nato realization that east-west friction , wherever it take place around the globe , is in essence the general conflict between two entirely different societies , and must be treated as such without regard to geographical distance or lack of apparent connection .	132.49142
the annual spring meeting has given an impetus in three main directions more , deeper , and more timely political consultation within the alliance , the use of the organization for economic cooperation and development ( when ratified ) as a method of coordinating aid to the underdeveloped countries , and the need for strengthening conventional forces as well as the maintenance of the nuclear deterrent .	52.88883
this increase in the `` threshold ' ' , as the conventional forces strengthening is called , will prove one of the alliance ' s most difficult problems in the months to come .	62.97449
each ally will have to carry out obligations long since laid down , but never completely fulfilled .	343.61584
the kennedy administration moves haltingly toward a geneva conference on laos just as serious debate over its foreign policy erupts for the first time .	56.84667
there is little optimism here that the communists will be any more docile at the conference table than they were in military actions on the ground in laos .	93.682
the united states , state department officials explain , now is mainly interested in setting up an international inspection system which will prevent laos from being used as a base for communist attacks on neighboring thailand and south viet nam .	56.52547
they count on the aid of the neutral countries attending the geneva conference to achieve this .	63.248344
the united states hopes that any future lao cabinet would not become communist dominated .	89.2025
but it is apparent that no acceptable formula has been found to prevent such a possibility .	25.918535
the inclination here is to accept a de facto cease-fire in laos , rather than continue to insist on a verification of the cease-fire by the international control commission before participating in the geneva conference .	38.190918
this is another of the modifications of policy on laos that the kennedy administration has felt compelled to make .	28.911266
it excuses these actions as being the chain reaction to basic errors made in the previous administration .	134.34135
its spokesmen insist that there has not been time enough to institute reforms in military and economic aid policies in the critical areas .	74.43406
but with the months moving on -- and the immediate confrontations with the communists showing no gain for the free world -- the question arises	72.2284
how effective have kennedy administration first foreign policy decisions been in dealing with communist aggression ? ?	103.259
former vice-president richard m . nixon in detroit called for a firmer and tougher policy toward the soviet union .	39.303837
he was critical of what he feels is president kennedy ' s tendency to be too conciliatory .	36.459442
it does not take a gallup poll to find out that most republicans in congress feel this understates the situation as republicans see it .	157.92075
they can hardly restrain themselves from raising the question of whether republicans , if they had been in power , would have made `` amateurish and monumental blunders ' ' in cuba .	48.36616
one republican senator told this correspondent that he was constantly being asked why he didn ' t attack the kennedy administration on this score .	54.136326
his reply , he said , was that he agreed to the need for unity in the country now .	44.875763
but he further said that it was better politics to let others question the wisdom of administration policies first .	500.4344
the republicans some weeks ago served notice through senator thruston b . morton ( r ) of kentucky , chairman of the republican national committee , that the kennedy administration would be held responsible if the outcome in laos was a coalition government susceptible of communist domination .	36.626793
kennedy administration policies also have been assailed now from another direction by 70 harvard , boston university , brandeis , and massachusetts institute of technology educators .	72.61275
this group pleads with the administration to `` give no further support for the invasion of cuba by exile groups ' ' .	58.018967
it recommends that the united states `` seek instead to detach the castro regime from the communist bloc by working for a diplomatic detente and a resumption of trade relations	73.94061
and concentrate its constructive efforts on eliminating in other parts of latin america the social conditions on which totalitarian nationalism feeds ' ' .	52.176178
mr . nixon , for his part , would oppose intervention in cuba without specific provocation .	252.83057
but he did recommend that president kennedy state clearly that if communist countries shipped any further arms to cuba that it would not be tolerated .	141.47717
until the cuban fiasco and the communist military victories in laos , almost any observer would have said that president kennedy had blended a program that respected , generally , the opinions voiced both by mr . nixon and the professors .	77.87017
very early in his administration he informed the kremlin through diplomatic channels , a high official source disclosed , that the new administration would react even tougher than the eisenhower administration would during the formative period of the administration .	74.063484
strenuous efforts were made to remove pin pricking from administration statements .	418.03708
policies on nuclear test ban negotiations were reviewed and changed .	46.86785
but thus far there has been no response in kind .	196.34792
foreign aid programs were revamped to give greater emphasis to economic aid and to encourage political reform in recipient nations .	54.958477
in laos , the administration looked at the eisenhower administration efforts to show determination by sailing a naval fleet into southeast asian waters as a useless gesture .	80.24544
again and again it asked the communists to `` freeze ' ' the military situation in laos .	31.541937
but the communists aided the pathet lao at an even faster rate .	141.43097
and after several correspondents went into pathet lao territory and exposed the huge build-up , administration spokesmen acclaimed them for performing a `` great service ' ' and laid the matter before the southeast asia treaty organization .	118.957146
seato was steamed up and prepared contingency plans for coping with the military losses in laos .	44.996742
but the communists never gave sufficient provocation at any one time for the united states to want to risk a limited or an all-out war over laos .	60.868046
there was the further complication that the administration had very early concluded that laos was ill suited to be an ally , unlike its more determined neighbors , thailand and south viet nam .	118.51343
the administration declared itself in favor of a neutralized laos .	29.180727
the pro-western government , which the united states had helped in a revolt against the souvanna phouma `` neutralist ' ' government , never did appear to spark much fighting spirit in the royal lao army .	73.36227
there certainly was not any more energy displayed after it was clear the united states would not back the pro-western government to the hilt .	60.051697
if the administration ever had any ideas that it could find an acceptable alternative to prince souvanna phouma , whom it felt was too trusting of communists , it gradually had to relinquish them .	72.536026
one factor was the statement of senator j . w . fulbright ( d ) of arkansas , chairman of the senate foreign relations committee .	15.655466
he declared on march 25 that the united states had erred a year and a half ago by `` encouraging the removal ' ' of prince souvanna .	47.597584
the white house is taking extraordinary steps to check the rapid growth of juvenile delinquency in the united states .	16.242632
the president is deeply concerned over this problem and its effect upon the `` vitality of the nation ' ' .	25.026466
in an important assertion of national leadership in this field , he has issued an executive order establishing the president ' s committee on juvenile delinquency and crime , to be supported and assisted by a citizens advisory council of recognized authorities on juvenile problems .	54.024048
the president asks the support and cooperation of congress in his efforts through the enactment of legislation to provide federal grants to states for specified efforts in combating this disturbing crime trend .	77.81308
the president has also called upon the attorney general , the secretary of health , education and welfare , and the secretary of labor to coordinate their efforts `` in the development of a program of federal leadership to assist states and local communities in their efforts to cope with the problem .	30.839191
simultaneously the president announced thursday the appointment of david l . hackett , a special assistant to the attorney general , as executive director of the new committee on juvenile delinquency and youth crime .	28.644648
his sense of urgency in this matter stems from the fact that court cases and juvenile arrests have more than doubled since 1948 , each year showing an increase in offenders .	49.16699
among arrests reported by the federal bureau of investigation in 1959 , about half for burglary and larceny involved persons under 18 years of age .	49.086933
east providence should organize its civil defense setup and begin by appointing a full-time director , raymond h . hawksley , the present city cd head , believes .	128.67346
mr . hawksley said yesterday he would be willing to go before the city council `` or anyone else locally ' ' to outline his proposal at the earliest possible time .	80.36342
east providence now has no civil defense program .	2.0312562
mr . hawksley , the state ' s general treasurer , has been a part-time cd director in the city for the last nine years .	37.51381
he is not interested in being named a full-time director .	106.510124
noting that president kennedy has handed the defense department the major responsibility for the nation ' s civil defense program , mr . hawksley said the federal government would pay half the salary of a full-time local director .	37.581493
he expressed the opinion the city could hire a cd director for about $3 , 500 a year and would only have to put up half that amount on a matching fund basis to defray the salary costs .	70.548836
mr . hawksley said he believed there are a number of qualified city residents who would be willing to take the full-time cd job .	35.089798
one of these men is former fire chief john a . laughlin , he said .	29.08466
along with a director , the city should provide a cd headquarters so that pertinent information about the local organization would be centralized .	98.69081
one advantage that would come to the city in having a full-time director , he said , is that east providence would become eligible to apply to the federal government for financial aid in purchasing equipment needed for a sound civil defense program .	55.96294
matching funds also can be obtained for procurement of such items as radios , sirens and rescue trucks , he said .	45.53274
mr . hawksley believes that east providence could use two more rescue trucks , similar to the cd vehicle obtained several years ago and now detailed to the central fire station .	162.62025
he would assign one of the rescue trucks to the riverside section of the city and the other to the rumford area .	40.17463
speaking of the present status of civil defense in the city , mr . hawksley said he would be willing to bet that not more than one person in a hundred would know what to do or where to go in the event of an enemy attack .	43.30932
the narragansett race track grounds is one assembly point , he said , and a drive-in theater in seekonk would be another .	80.05858
riverside residents would go to the seekonk assembly point .	58.909958
mr . hawksley said he was not critical of city residents for not knowing what to do or where to assemble in case of an air attack .	126.44133
such vital information , he said , has to be made available to the public frequently and at regular intervals for residents to know .	70.7022
if the city council fails to consider appointment of a full-time cd director , mr . hawksley said , then he plans to call a meeting early in september so that a civil defense organization will be developed locally .	45.960064
one of the first things he would do , he said , would be to organize classes in first aid .	65.05623
other steps would be developed after information drifts down to the local level from the federal government .	27.773937
rhode island is going to examine its sunday sales law with possible revisions in mind .	241.09668
governor notte said last night he plans to name a committee to make the study and come up with recommendations for possible changes in time for the next session of the general assembly .	56.168686
the governor ' s move into the so-called `` blue law ' ' controversy came in the form of a letter to miss mary r . grant , deputy city clerk of central falls .	62.427654
mr . notte was responding to a resolution adopted by the central falls city council on july 10 and sent to the state house by miss grant .	72.08644
the resolution urges the governor to have a complete study of the sunday sales laws made with an eye to their revision at the next session of the legislature .	69.188194
while the city council suggested that the legislative council might perform the review , mr . notte said that instead he will take up the matter with atty . gen . j . joseph nugent to get `` the benefit of his views ' ' .	49.384094
he will then appoint the study committee with mr . nugent ' s cooperation , the governor said .	23.47144
`` i would expect the proposed committee to hold public hearings ' ' , mr . notte said , `` to obtain the views of the general public and religious , labor and special-interest groups affected by these laws ' ' .	46.616707
the governor wrote miss grant that he has been concerned for some time `` with the continuous problem which confronts our local and state law enforcement officers as a result of the laws regulating sunday sales ' ' .	68.33975
the attorney general has advised local police that it is their duty to enforce the blue laws .	51.323513
should there be evidence they are shirking , he has said , the state police will step into the situation .	72.620575
there has been more activity across the state line in massachusetts than in rhode island in recent weeks toward enforcement of the sunday sales laws .	147.05675
the statutes , similar in both the bay state and rhode island and dating back in some instances to colonial times , severely limit the types of merchandise that may be sold on the sabbath .	81.96607
the central falls city council expressed concern especially that more foods be placed on the eligible list and that neighborhood grocery and variety stores be allowed to do business on sunday .	163.29823
the only day they `` have a chance to compete with large supermarkets is on sunday ' ' , the council ' s resolution said .	45.659355
the small shops `` must be retained , for they provide essential service to the community ' ' , according to the resolution , which added that they `` also are the source of livelihood for thousands of our neighbors ' ' .	36.002064
it declares that sunday sales licenses provide `` great revenue ' ' to the local government .	20.402334
the council advised the governor that `` large supermarkets , factory outlets and department stores not be allowed to do business ' ' on sunday .	42.851658
they `` operate on a volume basis ' ' , it was contended , `` and are not essential to provide the more limited but vital shopping needs of the community ' ' .	46.864635
liberals and conservatives in both parties -- democratic and republican -- should divorce themselves and form two independent parties , george h . reama , nationally known labor-management expert , said here yesterday .	206.29546
mr . reama told the rotary club of providence at its luncheon at the sheraton-biltmore hotel that about half of the people in the country want the `` welfare ' ' type of government and the other half want a free enterprise system .	43.02597
he suggested that a regrouping of forces might allow the average voter a better pull at the right lever for him on election day .	115.02984
he said he was `` confessing that i was a member of the socialist party in 1910 ' ' .	11.011858
that , he added , was when he was `` a very young man , a machinist and toolmaker by trade .	40.9679
some of my fellow workers were grooming me for an office in the socialist party .	41.496815
the lawyer with whom i studied law steered me off the socialist track .	32.399128
he steered me to the right track -- the free enterprise track ' ' .	43.14838
he said that when he was a socialist in 1910 , the party called for government operation of all utilities and the pooling of all resources .	67.783844
he suggested that without the socialist party ever gaining a national victory , most of its original program has come to pass under both major parties .	95.265686
mr . reama , who retired as vice president of the american screw co . in 1955 said , `` both parties in the last election told us that we need a five per cent growth in the gross national product -- but neither told us how to achieve it ' ' .	64.55218
he said he favors wage increases for workers -- `` but manufacturers are caught in a profit squeeze ' ' -- and raises should only come when the public is conditioned to higher prices , he added .	115.64956
indicating the way in which he has turned his back on his 1910 philosophy , mr . reama said `` a socialist is a person who believes in dividing everything he does not own ' ' .	68.20137
mr . reama , far from really being retired , is engaged in industrial relations counseling .	104.57133
a petition bearing the signatures of more than 1 , 700 johnston taxpayers was presented to the town council last night as what is hoped will be the first step in obtaining a home rule charter for the town .	55.510303
william a . martinelli , chairman of the citizens group of johnston , transferred the petitions from his left hand to his right hand after the council voted to accept them at the suggestion of council president raymond fortin sr . .	75.27635
the law which governs home rule charter petitions states that they must be referred to the chairman of the board of canvassers for verification of the signatures within 10 days and mr . martinelli happens to hold that post .	46.181427
mr . martinelli explained that there should be more than enough signatures to assure the scheduling of a vote on the home rule charter and possible election of a nine member charter commission within 70 days .	89.673416
he explained that by law the council must establish procedures for a vote on the issue within 60 days after the board of canvassers completes its work .	55.04605
a difference of opinion arose between mr . martinelli and john p . bourcier , town solicitor , over the exact manner in which the vote is handled .	59.94078
mr . martinelli has , in recent weeks , been of the opinion that a special town meeting would be called for the vote , while mr . bourcier said that a special election might be called instead .	47.98558
mr . bourcier said that he had consulted several superior court justices in the last week and received opinions favoring both procedures .	141.14525
he assured mr . martinelli and the council that he would study the correct method and report back to the council as soon as possible .	75.43345
mr . martinelli said yesterday that the citizens group of johnston will meet again july 24 to plan further strategy in the charter movement .	150.90776
he said that the group has no candidates for the charter commission in mind at present , but that it will undoubtedly endorse candidates when the time comes .	116.746284
`` after inspiring this , i think we should certainly follow through on it ' ' , he declared .	40.900326
`` it has become our responsibility and i hope that the citizens group will spearhead the movement ' ' .	38.999115
he said he would not be surprised if some of the more than 30 members of the group are interested in running on the required non-partisan ballot for posts on the charter commission .	69.377396
`` our most immediate goal is to increase public awareness of the movement ' ' , he indicated , `` and to tell them what this will mean for the town ' ' .	45.02024
he expects that if the present timetable is followed a vote will be scheduled during the last week in september .	62.84442
some opposition to the home rule movement started to be heard yesterday , with spokesmen for the town ' s insurgent democratic leadership speaking out against the home rule charter in favor of the model municipal league charter .	73.93339
increasing opposition can be expected in coming weeks , it was indicated .	62.85881
misunderstanding of the real meaning of a home rule charter was cited as a factor which has caused the citizens group to obtain signatures under what were termed `` false pretenses ' ' .	53.984993
several signers affixed their names , it was learned , after being told that no tax increase would be possible without consent of the general assembly and that a provision could be included in the charter to have the town take over the johnston sanitary district sewer system .	66.76201
action on a new ordinance permitting motorists who plead guilty to minor traffic offenses to pay fines at the local police station may be taken at monday ' s special north providence town council meeting .	63.62828
council president frank sanantonio said yesterday he may ask the council to formally request town solicitor michael a . abatuno to draft the ordinance .	114.95302
at the last session of the general assembly , the town was authorized to adopt such an ordinance as a means of making enforcement of minor offenses more effective .	72.62951
nothing has been done yet to take advantage of the enabling legislation .	54.548355
at present all offenses must be taken to sixth district court for disposition .	256.27713
local police have hesitated to prosecute them because of the heavy court costs involved even for the simplest offense .	220.38051
-- james p . mitchell and sen . walter h . jones r-bergen , last night disagreed on the value of using as a campaign issue a remark by richard j . hughes , democratic gubernatorial candidate , that the gop is `` campaigning on the carcass of eisenhower republicanism ' ' .	44.53144
mitchell was for using it , jones against , and sen . wayne dumont jr . r-warren did not mention it when the three republican gubernatorial candidates spoke at staggered intervals before 100 persons at the park hotel .	57.24651
the controversial remark was first made sunday by hughes at a westfield young democratic club cocktail party at the scotch plains country club .	93.974014
it was greeted with a chorus of boos by 500 women in trenton monday at a forum of the state federation of women ' s clubs .	60.78947
hughes said monday , `` it is the apparent intention of the republican party to campaign on the carcass of what they call eisenhower republicanism , but the heart stopped beating and the lifeblood congealed after eisenhower retired .	80.80331
now he ' s gone , the republican party is not going to be able to sell the tattered remains to the people of the state ' ' .	18.984097
sunday he had added , `` we can love eisenhower the man , even if we considered him a mediocre president but there is nothing left of the republican party without his leadership ' ' .	78.8225
mitchell said the statement should become a major issue in the primary and the fall campaign .	88.21503
`` how can a man with any degree of common decency charge this ' ' ? ?	83.70698
the former secretary of labor said he was proud to be an eisenhower republican `` and proud to have absorbed his philosophy ' ' while working in his adminstration .	134.061
mitchell said the closeness of the outcome in last fall ' s presidential election did not mean that eisenhower republicanism was a dead issue .	57.69596
jones said he regretted hughes had made a personal attack on a past president .	179.53499
`` he is wrong to inject eisenhower into this campaign ' ' , he said , `` because the primary is being waged on state issues and i will not be forced into re-arguing an old national campaign ' ' .	41.747643
the audience last night did not respond with either applause or boos to mention of hughes ' remark .	134.12923
dumont spoke on the merit of having an open primary .	179.53839
he then launched into what the issues should be in the campaign .	19.321234
state aid to schools , the continuance of railroad passenger service , the proper uses of surplus funds of the port of new york authority , and making new jersey attractive to new industry .	83.86163
mitchell decried the high rate of unemployment in the state and said the meyner administration and the republican-controlled state senate `` must share the blame for this ' ' .	57.215996
noting that plainfield last year had lost the mack truck co . plant , he said industry will not come into this state until there is tax reform .	107.32814

jones , unhappy that the candidates were limited to eight minutes for a speech and no audience questions , saved his barbs for mitchell .	237.72525
he said mitchell is against the centralization of government in washington but looks to the kennedy administration for aid to meet new jersey school and transportation crises .	110.22599
`` he calls for help while saying he is against centralization , but you can ' t have it both ways ' ' , jones said .	44.72874

`` i think that all americans will resent deeply the statements made about president eisenhower by richard j . hughes .	112.260796
his reference to ' discredited carcass ' or ' tattered remains ' of the president ' s leadership is an insult to the man who led our forces to victory in the greatest war in all history , to the man who was twice elected overwhelmingly by the american people as president of the united states , and who has been the symbol to the world of the peace-loving intentions of the free nations .	42.31341

-- william j . seidel , state fire warden in the department of conservation and economic development , has retired after 36 years of service .	28.854124
a citation from conservation commissioner salvatore a . bontempo credits his supervision with a reduction in the number of forest fires in the state .	32.919872
seidel joined the department in 1925 as a division fire warden after graduation in 1921 from the university of michigan with a degree in forestry and employment with private lumber companies .	96.51374
in october 1944 , he was appointed state warden and chief of the forest fire section .	70.29454
under his supervision , the state fire-fighting agency developed such techniques as plowing of fire lines and established a fleet of tractor plows and tractor units for fire fighting .	100.7773
he also expanded and modernized the radio system with a central control station .	126.90164
he introduced regular briefing sessions for district fire wardens and first aid training for section wardens .	41.920338
he is credited with setting up an annual co-operative fire prevention program in co-operation with the red cross and state department of education .	56.352932

the $6 , 100 , 000 , 000 measure , which was passed last monday by the senate , provides for forty-year mortgages at low down-payments for moderate-income families .	53.285847
it also provides for funds to clear slums and help colleges build dormitories .	152.76527
the education bill appears to be temporarily stalled in the rules committee , where two northern democratic members who usually vote with the administration are balking because of the religious controversy .	119.72401

this would provide for long-term federal loans for construction of parochial and other private-school facilities for teaching science , languages and mathematics .	91.199524
mr . delaney and mr . o ' neill are not willing to vote on the public-school measure until the defense education bill clears the house education and labor committee .	69.032745
about half of all peace corps projects assigned to voluntary agencies will be carried out by religious groups , according to an official of the corps .	38.997997
in the $40 , 000 , 000 budget that has been submitted for congressional approval , $26 , 000 , 000 would be spent through universities and private voluntary agencies .	52.21748

six of these were proposed by religious groups .	3.5980122
they will be for teaching , agriculture and community development in southeast asia , africa , the middle east and latin america .	16.874153
interviews with several church leaders have disclosed that this development has raised the question whether the peace corps will be able to prevent confusion for church and state over methods , means and goals .	86.20749
there are a number of ways this could happen , the churchmen pointed out , and here is an example	58.812458

the u . s . government pays for all its overseas workers ' ' .	28.259586
`` i don ' t work for the government ' ' , the american said .	17.917353

-- a committee of experts has recommended that a country ' s population be considered in the distribution of professional posts at the united nations .	50.386463
this was disclosed today by a responsible source amid intensified efforts by the soviet union to gain a greater role in the staff and operation of the united nations .	34.90841
one effect of the proposal , which puts a premium on population instead of economic strength , as in the past , would be to take jobs from european nations and give more to such countries as india .	85.603615
india is the most populous united nations member with more than 400 , 000 , 000 inhabitants .	26.862902
the new formula for filling staff positions in the secretariat is one of a number of recommendations made by a panel of eight in a long and detailed report .	49.824314
the report was completed after nearly eighteen months of work on the question of the organization of the united nations .	21.62407
the advisory committee on administrative and budgetary questions is expected to receive the report this week .	51.451126
the jobs formula is understood to follow these lines	71.5305
each of the organization ' s ninety-nine members would get two professional posts , such as political affairs officer , a department head or an economist , to start .	103.60291
each member would get one post for each 10 , 000 , 000 people in its population up to 150 , 000 , 000 people or a maximum of fifteen posts .	38.22833
each member with a population above 150 , 000 , 000 would get one additional post for each additional 30 , 000 , 000 people up to an unspecified cut-off point .	43.22231
-- the three leaders of laos agreed today to begin negotiations tomorrow on forming a coalition government that would unite the war-ridden kingdom .	145.23727
the decision was made in zurich by prince boun oum , premier of the pro-western royal government	29.820375
prince souvanna phouma , leader of the nation ' s neutralists and recognized as premier by the communist bloc , and prince souphanouvong , head of the pro-communist pathet lao forces .	31.279036
their joint statement was welcomed by the western delegations who will attend tomorrow the nineteenth plenary session of the fourteen-nation conference on the future of laos .	39.7702

w . averell harriman of the united states , malcolm macdonald of britain , maurice couve de murville , france ' s foreign minister , and howard c . green , canada ' s minister of external affairs , concluded , meanwhile , a round of consultations here on future tactics in the conference .	43.50875
the pace of the talks has slowed with each passing week .	495.26166

-- thousands of bleacher-type seats are being erected along pennsylvania avenue between the capitol and the white house for the big inaugural parade on jan . 20 .	45.544422
assuming the weather is halfway decent that day , hundreds of thousands of persons will mass along this thoroughfare as president john f . kennedy and retiring president dwight d . eisenhower leave capitol hill following the oath-taking ceremonies and ride down this historic ceremonial route .	94.90093
pennsylvania avenue , named for one of the original 13 states , perhaps is not the most impressive street in the district of columbia from a commercial standpoint .	68.46239
but from a historic viewpoint none can approach it .	11.992347
within view of the avenue are some of the united states government ' s tremendous buildings , plus shrines and monuments .	41.951595
of course , 1600 pennsylvania , the white house , is the most famous address of the free world .	22.812832

in the 1920 presidential election they had that right and many of them did vote for the first time .	44.140274
