-- the fbi yesterday arrested on a perjury charge one of the members of the jury that failed to reach a verdict in the `` freedom rider ' ' bus burning trial four weeks ago .	54.073647
u . s . attorney macon weaver said the federal complaint , charged that the juror gave false information when asked about ku klux klan membership during selection of jury .	125.11051
he identified the man as lewis martin parker , 59 , a farmer of hartselle , ala . .	16.212917
eight men were tried together in u . s . district court in anniston , ala . , on charges of interfering with interstate transportation and conspiracy growing out of a white mob ' s attack on a greyhound bus carrying the first of the freedom riders .	43.119473
one of the eight defendants was freed on a directed verdict of acquittal .	30.946762
a mistrial was declared in the case against the other seven when the jury was unable to agree on a verdict .	47.54419
the arrest of mr . parker marks the third charge of wrongdoing involving the jury that heard the case .	141.91231
the first incident occurred before the trial got under way when judge h . hobart grooms told the jury panel he had heard reports of jury-tampering efforts .	114.90786
he asked members of the panel to tell him if anyone outside the court had spoken to them about the case .	112.791084
two members of the panel later told in court about receiving telephone calls at their homes from anonymous persons expressing interest in the trial .	160.01535
then , when the case went to the jury , the judge excused one of the jurors , saying the juror had told him he had been accosted by masked men at his motel the night before the trial opened .	64.493195
the juror said the masked men had advised him to be lenient .	18.798056
the judge replaced the juror with an alternate .	19.680763
no formal charges have been filed as a result of either of the two reported incidents .	49.928753
at the opening of the trial , the jury panel was questioned as a group by mr . weaver about ku klux klan connections .	54.636562
one member of the panel -- not mr . parker -- indicated he had been a member of the kkk at one time .	39.00316
the perjury charge against mr . parker carries a maximum penalty of $2 , 000 fine and five years imprisonment on conviction .	60.141705
-- the new york university board of trustees has elected the youngest president in the 130-year history of nyu , it was announced yesterday .	58.45445
the new president is 37-year-old dr . james mcn . hester , currently dean of the nyu graduate school of arts and sciences .	34.27836
he will take over his new post jan . 1 .	11.615505
dr . hester , also one of the youngest men ever to head a major american university , succeeds dr . carroll v . newsom who resigned last september to join prentice-hall inc . publishing firm .	128.8396
dr . hester , of princeton , n . j . , is a native of chester , pa . he joined nyu in september , 1960 .	19.153616
prior to that he was associated with long island university in brooklyn .	73.71608
vast spraying programs conducted by `` technicians with narrow training and little wisdom ' ' are endangering crops and wildlife , carl w . buchheister , president of the national audubon society , said today .	46.320114
`` it is like handing a loaded automatic to an 8-year-old and telling him to run out and play ' ' , he commented .	38.493134
buchheister told delegates to the west coast audubon convention that aerial spraying in louisiana failed to destroy its target , the fire ant .	68.981575
`` but it did destroy the natural controls of a borer and released a new plague that wrecked a sugar cane crop ' ' , he said .	32.562706
the conservation leader said other mistakes in spraying had caused serious damage in ohio and wyoming .	105.02182
there have even been serious errors in the u . s . forest service , whose officials pride themselves in their scientific training , he added .	49.575512
`` the news of their experiments reaches the farmers who , forgetting that birds are the most efficient natural enemies of insects and rodents , are encouraged to try to get rid of all birds that occasionally peck their grapes or their blueberries ' ' , buchheister told the delegates .	94.742546
in addition to urging greater restrictions on aerial spraying , buchheister called for support of the wilderness bill , creation of national seashore parks , including point reyes	95.5139
stronger water pollution control programs , and federal ratification of an international convention to halt pollution of the sea by oil .	87.20496
the reed rogers da fonta wild life sanctuary in marin county on friday officially became the property of the national audubon society .	53.33468
mrs . norman livermore , president of the marin conservation league , handed over the deed to the 645-acre tidelands tract south of greenwood beach to carl w . buchheister , president of the society .	66.15007
the presentation was made before several hundred persons at the annual meeting of the league at olney hall , college of marin , kentfield .	32.253525
buchheister pledged the land would be an `` inviolate ' ' sanctuary for all birds , animals and plants .	28.560394
seventeen years ago today , german scientist willy fiedler climbed into a makeshift cockpit installed in a v-1 rocket-bomb that was attached to the underbelly of a heinkel bomber .	23.292616
the world war 2 , german bomber rolled down a runway and took off .	48.58707
the only way fiedler could get back to earth alive was to fly the pulse jet missile and land it on the airstrip .	158.19342
now a quiet-spoken , middle-aged man , fiedler is an aeronautical engineer for lockheed ' s missiles and space division at sunnyvale , where he played a key role in the development of the navy ' s polaris missile .	22.571758
he sat in his office yesterday and recalled that historic flight in 1944 .	268.88303
`` the first two pilots had crashed ' ' , he said .	3.60456
`` i had developed the machines and therefore knew them .	117.52462
it was time to go up myself ' ' .	1.3310841
fiedler was then technical director of hitler ' s super-secret `` reichenberg project ' ' , which remained unknown to the allies until after the war .	46.618828
about 200 of the special v-1 rocket-bombs were to be made ready for manned flight with an explosive warhead .	20.12849
the target was allied shipping -- a desperate effort to stave off the allied invasion of europe .	22.260912
the success of the project depended upon fiedler ' s flight .	14.713746
squeezed into the few cubic feet normally filled by the rocket ' s automatic guidance mechanism , the scientist waited while the bomber gained altitude .	132.49257
at 12 , 000 feet , fiedler signaled `` release ' ' , and started the roaring pulse-jet engine -- then streaked away from beneath the heinkel .	53.192272
to the german pilot in the bomber the rocket became a faint black speck , hurtling through the sky at the then incredible speed of 420 m . p . h . .	48.385925
it was probably man ' s first successful flight in a missile .	62.907986
`` she flew beautifully ' ' , said fiedler .	49.106655
`` there was only one power control -- a valve to adjust the fuel flow .	51.95537
i had exactly 20 minutes to get down to the test strip ' ' .	36.90959
using a steering system that controlled the modified rocket ' s tail surfaces and wings equipped with ailerons , fiedler was to land the missile on a skid especially bolted under the fuselage .	83.44114
he managed to maneuver the missile to a landing speed of 200 m . p . h . -- fast even for a modern jet plane touchdown -- and banked into the airfield .	70.934364
moments later the v-1 skimmed across the landing strip , edging closer and closer to a touchdown -- then in a streamer of dust it landed .	89.16184
fiedler went on to make several other test flights before german pilots took over the reichenberg missiles .	133.19563
the missiles were to be armed with an underwater bomb .	32.998737
pilots would steer them in a suicide dive into the water , striking below the waterline of individual ships .	80.21487
a crack corps of 50 pilots was formed from the ranks of volunteers , but the project was halted before the end of the war , and the missiles later fell into allied hands .	52.72072
now a family man with three children , fiedler lives in a quiet residential area near the lockheed plant at sunnyvale .	43.201466
his spare time is spent in soaring gliders .	6.5059733
`` it ' s so quiet ' ' , he said , `` so slow , serene -- and so challenging ' ' .	28.285393
john di massimo has been elected president of the 1961 columbus day celebration committee , it was announced yesterday .	85.33041
other officers are angelo j . scampini , vice president , joseph v . arata , treasurer , and fred j . casassa , secretary .	20.65114
judge john b . molinari was named chairman of the executive committee .	5.138465
elios p . anderlini , attilio beronio , leo m . bianco , frederic campagnoli , joseph cervetto , armond j . de martini , grace duhagon , john p . figone , john p . figone jr . , stephen mana , john moscone , calude perasso , angelo petrini , frank ratto , and george r . reilly .	15.139118
dr . albert schweitzer , world-famous theologian and medical missionary , has endorsed an easter march for disarmament which begins tomorrow in sunnyvale .	177.04604
members of the san francisco american friends service , a quaker organization , will march to san francisco for a rally in union square at 2 p . m . saturday .	55.044083
in a letter to the american friends service , dr . schweitzer wrote	38.833828
`` leading nations of the west and of the east keep busy making newer nuclear weapons to defend themselves in the event the constantly threatening nuclear war should break out .	132.45529
`` they cannot do otherwise than live in dread of each other since these weapons imply the possibility of such grisly surprise attack .	106.59919
the only way out of this state of affairs is agreement to abolish nuclear weapons	132.25076
`` governments apparently do not feel obligated to make the people adequately aware of this danger	116.34593
therefore we need guardians to demonstrate against the ghastly stupidity of nuclear weapons and jolt the people out of their complacency ' ' .	31.174349
a federal grand jury called 10 witnesses yesterday in an investigation of the affairs of ben stein , 47 , who collected big fees as a `` labor consultant ' ' and operator of a janitors ' service .	53.425194
before he testified for 20 minutes , stein , who lives at 3300 lake shore dr . , admitted to reporters that he had a wide acquaintance with crime syndicate hoodlums .	76.788795
among his gangland buddies , he said , were joseph ( joey ) glimco , a mob labor racketeer , and four gang gambling chiefs , gus ( slim ) alex , ralph pierce , joe ( caesar ) divarco , and jimmy ( monk ) allegretti .	49.92417
another hoodlum , louis arger , drew $39 , 000 from stein ' s janitor firm , the national maintenance company , in three years ending in 1959 , stein disclosed in an interview .	56.725437
`` i put arger on the payroll because he promised to get my firm the stevedore account at navy pier ' ' , stein said .	79.06183
`` but arger never was able to produce it , so i cut him off my payroll ' ' .	56.4843
other witnesses , after appearances before the jury , which reportedly is probing into possible income tax violations , disclosed that government prosecutors were attempting to connect stein and his company with a number of gangsters , including glimco and alex .	97.552704
the federal lawyers , according to their witnesses , also were tracing stein ' s fees as a labor consultant .	62.591717
under scrutiny , two of the witnesses said , were payments and loans to stein ' s national maintenance company at 543 madison st . .	70.03795
the company supplies janitors and workmen for mccormick place and factories , liquor firms , and other businesses .	50.50305
among the witnesses were ed j . lee , director of mccormick place	205.03569
jerome leavitt , a partner in the union liquor company , 3247 s . kedzie av . , dominic senese , a teamster union slugger who is a buddy of stein and a cousin of tony accardo , onetime gang chief	28.444052
and frank w . pesce , operator of a glimco dominated deodorant firm , the best sanitation and supply company , 1215 blue island av . .	39.89829
lee said he had told the jury that he made an agreement in april with stein to supply and supervise janitors in mccormick place .	78.21313
stein ' s fee , lee said , was 10 per cent of the janitors ' pay .	24.033411
stein estimated this amount at `` about $1 , 500 or $1 , 600 a month ' ' .	26.000965
leavitt , as he entered the jury room , said he was prepared to answer questions about the $12 , 500 his liquor firm paid to stein for `` labor consultant work ' ' with five unions which organized leavitt ' s workers .	84.423546
leavitt identified the unions as a warehouseman ' s local , the teamsters union , a salesman ' s union , the janitors ' union , and a bottling workers ' union .	28.169415
government attorneys , leavitt said , have questioned him closely about `` five or six loans ' ' totaling about $40 , 000 which the liquor company made to stein in the last year .	65.518776
all of the loans , in amounts up to $5 , 000 each , have been repaid by stein , according to leavitt .	33.748154
stein said he needed the money , leavitt said , to `` meet the payroll ' ' at national maintenance company .	33.15695
the deodorant firm run by pesce has offices in the headquarters of glimco ' s discredited taxi drivers ' union at 1213-15 blue island av . .	35.042076
the radiation station of the chicago board of health recorded a reading of 1 micro-microcurie of radiation per cubic meter of air over chicago yesterday .	217.02478
the reading , which has been watched with interest since russia ' s detonation of a super bomb monday , was 4 on tuesday and 7 last saturday , a level far below the danger point , according to the board of health .	105.24851
the weather bureau has estimated that radioactive fallout from the test might arrive here next week .	130.34906
a board of health spokesman said there is no reason to believe that an increase in the level here will occur as a result of the detonation .	27.155588
curtis allen huff , 41 , of 1630 lake av . , wilmette , was arrested yesterday on a suppressed federal warrant charging him with embezzling an undetermined amount of money from the first federal savings and loan association , 1 s . dearborn st . , where he formerly was employed as an attorney .	56.72127
federal prosecutors estimated that the amount may total $20 , 000 , altho a spokesman for the association estimated its loss at approximately $10 , 000 .	38.798367
huff ' s attorney , antone f . gregorio , quoted his client as saying that part of the embezzlement represented money paid to huff , as attorney for the loan association , in satisfaction of mechanic ' s liens on property on which the association held mortgages .	86.63858
huff told gregorio that he took the money to pay `` the ordinary bills and expenses of suburban living ' ' .	87.63177
huff , who received a salary of $109 a week from the loan association from october of 1955 until september of this year , said that his private practice was not lucrative .	80.416046
huff lives with his wife , sue , and their four children , 6 to 10 years old , in a $25 , 000 home with a $17 , 000 mortgage .	45.088787
the complaint on which the warrant was issued was filed by leo blaber , an attorney for the association .	49.928837
the shortage was discovered after huff failed to report for work on sept . 18 .	88.18895
on that date , according to gregorio , huff left his home and took a room in the new lawrence hotel at 1020 lawrence av . .	60.200554
there , gregorio said , huff wrote a complete statement of his offense .	48.564026
later , huff cashed three checks for $100 each at the sherman house , using a credit card .	79.47565
when huff attempted to cash another $100 check there monday , hotel officials called police .	163.69835
-- greece and west germany have ratified an agreement under which germany will pay $28 , 700 , 000 to greek victims of nazi persecution , it was announced today .	62.87628
probably the hottest thing that has hit the dallas investment community in years was the morton foods stock issue , which was sold to the public during the past week .	65.374565
for many reasons , the demand to buy shares in the dallas-headquartered company was tremendous .	118.65077
it was not a case of the investment bankers having to sell the stock	66.354
it was more one of allotting a few shares to a number of customers and explaining to others why they had no more to sell .	66.825645
investors who wanted 100 shares in many cases ended up with 25 , and customers who had put in a bid to buy 400 shares found themselves with 100 and counted themselves lucky to get that many .	170.49275
in fact , very few customers , anywhere in the nation , were able to get more than 100 shares .	34.023582
some dallas investment firms got only 100 shares , for all of their customers .	25.994339
a measure of how hot the stock was , can be found in what happened to it on the market as soon as trading began .	79.16093
the stock was sold in the underwriting at a price of $12 . 50 a share .	54.199398
the first over-the-counter trade wednesday afternoon at eppler , guerin & turner , the managing underwriter , was at $17 a share .	36.52535
and from that the stock moved right on up until it was trading thursday morning at around $22 a share .	134.01787
but the morton foods issue was hot long before it was on the market .	31.10638
indeed , from the moment the reports of the coming issue first started circulating in dallas last january , the inquiries and demand for the stock started building up .	222.5184
letters by the reams came in from investment firms all over the nation , all of them wanting to get a part of the shares that would be sold ( 185 , 000 to the public at $12 . 50 , with another 5 , 000 reserved for morton foods employes at $11 . 50 a share ) .	53.79694
there was even a cable in french from a bank in switzerland that had somehow learned about the dallas stock offering .	203.6701
`` we subscribe 500 shares of morton foods of texas .	60.18307
cable confirmation ' ' , it said translated .	9.748453
but e . g . t . could not let the swiss bank have even 10 shares .	120.88455
after it allotted shares to 41 underwriters and 52 selling group members from coast to coast there were not many shares for anyone .	238.9637
but the result of it all was , e . g . t . partner dean guerin believes , an effective distribution of the stock to owners all over the nation .	63.91796
`` i feel confident the stock will qualify for the ' national list ' ' ' , he said , meaning its market price would be quoted regularly in newspapers all over the country .	77.66666
he was also pleased with the wide distribution because he thought it proved again his argument that dallas investment men can do just as good a job as the big new york investment bankers claim only they can do .	181.19408
but what made the morton foods stock issue such a hot one ? ?	178.19067
the answer is that it was a combination of circumstances .	20.664467
first , the general stock market has been boiling upward for the last few months , driving stocks of all kinds up .	89.740746
as a result , it is not easy to find a stock priced as the morton issue was priced ( at roughly 10 times 1960 earnings , to yield a little over 5 per cent on the 64-cent anticipated dividend ) .	79.0656
second , the `` potato chip industry ' ' has caught the fancy of investors lately , and until morton foods came along there were only two potato chip stocks -- frito and h . w . lay -- on the market .	66.30905
both of those have had dynamic run-ups in price on the market in recent months , both were selling at higher price-earnings and yield bases than morton was coming to market at , and everyone who knew anything about it expected the morton stock to have a fast run-up .	149.19003
and third , the potato chip industry has taken on the flavor of a `` growth ' ' industry in the public mind of late .	53.46588
foods , which long had been considered `` recession resistant ' ' but hardly dynamic stocks , have been acting like growth stocks , going to higher price-earnings ratios .	144.96349
the potato chip industry these days is growing , not only as a result of population increase and public acceptance of convenience foods , but also because of a combination of circumstances that has led to growth by merger .	67.38555
the history of the u . s . potato chip industry is that many of today ' s successful companies got started during the deep depression days .	89.24756
those that remain are those that were headed by strong executives , men with the abilities to last almost 30 years in the competitive survival of the fittest .	116.86643
but today many of those men are reaching retirement age and suddenly realizing that they face an estate tax problem with their closely held companies and also that they have no second-echelon management in their firms .	201.02698
so they go looking for mergers with other firms that have publicly quoted stock , and almost daily they pound on the doors of firms like frito .	238.83041
all those things combined to make the morton foods stock the hot issue that it was and is .	95.61944
now , if morton ' s newest product , a corn chip known as chip-o ' s , turns out to sell as well as its stock did , the stock may turn out to be worth every cent of the prices that the avid buyers bid it up to .	93.43141
dallas and north texas is known world-wide as the manufacturing and distribution center of cotton gin machinery and supplies , valued in the millions of dollars .	48.532368
more than 10 companies maintain facilities in dallas and one large manufacturer is located to the north at sherman .	81.15941
it is no coincidence that the texas cotton ginner ' s association is meeting here this week for the 46th time in their 52-year history .	59.249905
the exhibition of cotton ginning machinery at the state fair grounds is valued at more than a million dollars .	60.2596
it weighs in the tons , so the proximity of factory and exhibition area makes it possible for an outstanding exhibit each year .	123.70152
a modern cotton gin plant costs in the neighborhood of $250 , 000 , and it ' s a safe assumption that a large percentage of new gins in the u . s . and foreign countries contain machinery made in this area .	26.337101
the murray co . of texas , inc . , originated in dallas in 1896 .	45.392307
they ' ve occupied a 22-acre site since the early 1900 ' s .	14.837682
more than 700 employees make gin machinery that ' s sold anywhere cotton is grown .	156.17784
murray makes a complete line of ginning equipment except for driers and cleaners , and this machinery is purchased from a dallas-based firm .	54.95709
the continental gin co . began operations in dallas in 1899 .	62.02649
the present company is a combination of several smaller ones that date back to 1834 .	262.20224
factories are located here and in prattville , ala . .	3.4161365
about 40 per cent of the manufacturing is done at the dallas plant by more than 200 employes .	80.18684
the company sells a complete line of gin machinery all over the cotton-growing world .	131.61166
hardwicke-etter co . of sherman makes a full line of gin machinery and equipment .	15.648905
the firm recently expanded domestic sales into the southeastern states as a result of an agreement with cen-tennial gin co . .	35.579483
the company began operation in 1900 with hardware and oil mill supplies .	12.273226
in 1930 , they began making cotton processing equipment .	15.553104
presently , hardwicke-etter employs 300-450 people , depending on the season of the year .	12.857415
the lummus cotton gin co . has had a sales and service office in dallas since 1912 .	117.070114
factory operations are in columbus , ga . .	13.130711
the moss gordin lint cleaner co . and gordin unit system of ginning have joint headquarters here .	169.66505
the cleaner equipment firm began operations in 1953 and the unit system , which turns out a complete ginning system , began operations in 1959 .	69.2002
the john e . mitchell co . began work in dallas in 1928 .	83.77898
the firm is prominent in making equipment for cleaning seed cotton , driers , and heaters , and they lay claim to being the first maker ( 1910 ) of boil extraction equipment .	85.32772
the increase in mechanical harvesting of cotton makes cleaning and drying equipment a must for modern gin operation .	147.56326
mitchell employs a total of about 400 people .	40.941917
the hinckley gin supply co . is a maker of `` overhead equipment ' ' .	44.77261
this includes driers , cleaners , burr extractors , separators and piping that ' s located above gin stands in a complete gin .	107.286804
the firm began operations back in 1925 and sells equipment in the central cotton belt , including the mississippi delta .	100.993675
the cen-tennial gin supply co . has home offices and factory facilities here .	102.764465
they make gin saws and deal in parts , supplies and some used gin machinery .	109.819824
the stacy co . makes cleaning and drying equipment for sale largely in texas .	83.085
they ' ve been in dallas since 1921 .	3.5724251
cotton belt gin service , inc . of dallas makes gin saws and started here 14 years ago .	100.08988
the firm also handles gin and oil mill supplies such as belting , bearings , etc . .	21.028294
cotton processing equipment is a sizable segment of dallas business economy .	190.33615
new car sales in dallas county during march showed slight signs of recovering from the doldrums which have characterized sales this year .	126.291595
registrations of new cars in dallas county cracked the 3 , 000 mark in march for the first time this year .	34.89795
totaling 3 , 399 , sales jumped 14 per cent over february ' s 2 , 963 .	19.242132
however , compared with march 1960 new car sales of 4 , 441 , this march was off 23 per cent .	58.563286
on a quarter-to-quarter comparison , the first quarter of 1961 total of 9 , 273 cars was 21 per cent behind the previous year ' s 3-month total of 11 , 744 .	66.3941
this year-to-year decline for dallas county closely follows the national trend -- estimated sales of domestic cars in the u . s . for first three months of 1961 were about 1 , 212 , 000 or 80 per cent of the total in the first quarter a year earlier .	28.941273
with the march pickup , dealers are optimistic that the april-june quarter will equal or top last year .	159.24738
the march gain plus this optimism has been encouraging enough to prompt auto makers to boost production schedules for the next quarter .	93.85252
on the local level , compacts continue to grab a larger share of the market at the expense of lower-priced standard models and foreign cars .	55.27156
only three standard models -- buick , chrysler , and mercury -- had slight year-to-year gains in march sales in the county .	72.3967

now in its third year , the program is designed to provide a laboratory for those youngsters seeking careers in marketing and salesmanship .	40.14057

the kennedy administration ' s new housing and urban renewal proposals , particularly their effect on the federal housing administration , came under fire in dallas last week .	98.62651
the administration ' s proposals , complex and sweeping as they are , all deal with fringe areas of the housing market rather than its core , stated caron s . stallard , first vice-president of the mortgage bankers association of america .	76.17844
-- `` the present recovery movement will gather steady momentum to lift the economy to a new historic peak by this autumn ' ' , beryl w . sprinkel , economist of harris trust & savings bank , chicago , predicted at the closing session here tuesday of investment bankers assn . , california group , conference .	123.90401
another speaker , william h . draper , jr . , former under secretary of the army and now with the palo alto venture capital firm of draper , gaither & anderson , urged the u . s . to `` throw down the gauntlet of battle to communism and tell moscow bluntly we won ' t be pushed around any more ' ' .	50.24189
he urged support for president kennedy ' s requests for both defense and foreign aid appropriations .	55.57718
sprinkel told conferees that the recent improvement in economic activity was not a `` temporary flash in the pan ' ' but the beginning of a substantial cyclical expansion that will carry the economy back to full employment levels and witness a renewal of our traditional growth pattern .	116.8954
`` in view of the current expansion , which promises to be substantial ' ' he said the odds appear to favor rising interest rates in coming months , but `` there is reason to believe the change will not be as abrupt as in 1958 nor as severe as in late 1959 and 1960 ' ' .	85.475296
sprinkel strongly refuted the current neo-stagnationist thesis that we are facing a future of limited and slow growth , declaring that this pessimism `` is based on very limited and questionable evidence ' ' .	95.189766
rather than viewing the abortive recovery in 1959-60 as a reason for believing we have lost prospects for growth ' ' , he said `` it should be viewed as a lesson well learned which will increase the probability of substantial improvement in this recovery ' ' .	73.898705
he cautioned that `` the greater danger in this recovery may be excessive stimulation by government which could bring moderate inflation ' ' .	115.10501
the economist does not look for a drastic switch in the budget during this recovery and believes it `` even more unlikely that the federal reserve will aggressively tighten monetary policy in the early phases of the upturn as was the case in 1958 ' ' .	67.99585
the unsatisfactory 1958-60 expansion , he said , was not due to inadequate growth forces inherent in our economy but rather to the adverse effect of inappropriate economic policies combined with retrenching decisions resulting from the steel strike .	142.47044
draper declared , `` as i see it , this country has never faced such great dangers as threaten us today .	109.487755
we must be ready for any needed sacrifice ' ' .	3.1745648
he said that from his experience of two years with gen . clay in west berlin administration , that `` russia respects our show of strength , but that presently we ' re not acting as we should and must ' ' .	121.935074
he called the cuban tractor plan an outright blackmail action , and noted that in war `` you can ' t buy yourself out and that ' s what we ' re trying to do ' ' .	31.629396
while he declined to suggest , how , he said that sooner or later we must get rid of castro , `` for unless we do we ' re liable to face similar situations in this hemisphere .	104.21774
its the start of a direct threat to our own security and i don ' t believe we can permit that ' ' .	24.574242
-- stock market tuesday staged a technical recovery , erasing all of monday ' s losses in the associated press average and making the largest gain in about two weeks .	102.57774
analysts saw the move as a continuation of the recovery drive that got under way late monday afternoon when the list sank to a hoped-for `` support level ' ' represented by around 675 in the dow jones industrial average .	209.97034
it was a level at which some of the investors standing on the sidelines were thought likely to buy the pivotal issues represented in the averages .	179.55792
although it looked like a routine technical snapback to wall streeters it was accompanied by some good news .	58.980396
a substantial rise in new orders and sales of durable goods was reported for last month .	39.029297
treasury secretary douglas dillon said the economy is expected to advance by a whopping 8% next year , paving the way for lower taxes .	99.99948
the dow jones industrial average advanced 7 . 19 to 687 . 87 .	28.456295
of 1 , 253 issues traded , 695 advanced and 354 declined .	69.7484
new highs for the year totaled nine and new lows 14 .	49.096798
volume dipped to 3 . 28 million shares from 3 . 98 million monday .	66.284645
a $25 billion advertising budget in an $800 billion economy was envisioned for the 1970s here tuesday by peter g . peterson , head of one of the world ' s greatest camera firms , in a key address before the american marketing assn . .	58.26897
however , peterson , president of bell & howell , warned 800 u . s . marketing leaders attending a national conference at the ambassador , that the future will belong to the industrialist of creative and `` unconventional wisdom ' ' .	55.57519
`` as we look to the $800 billion economy that is predicted for 1970 and the increase of about 40% in consumer expenditures that will be required to reach that goal , management can well be restless about how this tremendous volume and number of new products will be created and marketed ' ' , peterson said .	85.64073
`` with this kind of new product log-jam , the premium for brilliant product planning will obviously go up geometrically ' ' .	105.375015
the executive paid tribute to research and development and technology for their great contributions in the past , but he also cautioned industry that they tend to be great equalizers because they move at a fairly even pace within an industry and fail to give it the short-term advantage which it often needs .	92.63707
peterson said america has nothing to fear in world competition if it dares to be original in both marketing and product ideas .	213.38187
he cited , as an example , how the american camera industry has been able to meet successfully the competition of japan despite lower japanese labor costs , by improving its production know-how and technology .	108.768456
he also used as an example the manufacturer who introduced an all-automatic camera in germany , with the result that it became the best selling camera in the german market .	83.537636
election of howard l . taylor to membership in pacific coast stock exchange , effective tuesday , has been announced by thomas p . phelan , president of the exchange .	62.33714
taylor , president and voting stockholder of taylor and co . , beverly hills , has been active in the securities business since 1925 .	49.370872
union oil co . of california tuesday offered $120 million in debentures to the public through a group of underwriters headed by dillon , read & co . , to raise money to retire a similar amount held by gulf oil corp . .	67.34428
gulf ' s holdings could have been converted into 2 , 700 , 877 shares of union oil common upon surrender of debentures plus cash , according to union .	148.49838
under the new offering , only $60 million in debentures are convertible into 923 , 076 common shares .	34.378914

the convertible debentures are convertible into common shares at $65 a share by june 1 , 1966	83.985245

-- i bought 50 shares of diversified growth stock fund on oct . 23 , 1959 , and 50 more shares of the same mutual fund on feb . 8 , 1960 .	35.81435
i am getting dividends on only 50 shares .	7.2963166
in other words , i am getting only half the dividends i should .	287.9356
-- write to the fund ' s custodian bank -- the first national bank of jersey city , n . j . .	45.253883
that bank handles most of the paper work for diversified growth stock fund , fundamental investors , diversified investment fund and television-electronics fund .	158.22963
the bank installed a magnetic tape electronic data processing system to handle things .	53.849903
but it seems that this `` electronic brain ' ' wasn ' t `` programmed ' ' correctly .	9.969251
this resulted in a great number of errors .	10.875699
and letters began to come in to this column from irate shareholders .	52.007435
i visited the bank in march and wrote a story about the situation .	35.42897
at that time , the people at the bank said they felt that they had the situation in hand .	45.686478
they indicated that no new errors were being made and that all old errors would be corrected `` within 60 days ' ' .	61.12382
that 60-day period is over and letters are still coming in from shareholders of these four funds , complaining about mistakes in their accounts .	97.06425
maybe it ' s taking longer to get things squared away than the bankers expected .	767.3719
any shareholder of any of these funds who finds a mistake in his account certainly should get in touch with the bank .	145.09785
he selects queries or general interest to answer .	5.0057516
-- alfred hayes , president of the federal reserve bank of new york , said tuesday `` there is no present need for far-reaching reforms ' ' which would basically alter the international financial system .	59.88247
hayes said that if a way can be found to deal effectively with short-term capital movements between nations , `` there is no reason , in my judgment why the international financial system cannot work satisfactorily for at least the foreseeable future ' ' .	108.00206
-- new york central railroad president alfred e . perlman said tuesday his line would face the threat of bankruptcy if the chesapeake & ohio and baltimore & ohio railroads merge .	59.645428
perlman said bankruptcy would not be an immediate effect of the merger , but could possibly be an ultimate effect .	75.69998
the railroad president made the statement in an interview as the interstate commerce commission opened round 2 of its hearing into the c & o ' s request to control and then merge with the b & aj .	79.72259
`` all these kind of things weaken us ' ' , perlman said .	12.17116
board chairman howard simpson of the baltimore & ohio railroad co . , testified the b & o was in its worst financial condition since the depression years and badly needed the economic lift it would get from consolidation with the chesapeake & ohio railroad .	73.03549
`` the financial situation of the baltimore & ohio , has become precarious -- much worse than at any time since the depression of the 1930s ' ' , he told the hearing .	39.573784
c & o president walter j . tuohy was summoned back for cross-examination by new york central attorneys before examiner john bradford who is hearing the complex case .	139.72768
the new york central also has asked the icc to permit it to gain control of the b & aj .	70.6746
central was rebuffed by the other two railroads in previous attempts to make it a three-way merger .	104.38137
the proposed c & o-b & o railroad would make it the hemisphere ' s second largest .	82.213844

on $1 . 1 billion of 90-day bills , the average yield was 2 . 325% .	19.761076
the rate a week ago was 2 . 295% .	33.470062
-- `` consumer uncertain about economic conditions ' ' .	1.8625205
this was the chief reason for a so-so sales outlook given by two-thirds of 56 builders polled by the national housing center .	125.953186
other reasons mentioned by one-third or more of the builders were `` resistance to high interest rates , cost advantage of buying over renting has narrowed , shelter market nearing saturation and prospects unable to qualify ' ' .	251.52084
the poll was taken at the center ' s annual builders ' intentions conference .	64.528694
expect their own production volume , and presumably sales , to jump 30 percent in 1961 .	82.99867
look for home building nationally to advance less than 10 percent this year from 1960 ' s 1 , 257 , 700 non-farm housing starts .	29.272665
the industry has said 1960 was a poor year .	35.360897
why the discrepancy between the builders ' forecasts for themselves and for the industry ? ?	52.215427

-- farm machinery dealer bob houtz tilts back in a battered chair and tells of a sharp pickup in sales `` we ' ve sold four corn pickers since labor day and have good prospects for 10 more .	100.66703
we sold only four pickers all last year ' ' .	3.6084776
gus ehlers , competitor of mr . houtz in this farm community , says his business since august 1 is running 50% above a year earlier .	143.65681
`` before then , my sales during much of the year had lagged behind 1960 by 20% ' ' , he says .	53.830902
though the sales gains these two dealers are experiencing are above average for their business , farm equipment sales are climbing in most rural areas .	128.13985
paradoxically , the sales rise is due in large measure to government efforts to slash farm output .	146.06924
although the administration ' s program cut crop acreage to the lowest point since 1934 , farmers , with the help of extra fertilizer and good weather , are getting such high yields per acre that many are being forced to buy new harvesting machines .	110.48279
fields of corn and some other crops in many cases are so dense that older equipment cannot handle them efficiently .	180.49387
the higher price supports provided by the new legislation , together with rising prices for farm products , are pushing up farm income , making it possible for farmers to afford the new machinery .	58.89572
seven of the eight companies that turn out full lines of farm machinery say sales by their dealers since the start of august have shown gains averaging nearly 10% above last year .	177.09229
`` in august our dealers sold 13% more farm machinery than a year earlier and in september retail sales were 14% higher than last year ' ' , says mark v . keeler , farm equipment vice president of international harvester co . .	51.440983
for the year to date , sales of the company ' s farm equipment dealers still lag about 5% behind 1960 .	54.766407
among individual dealers questioned in nearly a score of states , two out of three report their sales since august 1 show sizable gains from a year earlier , with the increases ranging from 5% to 50% .	81.67572
not all sections are showing an upswing , however	27.265984
the drought-seared north central states are the most notable exceptions to the uptrend .	28.625109
the significance of the pickup in farm machinery sales extends beyond the farm equipment industry .	66.327896
the demand for farm machinery is regarded as a yardstick of rural buying generally .	62.155903
farmers spend more of their income on tractors and implements than on any other group of products .	64.104546
more than 20 million people live on farms and they own a fourth of the nation ' s trucks , buy more gasoline than any other industry and provide a major market for home appliances , chemicals and other products .	76.636955
farmers are so eager for new machinery that they ' re haggling less over prices than they did a year ago , dealers report .	120.45899
`` farmers aren ' t as price conscious as last year so we can get more money on a sale ' ' , says jack martin , who sells j . i . case tractors and implements in sioux city , iowa .	92.29008
`` this morning , we allowed a farmer $600 on the old picker he traded in on a new $2 , 700 model .	114.54942
last year , we probably would have given him $700 for a comparable machine ' ' .	58.64653
in august of 1960 , he sold seven .	334.04938
with dealer stocks of new equipment averaging about 25% below a year ago , the affects of the rural recovery are being felt almost immediately by the country ' s farm equipment manufacturers .	59.34989
for example , farm equipment shipments of international harvester in august climbed about 5% above a year earlier , mr . keeler reports .	70.256004
tractor production at massey-ferguson , ltd . , of toronto in july and august rose to 2 , 418 units from 869 in the like period a year earlier , says john staiger , vice president .	76.329
with the lower dealer inventories and the stepped-up demand some manufacturers believe there could be shortages of some implements .	354.14307
merritt d . hill , ford motor co . vice president , says his company is starting to get calls daily from dealers demanding immediate delivery or wanting earlier shipping dates on orders for corn pickers .	186.73555
except for a few months in late 1960 and early 1961 , retail farm equipment sales have trailed year-earlier levels since the latter part of 1959 .	67.82808
the rise in sales last winter was checked when the government ' s new feed grain program was adopted	95.44656
the program resulted in a cutback of around 20% in planted acreage and , as a result , reduced the immediate need for machines .	80.03511
nearly all of the farm equipment manufacturers and dealers say the upturn in sales has resulted chiefly from the recent improvement in crop prospects .	120.17391
total farm output for this year is officially forecast at 129% of the 1947-49 average , three points higher than the july 1 estimate and exactly equal to the final figure for 1960 .	116.405815
the government also is aiding farmers ' income prospects .	10.68818
agriculture department economists estimate the government this year will hand farmers $1 . 4 billion in special subsidies and incentive payments , well above the record $1 . 1 billion of 1958 and about double the $639 million of 1960 .	135.54474
price support loans may total another $1 billion this year .	28.75375
with cash receipts from marketings expected to be slightly above 1960 , farmers ' gross income is estimated at $39 . 5 billion , $1 . 5 billion above 1960 ' s record high .	74.61188
net income may reach $12 . 7 billion , up $1 billion from 1960 and the highest since 1953 .	49.403027
the government reported last week that the index of prices received by farmers rose in the month ended at mid-september for the third consecutive month , reaching 242% of the 1910-14 average compared with 237% at mid-july .	47.025585
kennedy opposes any widespread relief from a high court depletion ruling .	35.80414
the supreme court decision in mid-1960 was in the case of a company making sewer pipe from clay which it mined .	136.07803
the company , in figuring its taxable earnings , deducted a percentage of the revenue it received for its finished products .	107.56992
such `` depletion allowances ' ' , in the form of percentages of sales are authorized by tax law for specified raw materials producers using up their assets .	164.43349
the high court held that the company must apply its percentage allowance to the value of the raw materials removed from the ground , not to the revenue from finished products .	95.55403
a measure passed by congress just before adjourning softened the ruling ' s impact , on prior-year returns still under review , for clay-mining companies that make brick and tile products .	219.5363
the measure allows such companies in those years to apply their mineral depletion allowances to 50% of the value of the finished products rather than the lower value of raw clay alone .	78.813515
president kennedy , in signing the relief measure into law , stressed he regarded it as an exception .	186.25702
`` my approval of this bill should not be viewed as establishing a precedent for the enactment of similar legislation for other mineral industries ' ' , the president said .	41.3308
charitable deductions come in for closer scrutiny by the i . r . s . .	36.373016
the service announced that taxpayers making such claims may be called on to furnish a statement from the recipient organization showing the date , purpose , amount and other particulars of the contribution .	93.059395
requests for substantiation , the service indicated , can be especially expected in cases where it suspects the donor received some material benefit in return , such as tickets to a show .	242.7407
in such an instance , revenuers stressed , the deduction must be reduced by the value of the benefit received .	55.1635
a rule on the federal deductibility of state taxes is contested .	50.73051
a realty corporation in louisiana owed no tax , under federal law , on its gain from the sale of property disposed of in line with a plan of liquidation .	63.240837
louisiana , however , collected an income tax on the profits from the sale .	29.623293
the corporation , in filing its final federal income return , claimed the state tax payment as a deductible expense , as permitted under u . s . tax law .	63.173233
the revenue service disallowed the claim , invoking a law provision that generally bars deductions for expenses incurred in connection with what it said was tax-exempt income .	147.08684
it said the tax-freedom of the gain in this case stemmed not from the exempt status of the income but from a special rule on corporate liquidations .	103.94786
the tax court decision and a similar earlier finding by the ninth circuit court of appeals challenges a year-old i . r . s . ruling on the subject .	51.682163
the service has not said what its next step will be .	34.72371
peace corps volunteers are assured a tax benefit under the law creating the agency .	77.177864
it provides that the $1 , 800 termination payment each cadet is to get , after serving a two-year hitch without pay , will be spread over both years , not taxed in its entirety at a possibly higher rate in the year received .	101.2223
the owner of a public relations firm owed no income tax on payments he received from a client company and `` kicked back ' ' to the company ' s advertising manager , the tax court ruled .	70.53861
the taxpayer testified that in order to retain the account he had to pad his invoices and pay the excess to the manager .	71.40152
the court upheld the taxpayer ' s contention that these `` kickbacks ' ' were not his income though they passed through his hands .	59.30938
the court limited its decision to the tax issue involved , commenting `` it is not our province to pass judgment on the morality of the transaction ' ' .	67.08812
a portable kerosene range designed for use aboard boats is sold with a special railing to keep it from moving with the motion of the vessel .	62.635902
the revenue service said the addition of the attachment does not keep the range from coming under the federal manufacturers ' excise tax on household-type appliances .	88.80128
hiring the wife for one ' s company may win her tax-aided retirement income .	129.84056
a spouse employed by a corporation her husband controls , for example , may be entitled to distributions under the company ' s pension plan as well as to her own social security coverage .	42.130604
she would be taxed on the pensions when received , of course , but the company ' s contributions would be tax-free .	34.15474
a frequent pitfall in this sort of arrangement , experts warn , is a tendency to pay the wife more than her job is worth and to set aside an excessive amount for her as retirement income .	108.50618
in that event , they note , the revenue service might declare the pension plan is discriminatory and deny it tax privileges under the law .	111.39679
possible upshots the company could be denied a deduction for its pension payments , or those payments for the wife and other employes could be ruled taxable to them in the year made .	85.59288
state briefs voters in four counties containing and bordering denver authorized the imposition of an additional 2% sales tax within that area .	223.4611
denver itself collects a 1% sales tax which is to be absorbed in the higher area tax .	46.62731
the washington state supreme court ruled that the state ' s occupation tax applied to sales , made at cost to an oil company , by a wholly-owned subsidiary set up to purchase certain supplies without divulging the identity of the parent .	92.2646
the state ' s occupation tax is computed on gross sales .	63.49462
the court held that the tax applied to non-profit sales because the corporations realized economic benefits by doing business as two separate entities .	501.52682
-- consumer spending edged down in april after rising for two consecutive months , the government reported .	111.53195
the commerce department said seasonally adjusted sales of retail stores dropped to slightly under $18 billion in april , down 1% from the march level of more than $18 . 2 billion .	67.3639
april sales also were 5% below those of april last year , when volume reached a record for any month , $18 . 9 billion ( see chart on page one ) .	99.810684
the seasonal adjustment takes into account such factors as easter was on april 2 this year , two weeks earlier than in 1960 , and pre-easter buying was pushed into march .	85.55497
commerce department officials were inclined to explain the april sales decline as a reaction from a surge of consumer buying in march .	137.0628

the attractive greer garson , who loves beautiful clothes and selects them as carefully as she does her professional roles , prefers timeless classical designs .	117.00616
occasionally she deserts the simple and elegant for a fun piece simply because `` it ' s unlike me ' ' .	74.4523
in private life , miss garson is mrs . e . e . fogelson and on the go most of the time commuting from dallas , where they maintain an apartment , to their california home in los angeles ' suburban bel-air to their ranch in pecos , new mexico .	59.086067
therefore , her wardrobe is largely mobile , to be packed at a moment ' s notice and to shake out without a wrinkle .	56.65067
her creations in fashion are from many designers because she doesn ' t want a complete wardrobe from any one designer any more than she wants `` all of her pictures by one painter ' ' .	62.63456
her favorite cocktail dress is a norell , a black and white organdy and silk jersey .	58.64874
irene suits rate high because they are designed for her long-bodied silhouette .	26.696972
she also likes the femininity and charm of designs by ceil chapman and helen rose .	63.448856
`` i bought my first dress from him when i was still a struggling young actress ' ' , she reminisces .	31.25077
`` i like his clothes for their drama and simplicity and appreciate the great impact he has on fashion ' ' .	103.49526
black and white is her favorite color combination along with lively glowing pinks , reds , blues and greens .	42.47042
of scotch-irish-scandinavian descent , greer garson was born in county down , ireland .	291.81924
her mother was a greer and her father ' s family came from the orkney isles .	25.91268
reared in england , she studied to be a teacher , earned several scholarships and was graduated with honors from the university of london .	60.38369
she took postgraduate work at the university of grenoble in france and then returned to london to work on market research with an advertising firm .	109.90742
her acting began with the birmingham repertory company and she soon became the toast of the west end .	73.02588
among stage performances was a starring role in `` golden arrow ' ' directed by noel coward .	37.024548
it was during `` old music ' ' at the st . james theater that hollywood ' s louis b . mayer spotted her .	85.07116
after signing a motion-picture contract , she came to america and had `` goodbye , mr . chips ' ' as her first assignment after a year ' s wait .	57.119717
other triumphs include `` random harvest ' ' , `` madame curie ' ' , `` pride and prejudice ' ' , `` the forsythe saga ' ' and `` mrs . miniver ' ' ( which won her the academy award in 1943 ) .	19.089718
honors that have come to greer garson are countless .	66.58661
just this april she was nominated for the seventh time for an academy award for her portrayal of eleanor roosevelt in `` sunrise at campobello ' ' .	70.60346
she gave a fine portrayal of auntie mame on broadway in 1958 and has appeared in live television from `` captain brassbound ' s conversion ' ' to `` camille ' ' .	65.64465
she is in madame tussard ' s waxworks in london , a princess of the kiowa tribe and an honorary colonel in many states .	31.997902
she is adept at skeet shooting , trout fishing , afro-cuban and oriental dancing and southwestern archaeology .	40.989582
she now serves on the board of directors of the dallas symphony orchestra and the dallas theater center and on the board of trustees of the dallas museum of fine arts .	32.867954
she is state chairman for the new mexico tuberculosis and cancer associations .	174.87543
both miss garson and her oilman-rancher husband are active supporters of boys clubs of america and patrons of the vivid art and opera colony that flourishes in new mexico .	140.0968

use one 6-ounce chicken breast for each guest .	13.02647
dip in melted butter and roll in flour .	2.616303
place side by side in a 2-inch deep baking pan .	40.50289
bake slowly about one hour at 250-275 f . until lightly brown .	209.36607
add enough warmed cream , seasoned to taste with onion juice , to about half cover the chicken breasts .	56.603092
while this is baking , saute mushrooms , fresh or canned , in butter .	54.385574

contemporary furniture that is neither danish nor straight-line modern but has sculptured pattern , many design facets , warmth , dignity and an effect of utter comfort and livability .	189.04729
that is the goal of two new collections being introduced in dallas this month .	138.18352
though there has been some avant garde indication that contemporary furniture might go back to the boxy look of the ' 20 ' s and ' 40 ' s , two manufacturers chose to take the approach of the sophisticated , but warm look in contemporary .	95.77874
these two , heritage and drexel , chose too not to produce the exactly matching design for every piece , but a collection of correlated designs , each of which could stand alone .	123.415245
the heritage collection , to be shown by sanger-harris and anderson ' s studio , has perhaps more different types of woods and decorations than any one manufacturer ever assembled together at one time .	104.14452
called perennian , to indicate its lasting , good today and tomorrow quality , the collection truly avoids the monotony of identical pieces .	116.89045
walnut , wormy chestnut , pecan , three varieties of burl , hand-woven philippine cane , ceramic tiles , marble are used to emphasize the feeling of texture and of permanence , the furniture to fit into rooms with tiled floors , brick or paneled walls , windows that bring in the outdoors .	41.10997
it is a collection with a custom-design look , offering simplicity with warmth , variety and vitality .	105.990715
the drexel collection , called composite , to be shown by titche ' s offers a realistic approach to decorating , a mature modern that is a variation of many designs .	86.06936
rounded posts give a soft , sculptured look , paneled doors have decorative burl panels or cane insets plus softening arches , table tops are inlaid in macassar ebony or acacia .	31.793774
a high-legged buffet provides easy-to-reach serving , a cocktail table has small snack tables tucked under each end , recessed arched panels decorate a 60-inch long chest .	75.34584
an interesting approach to the bedroom is presented , with a young , basic , functional group of chests , dressers and corner units and a canted headboard .	61.530384
the other bedroom has heavier styling , door-fronted dressers with acacia panels , a poster bed or a bed with arched acacia panels and matching mirror .	59.774574
colorful , bright eastman chromspun fabrics , with the magenta , pink and white tones predominating as well as golden shades are used with composite .	31.773237
the fabrics have scotchgard finish to resist soil and wrinkles .	18.810883
design elements closely rooted to traditional forms but wearing a definite contemporary label keynote drexel ' s fall 1961 group , composite .	180.94455
the spider-leg pedestal table has a base finished in an ebony , to set off the lustrous brown of the walnut top .	54.593487
see-through design of the chairs combines both the nostalgic ladder back and an oriental shoji flavor .	69.22641
to bring warmth to the dining area , golden orange tones are used in the fabrics .	44.75084
dignity and comfort , in a contemporary manner , reflecting the best aspects of today ' s design , with substance and maturity , keynote the perennian collection from heritage .	104.46218
center panel , hand-screened wood , actually is a back of one of the tall bookcases .	40.064964
mellow bronzy-green-gold fabrics and the gleam of copper and hand-crafted ceramic accessories reiterate the mood as does the alexander smith carpet in all wool loop pile .	100.96335

giving up the violin opened a whole new career for ilona schmidl-seeberg , a tiny hungarian who fritz kreisler had predicted would have a promising career on the concert stage .	43.06428
a heart attack when she was barely 20 put an end to the 10-hour daily practicing .	184.49577
she put the violin away and took out some linen , needles and yarn to while away the long , idle days in budapest .	166.2456
now her modern tapestries have been exhibited on two continents and , at 26 , she feels she is on the threshold of a whole new life in los angeles .	80.247925
her days as an art student at the university of budapest came to a sudden end during the hungarian uprisings in 1957 and she and her husband stephen fled to vienna .	88.445335
there they continued their studies at the university , she in art , he in architecture .	104.0522
and there she had her first showing of tapestry work .	121.544334
there ' s a lot of talk about the problem of education in america today .	34.682457
what most people don ' t seem to realize , if they aren ' t tied up with the thing as i am , is that 90% of the problem is transportation .	52.243423
i never dreamed of the logistical difficulties involved until , at long last , both of my boys got squeezed into high school .	225.67996
it seems like only last year that we watched them set out up the hill hand in hand on a rainy day in their yellow raincoats to finger-paint at the grammar school .	96.36379
getting to and from school was no problem .	7.451099
now they go to a high school that is two miles away .	43.27089
one might think the problem would be similar .	2.465478
they could walk , ride on a bus or be driven .	69.56907
it ' s much more complex than that .	107.811844
generally , they go to school with a girl named gloriana , who lives down the block , and has a car .	57.4278
this is a way of getting to school , but , i understand , it entails a certain loss of social status .	56.37164
a young man doesn ' t like to be driven up in front of a school in a car driven by a girl who isn ' t even in a higher class than he is , and is also a girl .	46.346684
`` why don ' t you walk to school then ' ' ? ?	29.4339
`` my father walked , through two miles of snow , in illinois ' ' .	30.267006
`` no ' ' , i said , `` i didn ' t happen to grow up in illinois ' ' .	14.499103
i explained , however , that i had my share of hardship in making my daily pilgrimage to the feet of wisdom .	140.81418
i had to ride a streetcar two miles .	13.681102
sometimes there weren ' t even any seats .	3.3233325
i had to stand up , with the ladies .	151.62726
sometimes i got on the wrong car and didn ' t get to school at all , but wound up at the ocean , or some other dismal place , and had to spend the day there .	73.18554
i ' ve tried to compromise by letting them take the little car now and then .	74.74406
when they do that my wife has to drive me to work in the big car .	47.35183
she has to have at least one car herself .	513.73267
i feel a certain loss of status when i am driven up in front of work in a car driven by my wife , who is only a woman .	50.792366
if they have to take any car , they ' d rather take the big one .	70.56546
they say that when they take a car , gloriana doesn ' t take her car , but rides with them .	49.84027
but when gloriana rides with them they also have to take the two girls who usually ride with her , so the little car isn ' t big enough .	67.64961
the logic of that is impeccable , of course , except that i feel like a fool being driven up to work in a little car , by my wife , when everybody knows i have a big car and am capable of driving myself .	71.60261
the solution , naturally , is the bus .	27.289944
however , it ' s a half-mile walk down a steep hill from our house to the bus , and it ' s too hard on my legs .	42.047035
my wife could drive us down the hill and we could all walk from there .	121.81919
nobody walks anymore but crackpots and harry truman , and he ' s already got an education .	73.30855

here ' s an idea for a child ' s room that is easy to execute and is completely charming , using puppets for lamp bases .	73.09009
most children love the animated puppet faces and their flexible bodies , and they prefer to see them as though the puppets were in action , rather than put away in boxes .	84.66563
displayed as lamps , the puppets delight the children and are decorative accent .	150.94734
to create such a lamp , order a wired pedestal from any lamp shop .	157.5205
measure the puppet to determine the height of the light socket , allowing three to four inches above the puppet ' s head .	30.557226
make sure that the metal tube through which the wire passes is in the shape of an inverted `` l ' ' , the foot of the `` l ' ' about three inches long , so that the puppet can hang directly under the light .	39.87242
using the strings that manipulate the puppet , suspend him from the light fixture by tying the strings to the lamp base .	43.724293
in this way , you can arrange his legs and arms in any desired position , with feet , or one foot , barely resting on the pedestal .	66.42329
if the puppets are of uniform size , you can change them in accord with your child ' s whims .	42.762547
although a straight drum shade would be adequate and sufficiently neutral that the puppets could be changed without disharmony , it is far more fun to create shades in the gay spirit of a child ' s playtime .	50.974716
those illustrated are reminiscent of a circus top or a merry-go-round .	20.425941
today ' s trend toward furniture designs from america ' s past is teaching home-owners and decorators a renewed respect for the shrewd cabinetmakers of our colonial era .	58.826954
a generation ago there were plenty of people who appreciated antiques and fine reproductions .	58.528778
in the background lurked the feeling , however , that these pieces , beautiful as they were , lacked the utilitarian touch .	70.882195
so junior ' s bedroom was usually tricked out with heavy , nondescript pieces that supposedly could take the `` hard knocks ' ' , while the fine secretary was relegated to the parlor where it was for show only .	82.95487
this isn ' t true of the many homemakers of the 1960 ' s , according to decorator consultant , leland alden .	37.366985
housewives are finding literally hundreds of ways of getting the maximum use out of traditional designs , says mr . alden and they are doing it largely because colonial craftsmen had `` an innate sense of the practical ' ' .	92.00504
there are a number of reasons why the eighteenth century designer had to develop `` down to earth ' ' designs -- or go out of business .	102.681046

is there anything a frustrated individual can do about communism ' s growing threat on our doorstep and around the world ? ?	38.146805
more than 300 teenagers last sunday proved there is and as many more are expected to prove it again for jim kern and his wife lynn from 4 to 8 p . m . sunday at first presbyterian church .	48.37564
at that time the second half of the christian youth crusade against communism will be staged .	72.01271
a young real estate salesman , kern first got seriously interested in the problems posed by communism when in the navy air force .	169.99149
he was particularly struck by a course on communist brainwashing .	34.172764
kern began reading a lot about the history and philosophy of communism , but never felt there was anything he , as an individual , could do about it .	72.423454
when he attended the christian anti-communist crusade school here about six months ago , jim became convinced that an individual can do something constructive in the ideological battle and set out to do it .	83.56887
the best approach , he figured , was to try to influence young people like the high schoolers he and his wife serve as advisors at first presbyterian church .	101.88305
and he wanted to be careful that the kids not only learn about communist but also about what he feels is the only antidote -- a biblically strong christianity .	143.96013
so the christian youth crusade against communisn developed and more than 300 top teenagers and 65 adult advisers from presbyterian churches of the area sat enthralled at the four-hour program .	125.95163
this sunday those attending the second session will hear a lecture by kern on the world situation	155.1652
a review of the philosophy of communist leaders by ted slack , another real estate agent who became interested as a philosophy major at the university of miami	103.903206
and talks on how their christian faith can guide them in learning about and fighting communism during high school and college days , by ted place , director of greater miami youth for christ , and jon braun , director of campus crusade for christ .	140.44167
the second half of the film `` communism on the map ' ' and the movie `` operation abolition ' ' also will be shown .	50.0457
response to the program has been so encouraging , kern said , that a city-wide youth school at dade county auditorium may be set up soon .	71.84307
and to encourage other churches to try their own programs , kern said this sunday ' s sessions -- including the free dinner -- will be open to anyone who makes reservations .	107.66332
the need for and the way to achieve a christian home will be stressed in special services marking national christian family week in miami area churches next week .	187.64151
of particular meaning to the charles macwhorter family , 3181 sw 24th ter . , will be the family dedication service planned for 10 50 a . m . sunday at first christian church .	55.374897
it will be the second time the assistant manager of a coral gables restaurant and his wife have taken part in the twice-a-year ceremonies for families with new babies .	57.42049
the first one , two years ago , changed the routine of their home life .	188.7965
`` when you stand up in public and take vows to strive to set an example before your children and to teach them the fundamentals of the christian faith , you strive a little harder to uphold those vows ' ' , explains the slender vice president of the young couples sunday school class .	72.90765
until that first dedication service , he and lois felt their children were too young to take part in any religious life at home .	116.982285
they have five daughters -- coral lee , 5 , glenda rae , 4 , pamela , 3 , karen , 2 , and shari , five months .	20.640095
but after that service , they decided to try to let the girls say grace at the table , have bedtime prayers , and bible stories .	158.03569
to their surprise , the children all were eager and quite able to take part .	155.45433
even the two-year-old feels miffed if the family has a prayer-time without her .	75.57844

enrique jorda , conductor and musical director of the san francisco symphony , will fulfill two more guest conducting engagements in europe before returning home to open the symphony ' s golden anniversary season , it was announced .	51.308758
the guest assignments are scheduled for november 14 and 18 , with the orchestra sinfonica siciliana in palermo and the orchestra of radio cologne .	16.45906
the season in san francisco will open with a special gala concert on november 22 .	39.94263
during his five-month visit abroad , jorda recently conducted the orchestre philharmonique de bordeau in france , and the santa cecilia orchestra in rome .	19.860254
in announcing jorda ' s return , the orchestra also announced that the sale of single tickets for the 50th anniversary season will start at the sherman clay box office on wednesday .	60.64815
guest performers and conductors during the coming season will include many renowned artists who began their careers playing with the orchestra , including violinists yehudi menuhin , isaac stern , ruggiero ricci and david abel	34.00369
pianists leon fleisher , ruth slenczynka and stephen bishop and conductor earl bernard murray .	55.02264
the leningrad kirov ballet , which opened a series of performances friday night at the opera house , is , i think , the finest `` classical ' ' ballet company i have ever seen , and the production of the petipa-tschaikowsky `` sleeping beauty ' ' with which it began the series is incomparably the finest i have ever had the pleasure of witnessing .	79.97662
i am prepared to demonstrate at anytime that it represents the spirit of imperial russia in its most vulgar , infantile , and reactionary aspect	62.879044
that its persistent use by ballet companies of the soviet regime indicates that that old spirit is just as stultifying alive today as it ever was	106.75607
that its presentation in this country is part of a capitalist plot to boobify the american people	36.97311
that its choreography is undistinguished and its score a shapeless assemblage of self-plagiarisms .	36.32888
all of this is true and all of it is totally meaningless in the face of the kirov ' s utterly captivating presentation .	31.550106
the reasons for this enchantment are numerous , but most of them end in `` ova ' ' , `` eva ' ' , or `` aya ' ' .	12.532623
in other words , no merely male creature can resist that corps de ballet .	318.81097
it seems to have been chosen exclusively from the winners of beauty contests -- miss omsk , miss pinsk , miss stalingr oops , skip it .	44.110973
these qualities alone , however , would not account for their success , and it took me a while to discover the crowning virtue that completes this company ' s collective personality .	160.96136
it is a kind of friendliness and frankness of address toward the audience which we have been led to believe was peculiar to the american ballet .	137.89001
oh-the-pain-of-it , that convention of russian ballet whereby the girls convey the idea that they are all the daughters of impoverished grand dukes driven to the stage out of filial piety , is totally absent from the kirov .	63.81098
this is all the more remarkable because the kirov is to ballet what senator goldwater is to american politics .	158.68918
but , obviously , at least some things have changed for the better in russia so far as the ballet is concerned .	91.52373
irina kolpakova , the princess aurora of friday ' s performance , would be a change for the better anywhere , at any time , no matter who had had the role before .	59.321316
she is the most beautiful thing you ever laid eyes on , and her dancing has a feminine suavity , lightness , sparkle , and refinement which are simply incomparable .	62.87517
alla sizova , who seems to have made a special hit in the east , was delightful as the lady bluebird and her partner , yuri soloviev , was wonderfully virile , acrobatic , and poetic all at the same time , in a tradition not unlike that of nijinsky .	50.386475
vladilen semenov , a fine `` danseur noble ' '	1.534931
and inna zubkovskaya , an excellent lilac fairy , were other outstanding members of the cast , but every member of the cast was magnificent .	50.96289

authenticated pieces of duncan phyfe furniture are uncommon , although millions of american homes today display pieces patterned after the style trends he set 150 years ago .	170.27843
this acquisition is a matched , perfect set -- consisting of two sofas six feet long , plus six sidechairs and two armchairs .	21.07465

at 4 p . m . the president left the white house to welcome the young musicians , students from the ages of 12 to 18 who spend six weeks at the brevard music center summer camp , and to greet the 325 crippled , cardiac and blind children from the district area who were special guests at the concert .	69.12287
it was the first in the series of `` concerts for young people by young people ' ' to be sponsored by first lady jacqueline kennedy at the white house .	39.395176

`` i think they played hail to the chief better than the marine corps band , and we are grateful to them ' ' , president kennedy remarked after mounting the bandstand and shaking hands with conductor james christian pfohl .	95.53439
after paying tribute to the conductor and his white-clad youthful students , president kennedy said , `` as an american i have the greatest possible pride in the work that is being done in dozens of schools stretching across the united states -- schools where devoted teachers are studying with interested young men and women and opening up the whole wide horizon of serious music ' ' .	60.19378
he added `` i think that sometimes in this country we are not aware as we should be of the extraordinary work that is being done in this field ' ' .	47.207207

a flow of correspondence between pfohl and miss baldrige resulted in an invitation to the 85-student north carolina group to play the first concert .	83.96323
one of the most interested `` students ' ' on the tour which the brevard group took at the national gallery yesterday following their concert at the white house , was letitia baldrige , social secretary to first lady jacqueline kennedy .	71.178825

she turned out to be a fan , too , of margaret bouton , the gallery ' s associate curator of education .	51.275555

the brevard group of 85 arrived at the gallery at 6 p . m . , remaining for about 45 minutes .	25.702965

they decided that they thought rembrandt ' s self-portrait made him look `` sad ' '	150.04337

the marriage of john and mary black had clearly reached the breaking point after eight years .	184.05836
john had a job in a small firm where the work was dull and monotonous .	33.14783
he would come home in the evening tired and discouraged -- in no frame of mind to play with their three children , or spend much time chatting with his wife .	82.00872
hurt by his lack of interest and attention , mary complained often that he didn ' t help around the house , and that he didn ' t really care about the family .	46.27722
he in turn told her she demanded too much .	6.9784203
they were both discouraged , disgusted and miserable .	2.2384653
without any definite plan in mind , she went to a judge to see what could be done .	54.752464
the judge listened quietly as the young woman poured out her frustrations -- then discussing with her the possibility of seeking aid from family service before going to a lawyer .	159.80374
family service , sharing in ugf , has five agencies in the washington area .	147.60669
they offer to the people of this community case work service and counseling on a wide variety of family problems .	148.53699
because neither of them really wanted their marriage to break up , mr . and mrs . black agreed to a series of interviews at family service of northern virginia , the agency nearest them .	73.53528
for nearly a year , they have been receiving counseling , separately and together , in an effort to understand and overcome the antagonisms which had given rise to the possibility of divorce .	71.36683
the interviews have led each of them to a new appreciation of the problems confronting the other .	61.246098
they are now working together toward solving their difficulties .	34.443546
he gives credit for the promotion to his new outlook on life .	104.880295
mary is cheery and gay when her husband comes home in the evenings , and the children ' s bed-time is frequently preceeded by a session of happy , family rough-housing .	45.556816
to outsiders , the blacks seem to be an ordinary , happy family , and they are -- but with a difference .	86.038795
they know the value of being just that -- an ordinary , happy family .	119.7123
family service has helped hundreds of families in this area .	17.752123
perhaps to some their work does not seem particularly vital .	309.3566
but to the families it serves , their help cannot be measured .	220.78369
