they insisted on the `` fundamental fact ' ' that `` the whole of berlin has a quadripartite status ' ' .	29.927256
this is far from acknowledging or recognizing those efforts as an accomplished fact .	206.3609
there remains , of course , the question of what the west can do beyond diplomatic protest to prevent the illegal efforts from becoming accomplished facts .	120.562195
one ground of action certainly exists when fusillades of stray shots go over into west berlin as communist `` vopos ' ' try to gun down fleeing unarmed residents .	77.4966
another remained when an american army car was recovered but with a broken glass .	67.195435
the glass may seem trivial but communist official hooliganism feeds on such incidents unless they are redressed .	44.228962
remembering the step-by-step fate of danzig and the west german misgivings about `` salami ' ' tactics , it is to be hoped that the dispatch of general clay to west berlin as president kennedy ' s representative will mark a stiffening of response not only to future indignities and aggressions but also to some that have passed .	82.91845
thousands of buffalo ( `` bison ' ' they will never be to the man on the street ) grazing like a mobile brown throw-rug upon the rolling , dusty-green grassland .	100.32201
a horizon even and seamless , binding the vast sun-bleached dome of sky to earth .	53.930534
that picture of the american prairie is as indelibly fixed in the memory of those who have studied the conquest of the american continent as any later cinema image of the west made in live-oak canyons near hollywood .	79.87475
for it was the millions of buffalo and prairie chicken and the endless seas of grass that symbolized for a whole generation of americans the abundant supply that was to take many of them westward when the ohio and mississippi valleys began to fill .	110.476364
the national park service now proposes to preserve an area in pottawatomie county , northeast kansas , as a `` prairie national park ' ' .	30.300003
there the buffalo would roam , to be seen as a tapestry , not as moth-eaten zoo specimens .	66.71164
wooded stream valleys in the folds of earth would be saved .	34.627346
grasslands would extend , unfenced , unplowed , unbroken by silo or barn -- as the first settlers saw them .	63.23128
the park service makes an impressive ecological and statistical case for creating this new park .	492.4612
american history should clinch the case when congress is asked to approve .	72.56827
a philadelphia distiller is currently breaching the customary prohibition against hard-liquor advertising on tv and radio .	200.66725
starting with small stations not members of the national association of broadcasters , the firm apparently is seeking to break down the anti-liquor barriers in major-market stations .	77.34818
probably the best answer to this kind of entering wedge is congressional action requiring the federal communications commission to ban such advertising through its licensing power .	154.04501
the national association of broadcasters code specifically bars hard-liquor commercials .	19.316942
past polls of public opinion show popular favor for this policy .	71.87737
even the distilled spirits institute has long had a specific prohibition .	114.72932
why , then , with these voluntary barricades and some state laws barring liquor ads , is it necessary to seek congressional action ? ?	67.27752
simply because the subverting action of firms that are not members of the distilled spirits institute and of radio and tv stations that are not members of the nab tends to spread .	69.04025
soon some members of the two industry groups doubtless will want to amend their codes on grounds that otherwise they will suffer unfairly from the efforts of non-code competitors .	106.7547
although the false glamour surrounding bourbon or other whisky commercials is possibly no more fatuous than the pseudo-sophistication with which tv soft-drinks are downed or toothpaste applied , there is a sad difference between enticing a viewer into sipping oopsie-cola and gulling him into downing bourbon .	54.993446
registered democrats in new york city this year have the opportunity to elect their party ' s candidates for mayor and other municipal posts and the men who will run their party organization .	77.78945
in the central contest , that for mayor , they may have found some pertinent points in what each faction has said about the other .	101.41168
mayor robert f . wagner must , as his opponents demand , assume responsibility for his performance in office .	177.7899
while all citizens share in blame for lax municipal ethics the wagner regime has seen serious problems in the schools , law enforcement and fiscal policies .	83.344986
the mayor is finding it awkward to campaign against his own record .	33.571453
state controller arthur levitt , on the other hand , cannot effectively deny that he has chosen to be the candidate of those party leaders who as a rule have shown livelier interest in political power than in the city ' s welfare .	62.78212
they , too , have links with the city ' s ills .	23.562086
both men are known to be honest and public-spirited .	37.59848
mayor wagner ' s shortcomings have perhaps been more mercilessly exposed than those of mr . levitt who left an impression of quiet competence in his more protected state post .	138.87659
as mayor , mr . levitt might turn out to be more independent than some of his leading supporters would like .	82.96944
his election , on the other hand , would unquestionably strengthen the `` regulars ' ' .	61.71424
mr . wagner might or might not be a `` new ' ' mayor in this third term , now that he is free of the pressure of those party leaders whom he calls `` bosses ' ' .	66.517044
these are , of course , the same people whose support he has only now rejected to seek the independent vote .	282.86707
but his reelection would strengthen the liberal democrats and the labor unions who back him .	58.25344
if this choice is less exciting than new york democrats may wish , it nevertheless must be made .	122.59351
the vote still gives citizens a voice in the operation of their government and their party .	52.650917
both mr . k ' s have so far continued to speak softly and carry big sticks over laos .	286.37573
president kennedy , already two quiet demands down , still refused thursday to be drawn into delivering a public ultimatum to moscow .	75.88155
but at the same time he moved his helicopter-borne marines to within an hour of the fighting .	68.23506
and secretary rusk , en route to bangkok , doubtless is trying to make emergency arrangements for the possible entry of australian or thai seato forces .	53.355835
for mr . kennedy , speaking softly and carrying a sizable stick is making the best of a bad situation .	139.36716
the new president is in no position to start out his dealings with moscow by issuing callable bluffs .	77.57461
he must show at the outset that he means exactly what he says .	77.12063
in this case he has put the alternatives clearly to mr . khrushchev for the third time .	34.412914
at his press conference mr . kennedy said , `` all we want in laos is peace not war a truly neutral government not a cold war pawn ' ' .	67.56605
at the scene he has just as clearly shown his military strength in unprovocative but ready position .	503.79614
since laos is of no more purely military value to moscow itself than it is to washington , this approach might be expected to head off mr . khrushchev for the moment .	61.879665
but because of the peculiar nature of the military situation in laos , the soviet leader must be tempted to let things ride -- a course that would appear to cost him little on the spot , but would bog washington in a tactical mess .	90.620544
as wars go , laos is an extremely little one .	27.669598
casualties have been running about a dozen men a day .	100.55419
the hard core of the pro-communist rebel force numbers only some 2 , 000 tough viet minh guerrilla fighters .	68.93479
but for the united states and its seato allies to attempt to shore up a less tough , less combat-tested government army in monsoon-shrouded , road-shy , guerrilla-th ' -wisp terrain is a risk not savored by pentagon planners .	157.38654
but if anything can bring home to mr . khrushchev the idea that he will not really get much enjoyment from watching this braddock-against-the-indians contest , it will probably be the fact that seato forces are ready to attempt it -- plus the fact that moscow has something to lose from closing off disarmament and other bigger negotiations with washington .	100.35339
fortunately both the republicans and america ' s chief western allies now are joined behind the neutral laos aim of the president .	88.582886
actually it would be more accurate to say that the leader of the alliance now has swung fully behind the british policy of seeking to achieve a neutral laos via the international bargaining table .	66.311195
it is ironic that washington is having to struggle so for a concept that for six years it bypassed as unreasonable .	140.08932
the state department tacitly rejected the neutral laos idea after the geneva conference of 1954 , and last year washington backed the rightist coup that ousted neutral premier souvanna phouma .	38.882183
but since last fall the united states has been moving toward a pro-neutralist position and now is ready to back the british plan for a cease-fire patrolled by outside observers and followed by a conference of interested powers .	89.25011
the road to a guaranteed-neutral , coup-proof laos is today almost as difficult as warfare on that nation ' s terrain .	137.56671
but for the safety of southeast asia , and for the sake of the laotian people -- who would not be well-ruled by either militant minority now engaged in the fighting -- this last big effort to seal that country from the cold war had to be made .	71.723816
the world awaits mr . khrushchev ' s choice of alternatives .	68.70648
the senate ' s overwhelming ( 64-13 ) vote to support locally controlled educational tv efforts should be emulated in the lower house .	179.33878
twice previously the senate has approved measures backing etv and the house has let them die .	96.200615
the house communications subcommittee is expected to report out a good bill calling for the states to match federal funds .	120.399956
this year ' s senate measure would provide each state and the district of columbia with $1 , 000 , 000 to be used in support of private , state , or municipal etv efforts .	30.284353
the funds would be used for equipment , not for land , buildings , or operation .	143.84067
the relatively few communities that have educational stations have found them of considerable value .	54.92594
but , lacking money from commercial sponsors , the stations have had difficulties meeting expenses or improving their service .	204.4537
other communities -- the ones to be aided most by the senate bill -- have had difficulty starting such stations because of the high initial cost of equipment .	172.61809
sam rayburn was a good man , a good american , and , third , a good democrat .	72.725296
he was all of these rolled into one sturdy figure	3075.3667
mr . speaker , mr . sam , and mr . democrat , at one and the same time .	28.143253
the house was his habitat and there he flourished , first as a young representative , then as a forceful committee chairman , and finally in the post for which he seemed intended from birth , speaker of the house , and second most powerful man in washington .	111.62309
mr . rayburn was not an easy man to classify or to label .	150.21896
he was no flaming liberal , yet the new deal , the fair deal and the new frontier needed him .	112.28902
he was not a rear-looking conservative , yet partisans of that persuasion will miss him as much as any .	68.30805
two of the vital qualities demanded of a politician by other politicians are that he always keep a confidence and that he keep his word .	173.08476
sam rayburn took unnumbered secrets with him to the grave , for he was never loquacious , and his word , once given , was not subject to retraction .	67.4827
it might be added that as he kept his word so he expected that others keep theirs .	220.72958
the demonstration of his power was never flamboyant or theatrical .	35.150562
a growl , a nod , was usually enough .	65.728745
when it was not , one of the great dramas of washington would be presented .	71.28949
he would rise in the well of the house , his chin upon his chest , his hands gripping the side of a desk , and the political and legislative chatter would subside into silence .	67.54724
he spoke briefly , sensibly , to the point and without oratorical flourishes .	54.002666
he made good , plain american common sense and the house usually recognized it and acted upon it .	144.6258
these public efforts were rare because mr . rayburn normally did his counseling , persuading and educating long before an issue reached its test on the house floor .	197.97444
he expected democrats to do their duty when it had been patiently pointed out to them .	66.96501
with his long service he had a long memory , an excellent thing in a political leader .	101.98994
he was , of course , in the house for a very long time .	22.309671
there are only two men remaining in congress who , with rayburn , voted for the declaration of war against germany in 1917 .	51.812805
to almost two generations of americans it must have seemed as though the existence of mr . sam coincided with that of the house .	41.747295
to be presiding officer of it was the end of his desire and ambition .	52.038506
the senate to him was not the `` upper body ' ' and he corrected those who said he served `` under ' ' the president .	69.60839
sound the roll of those with whom he served and who preceded him in death .	121.951126
woodrow wilson , with whom he began his years in washington , warren g . harding , calvin coolidge , fdr , with whom he managed a social revolution .	75.71536
and those still with us , herbert c . hoover , harry s . truman , dwight d . eisenhower and john f . kennedy .	18.841208
he was a fighter for those of his own party .	65.31556
mr . truman has only to recall the `` hopeless ' ' campaign of 1948 to remember what a loyal partisan he was and the first experience of mr . kennedy with congress would have been sadder than it was had not mr . sam been there .	110.34858
as it was , his absence because of his final illness was a blow to the administration .	47.13098
he was his own man , not an automatic obstructionist .	66.761375
he kept his attacks on republicanism for partisan campaigns , but that is part of the game he was born to play .	41.36875
under any name -- mr . speaker , mr . democrat , mr . sam -- he was a good man .	20.704477
thirteen italian airmen who went to the congo to serve the cause of peace under the united nations banner have instead met violent death at the hands of congolese troops supposedly their friends .	146.34093
in 18 months , no more grisly incident has been reported from that jungle .	66.27181
simply out of bloodlust , their murderers dismembered the bodies and tossed the remains into the river .	86.99688
the excuse was offered for them that they had mistaken the italians for belgian mercenaries .	88.10947
in other words , atrocities by savages wearing the uniform of the central government might be condoned , had the victims been serving the cause of dissident katanga .	110.33074
does this suggest that the congo is fit for nationhood or that un is making any progress whatever toward its goal of so making it ? ?	203.12961
to the contrary , through the past six weeks violence has been piled upon violence .	195.996
mass rapes , troop mutinies , uncontrolled looting and pillage and reckless military adventures , given no sanction by any political authority , have become almost daily occurrences .	103.20869
yet this basic condition of outlawry and anarchy is not the work of katanga .	41.640182
it happens in the territory of the leopoldville government , which is itself a fiction , demonstrably incapable of governing , and commanding only such limited credit abroad as un support gives it .	145.23602
the main question raised by the incident is how much longer will un bury its head in the sand on the congo problem instead of facing the bitter fact that it has no solution in present terms ? ?	144.80411
the probable answer is that it will do so just as long as russia can exercise a veto in favor of chaos and until young african nations wake up to the truth that out of false pride they are visiting ruin on central africa .	141.92381
right now , they are pushing a resolution which would have un use its forces to invade and subjugate katanga .	94.904915
that notion is fantastically wrong-headed from several points of view .	9.174665
the un army is too weak , too demoralized for the task .	53.31402
further , it has its work cut out stopping anarchy where it is now garrisoned .	100.23144
last , it makes no sense to deliver katanga , the one reasonably solid territory , into the existing chaos .	214.54773
the congo should have been mandated , because it was not ready for independence .	29.425081
the idea was not even suggested because political expediency prevailed over wisdom .	229.69466
it is perhaps too late now to talk of mandate because it is inconsistent with what is termed political realism .	103.50701
but if any realism and feeling for truth remain in the general assembly , it is time for men of courage to measure the magnitude of the failure and urge some new approach .	110.279884
otherwise , un will march blindly on to certain defeat .	203.5171
a recent editorial discussing a labor-management agreement reached between the southern pacific co . and the order of railroad telegraphers has been criticized on the grounds that it was not based on complete information .	41.493008
the editorial was based on a news association dispatch which said that the telegraphers had secured an agreement whereby they were guaranteed 40 hours ' pay per week whether they worked or not and that a reduction in their number was limited to 2 per cent per year .	124.404785
our comment was that this was `` featherbedding ' ' in its ultimate form and that sympathy for the railroad was misplaced since it had entered into such an agreement .	72.96375
the statement was also made that undoubtedly the railroad had received some compensating benefit from the telegraphers , but that it was difficult to imagine what could balance a job for life .	64.87569
additional information supplied to us discloses that the railroad gained a stabilized supply of telegraphers of which it was in need .	65.46382
also , normal personnel attrition would make the job reduction provision more or less academic .	157.74396
the situation with regard to the southern pacific was therefore a special one and not necessarily applicable to other situations in other industries .	85.04642
the solution reached in the agreement was more acceptable to the railroad than that originally included in a series of union demands .	51.281715
time was when the house of delegates of the american bar association leaned to the common sense side .	96.66979
but the internationalists have taken over the governing body of the bar , and when the lads met in st . louis , it was not to grumble about the humidity but to vote unanimously that the united nations was scarcely less than wonderful , despite an imperfection here and there .	57.56535
it was , the brief writers decided , `` man ' s best hope for a peaceful and law abiding world ' ' .	39.302513
peace , it ' s wonderful , and `` world law ' ' , it ' s wonderful , too , and shouldn ' t we get an international covenant extending it into space , before the russians put some claim jumper on the moon ? ?	55.724163
meanwhile , in moscow , khrushchev was adding his bit to the march of world law by promising to build a bomb with a wallop equal to 100 million tons of tnt , to knock sense into the heads of those backward oafs who can ' t see the justice of surrendering west berlin to communism .	81.541695
a nuclear pacifier of these dimensions -- roughly some six and a half times bigger than anything the united states has triggered experimentally -- would certainly produce a bigger bang , and , just for kicks , khrushchev might use it to propel the seminar of the house of delegates from st . louis to the moon , where there wouldn ' t even be any beer to drink .	77.61738
while he was at it , the philosopher of the kremlin contributed an additional assist to the rule of reason by bellowing at those in the west who can ' t appreciate coexistence thru suicide .	129.80435
`` fools ' ' , he bayed , `` what do you think you are doing ' ' ? ?	16.234695
the only response we can think of is the humble one that at least we aren ' t playing the marimba with our shoes in the united nations , but perhaps the heavy domes in the house of delegates can improve on this feeble effort .	68.352394
another evidence of the spreading rule of reason was provided from mexico city with the daily hijacking of an american plane by a demented algerian with a gun .	53.874184
the craft made the familiar unwelcome flight to havana , where , for some unknown reason , castro rushed to the airport to express mortification to the colombian foreign minister , a passenger , who is not an admirer of old ten o ' clock shadow .	61.152565
the plane was sent back to the united states , for a change , but castro kept the crazy gunman , who will prove a suitable recruit to the revolution .	52.08314
less respect for the legal conventions was displayed by castro ' s right hand man , che guevara , who edified the inter-american economic and social council meeting in montevideo by reading two secret american documents purloined from the united states embassy at caracas , venezuela .	62.408577
the contents were highly embarrassing to american spokesmen , who were on hand to promise latin americans a 20 billion dollar foreign aid millennium .	120.16102
perhaps the moralities of world law are not advanced by stealing american diplomatic papers and planes , but the kennedy administration can always file a demurrer to the effect that , but for its own incompetence in protecting american interests , these things would not happen .	60.58771
the same can be said about the half-hearted cuban invasion mounted by the administration last april , which , we trust , is not symptomatic of the methods to be invoked in holding off the felonious khrushchev .	89.186554
pass the iron rations , please , and light another candle , for it ' s getting dark down here and we ' re minded to read a bit of world law just to pass the time away .	98.84232
the board of suspension of the interstate commerce commission has ordered a group of railroads not to reduce their freight rates on grain , as they had planned to do this month .	63.376408
the request for lower rates originated with the southern railway , which has spent a good deal of time and money developing a 100-ton hopper car with which it says it can move grain at about half what it costs in the conventional , smaller car .	100.24363
by reducing rates as much as 60 per cent , it and its associated railroads hope to win back some of the business they have lost to truckers and barge lines .	121.19241
the board ' s action shows what free enterprise is up against in our complex maze of regulatory laws .	108.26726
word of dag hammarskjold ' s death in an african plane crash has sent a shockwave around the globe .	59.75121
as head of the united nations he was the symbol of world peace , and his tragic end came at a moment when peace hangs precariously .	54.90748
it was on the eve of a momentous u . n . session to come to grips with cold war issues .	33.11155
mr . hammarskjold was in africa on a mission of peace .	23.041077
he had sought talks with moise tshombe , the secessionist president of congo ' s katanga province where recent fighting had been bloody .	127.45746
the story of the fatal crash is not fully known .	128.46123
the u . n . -chartered plane which was flying from the conference city of ndola in northern rhodesia had been riddled with machinegun bullets last weekend and was newly repaired .	92.71224
whether this , or overt action , was the cause of the crash must be promptly determined .	61.080467
the death of mr . hammarskjold removes the united nations ' most controversial leader .	96.766785
he was controversial because he was uncompromising for peace and freedom with justice .	40.312717
he courageously defended the rights of small nations , and he stood his ground against the savage attacks of the communist bloc .	28.62186
the congo , in whose cause he died , was the scene of one of his greatest triumphs .	30.954489
his policies had resolved the conflicts that threatened to ignite the cold war and workable solutions were beginning to take shape .	77.80896
when the recent katangan outbreaks imperiled these solutions mr . hammarskjold , despite the danger , flew to exert a calming influence .	82.49623
the u . n . session scheduled for today will meet under the cloud of his passing .	113.733406
it is a crucial session with the world on the edge of momentous developments .	34.845512
if the manner of his passing moves the nations to act in the spirit of his dedication the sore issues that plague the world can yet be resolved with reason and justice .	105.240234
reaching agreement on projects of value to the whole community has long been one of greater miami ' s hardest tasks .	49.804455
even when public bodies arrived at a consensus , at least one dissenting vote has been usual .	56.049572
so we note approvingly a fresh sample of unanimity .	238.4988
all nine members of the inter-american center authority voted for goodbody & company ' s proposal to finance the long-awaited trade and cultural center .	90.55826
the widely known financial firm has 60 days to spell out the terms of its contract .	62.61094
if the indenture is accepted , the authority will proceed to validate a bond issue repayable from revenue .	87.535835
then goodbody will hand over a minimum of $15 . 5 million for developing the spacious graves tract to house the center .	64.96583
the next step awaits approval today by the metro commissioners as the members of the dade county port authority .	56.91355
they allotted $500 , 000 three years ago to support interama until its own financing could be arranged .	137.84138
less than half the sum has been spent , since the interama board pinched pennies during that period of painstaking negotiations .	144.21432
the balance is being budgeted for the coming year .	16.90068
it is one of the rare public ventures here on which nearly everyone is agreed .	291.6024
the city of miami recently yielded a prior claim of $8 . 5 million on the graves tract to clear the way for the project .	52.9287
so have the people ' s elected spokesmen at the state and federal levels .	41.842056
interama , as it rises , will be a living monument to greater miami ' s ability to get together on worthwhile enterprises .	73.37255
progress , or lack of it , toward civil rights in the 50 states is reported in an impressive 689-page compilation issued last week by the united states commission on civil rights .	68.04408
much happened in this field during the past 12 months .	26.867699
each state advisory committee documented its own activity .	8.678561
some accounts are quite lengthy but florida ' s is the shortest of all , requiring only four paragraphs .	138.29802
`` the established pattern of relative calm in the field of race relations has continued in all areas ' ' , reported this group headed by harold colee of jacksonville and including two south floridians , william d . singer and john b . turner of miami .	75.225395
`` no complaints or charges have been filed during the past year , either verbally or written , from any individual or group .	74.028885
`` the committee continues to feel that florida has progressed in a sound and equitable program at both the state and local levels in its efforts to review and assess transition problems as they arise from time to time in the entire spectrum of civil rights ' ' .	58.7096
problems have arisen in this sensitive field but have been handled in most cases with understanding and restraint .	67.68517
the progress reported by the advisory committee is real .	580.1136
while some think we move too fast and others too slowly , florida ' s record is a good one and stands out among the 50 .	158.64818
west germany will face the crucial tests that lie ahead , on berlin and unification , with a coalition government .	71.251564
this is the key fact emerging from sunday ' s national election .	37.79858
chancellor adenauer ' s christian democratic party slipped only a little in the voting but it was enough to lose the absolute bundestag majority it has enjoyed since 1957 .	82.83112
in order to form a new government it must deal with one of the two rival parties which gained strength .	70.04293
the aging chancellor in all likelihood will be retired .	172.63333
both willy brandt ' s social democrats , who gained 22 seats in the new parliament , and the free democrats , who picked up 23 , will insist on that before they enter the government .	87.75855
moon-faced ludwig erhart , the economic expert , probably will ascend to the leadership long denied him .	325.00082
if he becomes chancellor , dr . erhart would make few changes .	398.99002
the wizard who fashioned west germany ' s astonishing industrial rebirth is the soul of free enterprise .	65.913864
he is dedicated to building the nation ' s strength and , as are all west germans , to a free berlin and to reunion with captive east germany .	88.79992
what is in doubt as the free germans and their allies consider the voting trends is the nature of the coalition that will result .	81.44132
if the party of adenauer and erhart , with 45 per cent of the vote , approaches the party of willy brandt , which won 36 per cent , the result would be a stiffening of the old resolve .	50.74074
west berlin ' s mayor brandt vigorously demanded a firmer stand on the dismemberment of his city and won votes by it .	60.172256
the free democrats ( 12 per cent of the vote ) believe a nuclear war can be avoided by negotiating with the soviet union , and more dealings with the communist bloc .	29.558535
the question left by the election is whether west germany veers slightly toward more firmness or more flexibility .	106.11431
it could go either way , since the gains for both points of view were about the same .	66.08462
regardless of the decision two facts are clear .	3.6347015
west germany , with its industrial and military might , reaffirmed its democracy and remains firm with the free nations .	125.22313
and the career of konrad adenauer , who upheld germany ' s tradition of rock-like leaders which bismarck began , draws near the end .	95.86295
americans are a nation of joiners , a quality which our friends find endearing and sometimes amusing .	251.25856
but it can be dangerous if the joiner doesn ' t want to make a spectacle of himself .	13.374038
for instance , so-called `` conservative ' ' organizations , some of them secret , are sprouting in the garden of joining where `` liberal ' ' organizations once took root .	78.72836
one specific example is a secret `` fraternity ' ' which will `` coordinate anti-communist efforts ' ' .	19.339634
the principle is commendable but we suspect that in the practice somebody is going to get gulled .	101.877846
according to the chicago tribune news service , state atty . gen . stanley mosk of california has devised a series of questions which the joiner might well ask about any organization seeking his money and his name 1 .	71.56011
does it assail schools and churches with blanket accusations ? ?	16.258408
does it attack other traditional american institutions with unsupportable and wild charges ? ?	119.29751
does it put the label of un-american or subversive on everyone with whom it disagrees politically ? ?	246.11932
does it attempt to rewrite modern history by blaming american statesmen for wars , communism , depression , and other troubles of the world ? ?	39.197556
does it employ crude pressure tactics with such means as anonymous telephone calls and letter writing campaigns ? ?	153.11072
do its spokesmen seem more interested in the amount of money they collect than in the principles they purport to advocate ? ?	150.82733
in some instances a seventh question can be added 7 .	279.62598
does the organization show an affinity for a foreign government , political party or personality in opposition or preference to the american system ? ?	93.56726
if the would-be joiner asks these questions he is not likely to be duped by extremists who are seeking to capitalize on the confusions and the patriotic apprehensions of americans in a troubled time .	39.01485
falling somewhere in a category between einstein ' s theory and sand fleas -- difficult to see but undeniably there , nevertheless -- is the tropical green `` city ' ' of islandia , a string of offshore islands that has almost no residents , limited access and an unlimited future .	76.77887
whatever land you can see here , from the north tip end of elliott key looking southward , belongs to someone -- people who have title to the land .	215.35663
and what you can ' t see , the land underneath the water , belongs to someone , too .	64.20571
the only real problem is to devise a plan whereby the owners of the above-water land can develop their property without the public losing its underwater land and the right to its development for public use and enjoyment .	126.505135
in the fairly brief but hectic history of florida , the developers of waterfront land have too often wound up with both their land and ours .	142.18011
in this instance , happily , insistence is being made that our share is protected .	175.23419
and until this protection is at least as concrete as , say , the row of hotels that bars us from our own sands at miami beach , those who represent us all should agree to nothing .	142.61569
the reaction of certain city council members to california ' s newest anti-secrecy laws was as dismaying as it was disappointing .	42.04477
we had assumed that at least this local legislative body had nothing to hide , and , therefore , had no objections to making the deliberations of its committees and the city commissions available to the public .	79.44253
in the preamble to the open-meeting statutes , collectively known as the brown act , the legislature declares that `` the public commissions , boards and councils and other public agencies in this state exist to aid in the conduct of the people ' s business .	64.666626
it is the intent of the law that their actions be taken openly and that their deliberations be conducted openly .	143.94255
`` the people of this state do not yield their sovereignty to the agencies that serve them .	141.67268
the people , in delegating authority , do not give their public servants the right to decide what is good for the people to know and what is not good for them to know .	52.213474
the full implementation of these noble words , however , has taken the efforts of five sessions of the legislature .	30.687357
since 1953 california has led the nation in enacting guarantees that public business shall be publicly conducted , but not until this year did the lawmakers in sacramento plug the remaining loopholes in the brown act .	118.32082
despite the lip service paid by local governments , the anti-secrecy statutes have been continuously subverted by reservations and rationalizations .	44.94351
when all else fails , it is argued that open sessions slow down governmental operations .	170.44147
we submit that this is a most desirable effect of the law -- and one of its principal aims .	41.583553
without public scrutiny the deliberations of public agencies would no doubt be conducted more speedily .	188.65198
but the citizens would , of course , never be sure that the decisions that resulted were as correct as they were expeditious .	124.93195
if the dominican republic achieves free , democratic government , it will be due in large part to the u . s . show of force that enabled president balaguer to prevent a threatened restoration of trujillo dictatorship .	68.70609
mr . balaguer is in control , and opposition leaders have no further excuse to suspect his offer of a coalition government preliminary to free elections in the spring .	100.40776
had u . s . warships not appeared off the dominican coast , there is every possibility that the country would now be wracked by civil war .	54.472248
ultimately either the trujillos would have been returned to power or the conflict would have produced conditions favorable to a takeover by dominican elements responsive to castro in cuba .	88.430824
within the organization of american states , there may be some criticism of this unilateral american intervention which was not without risk obviously .	112.119835
but there was no complaint from the dominican crowds which lined ciudad trujillo ' s waterfront shouting , `` vive yankees ' ' ! !	14.830817
more , the u . s . action was hailed by a principal opposition leader , dr . juan bosch , as having saved `` many lives and many troubles in the near future ' ' .	60.380634
mr . balaguer ' s troubles are by no means over .	98.37861
he will need the help of all oas members to eradicate , finally , the forces of authoritarianism , pro-trujillo and pro-castro alike .	29.983139
in cooperating toward that objective , oas might move with the speed and effectiveness demonstrated by the united states .	53.611156
those watching the growing rivalry between craft unions and industrial unions may recognize all the pressures that led to the big labor split in 1935 .	99.60677
now , as then , it is a matter of jobs .	41.30096
craft unions seek work that industrial unions claim , such as factory maintenance .	146.63968
the issue was sufficiently potent in 1935 to spark secession from the american federation of labor of its industrial union members .	48.46282
that breach was healed 20 years later by merger of the american federation of labor and the congress of industrial organizations .	43.000546
or that ' s what it looked like at the time .	23.965572
but automation and the increasing complexity of factories has renewed the competition for jobs .	89.28255
walter reuther , leader of the industrial union faction of the afl-cio , says another two years of this squabbling will be disastrous for all american labor .	78.49648
whether it could be as disastrous for american labor as , say , jimmy hoffa of the teamsters , is a matter of conjecture .	44.00173
but the jurisdictional disputes that result from the craft-industrial rivalry do not win friends for labor .	143.10106
engaged as it is in a battle for world trade as a condition of national survival , this country can have little patience with labor ' s family feuds .	86.13156
the concept of labor as a special class is outmoded , and in the task confronting america as bastion of the free world , labor must learn to put the national interest first if it is itself to survive .	97.678055
the army , navy and air force , among others , may question secretary freeman ' s claim that the high estate of united states agriculture is the `` strongest deterrent ' ' to the spread of communism .	65.53015
but the secretary insists that the success of the american farmer is the `` greatest single source of strength ' ' in the struggle to insure freedom around the world .	42.796448
mr . freeman said that in many of the countries he visited on a recent world trade trip people were more awed by america ' s capacity to produce food surpluses than by our industrial production -- or even by the soviet ' s successes in space .	85.59377
american taxpayers have been impressed by the surpluses for a long , long time .	41.972134
in fact , over the years , the american farmer ' s capacity to over-produce has cost the taxpayers a large dollar .	86.347
and thus far , mr . freeman has offered very little relief .	145.2158
the 1961 feed grain program , which the secretary sponsored , has been declared a billion dollar fiasco .	59.734913
in exchange for higher price supports , growers pledged reduction in planted acreage .	34.338997
but the farmers outsmarted washington by shortening the distance between the rows and pouring on the fertilizer .	66.749756
the result $1 . 1 billion added to the deficit in the federal budget .	26.030607
perhaps , as mr . freeman says , american agriculture may stop the communists , but it is also swindling the american taxpayer .	49.08073
a senate subcommittee headed by sen . jackson of washington has been going over the state department and has reached some predictable conclusions .	91.42907
the department needs a clearer `` sense of direction ' ' at the top and it needs fewer , but better , people , sen . jackson says .	61.056793
the subcommittee is not alone in questioning the effectiveness of the department .	38.683353
president kennedy has indicated his dissatisfaction with its performance .	27.707205
but those who would revitalize so complex an organization must , first of all , overcome the resistance of layers of officials wedded to traditional procedures , suspicious of innovation and fearful of mistakes .	160.90672
nor does sen . jackson discuss the delicate situation created by the presence in the white house of a corps of presidential assistants engaged in the study of foreign policy .	42.41239
this tends to create friction and confusion and has not made it easier for secretary rusk to restore vigor and initiative among his subordinates .	144.59593
but competent observers believe he is making progress , particularly toward what sen . jackson lists as the primary need -- `` a clearer understanding of where our vital national interests lie and what we must do to promote them ' ' .	90.49294
the jackson report will provide some of the political support mr . rusk will need if he is to get rid of department personnel engaged , as sen . jackson puts it , `` in work that does not really need doing ' ' .	83.248146
mr . rusk should also draw comfort from sen . jackson ' s recommendation that congressional methods of dealing with national security problems be improved .	53.645256
self-criticism is a rare but needed commodity in congress .	50.125042
forecasting economic activity is a hazardous undertaking even for the specialist .	42.395813
but now apparently the job of secretary of labor requires that he be willing to risk his reputation as a prognosticator of unemployment trends .	77.36106
james p . mitchell , when he was the head of the department , promised to eat his hat if unemployment didn ' t drop below three million a couple of years ago .	66.3752
he lost , but settled for a cake in the shape of a fedora .	23.993284
his successor , secretary goldberg , also has been guessing wrong on a drop in the unemployment rate which has been holding just under 7 per cent for the last 11 months .	50.40492
no betting man , mr . goldberg says he ' s merely `` putting my neck out again ' ' by predicting the rate will go down this month .	75.05385
he is basing his guess on new government statistics that show business has broadened its stride -- a new record high in personal income , an increase in housing starts , a spurt in retail sales and a gain in orders for durable goods .	96.1848
mr . mitchell had an excuse for losing -- the steel strike lasted much longer than he anticipated .	215.09514
mr . goldberg has less reason for missing .	24.049627
the economy seems to be sailing along on an even keel and the 1961 hurricane season and auto strikes are at an end so they can ' t be blamed in november .	104.29615
the odds thus appear favorable that the secretary ' s neck may be spared .	27.687956
cambodia ' s chief of state , who has been accused of harboring communist marauders and otherwise making life miserable for neighboring south viet nam and thailand , insists he would be very unhappy if communism established its power in southeast asia .	61.92477
but so convinced of communism ' s inevitable triumph is prince sihanouk that he is ready to throw in the towel .	40.761757
`` i have to see the facts ' ' , is the way the prince puts it .	38.523354
and from that point of vantage he concedes another two years of grace to nations maintaining a pro-western posture .	193.36615
prince sihanouk ' s powers of prognostication some day may be confirmed but history is not likely to praise the courage of his convictions .	82.10845
commerce secretary hodges seems to have been cast in the role of pacemaker for official washington ' s economic forecasters .	85.71504
weeks ago he saw a business upturn in the second quarter of this year while his colleagues in the cabinet were shaking their heads in disagreement .	65.36114
recently treasury secretary dillon and labor secretary goldberg fell into line with mr . hodges ' appraisal , though there has been some reluctance to do so at the white house .	43.42107
and now mr . hodges has pioneered further into the economic unknown with the announcement that he thinks business has stopped sliding and that it should start going upward from this point .	76.48333
he is the first top administration officer to see the bottom of the slump .	59.179234
the secretary based his assessment on the upturn in retail sales .	22.751036
february ' s volume was 1 per cent above january ' s for the first pickup since last october , although it ' s still 1 . 5 per cent off from february 1960 .	49.017296
corroborating mr . hodges ' figures was the federal reserve board ' s report of the large sales increase in the nation ' s department stores for the week ending march 4 .	37.966934
in newark , for example , this gain was put at 26 per cent above the year-earlier level .	35.05048
of course , some of the credit for the sale boost must be given to improvement in the weather and to the fact that easter comes more than two weeks earlier than in 1960 .	57.919266
another optimistic sign , this one from the labor department , was the report that the long rise in unemployment compensation payments `` was interrupted for the first time in the week ending feb . 25 ' ' .	51.24951
initial claims for jobless benefits were said to have dropped by 8 , 100 in the week ending march 4 .	63.04669
mr . hodges is so hopeful over the outlook that he doesn ' t think there will be any need of a cut in income taxes .	37.40365
well , we can ' t have everything .	19.64683
prosperity for the whole nation is certainly preferred to a tax cut .	37.353344
new jersey folk need not be told of the builder ' s march to the sea , for in a single generation he has parceled and populated miles of our shoreline and presses on to develop the few open spaces that remain .	111.5586
now the stone harbor bird sanctuary , 31 acres of magic attraction for exotic herons , is threatened , but the battlefront extends far beyond our state .	65.664246
against the dramatic fight being waged for preservation of 30 miles of cape cod shoreline , the tiny tract at stone harbor may seem unimportant .	38.128628
but interior secretary udall warns that there is a race on between those who would develop our few surviving open shorelines and those who would save them for the enjoyment of all as public preserves .	83.85296
the move for establishment of a national seashore park on 30 , 000 acres of cape cod , from provincetown to chatham , is strengthened by president kennedy ' s interest in that area .	34.535843
but preservation of the natural beauty of the cape is of more than regional concern , for the automobile age has made it the recreation spot of people from all over the country .	118.81491
by comparison , stone harbor bird sanctuary ' s allies seem less formidable , for aside from the audubon society , they are mostly the snowy , common and cattle egrets and the louisiana , green , little blue and black-crowned herons who nest and feed there .	113.889915
but there is hope , for conservation commissioner bontempo has tagged the sanctuary as the kind of place the state hopes to include in its program to double its park space .	101.15485
the desirability of preserving such places as the cape dunes and stone harbor sanctuary becomes more apparent every year .	72.03785
public sentiment for conserving our rich natural heritage is growing .	61.101036
much of the glamor president kennedy ' s peace corps may have held for some prospective applicants has been removed by sargent shriver , the head corpsman .	86.47448
anybody who is expecting a joyride should , according to mr . shriver , get off the train right now .	87.54472
first of all , the recruits will have to undergo arduous schooling .	56.097782
then off to a remote place in an underdeveloped country where the diet , culture , language and living conditions will be different .	104.009636
and the pay , of course , will be nil .	29.69055
despite all this , the idea apparently has captured the imagination of countless youths whose parents are probably more surprised by the response than anybody else .	101.55647
the study of the st . louis area ' s economic prospects prepared for the construction industry joint conference confirms and reinforces both the findings of the metropolitan st . louis survey of 1957 and the easily observed picture of the missouri-illinois countryside .	97.95946
st . louis sits in the center of a relatively slow-growing and in some places stagnant mid-continent region .	44.0486
slackened regional demand for st . louis goods and services reflects the region ' s relative lack of purchasing power .	59.00794
not all st . louis industries , of course , have a market area confined to the immediate neighborhood .	76.21996
but for those which do , the slow growth of the area has a retarding effect on the metropolitan core .	29.360504
the city has a stake in stimulating growth and purchasing power throughout outstate missouri and southern illinois .	76.404236
gov . dalton ' s new commerce and industry commission is moving to create a nine-state regional group in a collective effort to attract new industry .	79.44761
another would be to take the advice of dr . elmer ellis , president of the university of missouri , and provide for an impartial professional analysis of missouri ' s economy .	35.853916
he says the state , in order to proceed with economic development , must develop an understanding of how the various parts of its economy fit together and dovetail into the national economy .	69.10893
the research center of the university ' s school of business and public administration is prepared to undertake the analysis dr . ellis has been talking about .	75.48519
he and dean john w . schwada of the business school outlined the project at a recent conference .	73.31737
the university can make a valuable contribution to the state ' s economic development through such a study .	35.62783
in southern illinois , the new federal program of help to economically depressed areas ought to provide some stimulus to growth .	92.46487
the carbondale industrial development corp . has obtained a $500 , 000 loan to help defray the cost of remodeling a city-owned factory to accommodate production that will provide 500 new jobs .	65.611694
carbondale is in the herrin-murphysboro-west frankfort labor market , where unemployment has been substantially higher than the national average .	29.028095
the federal program eventually should have a favorable impact on missouri ' s depressed areas , and in the long run that will benefit st . louis as well .	51.63808
politics-ridden st . clair county in illinois presents another piece of the problem of metropolitan development .	53.02368
more industrial acreage lies vacant in st . clair county than in any other jurisdiction in the st . louis area .	45.90511
the unstable political situation there represents one reason new plants shy away from the east side .	103.42315
and then there is st . louis county , where the democratic leadership has shown little appreciation of the need for sound zoning , of the important relationship between proper land use and economic growth .	75.44201
st . louis county under its present leadership also has largely closed its eyes to the need for governmental reform , and permitted parochial interests to take priority over area-wide interests .	169.6954
some plant-location specialists take these signs to mean st . louis county doesn ' t want industry , and so they avoid the area , and more jobs are lost .	75.32407
metropolitan st . louis ' s relatively slow rate of growth ought to be a priority concern of the political , business , civic and other leaders on both sides of the mississippi .	52.655285
without a great acceleration in the metropolitan area ' s economy , there will not be sufficient jobs for the growing numbers of youngsters , and st . louis will slip into second-class status .	44.201057
many of our very best friends are reformers .	2.1130319
still we must confess that sometimes some of them go too far .	48.802456
take , for example , the reformers among new york city ' s democrats .	22.76463
having whipped mr . de sapio in the primaries and thus come into control of tammany hall , they have changed the name to chatham hall .	134.2638
even though headquarters actually have been moved into the chatham building , do they believe that they can make the new name stick ? ?	82.42055
granted that the tammany name and the tammany tiger often were regarded as badges of political shame , the sachems of the hall also have a few good marks to their credit .	90.5583
but it is tradition rather than the record which balks at the expunging of the tammany name .	104.414825
after all , it goes back to the days in which sedition was not un-american , the days in which the sons of st . tammany conspired to overthrow the government by force and violence -- the british government , that is .	64.20082
further , do our reforming friends really believe that the cartoonists will consent to the banishment of the tiger from their zoo ? ?	56.494507
they will -- when they give up the donkey and the elephant .	47.665222
instead of attempting the impossible , why not a publicity campaign to prove that all the tiger ' s stripes are not black ? ?	65.7473
the white house itself has taken steps to remove a former batista official , col . mariano faget , from his preposterous position as interrogator of cuban refugees for the immigration service .	88.79552
the faget appointment was preposterous on several grounds .	9.546784
the kennedy administration had assured anti-castro cubans that it would have nothing to do with associates of dictator batista .	55.33691
using a batista man to screen refugees represented a total misunderstanding of the democratic forces which alone can effectively oppose castro .	73.000435
moreover , col . faget ' s information on cuba was too outdated to be useful in `` screening ' ' castro agents	123.934616
the colonel fled to the friendly haven of the dominican dictatorship as soon as castro seized power .	72.29514
and while he had headed batista ' s anti-communist section , the batista regime did not disturb the communists so much as more open opponents who were alleged to be communists .	101.895775
responsibility for the faget appointment rests with gen . j . m . swing , an eisenhower appointee as head of the immigration service .	26.914886
gen . swing has received public attention before this for abuse of some of the prerogatives of his office .	80.0834
some reports say he was rescued from timely retirement by his friend , congressman walter of pennsylvania , at a moment when the kennedy administration was diligently searching for all the house votes it could get .	69.585464
congressman walter has been all-powerful in immigration matters , but he has announced plans to retire in 1962 .	23.824465
at that point the administration will have little reason to hang onto gen . swing .	239.4915
the faget case was the kind of salvage job the administration should not have to repeat .	73.35845
as president , dwight d . eisenhower often assumed a role aloof from the strife of partisan politics .	79.43094
as a former president , however , mr . eisenhower abandoned this role to engage in partisan sniping during a new york republican rally , and generally missed his target .	106.12768
mr . eisenhower seized upon the incident of the postcard lost by a peace corps girl in nigeria to attack the entire corps as a `` juvenile experiment ' ' and to suggest sending a corps member to the moon .	94.989265
nowhere did the speaker recognize the serious purpose of the corps or its welcome reception abroad .	61.314415
his words were the more ungracious to come from a man who lent his name to the eisenhower exchange fellowships dedicated to the same goal of international understanding .	66.65536
the former president blithely ignored recent history in speaking of `` dollarette ' ' dollars under kennedy administration fiscal policies .	167.10713
it was the eisenhower administration which produced the largest peacetime deficit .	13.062818
finally , mr . eisenhower found nothing but confusion in washington .	53.78791
this statement recalls the 1959 berlin crisis , when president eisenhower first told reporters that berlin could not be defended with conventional weapons and then added that a nuclear defense was out of the picture too .	118.79859
the crisis has been renewed since then but the confusion has hardly been compounded .	62.81428
ex-presidents , relieved of accountability for policy , sometimes seem to feel free of accountability for their words .	149.84866
some of former president truman ' s off-the-cuff discourses have been in that vein .	56.913094
nobody can deny the right of former chief executives to take part in politics , but the american people expect them always to remember the obligations of national leadership and to treat issues with a sense of responsibility .	78.19433
this is a matter of respect for the presidency .	51.341408
mr . eisenhower ' s new york speech does not encourage respect for that or for his elder statesmanship .	162.69185
the queen mary has long been a symbol of speed , luxury , and impeccable british service on the high seas .	48.4893
reports that the venerable liner , which has been in service since 1936 , was to be retired struck a nostalgic note in many of us .	78.49821
but the cunard line , influenced by unpleasant economic facts and not sentiment , has decided to keep the queen mary in service until next spring at least .	172.64468
a new queen , with the prosaic title of q3 , had been planned for several years to replace the queen mary .	33.56016
the british government , concerned about the threat of unemployment in the shipbuilding industry , had put through a bill to give cunard loans and grants totaling $50 , 400 , 000 toward the $84 , 000 , 000 cost of a new 75 , 000-ton passenger liner .	47.637604
since 1957 , more and more trans-atlantic passengers have been crossing by air .	91.61123
economy class fares and charter flights have attracted almost all new passengers to the airlines .	110.91954
competition from other steamship lines has cut cunard ' s share of sea passengers from one-third to one-fourth and this year the line showed a marked drop of profits on the atlantic run .	69.62854
the cunard line has under consideration replacing the queen mary with a ship smaller than 75 , 000 tons .	97.95951
this would be cheaper to operate and could be used for cruises during the lean winter months .	61.507565
also under consideration is an increased investment in cunard eagle airways which has applied to serve new york .	74.081
the decline of the cunard line from its position of dominance in atlantic travel is a significant development in the history of transportation .	122.19705
gen . maxwell taylor ' s statement in saigon that he is `` very much encouraged ' ' about the chances of the pro-western government of viet nam turning back communist guerrilla attacks comes close to an announcement that he will not recommend dispatching united states troops to bolster the vietnamese army .	52.60795
gen . taylor will report to president kennedy in a few days on the results of his visit to south viet nam and , judging from some of his remarks to reporters in the far east , he is likely to urge a more efficient mobilization of vietnamese military , economic , political and other resources .	49.07118
there was good reason for gen . taylor to make an inspection trip at this time .	55.337936
communist guerrillas recently have been reported increasing their activities and the great flood of the mekong river has interposed a new crisis .	43.02268
south viet nam ' s rice surplus for next year -- more than 300 , 000 tons -- may have been destroyed .	29.568235
the viet cong , the communist rebels , may have lost their stored grain and arms factories .	168.33733
the rebels may try to seize what is left of the october harvest when the floods recede and the monsoon ends in november .	79.071785
nothing that is likely to happen , however , should prompt the sending of united states soldiers for other than instructional missions .	93.84586
the indochina struggle was a war to stay out of in 1954 , when gen . ridgway estimated it would take a minimum of 10 to 15 divisions at the outset to win a war the french were losing .	73.4325
it is a war to stay out of today , especially in view of the fact that president ngo dinh diem apparently does not want united states troops .	81.015305
he may want additional technical help , and this should be forthcoming .	41.406406
south viet nam has received $1 , 450 , 000 , 000 in united states aid since 1954 and the rate of assistance has been stepped up since vice president lyndon b . johnson ' s visit last may .	47.49705
gen . taylor , the president ' s special military adviser , is a level-headed officer who is not likely to succumb to propaganda or pressure .	57.569138
it is probable that his recommendations will be informed and workable , and that they will not lead to involving the united states in an asian morass .	57.597965
gov . john m . dalton , himself a lawyer and a man of long service in government , spoke with rich background and experience when he said in an address here that lawyers ought to quit sitting in the missouri general assembly , or quit accepting fees from individuals and corporations who have controversies with or axes to grind with the government and who are retained , not because of their legal talents , but because of their government influence .	109.39407
ambassador stevenson yesterday described the u . n . ' s problem of electing a temporary successor to the late dag hammarskjold as `` the gravest crisis the institution has faced ' ' .	36.93738
if the decision goes wrong , it may be -- as mr . stevenson fears -- `` the first step on the slippery path downhill ' ' to a u . n . without operational responsibilities and without effective meaning .	74.06483
the integrity of the office not merely requires that the secretary general shall be , as the charter puts it , `` the chief administrative officer of the organization ' ' , but that neither he nor his staff shall seek or receive instructions from any government or any other authority `` external to the organization ' ' .	58.05672
in other words , the secretary general is to be a nonpartisan , international servant , not a political , national one .	78.7093
he should be , as dag hammarskjold certainly was , a citizen of the world .	30.483498
the charter does stipulate that `` due regard ' ' shall be paid to the importance of recruiting the staff on `` as wide a geographical basis as possible ' ' .	75.21898
the united states and its allies have had no objection to this .	23.814934
what they have objected to is the attempt of the russians to make use of the tragedy of dag hammarskjold ' s death to turn the entire u . n . staff from the secretary down into political agents of the respective countries from which they come .	68.92654
the controversy now revolves mainly around the number and geographic origin of the deputies of the secretary general and , more particularly , around the nature of his relationship with them .	73.6065
although the united states and the u . s . s . r . have been arguing whether there shall be four , five or six top assistants , the most important element in the situation is not the number of deputies but the manner in which these deputies are to do their work .	41.245262
if any one of them has any power to veto the secretary general ' s decisions the nature of the organization will have changed .	45.978607
if they give him advice when he asks it , or if they perform specified duties under his direction , the nature of the u . n . will not of necessity change .	68.31169
the secretary general must have , subject to the constitutional direction of the security council and the general assembly , the power to act , to propose action and to organize action without being hobbled by advisers and assistants acting on someone else ' s instructions .	56.28923
this is the root issue for which the united states should stand .	52.835968
we should not become confused or let our public become confused over irrelevant questions of number or even of geography .	212.82877
what we must have , if the united nations is to survive , is as nonpolitical , nonpartisan an organization at the top as human beings can make it , subject to no single nation ' s direction and subservient to no single nation ' s ambition .	60.246468
the new city charter , which should get a yes vote as question no . 1 on nov . 7 , would not make a good mayor out of a bad one .	113.44395
there is no such magic in man-made laws .	3.2854538
but it would greatly strengthen any mayor ' s executive powers , remove the excuse in large degree that he is a captive of inaction in the board of estimate , increase his budget-making authority both as to expense and capital budgets , and vest in him the right to reorganize city departments in the interest of efficiency and economy .	86.419044
lawmaking power is removed from the board of estimate and made a partnership responsibility of the city council and the mayor .	54.422413
thus there is a clearer division of authority , administrative and legislative .	92.40938
the board is diminished in both respects , while it retains control over zoning , franchises , pier leases , sale , leasing and assignment of property , and other trusteeship functions .	46.882393
the board will be able to increase , decrease , add or eliminate budget items , subject to the mayor ' s veto	123.46045
but the city council will now share fully this budget-altering power .	175.30348
overriding of mayoral veto on budget changes will require concurrence by board and council , and a two-thirds vote .	78.965
the controller retains his essential `` fiscal watchdog ' ' functions	18.310602
his broad but little used investigative powers are confirmed .	139.94719
he loses now-misplaced tax collection duties , which go to the finance department .	75.14947
on net balance , in spite of controller gerosa ' s opposition to the new charter as an invasion of his office , the controller will have the opportunity for greater usefulness to good government than he has now .	62.447426
borough presidents , while retaining membership in the board of estimate , lose their housekeeping functions .	156.28265
highways go to a new department of highways , sewers to the department of public works , such street cleaning as borough presidents now do ( in queens and richmond ) to the sanitation department .	96.759674
the expense ( operating ) budget is to be a program budget , and red tape is cut to allow greater autonomy ( with the mayor approving ) in fund transfers within a department .	102.840645
the capital budget , for construction of permanent improvements , becomes an appropriating document instead of just a calendar of pious promises	174.95634
but , as a second-look safeguard , each new project must undergo a board of estimate public hearing before construction proceeds .	268.71384
a road block to desirable local or borough improvements , heretofore dependent on the pocketbook vote of taxpayers and hence a drag on progress , is removed by making these a charge against the whole city instead of an assessment paid by those immediately affected .	196.83698
this will have a beneficial effect by expediting public business	640.2381
enlargement of the city council and a new method of selecting members will be discussed tomorrow .	111.42086
the inter-american press association , which blankets the western hemisphere from northern canada to cape horn , is meeting in new york city this week for the first time in eleven years .	58.419926
the i . a . p . a . is a reflection of the problems and hopes of the hemisphere	36.084496
and in these days this inevitably means a concentration on the effects of the cuban revolution .	41.82535
as the press in cuba was gradually throttled by the castro regime , more and more cuban publishers , editors and correspondents were forced into exile .	44.100185
the i . a . p . a . found itself driven from journalism into politics as it did its best to bring about the downfall of the castro government and the return of the cuban press to the freedom it knew before batista ' s dictatorship began in 1952 .	89.21687
freedom of the press was lost in cuba because of decades of corruption and social imbalances .	165.59953
this , in more diplomatic language , is what adlai stevenson told the newspaper men of latin america yesterday on behalf of the united states government .	60.64966
he felt able to end on a note of hope .	29.154516
he sees evidence of fair winds for the ten-year alliance for progress plan with its emphasis on social reforms .	237.93562
no group can contribute more to the success of the program than the editors and publishers of the inter-american press association .	37.509254
the twenty-second soviet communist party congress opens in moscow today in a situation contrasting sharply with the script prepared many months ago when this meeting was first announced .	113.77691
according to the original program , premier khrushchev expected the millions looking toward the kremlin this morning to be filled with admiration or rage -- depending upon individual or national politics -- because of the `` bold program for building communism in our time ' ' which the congress will adopt .	132.26639
but far from being concerned about whether or not russia will have achieved utopia by 1980 , the world is watching moscow today primarily for clues as to whether or not there will be nuclear armageddon in the immediate future .	113.37971
the evident contradiction between the rosy picture of russia ' s progress painted by the communist party ' s program and the enormous dangers for all humanity posed by premier khrushchev ' s berlin policy has already led to speculation abroad that the program may be severely altered .	63.31301
whether it is or not , the propaganda impact on the free world of the document scheduled to be adopted at this meeting will be far less than had been originally anticipated .	73.44336
and there must be many soviet citizens who know what is going on and who realize that before they can hope to enjoy the full life promised for 1980 they and their children must first survive .	136.99026
this congress will see premier khrushchev consolidating his power and laying the groundwork for an orderly succession should death or illness remove him from the scene in the next few years .	97.541595
the widespread purge that has taken place the past twelve months or so among communist leaders in the provinces gives assurance that the party officials who will dominate the congress , and the central committee it will elect , will all have passed the tightest possible khrushchev screening , both for loyalty to him and for competence and performance on the job .	103.4517
dr . james b . conant has earned a nationwide reputation as a moderate and unemotional school reformer .	39.174564
his earlier reports considered the american public schools basically sound and not in need of drastic change .	109.50623
now , a close look at the schools in and around the ten largest cities , including new york , has shattered this optimism .	69.9797
dr . conant has come away shocked and angry .	87.73579
his new book , entitled `` slums and suburbs ' ' , calls for fast and drastic action to avert disaster .	62.825935
there is room for disagreement concerning some of dr . conant ' s specific views .	39.595425
his strong opposition to the transfer of negro children to schools outside their own neighborhood , in the interest of integration , will be attacked by negro leaders who have fought for , and achieved , this open or permissive enrollment .	100.78787
dr . conant may underestimate the psychological importance of even token equality .	178.44933
his suggestion that the prestige colleges be made the training institutions for medical , law and graduate schools will run into strong opposition from these colleges themselves -- even though what he is recommending is already taking shape as a trend .	225.07321
but these are side issues to a powerful central theme .	43.534805
that theme cuts through hypocrisies , complacency and double-talk .	8.708324
it labels the slums , especially the negro slums , as dead-end streets for hundreds of thousands of youngsters .	37.78746
the villains of the piece are those who deny job opportunities to these youngsters , and dr . conant accuses employers and labor unions alike .	153.14525
the facts , he adds , are hidden from public view by squeamish objections to calling bad conditions by their right name and by insistence on token integration rather than on real improvement of the schools , regardless of the color of their students .	126.99408
a call for action `` before it is too late ' ' has alarming implications when it comes from a man who , in his previous reports on the schools , cautioned so strongly against extreme measures .	99.63817
dr . conant ' s conscientious , selfless efforts deserve the nation ' s gratitude .	107.0529
he has served in positions of greater glamour , both at home and abroad	72.5076
but he may well be doing his greatest service with his straightforward report on the state of the public schools .	49.91784
a fascinating letter has just reached this desk from a correspondent who likes to receive so-called junk mail .	99.25104
he was delighted to learn that the post office department is now going to expand this service to deliver mail from representatives in congress to their constituents without the use of stamps , names , addresses or even zone numbers .	111.98263
in accordance with legislation passed at the last session of congress , each representative is authorized to deliver to the post office in bulk newsletters , speeches and other literature to be dropped in every letter box in his district .	62.861958
this means an added burden to innumerable postmen , who already are complaining of heavy loads and low pay , and it presumably means an increased postal deficit , but , our correspondent writes , think of the additional junk mail each citizen will now be privileged to receive on a regular basis .	129.37846
occasional letters are sent by individuals to one another and many are written by companies to one another , but these are mostly typewritten .	72.55817
most mail these days consists of nothing that could truly be called a letter .	121.5142
old , tired , trembling the woman came to the cannery .	24.988554
she had , she said , heard that the plant was closing .	81.84831
it couldn ' t close , she said .	4.0452347
she had raised a calf , grown it beef-fat .	34.2512
she had , with her own work-weary hands , put seeds in the ground , watched them sprout , bud , blossom , and get ready to bear .	62.270084
she was ready to kill the beef , dress it out , and with vegetables from her garden was going to can soup , broth , hash , and stew against the winter .	80.11884
she had done it last year , and the year before , and the year before that , and she , and her people were dependent upon these cans for food .	84.89169
this did not happen in counties of north georgia , where the rivers run and make rich the bottom land .	103.54004
nor in south georgia , where the summer sun shines warmly and gives early life to the things growing in the flat fields .	174.87794
this happened in decatur , dekalb county , not 10 miles from the heart of metropolitian atlanta .	133.52823
and now , the woman , tired and trembling , came here to the dekalb county cannery .	45.315697
`` is it so the cannery is going to close ' ' ? ?	15.57515
o . n . moss , 61 , tall , grey as a possum , canning plant chief since 1946 , didn ' t know what to say .	52.87871
he did say she could get her beef and vegetables in cans this summer .	59.356544
he did say he was out of cans , the no . 3 ' s , but `` i requisitioned 22 , 000 ' ' .	65.84108
he said he had no . 2 ' s enough to last two weeks more .	60.048347
threat of closing the cannery is a recent one .	36.274742
a three-man committee has recommended to commission chairman charles o . emmerich that the dekalb county cannery be closed .	24.540903
reason the cannery loses $3 , 000 yearly .	94.23469
but dekalb citizens , those who use the facilities of the cannery , say the cannery is not supposed to make any money .	31.547516
`` the cannery ' ' , said mrs . lewellyn lundeen , an active booster of the cannery since its opening during the war and rationing years of 1941 , to handle the `` victory garden ' ' produce , `` is a service to the taxpayer .	60.60216
and one of the best services available to the people who try to raise and can meat , to plant , grow vegetables and put them up .	90.479095
`` the county , though , seems more interested in those people who don ' t even try , those who sit and draw welfare checks and line up for surplus food ' ' .	101.795006
a driver of a dairy truck , who begins work at 1 a . m . finishes before breakfast , then goes out and grows a garden , and who has used the cannery to save and feed a family of five , asked , `` what in the world will we do ' ' ? ?	66.5325
`` what in the world ' ' , echoed others , those come with the beans , potatoes , the tomatoes , `` will any of us do ' ' ? ?	103.41752
moss , a man who knows how much the cannery helps the county , doesn ' t believe it will close .	34.406013
but he is in the middle , an employe of dekalb , but on the side of the people .	42.29799

he does not expect to get great riches or he would not have chosen to answer the call to preach .	67.60631

theirs is a sacrificial life by earthly standards .	2.1172154
