mr . podger always particularly enjoyed the last night of each summer at loon lake .	56.849297
the narrow fringe of sadness that ran around it only emphasized the pleasure .	416.8229
the evening was not always spent in the same way .	10.270369
this year , on a night cool with the front of september moving in , but with plenty of summer still about , the podgers were holding a neighborhood gathering in the pod .	152.27356
the little cottage was bursting with people of all ages .	106.711945
in the midst of it all , mr . podger came out on the pod porch , alone .	31.863586
he had that day attended a country auction , and he had come back with a prize .	33.041214
the prize was an old-fashioned , woven cloth hammock , complete with cross-top pillow , fringed side pieces , and hooks for hanging .	39.331093
mrs . podger had obligingly pushed things around on the porch to make room for it , and there it was , slung in a vine-shaded corner , the night breeze rippling its fringe with a slow , caressing movement .	49.48392
mr . podger sat down in it , pushed himself back and forth in one or two slow , rhythmic motions , and then swung his feet up into it .	115.31651
he closed his eyes and let the unintelligible drift of voices sweep pleasantly over him .	81.371414
suddenly one young voice rose above the others .	9.371774
`` but ' ' , it said , `` do you always know when you ' re happy ' ' ? ?	14.962899
the voice sank back into the general tangle of sound , but the question stayed in mr . podger ' s mind .	38.288467
here , in the cool , autumn-touched evening , mr . podger mentally retraced a day that had left him greatly contented and at peace .	54.9908
it had begun with the blue jay feather .	10.796896
walking along the lake before breakfast , mr . podger had seen the feather , and the bird that had lost it in flight .	54.8246
the winging spread of blue had gone on , calling harshly , into the wood .	54.548695
the small shaft of blue had drifted down and come to rest at his feet .	43.812332
all day long mr . podger , who was a straw-hat man in the summer , had worn the feather in the band of his broad-brimmed sunshield .	34.816257
would a blue feather in a man ' s hat make him happy all day ? ?	171.98422
but it was something to have seen it floating down through the early morning sunshine , linking the blue of the sky with the blue of the asters by the lake .	52.36386
then , since the auction was being held nearby , he had walked to it .	75.041824
and there , on the way , had been the box turtle , that slow , self-contained , world-ignoring relic of pre-history , bent , for reasons best known to itself , on crossing the road .	153.42908
it was doing very well , too , having reached the center , and was pursuing its way with commendable singleness of purpose when mr . podger saw hazard approaching in the shape of a flashy little sports car .	88.77499
would he take pains to avoid it ? ?	1.0472845
taking off his hat and signaling the driver with it , mr . podger stepped into the road , lifted the surprised turtle and consummated its road-crossing with what must have been a breath-taking suddenness .	50.523262
the turtle immediately withdrew into its private council room to study the phenomenon .	222.1144
but mr . podger and the driver of the sports car waved at each other .	77.73631
here in the cool darkness mr . podger could still feel the warmth of midday , could still see the yellow butterflies dancing over the road , could still see the friendly grin on the young , sun-browned face as the driver looked back over his shoulder for a moment before the car streaked out of sight .	77.45954
for a few brief minutes they had all been part of one little drama .	137.59224
the three would never meet again , but for some reason or other mr . podger was sure he would always remember the incident .	87.8582
at will , the voice of the auctioneer , the voices of the bidders , and finally the small boy who had been so interested in mr . podger ' s hammock purchase .	43.645664
`` i like them things , too ' ' , he had said .	12.073944
if you ' re lyin ' out in the hammock at night , and it gets kinda cool -- you know -- you just take these sides with the fringe on -- see -- and wrap ' em right over you .	106.71917
i do it , lots o ' times -- i like to lie in a hammock at night , by myself , when it ' s all quiet .	75.28349
the wind moves it a little bit -- you know .	29.45486
mr . podger had thanked him gravely , and now he made use of the advice .	59.014297
as he pulled the fringed sides up and made himself into a cocoon , mr . podger saw that thin , attractive , freckled little face again , and hoped that the boy , too , was lying in a cool , fringed-wrapped quiet .	62.887077
alacrity , the podger cat , came by the hammock , rubbed her back briefly against it , and then , sure of a welcome , hopped up .	112.44831
she remarked that she found the night wind a little chilly , and mr . podger took her inside the fringe .	56.018368
soon her purring rivaled the chirping of the tree crickets , rivaled the hum of voices from inside the pod .	79.86725
mr . podger was just adding this to his pictures of the day when the screen door opened and pam burst out .	65.3111
`` it ' s getting so chilly we ' ve lighted a fire , and we ' re going to tell a round robin story -- a nice , scary one .	52.096962

`` of course i am ' ' , he said .	5.08245
i just came out here to know it ' ' .	3.6191778
as the south begins another school year , national and even world attention is directed at the region ' s slow progress toward racial equality in the public schools .	148.9608
desegregation is beginning in two more important southern cities -- dallas and atlanta .	44.275974
in each city civic and education leaders have been working hard to get public opinion prepared to accept the inevitability of equal treatment .	123.09887
these programs emphasize the acceptance of biracial classrooms peacefully .	20.231003
the programs do not take sides on the issue itself .	180.65979
they point out simply that `` it is the law of the land ' ' .	10.820921
the two cities have the examples of little rock and new orleans to hold up as warnings against resorting to violence to try to stop the processes of desegregation .	80.943985
even better , they have the examples of nashville and houston to hold up as peaceful and progressive programs .	111.93762
in each case there was an initial act of violence .	53.34057
in houston , there were a few incidents of friction between whites and negroes , none of which were serious .	83.58325
in each city quick public reaction and fast action by the city government halted the threats of more serious incidents .	77.10625
the nashville plan , incidentally , has become recognized as perhaps the most acceptable and thus the most practical to put into effect in the troubled south .	86.03813
it is a `` stair-step ' ' plan , in which desegregation begins in the first grade .	66.054794
each year another grade is added to the process , until finally all 12 grades are integrated .	366.56586
the schedules are flexible so that the program can be accelerated as the public becomes more tolerant or realizes that it is something that has to be done , `` so why not now ' ' .	43.89937
the program has worked well in both nashville and houston .	14.356564
it met a serious rebuff in new orleans , where the two schools selected for the first moves toward integration were boycotted by white parents .	87.81406
another attempt will be made this year in new orleans to resume the program .	39.616707
generally , throughout the south , there is a growing impatience with the pattern of violence with which every step of desegregation is met .	77.52787
perhaps the most eloquent move toward removal of racial barriers has been in dallas .	87.3535
during the summer , negroes began quietly patronizing previously segregated restaurants and lunch counters in downtown retail establishments .	49.045017
it was part of a citywide move toward full integration .	100.29709
so successful has been this program , worked out by white and negro civic leaders , that further extensions are expected in the next few months .	38.697872
hotels , for example , are ready to let down the bars .	79.877525
already , at least one hotel has been quietly taking reservations on a nonracial basis .	107.53987
several conventions have been held in recent months in hotels on a nonsegregated basis .	33.837624
this is a radical change in attitude from the conditions which prevailed several years ago , when a series of bombings was directed against negroes who were moving into previously all-white neighborhoods of dallas .	57.7084
it is also symptomatic of a change in attitude which appears to be spreading all across the south .	75.49346
southern whites themselves are realizing that they had been wrong in using violence to try to stop negroes from claiming equal rights .	161.26228
they insist they are ashamed of such violence and intimidation as occurred in alabama when the freedom riders sought to break down racial discrimination in local bus depots .	114.05219
all across the south there are signs that racial violence is finding less approval among whites who themselves would never take active part but might once have shown a tolerant attitude toward it .	228.29373
business leaders are aware now that they suffer greatly from any outbreak of violence .	48.565044
they are putting strong pressure on their police departments to keep order .	111.36503
in the past these same southerners were inclined to look the other way .	44.111195
and as the businessmen have begun to act , a real sense of co-operation has sprung up .	35.495747
this co-operation has emboldened other southern whites to add their voices to demands for peaceable accommodation .	47.485767
they realize that by acting in concert , rather than individually , they will not be picked out as objects of retaliation -- economic and otherwise .	158.77766
since moving from a chicago suburb to southern california a few months ago , i ' ve been introduced to a new game called lanesmanship .	23.13118
played mostly on the freeways around los angeles , it goes like this	198.53531
a driver cruising easily at 70 m . p . h . in lane a of a four-lane freeway spies an incipient traffic jam ahead .	47.42181
traffic in the next lane appears to be moving more smoothly so he pokes a tentative fender into lane b , which is heavily populated by cars also moving at 70 m . p . h . .	65.61301
the adjacent driver in lane b has three choices open to him .	111.77804
he can ( 1 ) point his car resolutely at the invading fender and force the other driver back into lane a	66.71173
( 2 ) slow down and permit the ambivalent driver to change lanes	677.1287
or ( 3 ) alternately accelerate and decelerate , thus keeping the first driver guessing as to his intentions , thereby making a fascinating sport of the whole affair .	102.36621
the really remarkable thing to me is that most california natives unhesitatingly elect to slow down and permit the invading car free access .	227.9901
whether or not this is done out of enlightened self-preservation , i don ' t know .	26.781336
but it is done , consistently and i ' m both surprised and impressed .	85.98895
this could never happen in my native chicago .	7.2118516
there such soggy acquiesence would be looked upon as a sure sign of deteriorating manhood .	64.736725
in chicago , the driver cut out would likely jam his gas pedal to the floor in an effort to force the other car back .	122.36691
failing this , he would pull alongside at the first opportunity and shake his fist threateningly .	39.73942
this negative explanation of courtesy on the freeways , however , does an injustice to southern california drivers .	99.15105
at the risk of losing my charge-a-plate at marshall field and company , i would like to challenge an old and hallowed stereotype .	104.091896
after three months of research , i can state unequivocally that los angeles drivers are considerably more courteous and competent than any other drivers i ' ve ever encountered .	78.51347
during one recent day of driving about los angeles there were actually a dozen occasions when oncoming drivers stopped an entire lane of traffic to permit me to pull out of an impossible side street .	89.133575
an out-of-town writer came up to paul richards today and asked the oriole manager if he thought his ball club would be improved this year .	122.850006
now richards , of course , is known as a deep thinker as baseball managers go .	111.31777

he hasn ' t played too much , because richards has been working on him furiously in batting practice .	164.18309

is the mother of an `` autistic ' ' child at fault ? ?	68.08332
( the `` autistic ' ' child is one who seems to lack a well-defined sense of self .	61.77354
he tends to treat himself and other people as if they were objects -- and sometimes he treats objects as if they were people .	96.436325
) did his mother make him this way ? ?	16.286175
we believe that autism , like so many other conditions of defect and deviation , is to a large extent inborn .	74.762634
a mother can help a child adapt to his difficulties .	143.25679
sometimes she can -- to a large extent -- help him overcome them .	155.51718
but we don ' t think she creates them .	35.007824
we don ' t think she can make her child defective , emotionally disturbed or autistic .	162.51971
the mother of a difficult child can do a great deal to help her own child and often , by sharing her experiences , she can help other mothers with the same problem .	58.1301
since little is known about autism , and almost nothing has been written for the layman , we ' d like to share one experienced mother ' s comments .	99.971825
as the mother of an autistic child who is lacking in interest and enthusiasm about almost anything , i have to manipulate my son ' s fingers for him when he first plays with a new toy .	56.043564
he wants me to do everything for him .	3.788774
`` you don ' t believe that autistic children become autistic because of something that happens to them or because of the way their mother treats them .	134.26706
but i do and my psychiatrist does , too .	35.658447
i know , that my son wants control and direction , but being autistic myself i cannot give full control or direction .	197.29346
`` one thing i notice which i have seldom heard mentioned .	233.64505
this is that autistic people don ' t enjoy physical contact with others -- for instance , my children and i .	46.039413
when i hold my son he stiffens his whole body in my arms until he is as straight and stiff as a board .	84.07957
he pushes and straightens himself as if he can ' t stand the feeling of being held .	45.784172
physical contact is uncomfortable for him ' ' ! !	12.480796
as a rule , the autistic child doesn ' t enjoy physical contact with others .	10.9013605
parents have to find other ways of comforting him .	79.50585
for the young child this may be no more than providing food , light or movement .	128.35297
as he grows older it may be a matter of providing some accustomed object ( his `` magic ' ' thing ) .	138.11766
or certain words or rituals that child and adult go through may do the trick .	166.425
the answer is different for each autistic child , but for most there is an answer .	53.717545
`` dear doctors we learned this year that our older son , daniel , is autistic .	92.40924
we did not accept the diagnosis at once , but gradually we are coming to .	89.38282
fortunately , there is a nursery school which he has been able to attend , with a group of normal children .	27.723507
`` i try to treat daniel as if he were normal , though of course i realize he is far from that at present .	107.47738
what i do is to try to bring him into contact with reality as much as possible .	46.939926
i try to give him as many normal experiences as possible .	41.65157

seen in decorating circles of late is a renewed interest in an old art embroidery .	119.11295
possibly responsible for this is the incoming trend toward multicolor schemes in rooms , which seems slated to replace the one-color look to which we have been accustomed .	58.585545
just as a varitinted oriental rug may suggest the starting point for a room scheme , so may some of the newest versions of embroidery .	141.84499
one such , in fact , is a rug .	340.894
though not actually crewel embroidery , it has that look with its over-stitched raised pattern in blue , pink , bronze and gold and a sauterne background .	92.91914
the twirled , stylized design of winding stems and floral forms strongly suggests the embroidered patterns used so extensively for upholstery during the jacobean period in england .	74.58677
traditional crewel embroidery which seems to be appearing more frequently this fall than in the past few years is still available in this country .	52.1213
the work is executed in england ( by hand ) and can be worked in any desired design and color .	66.18263
among some recent imports were seat covers for one series of dining room chairs on which were depicted salad plates overflowing with tomatoes and greens and another set on which a pineapple was worked in naturalistic color .	100.38732
for a particularly fabulous room which houses a collection of fine english chippendale furniture , fabric wall panels were embroidered with a typically chinese-inspired design of this revered eighteenth century period .	32.957733
since the work is done by hand , the only limitation , it is said , `` is that of human conception ' ' .	33.317764
modern embroidered panels , framed and meant to be hung on the wall , are another aspect of this trend .	44.64848
these have never gone out of style in scandinavian homes and now seem to be reappearing here and there in shops which specialize in handicrafts .	148.23642
an amateur decorator might try her hand at a pair during the long winter evenings , and , by picking up her living room color scheme , add a decorative do-it-yourself note to the room .	71.92753
california democrats this weekend will take the wraps off a 1962 model statewide campaign vehicle which they have been quietly assembling in a thousand district headquarters , party clubrooms and workers ' backyards .	135.56659

-- arrangements for a statewide pre-primary endorsing convention in fresno next jan . 26-28 .	57.146248

at the head of the cdc is an unorthodox , 39-year-old amateur politico , thomas b . carvey jr . , whose normal profession is helping develop hughes aircraft ' s moon missiles .	92.750084
he ' s approached his democratic duties in hard-nosed engineering fashion .	250.38213
viewed from afar , the cdc looks like a rather stalwart political pyramid its elected directorate fans out into an array of district leaders and standing committees , and thence into its component clubs and affiliated groups -- 500 or so .	159.49338
much of its strength stems from the comfortable knowledge that every `` volunteer ' ' democratic organization of any consequence belongs to the aj .	108.13399
moreover , the entire state democratic hierarchy , from gov . brown on down to the county chairmen , also participates in this huge operation .	142.6618
contrarily , republican `` volunteers ' ' go their separate ways , and thus far have given no indication that they ' d be willing to join forces under a single directorate , except in the most loose-knit fashion .	78.66473
carvey believes that reapportionment , which left many democratic clubs split by these new district boundaries , actually will increase cdc membership .	322.32745
where only one club existed before , he says , two will flourish henceforth .	131.54102
biggest organizational problem , he adds , is setting up cdc units in rock-ribbed democratic territory .	132.43257
paradoxically the council is weakest in areas that register 4- and 5-to-1 in the party ' s favor , strongest where democrats and republicans compete on a fairly even basis .	153.82906
like most democratic spokesmen , carvey predicts 1962 will be a tremendously `` partisan year ' ' .	41.030304
hence the attention they ' re lavishing on the aj .	38.55976
in all probability , the council will screen and endorse candidates for the assembly and for congress , and then strive to put its full weight behind these pre-primary favorites .	65.15296
this bodes heated contests in several districts where claims have already been staked out by democratic hopefuls who don ' t see eye-to-eye with the aj .	68.13103
naturally , the statewide races will provide the major test for the expanding council .	88.050835
shunted aside by the rampant organizers for john f . kennedy last year , who relegated it to a somewhat subordinate role in the presidential campaign , the cdc plainly intends to provide the party ' s campaign muscle in 1962 .	45.108707
there is evidence that it will be happily received by gov . brown and the other constitutional incumbents .	30.862286

aug . 4 , 1821 , nearly a century after benjamin franklin founded the pennsylvania gazette -- a century during which it had undergone several changes in ownership and a few brief suspensions in publication -- this paper made its first appearance as the saturday evening post .	100.124535
the country was now full of gazettes and samuel c . atkinson and charles alexander , who had just taken over franklin ' s old paper , desired a more distinctive name .	90.94443
when founded by franklin the gazette was a weekly family newspaper and under its new name its format remained that of a newspaper but its columns gradually contained more and more fiction , poetry , and literary essays .	180.41978
in the middle of the century , with a circulation of 90 , 000 , the post was one of the most popular weeklies in the country .	21.609684
but during the second half of the century its fortunes reached a low point and when in 1897 cyrus h . k . curtis purchased it -- `` paper , type , and all ' ' -- for $1 , 000 it was a 16-page weekly filled with unsigned fiction and initialed miscellany , and with only some 2 , 000 subscribers .	82.72778
little more than a fine old name , valuable principally because of the franklin tradition , the saturday evening post was slow to revive .	102.94657
but curtis poured over $1 million into it and in time it again became one of the most popular weeklies of the country .	30.259481

the 350th anniversary of the king james bible is being celebrated simultaneously with the publishing today of the new testament , the first part of the new english bible , undertaken as a new translation of the scriptures into contemporary english .	36.356293
since it was issued in the spring of 1611 , the king james version has been most generally considered the most poetic and beautiful of all translations of the bible .	48.61348
however , biblical scholars frequently attested to its numerous inaccuracies , as old manuscripts were uncovered and scholarship advanced .	87.01422
this resulted in revisions of the king james bible in 1881-85 as the english revised version and in 1901 as the american standard version .	47.637833
then in 1937 america ' s international council of religious education authorized a new revision , in the light of expanded knowledge of ancient manuscripts and languages .	48.89366
undertaken by 32 american scholars , under the chairmanship of rev . dr . luther a . weigle , former dean of yale university divinity school , their studies resulted in the publishing of the revised standard version , 1946-52 .	35.937325
the new english bible ( the old testament and apocrypha will be published at a future date ) has not been planned to rival or replace the king james version , but , as its cover states , it is offered `` simply as the bible to all those who will use it in reading , teaching , or worship ' ' .	70.81881
time , of course will testify whether the new version will have achieved its purpose .	94.83548
bible reading , even more so than good classical music , grows in depth and meaning upon repetition .	158.31409
if this new bible does not increase in significance by repeated readings throughout the years , it will not survive the ages as has the king james version .	143.63353
however , an initial perusal and comparison of some of the famous passages with the same parts of other versions seems to speak well of the efforts of the british biblical scholars .	71.02815
one is impressed with the dignity , clarity and beauty of this new translation into contemporary english , and there is no doubt that the meaning of the bible is more easily understandable to the general reader in contemporary language in the frequently archaic words and phrases of the king james .	34.221165
for example , in the third chapter of matthew , verses 13-16 , describing the baptism of jesus , the 1611 version reads	46.92042
`` then cometh jesus from galilee to jordan unto john , to be baptized of him .	64.41995
`` but john forbad him , saying , i have need to be baptized of thee , and comest thou to me ? ?	50.361065
`` and jesus answering said unto him , suffer it to be so now for thus it becometh us to fulfill all righteousness .	170.44156
`` and jesus , when he was baptized went up straightway out of the water and lo , the heavens were opened unto him , and he saw the spirit of god descending like a dove , and lighting upon him ' ' .	57.491665
certainly , the meaning is clearer to one who is not familiar with biblical teachings , in the new english bible which reads `` then jesus arrived at jordan from galilee , and he came to john to be baptized by him .	41.41555
' do you come to me ' ? ?	1.0854913
' i need rather to be baptized by you .	30.674088
jesus replied , ' let it be so for the present	68.822105
we do well to conform this way with all that god requires .	169.86646
after baptism jesus came up out of the water at once , and at that moment heaven opened	162.57411
he saw the spirit of god descending like a dove to alight upon him ' '	28.544153
( the paragraphing , spelling and punctuation are reproduced as printed in each version .	75.27082
among the most frequently quoted biblical sentences are the beatitudes and yet so few persons , other than scholars , really understand the true meaning of these eight blessings uttered by jesus at the beginning of the sermon on the mount .	86.75429
to illustrate , the first blessing in the king james bible reads `` blessed are the poor in spirit	121.41308
for their ' s is the kingdom of heaven ' ' .	6.2360735
the new version states `` how blest are those who know that they are poor	33.57742
the kingdom of heaven is theirs ' ' .	1.7766533
some of the poetic cadence of the older version certainly is lost in the newer one , but almost anyone , with a fair knowledge of the english language , can understand the meaning , without the necessity of interpretation by a biblical scholar .	91.22853
in the second and third chapters of revelation the new version retains , however , the old phrase `` angel of the church ' ' which biblical scholars have previously interpreted as meaning bishop .	65.12631
for the most part , however , the new version is contemporary and , as such , should be the means for many to attain a clearer comprehension of the meaning of those words recorded so many hundreds of years ago by the first followers of christ .	70.001396
originally recorded by hand , these words have been copied and recopied , translated and retranslated through the ages .	54.640106
discoveries recently made of old biblical manuscripts in hebrew and greek and other ancient writings , some by the early church fathers , in themselves called for a restudy of the bible .	67.09891
to have the results recorded in everyday usable english should be of benefit to all who seek the truth .	138.08063
with contemporary english changing with the rapidity that marks this jet age , some of the words and phrases of the new version may themselves soon become archaic .	164.74467
the new testament offered to the public today is the first result of the work of a joint committee made up of representatives of the church of england , church of scotland , methodist church , congregational union , baptist union , presbyterian church of england , churches in wales , churches in ireland , society of friends , british and foreign bible society and national society of scotland .	52.93548
prof . c . h . dodd , 76 , a congregational minister and a leading authority on the new testament , is general director of the project and chairman of the new testament panel .	38.200577

the brush moves up and down and is small enough to clean every dental surface , including the back of the teeth .	90.65378
in addition , the motor has the seal of approval of the underwriters laboratories , which means it is safe .	64.16705
the unit consists of a small motor that goes on as soon as it is plugged in .	87.38957
the speed is controlled by pressing on the two brake buttons located where the index finger and thumb are placed when holding the motor .	143.68025
the brushes can be cleaned and sterilized by boiling and are detachable so that every member of the family can have his own .	63.527115
most of us brush our teeth by hand .	5.0090446
the same can be said of shaving yet the electric razor has proved useful to many men .	53.58755
the electric toothbrush moves in a vertical direction , the way dentists recommend .	86.39559
in addition , it is small enough to get into crevices , jacket and crown margins , malposed anteriors , and the back teeth .	33.07602
the bristles are soft enough to massage the gums and not scratch the enamel .	230.73424
it is conceivable that broxodent could do a better job than ordinary brushing , especially in those who do not brush their teeth properly .	78.098495
several dentists and patients with special dental problems have experimented with the device .	64.335075
the results were good although they are difficult to compare with hand brushing , particularly when the individual knows how to brush his teeth properly .	90.7324
the electric gadget is most helpful when there are many crowned teeth and in individuals who are elderly , bedfast with a chronic disease , or are handicapped by disorders such as cerebral palsy or muscular dystrophy .	66.29473
but for many of us , it will prove an enjoyable luxury .	237.44678
it is not as convenient as the old type toothbrush and the paste tends to shimmy off the bristles .	36.900078
since the apparatus is new , it requires experimentation and changes in technique .	161.34798
writes does numbness in the left hand at night , which awakens the person , indicate brain tumor ? ?	154.08107
this is a common symptom and the cause usually is pressure on the nerve leading to the affected hand .	190.60999
the pressure may come from muscles , tendons , or bones anywhere from the neck to the hand .	49.934826
writes do steam baths have any health value ? ?	4.8384223
no , other than cleaning out the pores and making the sweat glands work harder .	58.09131
an ordinary hot bath or shower will do the same .	32.517296
writes what makes my hands numb when sewing ? ?	20.983385
there are many possibilities , including poor circulation , a variety of neurological conditions , and functional disorders .	31.916286
this manifestation may be an early sign of multiple sclerosis or the beginning of sewer ' s cramp .	57.923656
writes does a brace help in sciatica ? ?	1.040183
a back brace might help , depending upon the cause of sciatica .	28.42477
writes does the cholesterol go down when most of the thyroid gland is removed ? ?	21.772083
the cholesterol level in the blood is influenced by the glands of the body .	10.403158
it is low when the thyroid is overactive and high when the gland is sluggish .	59.58951
the latter is likely to occur when the thyroid is removed .	33.11701
the gap between the bookshelf and the record cabinet grows smaller with each new recording catalogue .	268.28674
there ' s more reading and instruction to be heard on discs than ever before , although the spoken rather than the sung word is as old as thomas alva edison ' s first experiment in recorded sound .	100.3531
edison could hardly have guessed , however , that sophocles would one day appear in stereo .	230.02194
if the record buyer ' s tastes are somewhat eclectic or even the slightest bit esoteric , he will find them satisfied on educational records .	82.79412
and he will avoid eye-strain in the process .	12.909732
everything from poetry to phonetics , history to histrionics , philosophy to party games has been adapted to the turntable .	162.86206
for sheer ambition , take the decca series titled modestly `` wisdom ' ' .	20.12862
volumes one and two , selected from the sound tracks of a television series , contain `` conversations with the elder wise men of our day ' ' .	72.9943
these sages include poet carl sandburg , statesman jawaharlal nehru and sculptor jacques lipchitz , in volume one , and playwright sean o ' casey , david ben-gurion , philosopher bertrand russell and the late frank lloyd wright in the second set .	33.67211
hugh downs is heard interviewing wright , for an added prestige fillip .	46.97469
there ' s more specialization and a narrower purpose in two albums recently issued by dover publications .	85.88827

previous presentations have been on french , spanish , russian , italian , german and japanese .	21.204218
but the firm has recognized the tight dollar and the tourist ' s desire to visit the `` smaller , less-traveled and relatively inexpensive countries ' ' , and is now prepared to teach modern greek and portuguese through recordings .	53.352394
the respective vocabularies `` essential for travel ' ' are available in separate albums .	23.541569
thanks to spoken arts records , history buffs may hear lincoln ' s `` most memorable speeches and letters ' ' in a two-disc set , interpreted by lincoln authority and lecturer roy p . basler .	64.73937
as a contemporary bonus , the set includes carl sandburg ' s address at a joint session of congress , delivered on lincoln ' s birthday two years ago .	28.41099
for those who `` like poetry but never get around to reading it ' ' , the library of congress makes it possible for poets to be heard reading their own work .	74.0287
the program was instituted in 1940 , and releases are available only from the recording laboratory of the library of congress , washington 25 , d . c . .	33.87519
newest on the list are john ciardi , w . d . snodgrass , i . a . richards , oscar williams , robert hillyer , john hall wheelock , stephen vincent benet , edwin muir , john peal bishop and maxwell bodenheim .	39.638508
two poets are paired on each record , in the order given above .	75.00555

howard mitchell and the national symphony perform in the first two releases , designed for grades one and two .	104.612816
in an effort to fortify himself against the unforseen upsets sure to arise in the future , herbert a . leggett , banker-editor of the phoenix `` arizona progress ' ' , reflects upon a few of the depressing experiences of the feverish fifties .	66.96909
one of the roughest was the tv quiz shows , which gave him inferiority complexes .	82.78252
though it was a great relief when the big brains on these shows turned out to be frauds and phonies , it did irreparable damage to the ego of the editor and many another intelligent , well-informed american .	93.94508
but the one that upset the financially wise was the professional dancer who related in a book how he parlayed his earnings into a $2 , 000 , 000 profit on the stock market .	52.896317
every man who dabbles in the market to make a little easy money on the side and suffers losses could at the time hardly face his wife who was wondering how her husband could be so dumb .	141.10548
investors breathed more freely when it was learned that this acrobatic dancer had turned magician and was only doing a best seller book to make some dough .	160.49493
people who take us for suckers are like the westerner who had on exhibit his superior marksmanship in the form of a number of bull ' s-eye achievements .	59.457584
the promoter who wanted to sign him up for the circus asked him how he was able to do it .	38.679413
he just shot at the board and then drew circles around the holes to form a bull ' s-eye .	47.322914
one of the obstacles to the easy control of a 2-year-old child is a lack of verbal communication .	41.613625
if his mother loves him , he clings to that love as a ballast .	64.79345
he wants mommy to think him a good boy .	68.73329
he doesn ' t want her to look frowningly at him , or speak to him angrily .	76.10589
he wants to be called sweet , good , considerate and mother ' s little helper .	35.140106
but even mother ' s loving attitude will not always prevent misbehavior .	156.0696
his desires are so strong that he needs constant reassurance of his mother ' s love for him and what she expects of him , in order to overcome them .	51.683777
his own inner voice , which should tell him what not to do , has not developed .	60.15071
it won ' t develop until he has words with which to clothe it .	225.33652
what can a mother do then to prevent misbehavior ? ?	13.397702
the fewer nos she has to utter the more effective they will be .	118.75442
she should offer substitutes for the temptations which seem overwhelmingly desirable to the child .	106.69984
if he can ' t play with mommy ' s magazines , he should have some old numbers of his own .	70.16651
if daddy ' s books are out of bounds his own picture books are not .	122.084885
toys he has can be made to act as substitutes for family temptations such as refrigerator and gas stove .	56.717216
during this precarious period of development the mother should continue to influence the growth of the child ' s conscience .	33.19352
she tells him of the consequences of his behavior .	60.751484
if he bites a playmate she says , `` danny won ' t like you ' ' .	22.904074
if he snatches a toy , she says , `` caroline wants her own truck just as you do ' ' .	34.504795
there is no use trying to `` explain ' ' to a 2-year-old .	12.428973
remove the child from the scene of his misbehavior .	37.740055
substitute approved objects for forbidden ones and keep telling him how he is to act .	68.7156
he won ' t submit to his natural desires all the time , and it ' s mother ' s love that is responsible for his good behavior .	43.98326
this is the period during the melancholy days of autumn when universities and colleges schedule what they call `` homecoming day ' ' .	130.14323
they seek thereby to lure the old grad back to the old scenes .	43.54527
the football opponent on homecoming is , of course , selected with the view that said opponent will have little more chance than did a christian when thrown to one of the emperor ' s lions .	89.19756
it is true , of course , the uncertainties of life being what they are , that as now and then the christian killed the lion , homecoming days have been ruined by a visiting team .	171.63875
even with all possible precaution , homecomings are usually rather cruel and sad , and only the perpetually ebullient and the continually optimistic are made happy by them .	119.37314
more often than not , as the old grad wanders along the old paths , his memory of happy days when he strolled one of the paths with a coed beside him becomes an ache and a pain .	86.48962
he can smell again the perfume she wore and recall the lilting sound of laughter , and can smell again the aroma of autumn -- fallen leaves , the wine of cool air , and the nostalgia of woodsmoke which blows through all the winds of fall .	101.489815
it is at precisely such moments that he encounters a couple of undergraduates , faces alight , holding hands and talking happily as they come along , oblivious of him , or throwing him the most fleeting and casual of glances , such as they would give a tethered goat .	131.634
usually , they titter loudly after they have passed by .	162.1164
he feels , suddenly , the weight of the fat that is on him .	43.26203
his bridgework or his plates feel loose and monstrous .	148.60634
his legs suddenly feel heavy and unaccountably weary , as if he had walked for miles , instead of strolling a few hundred yards along the old campus paths .	56.74102
bitterness comes over him and the taste of time is like unripe persimmons in his mouth .	83.15332
it is not much better if he meets with old classmates .	31.087912
too often , unless he hails them , they pass him by .	471.513
he recalls with a wry smile the wit who said , on returning from a homecoming reunion , that he would never go again because all his class had changed so much they didn ' t even recognize him .	59.91643
if they do meet and recognize one another , slap backs and embrace , the moment soon is done .	123.761696
after all , when one has asked whatever became of old joe and charlie when one has inquired who it was sue brown married and where it is they now live when questions are asked and answered about families and children , and old professors when the game and its probable outcome has been exhausted that does it .	185.5123
by then one begins to notice the middle-age spread	302.076
the gray hairs , the eyeglasses , bodies that are too thin or too heavy	118.05066
the athlete of by-gone years who wears a size 46 suit and puffs when he has finished a sentence of any length then , it is time to break it up and move on .	92.65903
it is , if anything , worse on the old player	156.51675
he sits in the stands and he doesn ' t like that .	14.462646
enough of his life was spent there on the field for him never to like watching the game as a spectator in the crowd .	64.6942
on a team a man feels he is a part of it and akin to the men next to him .	101.760254
in the stands he is lonely and lost , no matter how many are about him .	43.52175
he sits there remembering the tense moment before the ball was snapped	48.701252
the churning of straining feet , the rasp of the canvas pants	19.351934
the smell and feel of hot , wet woolen sleeves across his face .	27.59773
and so , he squirms with each play , remembering his youth .	88.42986
no matter how often a man goes back to the scenes of his youth and strength , they can never be recaptured again .	57.18646
since the obvious is not always true , the republican national committee wisely analyzed its defeat of last autumn and finds that it occurred , as suspected , in the larger cities .	107.33556
of 40 cities with populations of 300 , 000 and more , mr . kennedy carried 26 and mr . nixon 14 .	41.26896
there are eight states in which the largest urban vote can be the balance of power in any close election .	91.16995
these are new york , pennsylvania , michigan , maryland , missouri , new jersey , illinois and minnesota .	16.902967
in 1952 mr . eisenhower won all but missouri .	247.74776
yet , in 1960 all eight gave majorities to mr . kennedy .	21.808691

yet , the gop breakdown discovered that in philadelphia mr . nixon received but 21 per cent of the so-called `` polish ' ' vote	61.36352
30 per cent of the `` irish ' ' vote , and 18 per cent of the `` negro ' ' vote .	17.284372
a gop `` task force ' committee will seek to find out how its party may win support from the ethnic and minority groups in cities .	114.2652
the task force might make a start in washington with republican congressional leaders .	80.438095
these gentlemen already have done the party harm by their seeming reluctance to vote aid for the depressed areas and by their criticism of mr . kennedy for talking about a recession and unemployment .	80.25898
this error was compounded by declaring the recession to be `` a statistical one ' ' , and not a reality .	37.242435
the almost six million persons without jobs and the two million working part-time do not consider themselves and their plight as statistical .	232.93555
they did not view the tour of the distressed cities and towns by secretary of labor goldberg as politics , which the gop declared it to be .	131.41368
the people visited were glad to have a government with heart enough to take an interest in their misery .	134.83827

the present republican leadership as practiced by mundt , goldwater , bridges , dirksen , et al , is repeating the errors of the party leadership of the 1930s .	50.128723
in that decade the partisan zeal to defend mr . hoover , and the party ' s failure to anticipate or cope with the depression , caused a great majority of americans to see the republican party as cold and lacking in any sympathy for the problems of human beings caught up in the distress and suffering brought on by the economic crash .	66.15622
the republican party was not lacking in humanity , but it permitted its extremely partisan leadership to make it appear devoid of any consideration for people in trouble .	108.47431

one may be sure the present republican congressional leadership hasn ' t meant to repeat this error .	25.670483

the providence journal editorial ( jan . 25 ) entitled `` east greenwich faces a housing development problem ' ' points to a dilemma that faces communities such as ours .	132.2647
your suggested solution , it seems to me , is grossly oversimplified and is inconsistent with your generally realistic attitude toward , and endorsement of , sound planning .	115.953255
first of all there is ample area in east greenwich already zoned in the classification similar to that which petitioner requested .	104.081276
this land is in various stages of development in several locations throughout the town .	40.042942
the demand for these lots can be met for some time to come .	24.648804
this would seem to indicate that we are trying neither `` to halt an influx of migrants ' ' nor are we `` setting up such standards for development that only the well-to-do could afford to buy land and build in the new sites ' ' .	132.01347
what we are attempting to do is achieve and maintain a balance between medium density and low density residential areas and industrial and commercial development .	43.178978
it is in fact entirely consistent with your suggestion of modest industrial development to help pay governmental costs .	120.44003
bostitch , inc . is approximately half way through a 10-year exemption of their real estate tax .	70.517456
the wisdom of granting such tax exemptions is another matter , but this particular instance is , in my opinion , completely satisfactory .	91.39094
the 1960 tax book for east greenwich indicates a valuation for this property in excess of two million dollars .	47.520218
with our current $3 per hundred tax rate , it is safe to assume that this will qualify when you suggest a community should `` try to develop a modest industrial plant ' ' as the best way to meet these problems .	56.329884
in order to attract additional industry that is compatible with this community it is all the more important to present to the industrial prospect an orderly balance in the tax structure .	103.04936
as this tax base grows so then can your medium and low density residential areas grow .	145.30986
mr . richard preston , executive director of the new hampshire state planning and development commission , in his remarks to the governors conference on industrial development at providence on october 8 , 1960 , warned against the fallacy of attempting to attract industry solely to reduce the tax rate or to underwrite municipal services such as schools when he said `` if this is the fundamental reason for a community ' s interest or if this is the basic approach , success if any will be difficult to obtain ' ' .	58.05478
he went on to say `` in the first place , industry per se is not dedicated to the role of savior of foundering municipalities .	92.962265
it is not in business for the purpose of absorbing increased municipal costs no matter how high a purpose that may be ' ' .	91.31374
while councilman olson cited the anticipated increase in school costs in answer to a direct question from a taxpayer , the impact upon a school system does not have to be measured only in increased taxes to find alarm in uncontrolled growth .	122.06888
we in east greenwich have the example of two neighboring communities , one currently utilizing double sessions in their schools , and the other facing this prospect next year .	109.55815
it has already been reported in your newspapers that the east greenwich school committee is considering additions to at least one elementary school and to the high school to insure future accommodations for a school population that we know will increase .	77.15071
if they are to be commended for foresight in their planning , what then is the judgment of a town council that compounds this problem during the planning stage ? ?	193.4579
where then is the sound planning and cooperation between agencies within the community that you have called for in other editorials ? ?	112.64784
i submit that it cannot be dismissed simply by saying we are not facing the facts of life .	32.124104
the `` fruitful course ' ' of metropolitanization that you recommend is currently practiced by the town of east greenwich and had its inception long before we learned what it was called .	98.41407
the east greenwich police department utilizes the radio transmission facilities of the warwick police department , thereby eliminating duplication of facilities and ensuring police coordination in the cowessett-east greenwich-potowomut area of the two communities .	60.537663
the east greenwich fire district services parts of warwick as well as east greenwich .	24.355911
the taxpayers of east greenwich appropriate sums of money , as do other kent county communities , for the support of the kent county memorial hospital , a regional facility .	58.126244
the east greenwich free library receives financial support from the town of east greenwich and the city of warwick to supplement its endowment .	35.061806
feelers were put out last year to the city of warwick , as reported in your newspapers , suggesting investigation of a common rubbish disposal area to service the potowomut and cowessett areas of warwick along with east greenwich .	85.59868
east greenwich was one of the first rhode island towns to enter into contract agreement with the rhode island development council for planning services we could not provide for ourselves .	90.49497
the education program for retarded children conducted by the east greenwich school system has pupils from at least one neighboring community .	93.27357
i feel compelled to write this because i am greatly concerned with the problem of community growth rate and the relation between types of growth in a town such as east greenwich .	75.110016
i believe it is an area in which professional planners have failed to set adequate guide posts	239.19638
and yet they cannot ignore this problem because it concerns the implementation of nearly all the planning programs they have devised .	106.619125
these programs are volumes of waste paper and lost hours if the citizens of a community must stand aside while land developers tell them when , where , and in what manner the community shall grow .	254.03456
we have far less to fear in the migrant family than we have in the migrant developer under these conditions .	53.757374
until professional planners meet this situation squarely and update the concepts of zoning in a manner acceptable to the courts , i hope we in east greenwich can continue to shape our own destiny .	69.44803
i would like very much , on behalf of my husband and myself , to send our eternal thanks to all the wonderful people responsible for the gabrielle fund .	108.83414

i am a sophomore at mount pleasant high school .	3.622628
my future plans are to become a language teacher .	251.95503
of course , having this desire , i am very interested in education .	33.898136

the providence sunday journal article ( jan . 29 ) asking whether american taxpayers are being victimized by a gigantic giveaway to pay for the care of war veterans who have non-service-connected disabilities sounds as though the providence journal is desperate for news .	105.25328
usually a veteran has to hang himself to get space on the front page .	147.35605
on the question of admission to veterans administration hospitals of service-connected and non-service-connected disabled veterans , it must be recognized that there are many men who are greatly affected by war service .	41.47985
it can manifest itself before discharge from service , or it can come out years later .	66.1514
there is one other point we should never lose sight of many veterans who enter va hospitals as non-service cases later qualify as service-connected .	269.9085
no psychiatrist could tell me that the experience in a war can not have its effect in the ensuing years .	44.87663
the arguments advanced by those individuals and groups who oppose the system in force and who would drastically curtail or do away entirely with hospital care for the non-service-connected case , seem to be coldly impractical and out-of-step with the wishes of the general public .	106.14944
i believe in priority for service-connected disabled veterans in admission to va hospitals .	61.60863
but i don ' t believe we should close the door on non-service-connected patients .	392.13788
this matter is of great importance , and the outcome may mean the difference between life or death , or at least serious injuries , for many veterans .	54.309258
some critics say that the length of stay in a hospital is too long .	54.524235
there ' s a reason for this length of stay .	77.93117
first of all , the admitting physician in the va hospital gets the patient as a new patient .	60.154842
he has no experience with this veteran ' s previous medical record .	77.38995
if the doctor is conscientious , he wants to study the patient .	36.397385
as a result , it takes a little longer than it would on the outside where the family physician knows about the patient .	55.77805
secondly , the va physician knows that when the patient leaves the hospital , he is no longer going to have a chance to visit his patient .	46.78686
so he keeps the veteran in until he can observe the effects of treatment or surgery .	70.20219
the american public must be presented with the facts concerning va hospitalization .	99.705185
the public should understand that whether they support a state hospital or a va hospital , the tax dollar has to be paid one way or the other .	54.452938
the responsibility is still going to be there whether they pay for a va hospital or the tax dollar is spent for the state hospital .	38.567463
an adequate system of va hospitals is better equipped to care for the veterans than any 50 state hospitals .	83.85471
it seems that open season upon veterans ' hospitalization is once more upon us .	155.66905
the american medical association is once again grinding out its tear-soaked propaganda based upon the high cost of the veterans administration medical program to the american taxpayer .	86.4307
do they , the a . m . a . , offer any solution other than outright abolition of a medical system unsurpassed anywhere in the world ? ?	98.23886
we veterans acknowledge the fact that as time passes the demand for medical care at va hospitals will grow proportionately as age fosters illness .	174.70491
nevertheless , we wonder at the stand of the a . m . a . on the health problem confronting the aged .	49.287537
they opposed the forand bill , which would have placed the major burden of financial support upon the individual himself through compulsory payroll deduction	164.41437
yet they supported the eisenhower administration which will cost a small state like ours approximately five million dollars ( matched incidentally by a federal grant ) to initiate .	130.27257
-- no doubt there have been moments during every presidency when the man in the white house has had feelings of frustration , exasperation , exhaustion , and even panic .	48.20463
but no president ever before referred to his as a `` lousy job ' ' ( as walter trohan recently quoted president kennedy as doing in conversation with sen . barry goldwater ) .	64.58506
during his aggressive campaign to win his present position , mr . kennedy was vitriolic about this country ' s `` prestige ' ' abroad .	32.07582
what does he think a remark like this `` lousy ' ' one does to our prestige and morale ? ?	58.0676
if the president of the united states really feels he won himself a `` lousy job ' ' , then heaven help us all .	69.38629
-- defense secretary robert s . mcnamara has asked congress for authority and funds to build fallout shelters costing about 200 million dollars .	75.4998
why should congress even consider allowing such a sum for that which can give no protection ? ?	85.930916
top scientists have warned that an area hit by an atomic missile of massive power would be engulfed in a suffocating fire storm which would persist for a long time .	55.320633
the scientists have also warned that no life above ground or underground , sheltered or unsheltered could be expected to survive in an area at least 50 miles in diameter .	50.306618
this sum spent for foreign economic aid , the peace corps , food for peace , or any other program to solve the problems of the underdeveloped countries would be an investment that would pay off in world peace , increased world trade , and prosperity for every country on the globe .	68.31095
let us prepare for peace , instead of for a war which would mean the end of civilization .	68.46904
-- it seems college isn ' t what it should be .	26.193068
i refer to the attire worn by the students .	144.01237
upon a visit to a local junior college last week , i was shocked to see the young ladies wearing short shorts and the young men wearing bermuda shorts .	42.247253
is this what our children are to come face to face with when they are ready for college in a few years ? ?	56.733284
education should be uppermost in their minds , but with this attire how can anyone think it is so ? ?	100.840996
it looks more like they are going to play at the beach instead of taking lessons on bettering themselves .	139.44473
high school students have more sense of the way to dress than college students .	111.846176
many high school students go past my house every day , and they look like perfect ladies and gentlemen .	80.295845
no matter how hot the day , they are dressed properly and not in shorts .	108.98334
-- the granting of the jan masaryk award august 13 to senator paul douglas is a bitter example of misleading minorities .	142.39249
douglas has consistently voted to aid the people who killed masaryk , and against principles masaryk died to uphold .	141.08173
douglas has voted for aid to communists and for the destruction of individual freedom ( public housing , foreign aid , etc . ) .	46.21639
-- in today ' s `` voice ' ' , the cta is urged to reduce fares for senior citizens .	50.424763
rising costs have increased the difficulties of the elderly , and i would be the last to say they should not receive consideration .	91.082306
but why is it the special responsibility of the cta to help these people ? ?	87.83307
why should cta regular riders subsidize reduced transportation for old people any more than the people who drive their own cars or walk to work should ? ?	113.40209
the welfare of citizens , old and young , is the responsibility of the community , not only of that part of it that rides the aj .	61.508827
cta regulars already subsidize transportation for school children , policemen , and firemen .	36.061756
-- in reply to a letter in today ' s `` voice ' ' urging the sale of meat after 6 p . m . , i wish to state the other side of the story .	39.07682
i am the wife of the owner of a small , independent meat market .	246.02557
my husband ' s hours away from home for the past years have been from 7 a . m . to 7 p . m . the early part of the week , and as late as 8 or 9 on week-ends .	45.753605
now he is apparently expected to give up his evenings -- and sundays , too , for this is coming .	105.486015
there is a trend to packaging meat at a central source , freezing it , and shipping it to outlying stores , where meat cutters will not be required .	72.001686
if a customer wishes a special cut , it will not be available .	17.440546
we are slowly being regimented to having everything packaged , whether we want it or not .	138.28998
most women , in this age of freezers , shop for the entire week on week-ends , when prices are lower .	125.03661
also , many working wives have children or husbands who take over the shopping chores for them .	100.95935
and my husband hasn ' t had a vacation in 14 years .	170.64243
but if we closed the store for a vacation , we would lose our customers to the chain stores in the next block .	52.11273
the meat cutters ' union , which has a history of being one of the fairest and least corrupt in our area , represents the little corner markets as well as the large supermarkets .	99.57173
what it is trying to do is to protect the little man , too , as well as trying to maintain a flow of fresh meat to all stores , with choice of cut being made by the consumer , not the store .	92.6668
-- i , too , congratulate the american legion , of which i am proud to have been a member for more than 40 years , on the recent state convention .	46.23678
i regret that bertha madeira ( today ' s `` voice ' ' ) obtained incorrect information .	34.94363
had i been granted the floor on a point of personal privilege , the matter she raised would have been clarified .	128.38162
the resolution under discussion at the convention was to require the boards of election to instruct judges to properly display the american flag .	156.75471
judges under the jurisdiction of the chicago board of election commissioners are instructed to do this .	41.952602
the resolution further asked that polling place proprietors affix an attachment to their premises for the display of the flag .	44.762215
it was my desire to advise the membership of the legion that the majority of polling places are on private property and , without an amendment to the law , we could not enforce this .	61.729282
my discussion with reference to the resolution was that we should commend those citizens who serve as judges of election and who properly discharge their duty and polling place proprietors who make available their private premises , and not by innuendo criticize them .	121.217674
at no time did i attempt to seek approval or commendation for the members of the chicago board of election commissioners for the discharge of their duties .	57.569107
-- the illinois commission for handicapped children wishes to commend the recent announcement by the catholic charities of the archdiocese of chicago and depaul university of the establishment of the institute for special education at the university for the training of teachers for physically handicapped and mentally retarded children .	34.26587
in these days of serious shortage of properly trained teachers qualified to teach physically handicapped and mentally handicapped children , the establishment of such an institute will be a major contribution to the field .	37.543774
the illinois commission for handicapped children , which for 20 years has had the responsibility of coordinating the services of tax supported and voluntary organizations serving handicapped children , of studying the needs of handicapped children in illinois , and of promoting more adequate services for them , indeed welcomes this new important resource which will help the people of illinois toward the goal of providing an education for all of its children .	84.83431

my son , who has completed two years in engineering school , has a summer job on a construction project as an unskilled laborer .	97.04833
at a rate of $3 . 22 an hour he is now earning approximately $580 a month .	43.79468
ironic , is it not , that after completing years of costly scientific training he will receive a cut in pay from what he is receiving as an ordinary unskilled laborer ? ?	87.206665
( editorial comment on this letter appears elsewhere on this page ) .	63.926098
-- your july 26 editorial regarding the position of attorney general robert f . kennedy on prospective tax relief for dupont stockholders is based on an erroneous statement of fact .	48.234188
as a result , your criticism of attorney general robert f . kennedy and the department of justice was inaccurate , unwarranted and unfair .	13.823178
the editorial concerned legislative proposals to ease the tax burden on dupont stockholders , in connection with the united states supreme court ruling that dupont must divest itself of its extensive general motors stock holdings .	45.782215
these proposals would reduce the amount of tax that dupont stockholders might have to pay -- from an estimated 1 . 1 billion dollars under present law to as little as 192 million dollars .	55.00239
congressman wilbur d . mills , chairman of the house ways and means committee , asked the department of justice for its views on these legislative proposals as they related to anti-trust law enforcement .	88.84012
the attorney general responded by letter dated july 19 .	9.136465
copies of this letter were made avaliable to the press and public .	80.640755
in this letter , mr . kennedy made it clear that he limited his comment only to one consideration -- what effect the legislative proposals might have on future anti-trust judgments .	150.72446
there are a number of other considerations besides this one but it is for the congress , not the department of justice , to balance these various considerations and make a judgment about legislation .	81.49948
yet your editorial said `` now the attorney general writes that no considerations ' justify any loss of revenue of this proportion ' ' ' .	70.90065
what mr . kennedy , in fact , wrote was `` it is the department ' s view that no anti-trust enforcement considerations justify any loss of revenue of this proportion ' ' .	51.01439
the editorial , by omitting the words anti-trust enforcement , totally distorted mr . kennedy ' s views .	38.54497
the headline is offensive , particularly in view of the total inaccuracy of the editorial .	30.69572
-- i concur most heartily with today ' s letter on the futility of writing to sen . dirksen and sen . douglas .	51.567226
but when you write to congresswoman church , bless her heart , your letter is answered fully and completely .	140.27388
should she disagree , she explains why in detail .	44.079277
when she agrees , you can rest assured her position will remain unchanged .	85.67753
i think we have the hardest working , best representative in congress .	224.03264

those in the public eye should be good examples of american citizens while abroad .	147.02457
the plane should have started at the scheduled time and left sinatra and martin to guzzle .	235.1064
-- overt socialism means government ownership and management of a nation ' s main industries .	40.16311
in covert socialism -- toward which america is moving -- private enterprise retains the ownership title to industries but government thru direct intervention and excessive regulations actually controls them .	468.0865
in order to attract new industries , 15 states or more are issuing tax free bonds to build government owned plants which are leased to private enterprise .	167.75766
issuing bonds for plant construction has brought new industries to certain regions .	129.54124
sir -- we are writing in reference to a recent `` suggestion ' ' made to the staff of the public health nursing service of jersey city ( registered professional nurses with college background and varying experiences ) .	74.172195
the day before election day , to which we are entitled as a legal holiday , we were informed to report to our respective polls to work as `` workers of the party ' ' .	40.15557
being ethical and professional people interested in community health and well-being , we felt this wasn ' t a function of our position .	68.8945
as we understand , this directive was given to all city and county employes .	51.21664
to our knowledge no nurse in our agency has been employed because of political affiliation .	48.776737
we , therefore , considered the `` suggestion ' ' an insult to our intelligence , ethics , bill of rights , etc . .	38.533623
our only obligation for this day is to vote , free of persuasion , for the person we feel is capable in directing the public .	121.404625
this is our duty -- not as nurses or city employes -- but as citizens of the united states .	43.590683
sir -- i read of a man who felt he should not build a fallout shelter in his home because it would be selfish for him to sit secure while his neighbors had no shelters .	128.37439
does this man live in a neighborhood where all are free loaders unwilling to help themselves , but ready to demand that `` the community ' ' help and protect them ? ?	41.413944
community shelters are , of course , necessary for those having no space for shelter .	123.07427
if in a town of 2 , 000 private homes , half of them have shelters , the need for the community shelters will be reduced to that extent .	81.35108
in designing his home fallout shelter there is nothing to prevent a man from planning to shelter that home ' s occupants , `` plus-one ' ' -- so he will be able to take in a stranger .	85.31722
i hope the man who plans to sit on his hands until the emergency comes will have a change of heart , will get busy and be the first member of our `` plus-one ' ' shelter club .	97.69422
sir -- people continue to inquire the reason for the race for outer space .	54.944958
it ' s simple enough from my point of view .	9.001859
it is the only method left for a man to escape from a woman ' s world .	38.85514
sir -- when the colonies decided upon freedom from england , we insisted , through the declaration of independence , that the nations of the world recognize us as a separate political entity .	41.47727
it is high time the united states began to realize that the god-given rights of men set forth in that document are applicable today to katanga .	118.12026
in the united nations charter , the right of self-determination is also an essential principle .	34.192776

sir -- permit me to commend your editorial in which you stress the fact that a program of county colleges will substantially increase local tax burdens and that taxpayers have a right to a clear idea of what such a program would commit them to .	106.64155
the bill which passed the assembly last may and is now pending in the senate should be given careful scrutiny .	117.464836
the procedure for determining the amounts of money to be spent by county colleges and raised by taxation will certainly startle many taxpayers .	131.98541
under the proposal the members of the board of trustees of a county college will be appointed	46.57607
the trustees will prepare an annual budget for the college and submit it to the board of school estimate .	34.460243
this board will consist of two of the trustees of the college , and the director and two members of the board of freeholders .	18.0766
it will determine the amount of money to be spent by the college and will certify this amount to the board of freeholders , which `` shall appropriate in the same manner as other appropriations are made by it the amount so certified and the amount shall be assessed , levied and collected in the same manner as moneys appropriated for other purposes ' ' .	50.415474
the approval of only three members of the board of school estimate is required to certify the amount of money to be allotted to the college .	26.984602
since two of these could be trustees of the college , actually it would be necessary to have the consent of only one elected official to impose a levy of millions of dollars of tax revenue .	56.760475

then see what a boom in all trades , as well as slum clearance at no cost to taxpayers , will happen .	125.94381
our entire economy will have a terrific uplift .	9.886405

sir -- i hasten to join in praise of the men in the toll booths on the garden state parkway .	37.911037
recently i traveled the parkway from east orange to cape may and i found the most courteous group of men you will find anywhere .	94.11663
one even gave my little dog a biscuit .	9.042069
the viewers of the `` deep peep show ' ' at 15th and m streets nw have an added attraction -- the view of a fossilized cypress swamp .	73.327286
twenty feet below the street level in the excavation of the new motel to be constructed on this site , a black coal-like deposit has been encountered .	59.85809
this is a black swamp clay in which about one hundred million years ago cypress-like trees were growing .	136.21489
the fossilized remains of many of these trees are found embedded in the clay .	64.4481
some of the stumps are as much as three feet long , but most of them have been flattened by the pressure of the overlying sediments .	36.520123
although the wood has been changed to coal , much of it still retains its original cell structure .	252.51044
in the clay are entombed millions of pollen grains and spores which came from plants growing in the region at the time .	32.49941
these microfossils indicate the swamp was `` formed during the lower cretaceous period when dinosaurs were at their heyday and when the first flowering plants were just appearing .	59.042583
the 15th street deposit is not to be confused with the nearby famous mayflower hotel cypress swamp on 17th street reported in the washington post , august 2 , 1955 , which was probably formed during the second interglacial period and is therefore much younger .	122.30618
recently the secretary of the friends committee on national legislation was interviewed on the air .	260.02063
while i respect his sincere concern for peace , he made four points that i would like to question .	77.42549
he said , `` let ' s work for peace instead of protection from aggression ' ' .	146.15396
i would ask , `` why not do both ' ' ? ?	13.618789
war is the result of mistrust and lack of understanding between people .	72.08149
are we not late , especially those of us who call ourselves friends , in doing enough about this lack of understanding ? ?	118.74484
as to protection , the speaker disapproved of shelters , pointing out that fallout shelters would not save everyone .	168.40839
is this a reason for saving no one ? ?	17.754227
would the man with an empty life boat row away from a shipwreck because his boat could not pick up everyone ? ?	124.66684
the speaker suggested that the desolation of a post-attack world would be too awful to face .	88.067085
if the world comes to this , wouldn ' t it be the very time when courage and american know-how would be needed to help survivors rebuild ? ?	48.204987
many of our young people think it would .	226.61609
lastly , the speaker decried our organized program of emergency help calling it `` civilian defense ' ' .	71.71704
in 1950 , public law 920 created civil defense ( different from civilian-groups of world war 2 ) , a responsibility of the government at all levels to help reduce loss of life and property in disaster , natural or manmade .	57.616264
far from creating fear , as the speaker suggests , preparedness -- knowing what to do in an emergency -- gives people confidence .	94.28103
civil defense has far to go and many problems to solve , but is it not in the best spirit of our pioneer tradition to be not only willing , but prepared to care for our own families and help our neighbors in any disaster -- storm , flood , accident or even war ? ?	76.74052
it seems rather peculiar that residents of apartments are denied the right of providing themselves with the protection and companionship of dogs .	109.55042
i feel that few burglars would be prone to break and enter into someone ' s apartment if they were met with a good hardy growl that a dog would provide .	72.82353
in addition , would not the young female public of washington be afforded a greater degree of protection at night when they are on the streets if they were accompanied by a dog on a leash ? ?	91.630844
i grant that the dog may not be really protective , based on his training , but if you were roaming the streets looking for a purse to snatch or a young lady to molest , how quick would you be to attack a person strolling with a dog ? ?	124.370445
i would like to suggest that the landlords and commissioners get together and consider liberalizing the practice of prohibiting dogs in apartments .	103.01488
