significantly , the initiation and leadership of a major proportion of the reform movements , especially those in the first half of the nineteenth century , came from men and women of new england birth or parentage and from either trinitarian or unitarian congregationalism .	44.888306
several of the movements were given a marked impetus by revivalism .	20.877697
quakers , some from new england , had a larger share than their proportionate numerical strength would have warranted .	151.31856
we do well to remind ourselves that from men and women of new england ancestry also issued the church of jesus christ of latter day saints , the seventh day adventists , christian science , the american board of commissioners for foreign missions , the american home missionary society , the american bible society , and new england theology .	50.128136
the atmosphere was one of optimism , of confidence in human progress , and of a determination to rid the world of its ills .	70.60659
the hopkinsian universal disinterested benevolence , although holding to original sin and the doctrine of election , inspired its adherents to heroic endeavours for others , looked for the early coming of the millennium , and was paralleled by the confidence in man ' s ability cherished by the unitarians , emerson , and the transcendentalists .	67.845345
we should recall the number of movements for the service of mankind which arose from the kindred evangelicalism of the british isles and the pietism of the continent of europe -- among them prison reform , anti-slavery measures , legislation for the alleviation of conditions of labour , the inner mission , and the red cross .	61.681614
we cannot take the space to record all the efforts for the removal or alleviation of collective ills .	58.289616
a few of the more prominent must serve as examples of what a complete listing and description would disclose .	202.22145
several were born in the early decades and persisted throughout the century .	53.419373
some disappeared with the attainment of their purpose .	7.215812
still others sprang up late in the century to meet conditions which arose from fresh stages of the revolutionary age .	190.12688
the movement to end negro slavery began before 1815 and mounted after that year until , as a result of the civil war , emancipation was achieved .	53.38281
long before 1815 the christian conscience was leading some to declare slavery wrong and to act accordingly .	222.5499
for example , in 1693 the philadelphia yearly meeting of friends declared that its members should emancipate their slaves and in 1776 it determined to exclude from membership all who did not comply .	158.07503
in the latter year samuel hopkins , from whom the hopkinsian strain of new england theology took its name , asked the continental congress to abolish slavery .	107.40345
as we have seen , methodism early took a stand against slavery .	68.8331
beginning at least as far back as 1789 various baptist bodies condemned slavery .	330.56766
after 1815 anti-slavery sentiment mounted , chiefly among protestants and those of protestant background of the older stock .	82.31799
the nineteenth-century immigration , whether protestant or roman catholic , was not so much concerned , for very few if any among them held slaves they were mostly in the northern states where slavery had disappeared or was on the way out , or were too poverty-stricken to own slaves .	106.646065
benjamin lundy ( 1789-1839 ) , a quaker , was a pioneer in preparing the way for anti-slavery societies .	69.00388
it was he who turned the attention of william lloyd garrison ( 1805-1879 ) to the subject .	41.58386
garrison , massachusetts born of nova scotian parentage , was by temperament and conviction a reformer .	46.14018
chiefly remembered because of his incessant advocacy of `` immediate and unconditional abolition ' ' , he also espoused a great variety of other causes -- among them women ' s rights , prohibition , and justice to the indians .	53.31011
incurably optimistic , dogmatic , and utterly fearless , in his youth a devout baptist , in spite of his friendship for the quaker poet john greenleaf whittier ( 1807-1892 ) he eventually attacked the orthodox churches for what he deemed their cowardly compromising on the slavery issue and in his invariably ardent manner was emphatically unorthodox and denied the plenary inspiration of the bible .	78.247665
a marked impulse came to the anti-slavery movement through the finney revivals .	25.955145
finney himself , while opposed to slavery , placed his chief emphasis on evangelism , but from his converts issued much of the leadership of the anti-slavery campaign .	117.574
theodore dwight weld ( 1803-1895 ) was especially active .	139.51889
weld was the son and grandson of new england congregational ministers .	15.67491
as a youth he became one of finney ' s band of evangelists and gave himself to winning young men .	46.313877
a strong temperance advocate , through the influence of a favorite teacher , charles stewart , another finney convert , he devoted himself to the anti-slavery cause .	63.03626
a group of young men influenced by him enrolled in lane theological seminary and had to leave because of their open anti-slavery position .	68.18709
the majority then went to the infant oberlin .	6.159527
they and others employed some of finney ' s techniques as they sought to win adherents to the cause .	58.794792
weld contributed to the anti-slavery convictions of such men as joshua r . giddings and edwin m . stanton , enlisted john quincy adams , and helped provide ideas which underlay harriet beecher stowe ' s uncle tom ' s cabin .	55.064404
he shunned publicity for himself and sought to avoid fame .	259.30695
wendell phillips ( 1811-1884 ) , from a prominent massachusetts family , in his teens was converted under the preaching of lyman beecher .	97.29321
although he later broke with the churches because he believed that they were insufficiently outspoken against social evils , he remained a devout christian .	49.64178
he was remembered chiefly for his fearless advocacy of abolition , but he also stood for equal rights for women , for opportunity for the freedmen , and for prohibition .	75.57018
the anti-slavery movement and other contemporary reforms and philanthropies were given leadership and financial undergirding by arthur tappan ( 1786-1865 ) and his younger brother , lewis tappan ( 1788-1873 ) .	53.987217
individuals possessing unusual gifts and great personal power were transmuted at death into awesome spirits	530.0024
they were almost immediately worshipped for these newer , even more terrible abilities .	63.179863
their direct descendants inherited not only their worldly fortunes , but also the mandate of their newfound power as spirits in the other half of the universe .	36.51279
royal lineages could be based on extraordinary worldly achievements translated into eternal otherworldly power .	65.4166
thus , the emperor could draw on sources not available to those with less puissant ancestors .	66.96906
but this eminence was not without its weighty responsibilities .	30.736023
since he possessed more power in an interdependent universe of living beings and dead spirits , the emperor had to use it for the benefit of the living .	68.73402
the royal ritual generated power into the other world it also provided the living with a way to control the spirits , and bring their powers directly to bear on the everyday affairs of the world .	70.41109
proper ritual observance at any level of society was capable of generating power for use in the spirit world	120.65427
but naturally , the royal ritual , which provided unusual control over already supremely powerful divine spirits , was held responsible for regulating the universe and insuring the welfare of the kingdom .	124.23513
this is the familiar system of `` cosmic government ' ' .	9.306951
the chinese emperor , by proper observance of ritual , manifested divine powers .	72.56737
he regulated the dualities of light and darkness , yang and yin , which are locked in eternal struggle .	39.94647
by swaying the balance between them , he effected the alternation of the seasons .	43.0896
his power was so great that he even promoted and demoted gods according to whether they had given ear or been deaf to petitions .	152.69543
in this system , no man is exempt from obligations .	418.38147
failure in daily moral and ethical duties to one ' s family , outrages to community propriety , any departure from rigid standards of moral excellence were offenses against the dead .	132.48543
and to offend the dead meant to incur their wrath , and thus provoke the unleashing of countrywide disasters .	14.872186
the family home was , in fact , a temple	259.40292
and the daily duties of individuals were basically religious in nature .	240.38129
the dead spirits occupied a prominent place in every hope and in every fear .	104.788155
the common belief was that there existed one moral order , which included everything .	179.67578
the dead controlled the material prosperity of the living , and the living adhered to strict codes of conduct in order not to weaken that control .	96.97113
men believed they could control nature by obeying a moral code .	32.12725
if the moral code were flouted , the proper balance of the universe would be upset , and the disastrous result could be floods , plague , or famine .	44.406513
modern westerners have difficulty comprehending this fusion of moral and material , largely because in the west the historical trend has been to deny the connection .	61.573826
living in urban conditions , away from the deadweight of village constraint and the constrictions of a thatched-roof world view , the individual may find it possible , say , to commit adultery not only without personal misgivings , but also without suffering any adverse effects in his worldly fortunes .	71.51566
basing action on the empirical determination of cause and effect provides a toughness and bravado that no powerful otherworldly ancestor could ever impart -- plus the added liberation from the constraint of silent burial urns .	74.99056
in china , the magical system par excellence was taoism .	23.87281
the taoists were quietist mystics , who saw an unchanging unity -- the tao -- underlying all phenomena .	141.49216
it was this timeless unity that was all-important , and not its temporary manifestations in the world of reality .	43.481174
the taoists believed the unity could be influenced by proper magical manipulation	69.184364
in other words , they were actually an organization of magicians .	71.42389
mahayana buddhism was no exception to these prevailing magical concepts .	13.122398
after this form of indian buddhism had been introduced into china , it underwent extensive changes .	108.87935
during its flowering in the sixth to the eighth centuries , mahayana offered a supernatural package to the chinese which bears no resemblance to the highly digested philosophical zen morsels offered to the modern western reader .	77.27099
mahayana had gods , and magic , a pantheon , heavens and hells , and gorgeously appareled priests , monks , and nuns , all of whom wielded power over souls in the other world .	39.25765
the self-realized mahayana saint possessed superhuman powers and magic .	52.552242
the mahayana that developed in the north was a religion of idolatry and coarse magic , that made the world into a huge magical garden .	69.48854
in its monastic form , mahayana was merely an organization of magic-practicing monks ( bonzes ) , who catered to the chinese faith in the supernatural .	44.411102
nonmagical confucianism was a secular , rational philosophy , but even with this different orientation it could not escape from the ethos of a cosmic government .	82.86829
confucianism had its own magic in the idea that virtue had power .	150.70778
if a man lived a classical life , he need not fear the spirits -- for only lack of virtue gave the spirits power over him .	149.10533
but let us not be mistaken about confucian `` virtue ' '	21.634573
this was not virtue as we understand the word today , and it did not mean an abandonment of the belief in magic manipulation .	66.36675
to the confucian , `` virtue ' ' simply meant mastery and correct observance of three hundred major rules of ritual and three thousand minor ones .	212.00964
propriety was synonymous with ritual observance , the mark of a true gentleman .	88.43779
to live correctly in an interdependent moral and material universe of living and dead was decisive for man ' s fate .	98.904175
this , in brief , was the historical background out of which zen emerged .	207.33351
promoters of zen to the west record its ancestry , and recognize that zen grew out of a combination of taoism and indian mahayana buddhism .	52.236423
but the `` marvelous person ' ' that is supposed to result from zen exhibits more chinese practicality than indian speculation -- he possesses magical powers , and can use them to order nature and to redeem souls .	113.97418
proponents of zen to the west emphasize disproportionately the amount of mahayana buddhism in zen , probably in order to dignify the indisputably magical taoist ideas with more respectable buddhist metaphysic .	48.731083
but in the chinese mind , there was little difference between the two -- the bonzes were no more metaphysical than a magician has to be .	63.090054
actually , zen owes more to chinese quietism than it does to mahayana buddhism .	38.013283
the ch ' an ( zen ) sect may have derived its metaphysic from mahayana , but its psychology was pure early taoist .	175.7288
this is well evidenced by the quietist doctrines carried over in zen the idea of the inward turning of thought , the enjoinder to put aside desires and perturbations so that a return to purity , peace , and stillness -- a union with the infinite , with the tao -- could be effected .	121.05178
in fact , the antipathy to outward ceremonies hailed by modern exponents as so uniquely characteristic of the `` direct thinking ' ' zennist was a feature of taoism .	61.140263
so , too , was the insistence on the relativity of the external world , and the ideas that language and things perceived by consciousness were poor substitutes indeed for immediate perception by pure , indwelling spirit the opposition of pure consciousness to ratiocinating consciousness .	173.50734
zen maintains that cognitive things are only the surface of experience .	54.677536
one of its features attractive to the west is its irreverence for tradition and dogma and for sacred texts .	120.193855
one patriarch is supposed to have relegated sacred scriptures for use in an outhouse .	44.19597
but this is not the spirit of self-reliant freedom of action for which the westerner mistakes it .	117.10138
it is simply that in taoist tradition -- as in all good mysticisms -- books , words , or any other manifestations that belong to the normal state of consciousness are considered only the surface of experience .	87.78844
the truth -- the eternal truth -- is not transmittable by words .	50.61377
reality is considered not only irrelevant to the acquisition of higher knowledge , but a positive handicap .	94.68279
the technique of reality confusion -- the use of paradox and riddles to shake the mind ' s grip on reality -- originated with fourth and third century b . c . chinese quietism the koan is not basically a new device .	71.196205
it is important for an understanding of zen to realize that the esoteric preoccupations of the select few cannot be the doctrine of the common man .	37.119385
in the supernatural atmosphere of cosmic government , only the ruling elite was ever concerned with a kingdom-wide ordering of nature popular religion aimed at more personal benefits from magical powers .	208.76822
and this is only natural -- witness the haste with which modern man gobbles the latest `` wonder drug ' ' .	129.46004
early chinese anchoritism was theoretically aimed at a mystic pantheist union with the divine , personal salvation being achieved when the mystical recluse united with divine essence .	90.62897
but this esoteric doctrine was lost in the shuffle to acquire special powers .	217.30904
the anchorite strove , in fact , to magically influence the world of spirits in the same way that the divine emperor manifested his power .	43.819622
thus , the mahayana metaphysic of mystical union for salvation was distilled down to a bare self-seeking , and for this reason , the mystic in asia did not long remain in isolated contemplation .	99.425835
as the zen literature reveals , as soon as an early zen master attained fame in seclusion , he was called out into the world to exercise his powers .	65.11631
the early anchorite masters attracted disciples because of their presumed ability to perform miracles .	62.181694
exponents of zen often insist that very early zen doctrine opposed the rampant supernaturalism of china , and proposed instead a more mature , less credulous view of the universe .	94.56138
in support of this , stories from the early literature are cited to show that zen attacks the idea of supernatural power .	120.072296
but actually these accounts reveal the supernatural powers that the masters were in fact supposed to possess , as well as the extreme degree of popular credulity `` hwang pah ( o baku ) , one day going up mount tien tai which was believed to have been inhabited by arhats with supernatural powers , met with a monk whose eyes emitted strange light .	67.40798
they went along the pass talking with each other for a short while until they came to a river roaring with torrent .	68.800385
there being no bridge , the master had to stop at the shore	81.15554
but his companion crossed the river walking on the water and beckoned to hwang pah to follow him .	42.731373
thereupon hwang pah said `` if i knew thou art an arhat , i would have doubled you up before thou got over there ' ' ! !	118.19062
the monk then understood the spiritual attainment of hwang pah , and praised him as a true mahayanist .	40.73745
a second tale shows still more clearly the kind of powers a truly spiritual monk could possess `` on one occasion yang shan ( kyo-zan ) saw a stranger monk flying through the air .	113.44244
when that monk came down and approached him with a respectful salutation , he asked `` where art thou from ' ' ? ?	30.28093
`` early this morning ' ' , replied the other , `` i set out from india ' ' .	29.4527
`` why ' ' , said the teacher , `` art thou so late ' ' ? ?	37.04701
`` i stopped ' ' , responded the man , `` several times to look at beautiful sceneries ' ' .	26.761152
`` thou mayst have supernatural powers ' ' , exclaimed yang shan , `` yet thou must give back the spirit of buddha to me ' ' .	45.695587
then the monk praised yang shan saying `` i have come over to china in order to worship manjucri , and met unexpectedly with minor shakya ' ' , and after giving the master some palm leaves he brought from india , went back through the air .	96.04249
in the popular chinese mind , ch ' an ( zen ) was no exception to the ideas of coarse magic that dominated .	62.41923
a closer look at modern zen reveals many magical carryovers that are still part of popular zen attitudes .	65.46382
to the zen monk the universe is still populated with `` spiritual beings ' ' who have to be appeased .	35.025204
part of the mealtime ritual in the zendo consists in offerings of rice to the spiritual beings ' ' .	54.3473
modern zen presentation to the west insists on the anti-authoritarian , highly pragmatic nature of the zen belief -- scriptures are burned to make fire , action is based on direct self-confidence , and so on .	96.08601
this picture of extreme self-reliant individuation is difficult to reconcile with such zendo formulas as `` o you , demons and other spiritual beings , i now offer this to you , and may this food fill up the ten quarters of the world and all the demons and other spiritual beings be fed therewith .	100.12539
pope leo 13 , on the 13th day of december 1898 , granted the following indulgences `` an indulgence of three hundred days is granted to all the faithful who read the holy gospels at least a quarter of an hour .	55.467575
a plenary indulgence under the usual conditions is granted once a month for the daily reading ' ' .	73.864426
pope pius the sixth , at rome , in april , 1778 , wrote the following `` the faithful should be excited to the reading of the holy scriptures for these are the most abundant sources which ought to be left open to everyone , to draw from them purity of morals and of doctrine , to eradicate errors which are so widely disseminated in these corrupt times ' ' .	79.40031
the american bishops assembled at the third plenary council of baltimore urged the catholic people to read the holy bible .	107.81677
`` we hope ' ' , they said , `` that no family can be found amongst us without a correct version of the holy scriptures ' ' .	41.762005
they recommended , also , that `` at a fixed hour , let the entire family be assembled for night prayers , followed by a short reading of the holy scriptures ' ' .	71.32761
since the catholic church expresses such desire that the sacred scriptures be read , the following taken from the holy bible ( new catholic edition ) will prove a means of grace and a source of great spiritual blessing .	60.2228
do not wonder that i said to thee , `` you must be born again ' ' .	12.659081
the new birth is necessary because god is holy .	44.592243
but as the one who called you is holy , be you also holy in all your behavior	284.7559
for it is written , you shall be holy , because i am holy .	43.921143
1 , st . peter 15 , 16 .	5.319893
holiness without which no man will see god .	51.36566
the new birth is necessary because all have sinned .	8.806396
as it is written , there is not one just man	1012.98016
all have sinned and have need of the glory of god .	16.20726
the new birth is necessary because the natural man is spiritually dead and blind .	76.75025
therefore as through one man sin entered into the world and through sin death , and thus death has passed unto all men because all have sinned .	61.05027
you also , when you were dead by reason of your offenses and sins .	82.615906
and if our gospel also is veiled , it is veiled only to those who are perishing .	37.00101
in their case , the god of this world ( satan ) has blinded their unbelieving minds , that they should not see the light of the gospel of the glory of christ , who is the image of god .	29.681019
for his workmanship we are , created in christ jesus .	36.77753
the new birth is effected through the word of god	3.2855895
for you have been reborn , not from corruptible seed but from incorruptible , through the word of god .	60.76055
of his own will he has begotten us by the word of truth .	44.931404
amen , amen , i say to thee , unless a man be born again of water ( symbol of the word of god , see ephesians 26 ) and the spirit , he cannot enter into the kingdom of god .	42.02262
that which is born of the flesh is flesh	203.53401
and that which is born of the spirit is spirit .	37.609238
if we are born of god we have faith in christ as the only saviour .	24.51579
everyone who believes that jesus is the christ is born of god .	13.620133
as many as received him were born of god .	9.472389
if we are born of god we do not practice sin as a habit .	41.819237
whoever is born of god does not commit sin ( that is , he does not practice sin .	32.738003
cf . 1 st . john 2 1 ) .	5.8639817
we know that no one who is born of god commits sin .	19.464638
( the new nature , received at the time of regeneration , is divine and holy , and as the believer lives under the power of this new nature he does not practice sin .	80.33318
) if we are born of god we practice righteousness .	109.12202
if you know that he ( god ) is just ( righteous ) , know that everyone also who does what is just ( righteous ) has been born of him .	81.370285
if we are born of god we love god .	20.22118
everyone who loves is born of god , and knows god .	102.44987
if we are born of god we love the brethren .	20.623852
we know that we have passed from death to life , because we love the brethren .	36.084328
he who does not love abides in death .	3.7673037
if we are born of god we overcome the world .	9.159692
all that is born of god overcomes the world	18.119612
and this is the victory that overcomes the world , our faith .	80.563385

fifteen years ago , troubled by the rising tide of materialism in the post-war world , a businessman and a minister asked themselves if there might not be a place for a small magazine in which men and women , regardless of creed or color , could set forth boldly their religious convictions and bear witness to the power of faith to solve the endless problems of living .	70.782555
neither had any publishing experience , but they had faith in their idea .	82.33483
they borrowed a typewriter , raised about $2 , 000 in contributions , hired a secretary , persuaded a couple of young men to join them for almost no pay and began mailing out a collection of unstapled leaflets that they called guideposts .	166.84415
compared to the big , established magazines , my first efforts seemed feeble indeed .	448.98047
but from the start they had two important ingredients sincerity and realism .	91.39119
the people who told the stories were sincere .	4.616323
for example , early in my life , when one of my editorial workers wanted to find out how churches and philanthropic organizations met the needs of new york ' s down-and-outers , he didn ' t just ask questions .	86.08697

at first i was happy to throw the support of our newspaper behind this man .	141.07144

diario de la marina was the oldest and most influential paper in cuba , with a reputation for speaking out against tyranny .	180.03015
my grandfather had been stoned because of his editorials .	28.369402
my own earliest memories are of exiles my three brothers and i were taken often to the united states `` to visit relatives ' ' while my father stayed on to fight the dictator machado .	93.02186
when it was my turn , i , too , printed the truth as i knew it about batista , and rejoiced to see his regime topple .	87.901955

he spent long hours before the tv spitting out promises of revenge .	289.30637
he showed us how he dealt with his enemies he executed them before tv cameras .	226.2313

he seemed bent on coupling them with vengeance .	3.6175888
new schools were rising , but with this went a harsh proclamation any academic degree earned during batista ' s regime was invalid .	246.73611
he had promised cheaper housing arbitrarily he cut all rents in half , whether the landlord was a millionaire speculator or a widow whose only income was the rental of a spare room .	137.72542
under another law , hundreds of farms were seized .	75.34994
farm workers had their wages cut almost in half .	75.11324
of this , only 50 cents a day was paid in cash , the rest in script usable only in `` people ' s stores ' ' .	80.90359
a suspicion was growing that fidel castro was a communist .	34.709953

too often a beginning bodybuilder has to do his training secretly either because his parents don ' t want sonny-boy to `` lift all those old barbell things ' ' because `` you ' ll stunt your growth ' ' or because childish taunts from his schoolmates , like `` hey lookit mr . america	65.53972
whaddya gonna do with all those muscles ( of which he has none at the time ) ' ' ? ?	55.19371
after all , a guy ' s gotta have a little ego ! !	21.907377
therefore it ' s a genuine pleasure to tell you about an entirely happy bodybuilder who has never had to train in secret has never heard one unkind word from his parents and never has been taunted by his schoolmates ! !	155.26201
this happy , always smiling lad with the sunny disposition is our new junior mr . canada -- henri de courcy .	233.50526
far from discouraging henri , his parents urge him on to greater and greater accomplishments .	151.7754
instead of admonishing him to let the weights alone they personally took him to that master montreal bodybuilding authority , professor roland claude .	208.97928
and they couldn ' t have entrusted henri to better hands because `` le professeur ' ' knows his muscles from the sterno-cleido mastoideus of the neck right down to the tibialis anticus of the leg and better still , he knows just what exercises work best for them and what weider principles to combine them with for fast , fast muscle growth .	133.3383
that ' s because the good professor teaches only weider methods at his famous montreal health studio which is located at 1821 mt . royal east in montreal .	122.25417
undoubtedly you have read the case histories of some of his prize-winning pupils ( every pupil has a physique title of some kind or other ) .	116.89641
there ' s gaetan d ' amours who is our newest mr . canada	243.8127
jean-paul senesac , whose story appeared here two issues ago	260.43048
jack boissoneault , who was with us last month	12.492504
charles harve , who recently won the `` most muscular man ' ' subdivision award in the mr . canada event	113.65891
yesiree , the professor knows his muscles ! !	1.4666862
now when henri was just 12 he was only 4 ' 10 ' ' ' ' tall and weighed an astounding 72 pounds , and his greatest desire was to pack on some weight .	59.30791
about that time he began reading mr . america and muscle builder and he learned of the famous weider way to fast weight gaining .	313.8988
seeing so many illustrations and reading so many testimonials to the value of quick-wate and super-protein , those two wonder-working weider food supplements , he decided to try them and see what they could do for him .	49.95589
well , sir they did real great ! !	1.2803837
for in almost less time than it takes to tell it , henri ' s bodyweight was increasing rapidly .	47.95514
he ' s crazy about water skiing and swimming and this vigorous exercise in conjunction with the added food supplements packed pounds of solid muscle on his skinny frame .	117.917946
henri has always had shapely legs from swimming and water skiing and really doesn ' t have to work them very much .	58.587025
but he was totally dissatisfied with his upper body .	10.527299
it was muscular but it wasn ' t symmetrical .	27.734896
`` a real ' nothing ' torso ' ' , says henri .	16.849976
it just got longer and longer ' ' .	2.3704545
that ' s when he went to professor claude .	206.0106
and at once claude saw what the trouble was and he knew just how to correct it .	58.665882
in his gym the professor has some of the most `` knocked out ' ' equipment since vic tanny .	61.965034
mr . claude is a specialist in torso development and he has long favored the now-famous weider push-pull super-set technique in which one exercise of the super-set is a pressing or `` pushing ' ' movement which accents one sector of a muscle group in a specific way , followed by a `` pulling ' ' exercise which works the opposing sector of the same muscle group .	80.17957
so right away claude introduced henri to his famous `` moon ' ' bench and proceeded to teach him his first push-pull super-set consisting of the wide-grip straight-arm pullover ( the `` pull ' ' part of the push-pull super-set ) which dramatically widens the ribcage and strongly affects the muscles of the upper back and chest and the collar-to-collar bench press which specifically works on the chest to build those wide , reeves-type `` gladiator ' ' pecs , while stimulating the upper lats and frontal deltoids .	60.836304
as you can see , in this push-pull super set the entire chest-back-shoulder area is vigorously exercised in alternate sectors by alternate exercises so the complete torso remains pumped-up all the time ! !	154.35434
now when henri has completed four complete push-pull super-sets no . 1 , the professor allows him about a five-minute rest period before starting him on four complete push-pull super-sets no . 2 .	89.69467
super-set no . 2 is made up of similar exercises , but this time done with dumbbells , and using both `` moon ' ' and flat benches .	93.849304
the `` push ' ' exercise of this push-pull super-set is the bench press done with elbows well pulled back and with a greater downward stretch of the pectorals not possible with the barbell variation .	171.5934
you need the barbell variation to build width and mass in the pecs .	36.871002
the dumbbell variation develops a most classically sculptured outline to the aj .	21.35681
the `` pull ' ' exercise in this super-set is the one-dumbbell bent-arm pullover .	60.94972
( note how strongly the upper lats and serratus are worked in this fine exercise because of the pin-point concentration of force which the dumbbell variation affords ) .	106.05149
in the third push-pull super-set the `` push ' ' exercise is the widegrip pushup between bars , while the `` pull ' ' exercise is the moon bench lateral raise with bent arms .	56.898655
the pushup done in this manner is the greatest pectoral-ribcage stretcher ever invented ! !	66.37238
this is true only if a very wide grip is used and only when the greatest possible stretch is achieved .	72.2899
you ' ll know when you ' ve made the greatest stretch because your shoulder blades will touch ! !	107.08768
as you see , the professor has designed a piece of apparatus that forces the bodybuilder to use a w-i-d-e grip .	76.66616
he just can ' t do anything about it at all ! !	38.676933
but as you can also see , it ' s not a painful exercise at all , because henri de courcy -- the `` happy ' ' bodybuilder -- looks as though he were having the time of his life ! !	55.8424
the last exercise of roland claude ' s prescribed program for henri is a single exercise , done in individual sets with a bit longer pause between sets .	306.71902
by this time henri ' s entire chest-back-lat-shoulder area is pumped-up to almost bursting point , and claude takes time to do a bit more pectoral-front deltoid shaping work .	129.81772
he has henri do from four to six sets of the incline bench press ( note the high incline ) .	34.563667
this gives a wide flare to the pecs , causing them to flow dramatically upward into deltoids and dramatically downward into the serratus and aj .	95.00834
this is the kind of chest that invariably wins contests	858.7418
that steel-edged `` carved-out-of-solid rock ' ' looks of the great champions .	34.27879
so with four complete push-pull super-sets no . 1 , four of no . 2 , four of no . 3 and four to six sets of the incline bench press , you can see that henri de courcy has had a terrific mass-building , muscle-shaping , torso-defining workout that cannot be improved upon .	43.28254
physique contests are rarely won on muscle size alone .	130.26994
rarer still is a mr . america or mr . universe of true herculean build .	143.67511
the aspects of physical development that catch the judges ' eyes and which rightfully influence their decisions are symmetry and that hallmark of the true champion -- superior definition of the muscles .	192.30026
now good definition is one thing that all of us can acquire with occasional high-set , high-rep , light-weight workouts .	41.32273
but contest definition -- that dramatic muscular separation of every muscle group that seems as though it must have been carved by a sculptor ' s chisel -- is something quite different .	85.29163
this comes not alone from high-set , high-rep training , but from certain definition-specialization exercises which the champion selects for himself with the knowledge of exactly what works best for him .	111.18702
often these exercises work well for some bodybuilders but less spectacularly for others .	55.264946
because they are `` minority ' ' exercises and have but a limited appeal they soon find themselves in the limbo of the forgotten .	175.09406
only when the newest mr . america or mr . universe discovers them and puts them into practice are we reacquainted with them and once again see how effective they really are .	153.3718
the exercise i shall discuss in this -- the first of a new series of articles on muscle definition-specialization of a particular body part -- is the one leg lunge .	61.26672
why it was ever forgotten for even a moment i cannot say because it works perfectly for everyone , no matter whether he has short or long thigh-bone lengths ! !	191.63084
it is the one exercise that drastically influences the definition of the thighs at the hipline -- that mark of the champion that sets him apart from all other bodybuilders	120.97342
a criterion of muscle `` drama ' ' that is unforgettable to judges and audiences alike	232.71196
the facet of muscular development that wins prizes .	7.432402
definition of the thighs at the uppermost part is quite commonly seen in most championship olympic lifters which is easily understandable .	140.94322
the one leg lunge is a split and all lifters practice this in their regular workouts .	396.17172
but for purely definition purposes -- used in conjunction with your regular squatting , leg curling , leg extensor programs -- a heavy weight is not needed .	39.38462
indeed , a lighter weight works much better because a greater , more extensive split can be performed .	137.28226
used in several sets of high reps once or twice each week it will not be long before your entire upper leg takes on a razor-sharp definition in which the muscles look like wire cables writhing and twisting under the skin ! !	83.63197
really there is no reason why this fine exercise should not find its way into your leg program at all times , for the following suggestions show why it is so effective 1 .	117.98493
it ' s a complete thigh contraction-extension exercise .	7.5892096
it places terrific tension on the leg muscles from start to finish of each repetition .	239.9944
it improves over-all balance and control for the bodybuilder , and helps to make squats more easily and more correctly performed .	95.24244
it speeds muscle growth and power development even for the advanced bodybuilder because each hip and leg is exercised separately , thus enabling a massive , concentrated effort to be focused on each .	189.5085
you ' ll need your weider power stands for this fine exercise and here ' s the way it ' s done 1 .	56.155052
place your power stands in position and adjust their height so that this will correspond to the height of your shoulders when you are in a deep leg split as for a heavy clean .	88.01238
grasp the bar ( which will rest against the back of your neck )	64.12051
extend your feet forward and backward until you are in a deep leg split .	53.602757
now raise the weight by straightening your front leg , without moving your feet .	77.67147
when the front knee is straight and locked , allow it to bend again until you feel the bar come lightly into contact with the sides of the power stands .	120.75211
after you have taken a breather , reverse the position of your legs so that the front thigh of the previous exercise is now to the rear , and the rear thigh now to the front , and perform the same movement in the same manner .	40.563755
that ' s the one-leg lunge in a nutshell .	12.504835
you should have a couple of training partners to stand by when you make your first experiments just for safety .	222.40742
you should also begin this exercise with a very light barbell until you become accustomed to it balance-wise .	116.227104
oh , you ' ll wobble and weave quite a bit at first .	94.388435
before your first training experiment has ended there will be a big improvement and almost before you know it you ' ll be raising and lowering yourself just like a veteran ! !	73.98858
although i suggested that you hold the bar at the back of the neck there ' s no reason why you shouldn ' t make some experiments with the bar held in front of the neck .	35.85417
squat-style lifters and leg-split lifters would both benefit enormously by practicing those variations providing that they remember to make alternate sets with the left and right leg to the front .	177.43192
the most beautiful bed of pansies i ' ve seen was in a south dakota yard on a sizzling day .	54.704212
pansies are supposed to like it cool , but those great velvety flowers were healthy and perky in the glaring sun .	112.24346
i sought out the gardener and asked him what he did to produce such beauties in that weather .	61.341785
`` i just love them ' ' , he said .	5.499643
the more i talked with him , the more convinced i became that that was the secret of their riotous blooming .	67.6202
of course his love was expressed in intelligent care .	44.633015
he planted the pansy seeds himself , buying them from a pansy specialist .	22.334099
these specialists , i learned , have done a great deal of work to improve the size and health of the plants and the resulting flowers .	61.28124
their seeds produce vigorous blooming plants half again the size of the unimproved strains .	22.135822
i asked him if he took seeds from his own plants .	38.469856
occasionally , when he had an unusual flower that he wanted more of he did	85.772446
but pansy seeds , he told me , soon `` run down ' ' .	101.58364
it ' s best to buy them fresh from a dealer who is working to improve them .	68.03376
his soil was `` nothing special ' ' , just prairie land , but he had harrowed in compost until it was loose , spongy and brown-black .	48.877995
i fingered it and had the feeling of adequacy that comes with the right texture , tilth and body .	92.01606
it isn ' t easy to describe it , but every gardener knows it when his fingers touch such soil .	108.36214
nothing is easier to grow from seed than pansies .	63.61763
they germinate quickly , the tiny plants appearing in a week , and grow along lustily .	45.279804
it doesn ' t really matter which month of the year you sow them , but they germinate best when they have a wide variation of temperature , very warm followed by cool in the same 24 hours .	112.27375
i like to make a seedbed right in the open , though many people start them successfully in cold frames .	144.66351
they ' d rather have things rugged , with only moderate protection on the coldest days .	106.13845
if you do use a cold frame be sure that its ventilation is adequate .	46.26579
for my seedbed i use good garden soil with a little sand added to encourage rooting .	44.198624
i dig it , rake it smooth , sow the seeds and wet them down with a fog spray .	79.615074
then i cover the sowing with a board .	40.17645
this keeps it cool and moist and protects it from birds .	52.31159
ants carry away the seeds so better be sure that there are no ant hills nearby .	60.806316
when the first sprinkling of green appears i remove the board .	54.100002
a light , porous mulch applied now keeps the roots cool and the soil soft during these early days of growth .	115.39435
i like sawdust for this , or hay .	35.099228
when they have 4 to 6 leaves and are thrifty little plants , it ' s time to set them out where they are to remain .	68.32069
every time you transplant a pansy you cause its flowers to become smaller .	165.59859
the moral is don ' t transplant it any oftener than you must .	190.72253
as soon as they are large enough to move , i put mine 9 inches apart where they are to bloom .	152.52594
i put a little scoop of pulverized phosphate rock or steamed bone meal into each hole with the plant .	188.93213
that encourages rooting , and the better developed the roots , the larger and more plentiful the flowers .	136.93188
i doubt if it is possible to overfeed them .	12.218365
lacking that , decayed manure spread over the bed is fine .	195.98404
one year i simply set the plants in the remains of a compost pile , to which a little sand had been added , and i had the most beautiful pansies in my , or any of my neighbors ' experience .	74.74844
in addition to the rich soil they benefit by feedings of manure water every other week , diluted to the color of weak tea .	145.82275
as a substitute for this , organic fertilizer dissolved in water to half the strength in the directions , may be used .	53.75222
three inches of porous material will do a good job of keeping weeds down and the soil moist and cool .	39.360523
when winter comes be ready with additional mulch .	9.152922
i like hay for this and apply it so that only the tops of the plants show right after a good frost .	97.76511
that keeps in the cold , retains moisture and prevents the heaving of alternate freezing and thawing .	16.943497
don ' t miss the pansies that appear from time to time through the winter .	30.584581
whenever there is a thaw or a few sunny days , you ' ll be likely to find a brave little blossom or two .	29.575327
if those aren ' t enough for you , why not grow some just for winter blooming ? ?	213.86725
the pansies i cherished most bloomed for me in february during a particularly cold winter .	142.28171
i started the seed in a flat in june and set out the little pansies in a cold frame .	88.6839
( an unheated greenhouse would have been better , if i had had one .	75.806114
) the plants took zero nights in their stride , with nothing but a mat of straw over the glass to protect them .	59.829327
in response to the lengthening days of february they budded , then bloomed their 4-inch velvety flowers .	53.09469
its mass of bright bloom set in a border of snow made my spirits rise every time i looked at it .	158.97122
like strawberries in december , pansies are far more exciting in february than in may .	95.29027
try that late winter pickup when you are so tired of cold and snow that you feel you just can ' t take another day of it .	72.693474
the day will come , in midsummer , when you find your plants becoming `` leggy ' ' , running to tall-growing foliage at the expense of blossoms .	48.16515
try pegging down each separate branch to the earth , using a bobby pin to hold it there .	88.24793
pick the flowers , keep the soil dampened , and each of the pegged-down branches will take root and become a little plant and go on blooming for the rest of the season .	65.6898
as soon as an experimental tug assures you that roots have taken over , cut it off from the mother plant .	216.3247
a second and also good practice is to shear off the tops , leaving an inch high stub with just a leaf or two on each branch .	126.04577
these cut-down plants will bud and blossom in record time and will behave just as they did in early spring .	175.12169
i like to shear half my plants at a time , leaving one half of them to blossom while the second half is getting started on its new round of blooming .	91.36422
probably no one needs to tell you that the way to stop all bloom is to let the blossoms go to seed .	102.30405
nature ' s aim , different from ours , is to provide for the coming generation .	56.267685
that done , her work is accomplished and she ignores the plant .	108.76986
here is a word of advice when you go shopping for your pansy seeds .	133.83273
go to a reputable grower , preferably a pansy specialist .	9.654334
it is no harder to raise big , healthy , blooming plants than weak , sickly little things	74.69197
but you will never get better flowers than the seed you grow .	110.04985
many people think that pansies last only a few weeks , then their period of growth and bloom is over .	70.267426
if the plants are cared for and protected over the winter , the second year is more prolific than the first .	43.21531
would you like to grow exhibition pansies ? ?	1.0600125
remove about half the branches from each plant , leaving only the strongest with the largest buds .	123.842636
they stick to their principles , insist upon their due , but grow and bloom with dependable regularity if given it .	131.01276
treat them right and they ' ll make a showing every month in the year except the frigid ones .	157.79752
give them food , some shade , mulch , water and more food , and they ' ll repay your solicitude with beauty .	52.49456
a salad with greens and tomato is a popular and wonderfully healthful addition to a meal , but add an avocado and you have something really special .	167.68144
this delightful tropical fruit has become well-known in the past thirty years because modern transportation methods have made it possible to ship avocados anywhere in the united states .	53.782978
it has a great many assets to recommend it and if you haven ' t made avocado a part of your diet yet , you really should .	74.796646
you will find that avocado is unlike any other fruit you have ever tasted .	37.727882
it is roughly shaped like a large pear , and when properly ripened , its dark green skin covers a meaty , melon-like pulp that has about the consistency of a ripe bartlett pear , but oily .	37.083668
the avocado should have a `` give ' ' to it , as you hold it , when it is ripe .	28.373764
the flavor is neither sweet , like a pear , nor tart like an orange	182.46507
it is subtle and rather bland , nut-like .	18.505949
it is a flavor that might take a little getting used to -- not because it is unpleasant , but because the flavor is hard to define in the light of our experience with other fruits .	78.29544
sometimes it takes several `` eatings ' ' of avocado to catch that delightful quality in taste that has made it such a favorite throughout the world .	166.03494
once you become an avocado fan , you will look forward to the season each year with eager anticipation .	130.15105
today , refrigerated carriers have made the shipping of avocados possible to any place in the world .	97.085365
the fruit is allowed to mature on the tree , but it is still firm at this point .	38.056496
it is brought to packing houses , cleaned and graded as to size and quality , and packed in protective excelsior .	50.72912
the fruit is then cooled to 42-degrees-f . , a temperature at which it lapses into a sort of dormant state .	106.62344
this cooling does not change the avocado in any way , it just delays the natural softening of the fruit until a grovelike temperature ( room temperature ) is restored .	108.71691
this happens on the grocer ' s shelf or in your kitchen .	67.64948
one of the most attractive things about avocados is that they do not require processing of any kind .	50.89585
there is no dyeing or waxing or gassing needed .	288.45605
if the temperature is controlled properly , the avocado will delay its ripening until needed .	167.16197
and unlike other fruits , one cannot eat the skin of the avocado .	23.540115
it is thick , much like an egg plant ' s skin , so that poison sprays , if they are used , present no hazard to the consumer .	59.84425
good taste and versatility , plus safety from spray poisons would be enough to recommend the frequent use of such a fruit , even if its nutritional values were limited .	52.80072
avocados , however , are very rich in nutrients .	130.31998
their main asset is an abundance of unsaturated fatty acids , so necessary for maintaining the good health of the circulatory system .	26.497648
aside from this , the average portion contains some protein , an appreciable amount of vitamins a and c -- about one-tenth of the minimum daily requirement , and about a third of the official vitamin e requirement .	74.694466
the b vitamins are well represented , especially thiamin and riboflavin .	22.117344
calcium , phosphorus and iron are present in worthwhile amounts , and eleven other minerals also have been found in varying trace amounts .	87.89729
none of these values is destroyed , not significantly altered by refrigeration storage .	84.88408
dr . wilson c . grant , of the veterans ' administration hospital , coral gables , florida , and the university of miami school of medicine , set out to discover if avocados , because of their high content of unsaturated fatty acids , would reduce the cholesterol of the blood in selected patients .	40.99318
the study comprised 16 male patients , ranging in age from 27 to 72 .	88.51875
they were put on control diets to determine as accurately as possible , the normal cholesterol level of their blood .	63.758907
then they were given 1/2 to 1-1/2 avocados per day as a substitute for part of their dietary fat consumption .	51.36483
five , four , three , two , one , fire ! !	98.93663
the tremendous energy released by giant rocket engines perhaps can be felt much better than it can be heard .	76.60571
the pulsating vibration of energy clutches at the pit of your stomach .	54.019566
never before has the introduction of a weapon caused so much apprehension and fear .	114.16281
nuclear weapons are fearsome , but the long-range ballistic missile gives them a stealth and merciless swiftness which is much more terrifying .	39.135452
a great many writers are bewitched by the apparently overwhelming advantage an attacker would have if he were to strike with complete surprise using nuclear rockets .	250.41066
it is relatively easy to go a step further and reason that an attacker , in possession of such absolute power , would simultaneously destroy his opponent ' s cities and people .	100.79153
with a nation defenseless before it , why would the attacker spare the victim ' s people ? ?	67.23194
wouldn ' t the wanton destruction of cities and people be the logical act of complete subjugation ? ?	112.750374
the will of its people , so crucial in time of peril , would be broken .	94.14266
nuclear weapons have given the world the means for self-destruction in hours or days	475.58813
and now rockets have given it the means to destroy itself in minutes .	71.66378
at this point it should be painfully obvious that cities , being `` soft ' ' , and the people within them are ideally suited to destruction by nuclear weapons .	66.22566
however , because this vulnerability is mutual , it is to the advantage of neither side to destroy the opponent ' s cities , at least so long as the opponent has nuclear weapons with which to effect reprisal .	63.845524
it should be appallingly apparent that city-trading is not a profitable military tactic .	24.294687
icbms have given us a capability which could be used in two different ways .	32.595966
they could be used to attack a nation ' s people ( which would inevitably mean the loss of the attacker ' s own people ) , or they could be used with discrimination to destroy the enemy ' s military force .	34.57402
if our national interest lies in being able to fight and win a war rather than committing national suicide , then we must take a much more penetrating look at ballistic missiles .	78.768166
we must determine whether missiles can win a war all by themselves .	108.20815
we must make certain that the aircraft is finished before we give the entire job to the missile .	59.001575
missiles are very valuable weapons , but they also have their too little known limitations .	321.5165
because of a missile ' s ballistic trajectory , the location of a fixed target must be known quite accurately .	48.23112
placing missiles in submarines , on barges , railroads , highways , surface vessels and in the air provides them with passive protection by taking advantage of the gravest weakness of long-range ballistic missiles today -- the extreme difficulty of destroying a mobile or moving target with such weapons .	93.421165
one must first detect a fleeting mobile or moving target , decide that it is worthy of destruction , select the missile to be fired against the target , compute ballistics for the flight , and prepare the missile for firing .	80.55793
even if all these operations could be performed instantaneously , the icbm still has a time of flight to the target of about 30 minutes .	62.311787
therefore , if the target can significantly change its location in something less than 30 minutes , the probability of having destroyed it is drastically lowered .	60.52361
because of this , it would appear inevitable that an increasing percentage of strategic missiles will seek self-protection in mobility -- at least until missile defenses are perfected which have an exceedingly high kill probability .	102.214714
in order to destroy the enemy ' s mobile , moving , or imprecisely located strategic forces , we must have a hunter-killer capability in addition to our missiles .	45.403835
until this hunter-killer operation can be performed by spacecraft , manned aircraft appear to be the only means available to us .	60.869034
it seems reasonable that if general nuclear war is not to be one cataclysmic act of burning each other ' s citizens to cinders , we must have a manned strategic force of long-endurance aircraft capable of going into china or russia to find and destroy their strategic forces which continued to threaten us .	66.61097
let us suppose the russians decide to build a rail-mobile icbm force .	46.0009
it is entirely feasible to employ aircraft such as the b-52 or b-70 in hunter-killer operations against soviet railway-based missiles .	36.007057
if we stop thinking in terms of tremendous multimegaton nuclear weapons and consider employing much smaller nuclear weapons which may be more appropriate for most important military targets , it would seem that the b-52 or b-70 could carry a great many small nuclear weapons .	46.064327
an aircraft with a load of small nuclear weapons could very conceivably be given a mission to suppress all trains operating within a specified geographic area of russia -- provided that we had used some of our icbms to degrade russia ' s air defenses before our bombers got there .	118.368965
the aircraft could be used to destroy other mobile , fleeting , and imprecisely located targets as well as the known , fixed and hardened targets which can also be destroyed by missile .	80.314186
why , then , aren ' t we planning a larger , more important role for manned military aircraft ? ?	92.57105
is there any other way to do the job ? ?	24.06239
survivability of our strategic forces ( polaris , mobile and hardened minuteman , hardened atlas and titan , and airborne skybolt ) means that it will take some time , perhaps weeks , to destroy a strategic force .	55.933006
war , under these circumstances , cannot be one massive exchange of nuclear devastation .	175.23128
forces will survive a surprise attack , and these forces will give depth , or considerable duration , to the conflict .	122.39953
the forces which survive the initial attack must be found and destroyed .	24.021421
even mobile forces must be found and destroyed .	2.2046573
but , how does one go about the job of finding and destroying mobile forces ? ?	108.026375
they are not susceptible to wholesale destruction by ballistic missile .	10.182743
some day , many years in the future , true spacecraft will be able to find and destroy mobile targets .	51.240955
but until we have an effective spacecraft , the answer to the hunter-killer problem is manned aircraft .	78.10322
however , the aircraft which we have today are tied to large , `` soft ' ' airfields .	109.92288
here then is our problem aircraft are vital to winning a war today because they can perform those missions which a missile is totally incapable of performing	130.28456
but the airfield , on which the aircraft is completely dependent , is doomed by the missile .	81.46094
this makes today ' s aircraft a one-shot , or one mission , weapon .	147.89117
aircraft are mighty expensive if you can use them only once .	131.77022
this is the point on which so many people have written off the aircraft in favor of the missile .	68.302414
but remember this -- it isn ' t the aircraft which is vulnerable to nuclear rockets , it is the airfield .	86.304276
eliminate the vulnerability of aircraft on the ground and you have essentially eliminated its vulnerability to long-range ballistic missiles .	80.050026
there are four rather obvious ways to reduce or eliminate the vulnerability of aircraft on the ground	28.465937
put aircraft in `` bomb-proof ' ' hangars when they are on the ground .	23.41257
build long-range aircraft which can take off from small ( 3 , 000-foot ) airfields with runways .	55.097626
if we could use all the small airfields we have in this country , we could disperse our strategic aircraft by a factor of 10 or more .	56.285206
use nuclear propulsions to keep our long-range military aircraft in the air for the majority of their useful life .	55.29281
using very high thrust-to-weight ratio engines , develop a vertical-takeoff-and-landing ( vtol ) long-range military aircraft .	13.1851635
we have the technology today with which to build aircraft shelters which could withstand at least 200 aj .	88.910675
we could put a portion of our strategic bombers in such shelters .	53.027763
large , long-range bombers can be developed which would have the capability to take off from 3 , 000-foot runways , but they would require more powerful engines than we have today .	59.003746
there is little enthusiasm for spending money to develop more powerful engines because of the erroneous belief that the aircraft has been made obsolete by the missile .	80.433685
this same preoccupation with missiles at the expense of aircraft has resulted in our half-hearted effort to develop nuclear propulsion for aircraft .	60.109337
one seldom hears the analogy `` nuclear propulsion will do for the aircraft what it has already done for the submarine ' ' .	51.861935
if , for some reason such as economy , we are not going to develop aircraft nuclear propulsion with a sense of national urgency , then we should turn our effort to developing jet engines with a thrust-to-weight ratio of 12 or 15 to one .	48.053143
with powerplants such as these , vertical takeoff and landing combat aircraft could be built .	70.10017
for example , a 12-to-one engine would power a supersonic vtol fighter .	13.168303
with a 15-to-one engine , a supersonic aircraft weighing 300 , 000 pounds could rise vertically .	66.18819
the reason that we are not going ahead full speed to develop high thrust-to-weight engines is that it would cost perhaps a billion dollars -- and you don ' t spend that sort of money if aircraft are obsolete .	67.525764
when aircraft are no longer helpless on airfields , they are no longer vulnerable to aj .	40.733612
if our sac bombers were , today , capable of surviving a surprise missile attack and because of infinite dispersion or long endurance had the capability to strike at russia again , and again , and again , those bombers would unquestionably assure our military dominance .	144.90736
we would have the means to seek out and destroy the enemy ' s force -- whether it were fixed or mobile .	48.035583
with such a force of manned bombers we could bring enormous pressure to bear on an enemy , and this pressure would be selective and extremely discriminating .	72.688446
no need to kill an entire city and all its people because we lacked the precision and reconnaissance to selectively disarm the enemy ' s military force .	38.579292
our first necessity , at the very outset of war , is post-attack reconnaissance .	65.18929
in a few years we will have samos ( semiautomatic missile observation system ) .	46.4769
but in the case of moving targets , and targets which have limited mobility , what will their location be when it is time to destroy them ? ?	85.6645
what targets have we successfully knocked out ? ?	1.0741538
a ballistic missile cannot , today , tell you if it was successful or unsuccessful .	97.95231
what targets still remain to be hit ? ?	1.0164825
these crucial questions must be answered by post-attack reconnaissance .	121.98288
samos will be hard put to see through clouds -- and to see in the dark .	51.099155
even if this is some day possible , there remains the 30-minute time of flight of a missile to its overseas target .	88.85507
if the target can change its position significantly during the 30 minutes the missile is in the air on its way , the probability of the missile destroying the target is drastically reduced .	53.333534
pre-attack reconnaissance is vital but only post-attack reconnaissance will allow us to terminate the war favorably .	25.147293
it would be priceless to have an aircraft to gather that post-attack reconnaissance .	93.87598
it could operate under the clouds and perform infrared photography through clouds and at night .	42.564594
it would be even more valuable because that same aircraft could immediately destroy any targets it discovered -- no need to wait for a missile to come all the way from the united states with the chance that the target , if it were mobile , would be gone .	107.71852
a large aircraft , such as the b-52 or b-70 , could carry perhaps 50 or 100 small nuclear weapons .	87.96098
few people realize that one kiloton of nuclear explosive power will create 1 , 000 psi overpressure at 100 feet .	46.894814
or put another way , the hardest missile site planned today could be destroyed by placing a one-kiloton warhead ( 1/20th the size of those used in hiroshima and nagasaki ) within 100 to 200 feet of the target ! !	62.471546
it is our lack of extreme accuracy which forces the use of very large yield nuclear weapons .	102.98825
today we have side-looking radar which has such high resolution that the radar picture clearly shows individual buildings , runways , taxi-ways , separate spans of bridges , etc . .	114.4213
with these keen `` eyes ' ' and small nuclear weapons delivered with accuracy , military forces can be directly attacked with minimum damage to urban areas .	170.96315
if we fail to develop the means to hunt down and destroy the enemy ' s military force with extreme care and precision , and if war comes in spite of our most ardent desires for peace , our choice of alternatives will be truly frightening .	73.91252
the lyric beauties of schubert ' s trout quintet -- its elemental rhythms and infectious melodies -- make it a source of pure pleasure for almost all music listeners .	77.759224
but for students of musical forms and would-be classifiers , the work presents its problems .	40.402786
since it requires only five players , it would seem to fall into the category of chamber music -- yet it calls for a double bass , an instrument generally regarded as symphonic .	90.831276
moreover , the piece is written in five movements , rather than the conventional four of most quintets , and this gives the opus a serenade or divertimento flavor .	61.86418
the many and frequent performances of the trout serve to emphasize the dual nature of its writing .	73.62349
some renditions are of symphonic dimensions , with the contrabass given free rein .	68.70311
other interpretations present the music as an essentially intimate creation .	81.14587
in these readings , the double bass is either kept discreetly in the background , or it is dressed in clown ' s attire -- the musical equivalent of a bull in a china shop .	62.382484
recently i was struck anew by the divergent approaches , when in the course of one afternoon and evening i listened to no fewer than ten different performances .	146.25407
the occasion for this marathon angel ' s long-awaited reissue in its `` great recordings of the century ' ' series of the schnabel-pro arte version .	41.673275
let me say at the outset that the music sounded as sparkling on the last playing as it did on the first .	102.69554
whether considered alone or in relation to other editions , colh 40 is a document of prime importance .	141.8339
artur schnabel was one of the greatest schubert-beethoven-mozart players of all time , and any commentary of his on this repertory is valuable .	117.848076
but schnabel was a great teacher in addition to being a great performer , and the fact that four of the ten versions i listened to are by schnabel pupils ( clifford curzon , frank glazer , adrian aeschbacher , and victor babin ) also sheds light on the master ' s pedagogical skills .	49.24073
certain pianistic traits are common to all five schnabelian renditions , most notably the `` schnabel trill ' ' ( which differs from the conventional trill in that the two notes are struck simultaneously ) .	82.33479
but the most impressive testimony to schnabel ' s distinction as a teacher is reflected by the individuality which marks each student ' s approach as distinctly his own .	128.92976
schnabel ' s emphasis on structural clarity , his innate rhythmic vibrancy , and impetuous intensity all tend to stamp his reading as a symphonic one .	68.895195
yet no detail was too small to receive attention from this master , and as a result the playing here has humor , delicacy , and radiant humanity .	65.884575
this is a serious-minded interpretation , but it is never strait-laced .	17.75416
and although schnabel ' s pianism bristles with excitement , it is meticulously faithful to schubert ' s dynamic markings and phrase indications .	61.745884
the piano performance on this trout is one that really demands a search for superlatives .	192.95517
about the pro arte ' s contribution i am less happy .	133.35045
i , for one , rather regret that schnabel didn ' t collaborate with the budapest quartet , whose rugged , athletic playing was a good deal closer to this pianist ' s interpretative outlook than the style of the belgian group .	63.291336
from a technical standpoint , the string playing is good , but the pro arte people fail to enter into the spirit of things here .	40.86851
the violinist , in particular , is very indulgent with swoops and slides , and his tone is pinched and edgy .	47.95539
the twenty-five-year-old recording offers rather faded string tone , but the balance between the instruments is good and the transfer is very quiet .	96.6004
there is a break in continuity just before the fourth variation in the `` forellen ' ' movement , and i suspect that this is due to imperfect splicing between sides of the original aj .	37.608986
turning to the more modern versions , curzon ' s ( london ) offers the most sophisticated keyboard work .	41.517944
every detail in his interpretation has been beautifully thought out , and of these i would especially cite the delicious laendler touch the pianist brings to the fifth variation ( an obvious indication that he is playing with viennese musicians ) , and the gossamer shading throughout .	106.38475
some of curzon ' s playing strikes me as finicky , however .	71.14269
why , for example , does he favor two tempos , rather than one , for the third movement ? ?	82.78263
the assisting musicians from the vienna octet are somewhat lacking in expertise , but their contribution is rustic and appealing .	110.984566
( special compliments to the double bass playing of johann krumpp his scrawny , tottering sound adds a delightful hilarity to the performance .	26.59213
the glazer-fine arts edition ( concert-disc ) is a model of lucidity and organization .	27.698156
it is , moreover , a perfectly integrated ensemble effort .	80.248955
but having lived with the disc for some time now , i find the performance less exciting than either schnabel ' s or fleisher ' s ( whose superb performance with the budapest quartet has still to be recorded ) and a good deal less filled with humor than curzon ' s .	82.46548
aeschbacher ' s work is very much akin to schnabel ' s , but the sound on his decca disc is dated , and you will have a hard time locating a copy of it .	55.996895
the hephzibah menuhin-amadeus quartet ( angel ) and victor babin-festival quartet ( rca victor ) editions give us superlative string playing ( both in symphonic style ) crippled by unimaginative piano playing .	42.040947
( babin has acquired some of schnabel ' s keyboard manner , but his playing is of limited insight .	103.611206
) badura-skoda-vienna konzerthaus ( westminster ) and demus-schubert quartet ( deutsche grammophon ) are both warm-toned , pleasantly lyrical , but rather slack and tensionless .	23.98979
helmut roloff , playing with a group of musicians from the bayreuth ensemble , gives a sturdy reading , in much the same vein as that of the last-mentioned pianists .	96.98648
telefunken has accorded him beautiful sound , and this bargain-priced disc ( it sells for $2 . 98 ) is worthy of consideration .	106.39242
returning once again to the schnabel reissue , i am beguiled anew by the magnificence of this pianist ' s musical penetration .	33.070374
here is truly a `` great recording of the century ' ' , and its greatness is by no means diminished by the fact that it is not quite perfect .	22.767918
this recording surely belongs in everyone ' s collection .	190.58472
from the beginning of commercial recording , new discs purported to be indistinguishable from the real thing have regularly been put in circulation .	94.25576
seen in perspective , many of these releases have a genuine claim to be milestones .	67.95964
although lacking absolute verisimilitude , they supply the ear and the imagination with all necessary materials for re-creation of the original .	88.20211
on the basis of what they give us we can know how the young caruso sang , appreciate the distinctive qualities of parsifal under karl muck ' s baton , or sense the type of ensemble toscanini created in his years with the new york philharmonic .	54.143658
since the concept of high fidelity became important some dozen years ago , the claims of technical improvements have multiplied tenfold .	116.053986
in many cases the revolutionary production has offered no more than sensational effects the first hearing was fascinating and the second disillusioning as the gap between sound and substance became clearer .	86.772415
other innovations with better claims to musical interest survived rehearing to acquire in time the status of classics .	138.53815
if we return to them today , we have no difficulty spotting their weaknesses but we find them still pleasing .	152.33398
records sound like records because they provide a different sort of experience than live music .	91.238235
this difference is made up of many factors .	7.297425
some of them are obvious , such as the fact that we associate recorded and live music with our responses and behavior in different types of environments and social settings .	106.60854
( music often sounds best to me when i can dress informally and sit in something more comfortable than a theatre seat .	113.56736
) from the technical standpoint , records differ from live music to the degree that they fail to convey the true color , texture , complexity , range , intensity , pulse , and pitch of the original .	73.03591
any alteration of one of these factors is distortion , although we generally use that word only for effects so pronounced that they can be stated quantitatively on the basis of standard tests .	121.77343
yet it is the accumulation of distortion , the fitting together of fractional bits until the total reaches the threshold of our awareness , that makes records sound like records .	207.38423
but if you know the real thing , you know that what you are hearing is only a clever imitation .	103.758934
command ' s new brahms second is a major effort to make a record that sounds like a real orchestra rather than a copy of one .	66.65488
like the recent scheherazade from london ( high fidelity , sept . 1961 ) , it is successful because emphasis has been placed on good musical and engineering practices rather than on creating sensational effects .	73.82446
because of this , only those with truly fine equipment will be able to appreciate the exact degree of the engineers ' triumph .	57.90513
the easiest way to describe this release is to say that it reproduces an interesting and effective steinberg performance with minimal alteration of its musical values .	75.7634
the engineering as such never obtrudes upon your consciousness .	101.58568
the effect of the recording is very open and natural , with the frequency emphasis exactly what you would expect from a live performance .	110.53938
this absence of peaky highs and beefed-up bass not only produces greater fidelity , but it eliminates listener fatigue .	139.66167
a contributing factor is the perspective , the uniform aesthetic distance which is maintained .	187.36774
the orchestra is far enough away from you that you miss the bow scrapes , valve clicks , and other noises incidental to playing .	31.141903
yet you feel the orchestra is near at hand , and the individual instruments have the same firm presence associated with listening from a good seat in an acoustically perfect hall .	142.14542
command has achieved the ideal amount of reverberation .	5.6171274
the music is always allowed the living space needed to attain its full sonority	126.928215
yet the hall never intrudes as a quasi-performer .	11.185728
the timbre remains that of the instruments unclouded by resonance .	30.244068
all of this would be wasted , of course , if the performance lacked authority and musical distinction .	98.891396
for me it has more of both elements than the majority of its competitors .	54.333893
steinberg seems to have gone directly back to the score , discounting tradition , and has built his performance on the intention to reproduce as faithfully as possible exactly what brahms set down on paper .	157.5528
those accustomed to broader , more romantic statements of the symphony can be expected to react strongly when they hear this one .	76.77357
without losing the distinctive undertow of brahmsian rhythm , the pacing is firm and the over-all performance has a tightly knit quality that makes for maximum cumulative effect .	118.210915
the presto ma non assai of the first trio of the scherzo is taken literally and may shock you , as the real allegro con spirito of the finale is likely to bring you to your feet .	49.020267
in the end , however , the thing about this performance that is most striking is the way it sings .	134.88232
steinberg obviously has concluded that it is the lyric element which must dominate in this score , and he manages at times to create the effect of the whole orchestra bursting into song .	95.548706
the engineering provides exactly the support needed for such a result .	31.575602
too many records seem to reduce a work of symphonic complexity to a melody and its accompaniment .	75.31857
the command technique invites you to listen to the depth of the orchestration .	22.10486
your ear takes you into the ensemble , and you may well become aware of instrumental details which previously were apparent only in the score .	141.884
it is this sort of experience that makes the concept of high fidelity of real musical significance for the home music listener .	175.10382
the first substantially complete stereo giselle ( and the only one of its scope since feyer ' s four-sided lp edition of 1958 for angel ) , this set is , i ' m afraid , likely to provide more horrid fascination than enjoyment .	67.00302
the already faded pastel charms of the naive music itself vanish entirely in fistoulari ' s melodramatic contrasts between ultravehement brute power and chilly , if suave , sentimentality .	84.66228
and in its engineers ' frantic attempts to achieve maximum dynamic impact and earsplitting brilliance , the recording sounds as though it had been `` doctored for super-high fidelity ' ' .	48.943226
the home listener is overpowered , all right , but the experience is a far from pleasant one .	88.058815
as with the penultimate giselle release ( wolff ' s abridgment for rca victor ) i find the cleaner , less razor-edged monophonic version , for all its lack of big-stage spaciousness , the more aurally tolerable -- but this may be the result of processing defects in my sd copies .	51.350945
at the westminster kc dog show in madison square garden , new york on the second day , the finals of the junior class brought out the most competitive competition in the history of this class .	42.085403
the class had entries from as far west as wisconsin and as far south as kentucky .	96.0603
this year several entries from canada were entered which made the junior class international .	279.84286
