forty-six of the 53 juniors who mailed in entries were present .	98.13398
it was interesting to note that many of these juniors were showing dogs in various other classes at the show prior to the finals of the junior class .	57.033848
as has been the custom for the past several years , john cross , jr . , bench show chmn . of westminster , arranged for the juniors ' meeting before the class , and invited two speakers from the dog world to address them .	104.57327
over 60 juniors , parents and guests attended .	22.208313
mrs . william h . long , jr . speaks	130.47852
after the juniors were welcomed and congratulated for qualifying for the finals of the junior class , mrs . william h . long , jr . was introduced as the first speaker .	17.686638
in her opening remarks mrs . long also welcomed the juniors and stated , `` there isn ' t any other show quite like westminster .	66.71975
i know because this is my 37th year with hardly a break .	318.94644
mrs . long still feels the same unique spirit of westminster which she stated the present juniors will experience today but probably will not appreciate in full for a number of years .	154.96991
twenty years ago her daughter betsey long , then 13 years of age , won the grand challenge trophy , children ' s handling class ( as they were called then ) at westminster .	135.36401
no sooner had betsey come out of the ring than mrs . long walked into the working competition with ch . cadet or noranda , another home-bred product , and won ! !	177.25746
speaking from long years of experience , mrs . long advised the juniors `` when showing dogs ceases to be fun and excitement , stop ! !	103.480705
dogs have a way of sensing our feelings ! !	14.97358
when you and your dog step into the junior ring , it should be just what the dog wants to do as much as what you want him to do .	63.47773
if you walk into the ring because it is fun to show your dog , he will feel it and give you a good performance ! !	59.31441
he knows your signals , what is expected of him and the way the class is conducted , right up through the flash-bulbs of the photographers ' ' .	78.08062
`` take away your attitude ' ' , said mrs . long , `` and what have you left ? ?	39.508263
either a nervous dog because you are livid with rage -- a sure sign that you are taking things too seriously and had better stop ! !	174.71873
or a bored dog because you are more interested in something else -- maybe the way you look , or the date you have after the class , or you are just doing this to please the parents .	81.463455
`` the reason you are in the ring today is to show your ability to present to any judge the most attractive picture of your dog that the skillful use of your aids can produce .	150.3656
aids sounds more like a pony club , or horsemanship classes -- riding a horse and showing a dog are very similar ! !	175.54472
`` your aids are your attitude , which comes through your voice , your hands and legs -- voice to encourage , discourage or whatever the need may be	102.89445
legs to produce motion and rate of speed .	7.4574723
without right attitude the other aids just do not work right ' ' .	39.85932
mrs . long wished all the juniors luck in the class and stated , `` have fun ! !	66.64566
and may you all continue to show at westminster in the years to come ' ' ! !	34.440178
the second speaker was harvey barcus , president of the dog writers ass ' n of america .	116.90628
mr . barcus spoke on the subject of scholarships for juniors -- with which he is very familiar .	102.33542
last year a boy he knows and helped in journalism won the thoroughbred racing ass ' n scholarship which is worth $10 , 000 .	128.33699
he gave a resume of the steps taken in order for the boy he sponsored to win the scholarship .	113.2765
`` junior showmanship is an extremely worthy project and should be earnestly encouraged ' ' ! !	80.25011
is one of mr . barcus ' strong beliefs .	79.23438
he feels very forcibly that the american kennel club should take a more active part in encouraging the junior division ! !	120.08151
in closing , mr . barcus also wished all the juniors luck in their class .	25.767563
instead of 3 a . m . in the past , the juniors class at westminster was held at 4 45 p . m . .	23.71797
this gave the juniors the use of the entire ring at the show -- a great advantage to them ! !	118.43779
before the juniors entered the ring the steward announced that after all juniors had moved their dogs around the ring and set them up , they could relax with their dogs .	72.67351
from there on , each junior was going to be judged individually .	31.66823
this thoughtful gesture was well received by the juniors as the class had an entry of 46 juniors and it took approximately one hour , 45 minutes to judge the class .	100.55558
this year anne hone rogers , outstanding handler , judged the class .	83.81118
this is the third time in 28 years of junior showmanship at westminster that a lady handler has judged the class .	99.2324
as the juniors entered the ring , mr . spring , the announcer , stated over the public-address system that this was the 28th year that westminster has held the finals of the junior competition .	90.46667
juniors competed last year at american kennel club and canadian kennel club , recognized shows to be eligible to compete in this class -- the finals for the year .	36.06095
a junior who won two or more wins in the open class was eligible .	119.20005
( the purpose of the junior showmanship competition is to teach and encourage juniors to become good sportsmen .	50.195038
many adults showing at westminster today are products of this class .	72.96556
it seemed an almost impossible job for miss rogers to select 4 winners from the 46 juniors entered .	89.44766
a large number of these juniors have 7 and 8 wins to their credit and are seasoned campaigners .	34.45653
after the judge moved all the dogs individually , she selected several from the group and placed them in the center of the ring .	60.297367
she then went over them thoroughly giving each a strenuous test in showmanship .	288.20938
betty lou ham , age 16 , holyoke , mass . , showing an irish setter , was chosen as international champion of the year .	30.47392
she was awarded the professional handlers ' ass ' ns ' leonard brumby , sr . memorial trophy ( named for the founder-originator of the junior classes .	29.30163
betty is 16 years of age and had several wins to her credit last year .	108.04672
in addition to showing an irish setter throughout the year , she also scored with an afghan .	49.8658
sydney le blanc , age 15 , staten island , n . y . , showing a doberman pinscher , was 2nd .	10.90971
susan hackmann , age 14 , from baltimore , md . , showing a dachshund , was 3rd .	15.129452
last year susan also placed 3rd in the finals at westminster .	26.532581
from the records we keep -- susan is the only junior who has placed in the junior classes in both united states and canada .	34.712914
karen marcmann , age 16 , trapp , penna . , showing a keeshond was 4th .	71.23774
most juniors who were entered in the finals are seasoned campaigners and not only show and win in junior classes but score in the breed classes as well .	139.49008
in 1960 , there were 7287 entries in the junior classes .	11.944813
each year these shows have increased in entries .	18.056768
next year 1962 , at westminster , the bench show committee has raised the requirements so that a junior must win 3 or more junior classes in the open division only to qualify for westminster .	176.68472
percy roberts , a leading judge will not be at the international show this year for the junior judging contest as he has been invited to judge in australia in march .	57.568256
it has been suggested many times that a class be set up for the juniors who are overage and cannot enter the junior classes .	67.39137
for some time this writer has been suggesting a junior judging class for intermediates over 16 and under 20 years of age who are ineligible to compete in the junior class .	75.46493
such a class was tried out successfully at the westchester kc show recently .	193.56438
not only were the contestants pleased with the class , but it aroused the interest of all in attendance that day .	61.14557
the intermediates in the class with the judge were asked to pick 4 winners and give their reasons but their decisions did not affect the choice of the judge .	76.12509
we suggested this class in the horse world and it was accepted immediately and included in the programs of horse shows .	149.37625
at the recent horse show convention in new york it was stated that this intermediate judging class is meeting with great success and will be a great help to future judges in the horse world .	60.339645
this class can be just as successful in the dog world if it is given a chance .	58.477924
last year robert harris , a leading junior handler entered the dog judging contest ( junior ) at the international kc of chicago show and had the highest score in judging of any junior since the class ' inception .	102.179924
juniors who attend this chicago show should make a point to enter this class as it would be of great help to them .	61.98004
superintendents at dog shows state it is becoming more difficult to obtain a licensed handler to judge junior showmanship competition .	53.659054
the founder of the junior showmanship competition the late leonard brumby , sr . ( for whom the trophy is named after at westminster ) was an outstanding handler and believed a junior should have an opportunity to exhibit in a dog show starting with the junior showmanship division .	91.78954
some years ago this class was judged by celebrities who knew nothing of what was required of a junior ' s ability to show a dog .	52.943066
to overcome this unfair judging , the a . k . c . requires that a licensed handler be present to judge the class .	48.384304
if the superintendents do not receive more cooperation from handlers , it has been suggested that licensed judges also be qualified to judge this class .	61.123795
by recognizing and helping juniors get interested in the dog world , all will be helping to create future dog owners .	103.80229
the airedale terrier club of america and the kerry blue terrier club of america have under consideration donating trophies to the boys or girls who win with their breeds in junior showmanship competition at any show .	66.872986
the kansas city and the topeka kcs are arranging that juniors who win at their shows will be qualified to win points for westminster .	136.43051
the rio grande kc is also considering having their junior classes set up so that juniors can qualify with points for westminster .	150.47986
the american pointer club is still continuing to donate trophies to juniors who win at junior showmanship classes with pointers .	51.15244
traveling through the south -- over 16 , 000 miles -- with two great danes , an afghan , and a persian kitten , we ' ve worked up a regular routine for acceptance at motels .	79.442
my husband enters the motel office , signs up for a room , and then solemnly asks the proprieter if he accepts pets .	48.002544
`` no ' ' , he replies , `` full grown , adult show dogs , housebroken , and obedience-trained ' ' .	44.54039
once settled , we ' re careful to walk the dogs in an out of the way spot , keep them under control in the room , and feed and bench them where they can ' t do any harm to the furnishings or the furniture .	83.78685
in the morning we leave the room looking as neat as a pin ! !	109.88268
many a motel owner -- when we ' ve stopped there again -- has remembered us and has said he preferred our dogs to most children .	153.35922
so many times i have wondered why veterinarians do not wipe the table clean before each new canine patient is placed on it for examination .	132.93999
is it that they don ' t care ? ?	6.9617248
are they indifferent to the fact that the dog can easily pick up germs from the preceding patient ? ?	76.43867
at one time , to most americans , unless they were fortunate enough to live near a body of navigable water , boats were considered the sole concern of fishermen , rich people , and the united states navy .	80.55962
today the recreational boating scene is awash with heartening statistics which prove the enormous growth of that sport .	100.78378
there are more than 8 , 000 , 000 recreational boats in use in the united states with almost 10 , 000 , 000 the prediction for within the next decade .	54.538734
about 40 , 000 , 000 people participated in boating in 1960 .	43.489773
boating has become a giant whose strides cover the entire nation from sea to shining sea .	28.882267
boats are operated in every state in the union , with the heaviest concentrations along both coasts and in the middle west .	65.96942
the spectacular upsurge in pleasure boating is markedly evident , expectedly , in the areas where boats have always been found the natural lakes , rivers , and along the nation ' s coastline .	51.63387
but during the last several years boats were launched in areas where , a short time ago , the only water to be found was in wells and watering troughs for livestock .	80.44976
developed as a result of the multi-purpose resources control program of the government , vast , man-made bodies of water represent a kind of glorious fringe benefit , providing boating and fishing havens all over the country .	91.68036
no matter how determined or wealthy boating lovers of the southwest had been , for example , they could never have created anything approaching the fifty square-mile lake texoma , located between texas and oklahoma , which resulted when the corp of army engineers dammed the red river .	70.14533
in 1959 , according to the engineers , lake texoma was only one of thirty-two artificial lakes and reservoirs which were used for recreation by over 1 , 000 , 000 persons .	64.93304
where an opportunity to enjoy boating has not been created by bringing bodies of water to the people , means have been found to take the people and their boats to the water .	65.05281
providing these means are about ninety companies which manufactured the estimated 1 , 800 , 000 boat trailers now in use .	68.36899
it is a simple task to haul a boat fifty or one hundred miles to a lake or reservoir on the new , light , strong , easy-to-operate trailers which are built to accommodate almost any kind of small boat and retail from $100 to $2 , 000 .	80.98695
the sight of sleek inboards , outboards , and sailboats being wheeled smartly along highways many miles from any water is commonplace .	165.44807
boatmen lucky enough to have facilities for year- ' round anchorage for their craft , will recall the tedious procedure of loading their gear into the car , driving to the water , and making trip after trip to transfer the gear to the boat .	89.91747
today , the boat , on its trailer , is brought to the gear and loaded at the door .	46.167435
arriving at the waterside , the boat is launched , the family taken aboard and , that easily , another day afloat is begun .	201.11087
and trailers for boats are not what they started out to be ten years ago .	38.14315
this year , americans will discover previously unheard of refinements in trailers that will be exhibited in about one hundred of our nation ' s national , regional and local boat shows .	74.69735
the boats of america ' s trailer sailors in 1961 will be coddled on clouds as they are hauled to new horizons .	69.66786
the variety of craft on the country ' s waters today is overwhelming .	74.487076
they range from an eight-foot pram , which you can build yourself for less than $50 , to auxiliary sailboats which can cost over $100 , 000 .	46.321087
boat prices vary according to the buyer ' s desires or needs .	105.98067
in this respect , boats can be compared with houses .	112.69523
there is no limit to what you can spend , yet it is easily possible to keep within a set budget .	143.82735
there is no question as to just what is available .	33.540718
you name it , our industry is producing it , and it probably is made in different models .	81.64496
there are canoes ideal for fishing in protected waters or for camping trips .	21.842957
there are houseboats which are literally homes afloat , accommodating whole families in comfort and convenience .	122.00812
you can cross an ocean in a fully equipped craft , sail , power , or both , or laze away a fine day in a small dinghy on a local pond .	112.013176
you may have your boat of wood , canvas , plywood , plastic , or metal .	37.855053
you may order utility models , inboard or outboard , with or without toilets , galleys , and bunks .	50.581066
you may dress it up with any number of accessories or keep it as simple as you choose .	79.562546
designers and manufacturers have produced models for purchasers who run the gamut from a nautical version of the elderly pasadena lady who never drove more than five miles an hour on her once-a-month ride around the block , to the sportiest boatman who insists on all the dash , color , flair and speed possible to encompass in a single boat .	96.26904
you pay your money and you take your choice .	29.020655
american technology in engine and hull design is largely responsible for the plentiful interest in american boating .	117.98065
i wonder if anyone ever bothered to make the point that when it comes to boats and their motors , americans excel over any country in the world in the long run .	76.92259
russia , whose technology is not quite primitive , is still in the dark ages when it comes to improving the outboard motor , for instance .	53.730736
the outboard engine of today has a phenomenal range of one to 80 horsepower , unheard of a few years ago for a two cycle engine in quantity production .	84.91643
these engines can be removed from a boat with relative ease , wherein lies their greatest advantage .	374.0457
their cost is not beyond the hopes of the american pocketbook , the range being about $150 to $1 , 000 , depending on size .	68.06995
great thought has been given to making life easier for the growing boating population of the country	117.2182
and to making the owning of a boat simpler .	263.55478
there was a time when , if a man wanted to purchase a boat , it was necessary for him to be able to produce a sizeable amount of cash before he could touch the tiller or wheel .	33.807514
having a boat financed through a local bank is done much the same way as an automobile loan is extended .	116.53944
marine dealers and even some manufacturers who sell direct in non-dealer areas cooperate in enabling you to launch now and pay later .	326.9511
terms range from one to five years and the interest rates and down payments run about the same as for automobiles .	201.59535
of course , individual financing arrangements depend a good deal on the purchaser ' s earning power , credit rating and local bank policy .	42.040356
outboard motors , insurance , and boat repairs may also be financed in the same way as boats .	25.45107
terms and rates of interest for motors generally follow those for home appliances .	80.72501
when the automobile was in its embryonic stage , such roads as existed were pretty much open roads with the tacit understanding that horses should not be unduly terrified being about the only rule governing where , when and how fast a car could go .	184.82703
when air travel was in its infancy , the sky was considered big enough and high enough for all .	100.541145
man had enough to worry about managing to get up there and stay without being burdened with rules once aloft .	167.83902
it was much the same with pleasure boating at first .	61.04675
come one , come all , the water ' s fine ! !	20.15101
as the ungoverned days of the automobile and the airplane are long since relegated to the past , so is the carefree attitude toward what a boatman may and may not do	139.49327
however , there is a minimum of legislative restriction on boating .	53.82023
laws on boating vary according to the state in which the craft is to be used and according to its horsepower .	44.3143
what may be acceptable in one state may be strictly prohibited across the boundary line .	47.97728
the main requirement is to be sure the boat is numbered according to the regulations of the state in which the boat will be principally used .	68.35937
if your state has no provisions for the numbering of pleasure boats , you must apply for a number from the u . s . coast guard for any kind of boat with mechanical propulsion rated at more than 10 horsepower before it can be used on federal waterways .	55.6261
state numbering laws differ from each other in many ways .	38.225613
fees are not the same and some states do not require certain craft , such as sailboats with no power , to be registered at all .	68.47329
many states have laws regulating the use of boat trailers and some have restrictions regarding the age of motor boat operators .	132.59578
generally , states reserve for communities the right to have local ordinances regulating speed and other activities .	82.73745
it is always wise to consult your marine dealer , local yacht or boat club secretary , or local law enforcement officers if you are not positive what the regulations are .	174.16493
ignorance of the law is no better excuse on the water than it is on land	142.67365
lack of ability and common sense can lead to just as much tragedy .	85.70875
hand in hand with the legislative program is the industry ' s self originated and directed safety program .	93.18448
foreseeing the possible threats to safety with the rapid growth of the sport , the industry has been supporting an intense , coordinated educational program with great success since 1947 .	65.6628
a primary factor in the success of the safety program has been the enthusiastic cooperation of the individual manufacturers .	67.5435
the industry has been its own watch dog .	13.969334
with u . s . coast guard cooperation , the american boat and yacht council was formed to develop recommended practices and standards for boats and their equipment with reference to safety .	102.597404
in 1959 , the yacht safety bureau was reorganized by the national association of engine and boat manufacturers and a group of insurance underwriters to provide a testing laboratory and labeling service for boats and their equipment .	52.69188
a new waterfront site for the bureau is now being built at atlantic city , new jersey , to provide the most modern marine testing facilities as a further tool to keep the sport safe .	82.7453
in addition to these activities , the naebm , with headquarters at 420 lexington avenue , new york city , as well as other associations and individual manufacturers , provide and distribute films , booklets , and public services in regard to proper boat handling and safety afloat .	67.12837
it is important to note the work of the united states power squadrons and the u . s . coast guard auxiliary .	21.086979
each of these fine groups gives free boating classes in seamanship piloting and small boat handling .	99.10019
this year , over 100 , 000 persons will receive this free instruction .	160.65764
as america on wheels was responsible for an industry of motor courts , motels , and drive-in establishments where you can dine , see a movie , shop , or make a bank deposit , the ever-increasing number of boating enthusiasts have sparked industries designed especially to accommodate them .	61.528214
instead of motels , for the boatman there are marinas .	17.295685
the word marina was coined by naebm originally to describe a waterfront facility where recreational boats could find protection and basic needs to lay over in relative comfort .	117.52276
currently , marina is used to indicate a municipal or commercially operated facility where a pleasure boat may dock and find some or all of the following available gasoline , fresh water , electricity , telephone service , ice , repair facilities , restaurants , sleeping accommodations , a general store , and a grocery store .	71.38685
yachtel , a relatively new word , indicates a waterfront type of hotel where a yachtsman may dock and find overnight accommodations on the premises as well as other services .	69.81648
it indicates the same thing but it is meant to pertain more specifically to establishments designed to cater to smaller type boats such as outboards .	307.1152
regardless of nomenclature , yachtels and boatels are marinas .	42.823826
boatyards which also provide some of the above facilities may rightfully be called marinas .	152.73636
a recent survey disclosed there are about 4 , 000 commercially and municipally operated marinas and boatyards in the united states , the majority of which are equipped to handle outboard boats .	19.289223
the design of a mechanical interlocking frame is much like a mechanical puzzle , but once understood , the principles can be applied to any track and signal arrangement .	75.25184
in the frame are two sets of bars which interact with each other to prevent the operator from making dangerous moves .	89.68774
the main set of bars are the `` tappets ' ' and one tappet is connected to each lever .	32.344353
if the lever is pulled to clear a signal or move a switch , the tappet moves a short distance lengthwise at the same time .	49.166157
close behind the plane of the tappets are the locking bars .	7.585687
these can also move a short distance but at right angles to the tappets .	46.819893
the number of locking bars required depends on how many false moves must be prevented .	176.51303
in the sides of the tappets are notches with sloping sides , and connection between the tappets and locking bars consist of cams called `` dogs ' ' .	46.379997
two or more dogs are mounted on each locking bar .	34.631626
these slide into and out of the notches in the tappets as the tappets are moved , locking and unlocking them .	36.885242
here ' s how the scheme works suppose the operator pulls the lever to clear a particular signal .	28.543821
this also pulls the tappet connected to the particular lever and forces any dogs seated in the notches to the side , thus moving one or more locking bars .	134.27988
the dogs on the other ends of these locking bars are thus forced into notches in other tappets .	98.91946
by this scheme , pulling one signal to clear locks all the other switch and signal levers in safe positions until the first signal is again restored to normal .	232.77654
interlocking signals are normally at stop or `` red ' ' position , and a lever must be pulled to `` clear ' ' the signal .	49.883816
this is not necessarily to green , however , for in some situations only a yellow indication is given to a train to let it into the `` plant ' ' .	81.56919
a turnout may have two levers , one to actually move the switch points , the other to lock the points .	101.780106
a signal cannot be cleared until all the related turnouts are properly thrown and locked .	148.02727
such locks are nearly always used where the switch points `` face ' ' oncoming traffic .	68.9749
the lock insures that the points are thrown all the way with no chance that a wheel flange will snag on a partly thrown point .	78.69087
if the points aren ' t thrown all the way , the turnout cannot be locked , and in turn , the signal cannot be cleared .	43.596554
generally , these locks on turnouts are called `` facing point locks ' ' .	31.760574
figs . 1-6 show typical arrangements of track and signals .	34.969017
each diagram is accompanied by a `` dog chart ' ' , a list of the levers that show which other levers any particular lever will lock if pulled .	104.38705
the lines connecting the wedge-shaped dogs represent the locking bars at right angles to the tappet bars .	19.411568
by studying the track-signal diagrams you ' ll note several other details .	175.80508
derails -- mechanical track devices that actually guide the wheels off the rails if a train passes a `` stop ' ' signal -- are used in many instances .	57.786907
`` home ' ' signals have two blades .	8.462445
the blacked-in blades indicate a fixed aspect -- the blade does not move .	71.59247
as an engineer approaches the plant the position of the home signal is seen in advance when he passes the `` distant ' ' signal located beyond the limits of the interlocking plant .	52.977573
in some low-speed situations , the distant signal is fixed at caution .	37.50559
in other instances where there is no automatic block signaling , the distant has only green and yellow aspects .	285.0155
the interlocking frame we built at the model railroader workshop and then installed on paul larson ' s railroad follows the fig . 1 scheme and is shown beginning in fig . 7 , page 65 , and in the photos .	82.82251
here ' s how it can be built .	4.5296493
the sizes of pieces needed for the interlocking frame are shown in the notes within fig . 7 , most of the bars being 1/8 ' ' ' ' brass in 1/4 ' ' ' ' and 1/2 ' ' ' ' widths .	23.65409
you may change the dimensions to suit a frame for more or fewer levers and locks as you wish .	126.95255
our instructions assume you are building this particular frame , which is for a junction .	46.588272
when cutting the pieces , dress the ends smooth , and square with a smooth file or sanding disk .	88.22584
start with the right-hand piece `` b ' ' , af , soldering it to the lower piece `` a ' ' of the same material but 12 ' ' ' ' long .	30.360125
let exactly 1 ' ' ' ' of `` a ' ' extend beyond `` b ' ' and use a square to check your angle to exactly 90 degrees .	55.819504
now lay 12 pieces of af cut 5-3/4 ' ' ' ' long side by side but separated by 12 pieces of the same material 1/2 ' ' ' ' sq . .	32.279198
this gives you the spacing for locating the left-hand piece `` b ' ' .	23.431799
compress the assembly when you make the mark to show the location for `` b ' ' .	33.788746
solder this second `` b ' ' to `` a ' ' at right angles .	21.998669
there should be 10 ' ' ' ' between the two parallel members and each should be 1 ' ' ' ' from an end of the long piece .	54.368362
cap this assembly ( with spacing bars in place ) with a af bar .	13.821462
tack-solder all the 1/2 ' ' ' ' sq . pieces to the 10 ' ' ' ' and 12 ' ' ' ' members .	25.308893
these will be drilled and tapped later on .	560.09576
now cut five af locking bar spacers ( which run horizontally ) .	28.031149
position these using six intermediate temporary af spacers and locate the upper 12 ' ' ' ' bar `` a ' ' .	24.264957
solder it and the five locking bar spacers to the frame .	12.546707
now place 12 pieces 1/2 ' ' ' ' sq . on this edge as we did before and space them with the 5-3/4 ' ' ' ' long `` tappets ' ' , as they are called .	44.639038
cap with a af bar and tack-solder in place .	20.639801
cap the locking bar spacers with two af directly under the first two `` b ' ' pieces .	29.343916
mark and center-punch all the holes required for screws to hold this assembly together .	138.46161
placement of these holes is not critical , but they should be located so that the centers are about 1/8 ' ' ' ' from any edge .	48.990707
drill all no . 50 and counter-drill all except the `` a ' ' pieces size 43 .	95.31894
tap the `` a ' ' pieces 2-56 .	6.594331
now unsolder and disassemble the frame except for the two 12 ' ' ' ' and the first two 3-3/4 ' ' ' ' bars ( `` a ' ' and `` b ' ' pieces ) , which are soldered together .	28.699932
either lay the components aside in proper order or code them with numbers and letters so they may be replaced in their proper positions .	147.05786
dress all surfaces with a file , cleaning off all solder and drilling burrs .	52.70703
drill 20 no . 47 holes in the upper piece `` a ' ' as shown in fig . 7 .	26.948223
tap these 3-48 for mounting the electrical contact later on .	372.58936
note , 6 and 8 lock levers don ' t require holes for contacts .	35.512325
now reassemble the frame , using af roundhead steel screws and nuts .	60.90916
put the 12 tappets and some af locking bar spacers in the frame to help align all the components before you tighten the screws .	28.317955
be sure the tappets are not pinched by a twisted 1/2 ' ' ' ' sq . spacer .	12.634309
as an anchor for the spring lock , insert a af bar in the lower left corner of the frame as shown in fig . 7 .	20.443932
drill a no . 43 hole through the pieces and secure with a 2-56 nut and screw .	81.54146
drill two no . 50 holes , one in the insert and one in the locking bar spacer directly above it , and tap 2-56 .	48.531075
number all the tappet bars before removing them so they can be replaced in the same slots .	49.380325
remove all other loose pieces and file the edges of the basic frame smooth .	42.013924
cut five pieces of af brass bar stock 3-3/4 ' ' ' ' long .	4.6335306
these are supporting members for the short locking bars .	2.6642728
locate their positions in fig . 7 and drill no . 43 to match the corresponding holes in the frame .	46.05812
cut off excess screw lengths and file flush with either frame or nut .	61.85309
drill four no . 19 and four no . 28 holes in the 12 ' ' ' ' long `` a ' ' pieces .	19.831892
draw-file no . 1 tappet to a smooth fit in its respective slot and square the ends .	153.01408
break the end corners with a slight 45 degree chamfer .	28.040178
drill a no . 50 hole 1-1/4 ' ' ' ' from one end and tap 2-56 .	12.934914
) put a 2-56 roundhead screw into the hole , cut off the excess threads and file flush with the underside of the bar .	24.185581
to find the other stop screw position , insert the tappet into the frame and hold the screw head tight against the frame edge .	30.905544
scribe a line across the bar on the other end of the tappet , 1/4 ' ' ' ' plus half the diameter of the 2-56 screw head ( about 5/64 ' ' ' ' ) away from the frame edge .	26.13204
total distance is about 21/64 ' ' ' ' .	2.1481137
tend to make this dimension slightly undersize so you can file the screw head to get exactly 1/4 ' ' ' ' tappet movement .	54.95612
drill a no . 50 hole , tap 2-56 and insert a roundhead 2-56 screw as you did on the first end .	44.17642
drill a no . 47 hole crosswise through the tappet at the position shown in figs . 7 and 8 .	30.105556
repeat these drill and tap operations for each of the tappet bars .	6.723036
to each tappet except 6 and 8 , solder a af piece of brass and file to the tapered shape shown in figs . 6 and 8 .	38.483295
these will serve as lifting pads for the electrical contacts .	70.88462
fitting the locking bars and making the locking pieces is a rather tedious job since stop screws , tappets and locking bars must be removed and replaced many times .	86.71972
as the work progresses the frame and moving parts become a sort of chinese puzzle where several pieces must be removed before the part you are working on is accessible .	226.90695
a little extra work here will pay off with a smooth , snug-fitting machine when you are finished .	99.76625
each completed locking bar should remain in place as the work progresses to insure snug fitting .	23.288202
the order of fitting is not too important .	4.76517
however , we started with the first row of bars and worked our way back .	119.35162
since the same method of shaping and fitting the dogs and notches is used throughout , we will only describe the construction of one locking bar .	99.15568
figs . 7 and 8 give all pertinent dimensions .	25.66511
all the bars are cut from af brass .	6.9115763
the lengths of each piece are listed at the bottom of fig . 7 .	7.6437044
bar `` c ' ' is 2-3/4 ' ' ' ' long .	3.9161544
draw-file the edges , square up the ends and put a slight chamfer on the edges so they will not snag in the frame .	38.819
fig . 8 gives the dimensions for locating the dog-pin holes .	14.071543
center-punch and drill the no . 31 hole 7/16 ' ' ' ' from one end of the bar .	7.961965
chuck a length of 1/8 ' ' ' ' dia . drill rod into a drill press or some similar turning device and while it is rotating file the end square and then file a slight taper 1/8 ' ' ' ' long .	45.449673
cut the piece about 9/32 ' ' ' ' or 5/16 ' ' ' ' long and drive it into the no . 31 hole drilled in the locking bar .	33.373478
file the bottom edge flush with the bar and the top 1/8 ' ' ' ' above the bar .	12.927076
this dog will engage a notch to be cut in tappet 3 .	195.49683
place the locking bar in proper position and insert tappet 3 .	128.96887
scribe a line through the center of the pin and across the face of tappet 3 , parallel to piece `` a ' ' .	94.36269
see the drawings for the shape of the notch .	74.86612
scribe v-shaped lines on the bar and rough out with either a hack saw or a cutting disk in a hand power tool .	156.24257
we used the latter equipped with a carborundum disk about	69.287476
' ' thick and 1 ' ' ' ' dia . fitted on a 1/8 ' ' ' ' dia . mandrel .	14.481543
such disks are very handy for cutting and shaping small parts .	131.38925
a barrette swiss pattern file is handy since its triangular shape with only one cutting face will allow you to work a surface without marring an adjoining one .	129.4493
endeavor to get the notches as much alike as possible .	12.067046
the notch should have a smooth finish so that the steel dog will slide easily over it .	86.45156
assemble the parts in the frame and test the sliding action of the mating pieces .	73.72603
all matching surfaces should be checked frequently and mated on a cut and fit basis .	169.02069
chuck a 2 ' ' ' ' or 3 ' ' ' ' piece of 1/8 ' ' ' ' dia . drill rod in a drill press or electric hand tool .	17.417286
fashion a sharp scribing point about 3/64 ' ' ' ' long on one end , using swiss pattern files .	86.57606
this tool can also be made with a lathe .	22.612629
scientists say that the world and everything in it are based on mathematics .	120.86036
without math the men who are continually seeking the causes of and the reasons for the many things that make the world go ' round would not have any means of analyzing , standardizing , and communicating the things they discover and learn .	103.508446
math and the formulas that allow it to be applied to different problems are , therefore , essential to any scientific endeavor .	80.57691
it ' s not a science as involved as determining what makes the earth rotate on its axis or building a rocket or putting a satellite into orbit but it is , nevertheless , a science .	119.12897
but because science is based on mathematics doesn ' t mean that a hot rodder must necessarily be a mathematician .	19.902866
a guy can be an active and successful hot rodder for years without becoming even remotely involved with mathematical problems	124.02648
however , he will have a clearer understanding of what he is doing and the chances are he will be more successful if he understands the few formulas that apply to rodding .	110.47277
a mathematical formula is nothing more than a pattern for solving a specific problem .	108.67462
it places the various factors involved in the problem in their correct order in relation to each other so that the influence of factors on each other can be computed .	50.89766
the first step in using a formula is to insert the numerical values of the factors involved in their correct positions in the formula .	25.394941
this changes the formula to an `` equation ' ' .	1.9207246
the equation is used for the mathematical process of solving the problem .	12.290988
they involve only simple mathematics that are taught in grammar school arithmetic classes .	41.43477
however , it is essential that the various mathematical symbols used in the equations be understood so that the mathematical processes can be done properly and in their correct order .	54.17179
they indicate simple division , multiplication , subtraction , and addition .	15.307064
the symbol for division is a straight line that separates two numbers placed one above the other .	142.13599
the lower number is always divided into the upper number af	451.40082
the symbol for multiplication is `` **b ' ' .	2.8653057
it is used to separate two or more numbers in a row .	37.79766
numbers to be multiplied together may be multiplied in any order .	33.077293
the result will be the same regardless of the order used .	89.76252
the symbol for subtraction is the standard minus sign .	151.01697
the number on the right of the symbol is always subtracted from the number on the left of the symbol .	53.62532
when more than two figures are separated by subtraction symbols the subtraction must be carried out from the left to right if the result is to be correct .	49.93698
for example , for the problem af , 10 from 25 equals 15 , then 6 from 15 equals 9 .	123.318115
the symbol is used to separate two or more numbers .	11.8329735
numbers separated by addition symbols may be placed in any order .	33.138695
when solving an equation that involves division as well as other steps , do all the division steps first to reduce those parts of the equation to their numerical value .	105.39591
multiplication , subtraction , and addition can then be accomplished as they appear in the equation by starting at the left end of the equation and working toward the right .	56.654617
completing the division first also includes those division parts that require multiplication , subtraction , or addition steps af .	58.196327
this would be reduced by multiplying 8 times 6 and then dividing the product by 12 .	126.60145
this part of the equation would then become 4 .	180.18842
for use in formulas , fractions should be converted to their decimal equivalents .	17.273134
the easiest way to do this is with a conversion chart .	252.90111
charts for this purpose are available from many sources .	28.721157
they are included in all types of mathematical handbooks and they are stamped on some types of precision measuring instruments .	60.103775
the various mathematical processes can be simplified by carrying the results to only two or three decimal places .	110.23577
shortening the results in this manner will not have any detrimental effect on the accuracy of the final result .	37.39899
a constant is a number that remains the same regardless of the other numbers used in the formula and the resultant equation .	32.132767
it is a number without which the equation cannot be solved correctly .	46.736202
rodding formulas apply to many phases of the sport .	118.331604
the answers they give can often pave the way to performance increases and , quite often , are necessary for completing entry blanks for different events .	104.373215
when it is needed , one formula is as important as another .	35.22401
however , some formulas are used more than others .	31.217518
we ' ll take them in the general order of their popularity .	98.63084
a rodder should be able to compute the displacement of his engine .	27.776123
displacement is sometimes referred to as `` swept volume ' ' .	6.7975636
most entry blanks for competitive events require engine displacement information because of class restrictions .	118.44072
it is good to be able to compute displacement so that changes in it resulting from boring and stroking can be computed .	111.75672
factors involved in the displacement formula are the bore diameter of the engine ' s cylinders , the length of the piston stroke , the number of cylinders in the engine , and a constant .	22.923216
the constant is , which is one-quarter of 3 . 1416 , another constant known as `` pi ' ' .	39.575558
pi is used in formulas concerned with the dimensions of circles .	136.00345
actually , the engine displacement formula is the standard formula for computing the volume of a cylinder of any type with an added factor that represents the number of cylinders in the engine .	25.39696
the cross-sectional area of the cylinders is determined and then the volume of the individual cylinders is computed by multiplying the area by the stroke length , which is the equivalent of the length of the cylinders .	23.210066
multiplying the result by the number of cylinders in the engine gives the engine ' s total displacement .	19.26459
dimensions in inches , and fractions of inches will give the displacement in cubic inches .	29.145042
dimensions in centimeters and fractions of centimeters will give the displacement in cubic centimeters ( cc . ) .	14.037364
one inch equals 2 . 54 centimeters one cubic inch equals 16 . 38 cubic centimeters .	23.24269
for example , let ' s consider a standard 283 cubic inch chevy aj .	39.382694
these engines have a cylinder diameter of 3-7/8 inches and a stroke length of 3 inches .	15.766634
the formula , with the fractions converted to decimals , becomes af .	131.85211
to arrive at the answer , multiply the numbers together by starting at the left of the group and working to the right .	82.00254
a cylinder ' s compression ratio is computed by comparing the cylinder ' s volume , or its displacement , with the total volume of the cylinder and its combustion chamber .	19.045576
cylinder volume can be determined mathematically but combustion chamber volume must be measured with a liquid .	28.38252
cylinder volume is determined in exactly the same manner as for the displacement formula af .	93.163246
to measure the volume of one of the combustion chambers in the cylinder head , install the valves and spark plug in the chamber and support the head so that its gasket surface is level .	49.316498
then pour water or light oil from a graduated beaker into the chamber to fill the chamber to its gasket surface .	30.475431
this is possible with water and other liquids that have a high surface tension .	65.89294
such liquids will rise to a considerable height above the surface around the chamber before they will flow out of the chamber .	34.213413
the amount of liquid poured into the chamber is determined by subtracting the quantity still in the beaker when the chamber is full from the original quantity .	108.04193
most beakers are graduated in cubic centimeters ( cc . ) , making it necessary to convert the result to cubic inches .	30.950481
however , the displacement of the cylinder can be converted to cubic centimeters .	7.7576323
the compression ratio arrived at with the formula will be the same regardless of whether cubic inches or cubic centimeters are used .	44.036133
the only precaution is that all volumes used in the formula be quoted in the same terms .	56.031723
the volume of the cylinder opening in the head gasket must be computed by multiplying its area in square inches by the gasket ' s thickness in thousandths of an inch .	48.646965
sometimes it is necessary to roughly calculate the square inch area of the opening but the calculation can usually be made with sufficient accuracy that it won ' t affect the final computation .	66.89253
the volume of the opening is added to the combustion chamber volume .	10.896146
another thing that must be taken into consideration is the volume of the area between the top of the piston and the top of the cylinder block when the piston is in top dead center position .	40.33328
compute this volume by measuring the distance from the top of the block to the piston head as accurately as possible with a depth micrometer or some other precision measuring device and then multiply the area of the cylinder by the depth .	41.547184
this volume is added to the total volume of the combustion chamber and head gasket opening .	18.292608
the total of these three volumes is the `` final combustion chamber volume ' ' .	13.7160015
after the factors just described have been computed , they are applied to the following formula af	34.74818
for an example let ' s dream up an engine that has a final combustion chamber volume of 5 cubic inches and a cylinder volume of 45 cubic inches .	34.514217
applying these figures to the formula we get the equation af .	18.082169
this method of computing compression ratio cannot be used accurately for engines that have pistons with either domed or irregularly shaped heads .	173.48947
any irregularity on the piston heads will make it impossible , with normal means , to determine the final combustion chamber volume because the volume displaced by the piston heads cannot be readily computed .	31.871384
the only way to determine the final combustion chamber volume when such pistons are used is by measuring it with liquid while the cylinder head is bolted to the cylinder block and the piston is in top dead center position .	50.850758
there are four versions of the formula that involves the relationships of car speed , engine speed , rear axle gear ratio , and rear tire size .	28.066416
by using the appropriate version any one of these factors can be determined for any combination of the other three .	41.17837
to simplify the formulas a representative symbol is substituted for each of the factors .	55.852413
tire size can be determined in several ways but the one that is the easiest and as accurate as any is by measuring the effective radius of a wheel and tire assembly .	74.14465
this is done by measuring the distance from the surface on which the tire is resting to the center of the rear axle shaft .	20.559813
a tire must be inflated to its normal hot operating pressure and the car must be loaded to its operating weight when this measurement is made .	112.637634
any fraction of an inch involved in the measurement must be converted to a decimal equivalent to simplify the mathematics .	81.04108
when tire size is measured in this manner a constant of 168 is used in the formula .	38.531918
to determine car speed for a given combination of engine speed , gear ratio , and tire size , the formula is af .	13.968021
for an engine speed of 5000 rpm , a gear ratio of 4 . 00 to 1 , and a tire radius of 13 inches , the equation would look like this af	40.867798
to determine engine speed for a given combination of the other three factors the formula is af .	24.895763
using the same figures as for the previous example , the equation becomes af	26.49056
to determine the rear axle gear ratio for a combination of the other three factors , the formula is af .	25.275047
using the figures from the previous examples , the equation becomes af .	20.310839
-- the best 2-year-old pacing mile up to date at ben white raceway has been that of mary liner ( mainliner-highland ellen ) , a member of the dick williams stable , who was clocked 2 25 .	69.17408
she is owned by ralph h . kroening , milwaukee , wis . , who , according to the railbirds , can feel justly proud of her .	46.362186
other good miles have been by debonnie ( dale frost-debby hanover ) and prompt time ( adios-on time ) in 2 28- 36	23.530289
kimberly gal ( galophone-kimberly hanover ) 2 26 . 2	7.126072
laguerre hanover ( tar heel-lotus hanover ) and monel ( tar heel-miracle byrd ) in 2 34 .	9.030582
laguerre hanover is outstanding in type and conformation -- good body , plenty of heart girth , stands straight on his legs on excellent feet -- and has the smoothest gait .	95.16535
this colt is behind most of the other 2-year-olds in the simpson stable but can show about as much pace as any of them .	99.62843
monel shows improvement with each work-out and looks the makings of a good brood mare after winning her share of races .	94.87144
stardel ( star ' s pride-starlette hanover ) , 2 34 , looks quite promising .	24.86683
fury hanover ( hoot mon-fay ) , caper ( hoot mon-columbia hanover ) and isaac ( hoot mon-goddess hanover ) has been working together but have not equalled their best work done some weeks ago .	42.306328
fury and caper worked in 2 35 and did it with ease .	266.52838
they are two good colts of different type .	6.423527
fury is upstanding and on the rangy side , and caper is more the compact type .	121.780685
i have never seen caper off his feet -- he seems to know nothing but ' trot ' and keeps trying a little harder if asked to do so .	75.28422
fury has made a few mistakes but looks like a wonderful prospect , with his impressive gait and stride which certainly make him cover the ground .	106.23744
trackdown ( torrid-mighty lady ) has worked a mile in 2 33 . 3 .	21.05057
it took this colt several weeks to strike a pace .	105.43854
then , after emasculation , he was eased up for a couple of weeks .	18.95156
he has thrived on all he has gone through and looks the makings of a good little race horse .	96.07914
thor hanover ( adios-trustful hanover ) is a wonderful looking prospect and another good individual , with solid , rugged conformation , good , flat bone and excellent feet .	147.6806
this colt arrived at the raceway early last november , and immediately was put into harness and line-driven for a few days , and then put to cart and broken in very nicely , knowing nothing but trot .	70.38889
he appeared in the hopples about november 14 , was treated for worms on the 18th , the latter date being the first time he struck a real pace .	79.530235
on december 5 he paced a mile in 55 on the twice-around , out in third position all the way .	112.57283
this colt has done everything asked of him , and done it with ease .	77.8682
his best mile to date is 2 32 . 2 .	8.738032
gamecock ( tar heel-terka hanover ) is another promising colt , and his best time is 2 32 . 2 .	24.17686
this is one of the best-tempered tar heels ever at the center .	38.65557
the first time he was harnessed he stood like a gentle old mare	139.80705
the crupper under his tail seemed to be old stuff .	266.45786
the fourth time in harness he walked off like a gentleman .	146.7908
being blistered for curbs has delayed his work somewhat .	176.37799
but up to date he has shown as much as any in the big simpson stable .	50.632153
hustler ( knight dream-torkin ) is a playful bay rascal of a colt , not the best gaited , but he surely can pace and is right there with them , and sometimes leading them , in the best miles .	78.06618
torrid freight ( torrid-breeze on hal ) is a very rugged , strong-made colt with a wonderful stride who has done with ease everything asked of him .	100.811424
strongheart ( adios-direct gal ) , a fair-looking sorrel colt , knows nothing but pace and has been right there in the best miles .	76.302505
torrid adios ( torrid-adios molly ) is not so masculine as most of the colts , but i like his type and he certainly is one of the best-gaited pacers on the grounds .	61.53681
blistered for curbs and laid off three weeks , he is coming along fine and looks like a pacer to me .	48.451416
first flyer ( frisco flyer-castle light ) looks like a splendid candidate for the illinois stakes .	54.404354
the colts in simpson ' s stable have little if anything on the fillies , especially the pacers .	162.80188
justine hanover ( sampson hanover-justitia hanover ) is improving with each work-out and paced 2 32 . 4 weeks ago .	66.27346
mrs . freight ( knight dream-miss reed ) shows promise and does it in good form , and her best time is about 2 35 .	93.42259
