the average reader of this magazine owns more than one gun ( we ran a survey to find out ) but he ' s always on the lookout for new and better arms .	95.76861
he ' s more than a reader of outdoor articles	463.91522
he ' s a real hunter and shooter , eager to improve his sport .	37.914345
well , if you ' re that kind of sportsman we ' re here to help you .	47.95086
you ' ve probably given a lot of christmas-season thought to the guns in your rack , but it ' s not easy to decide on a new one .	48.230095
you still have time to drop a few hints about the gifts you ' d appreciate most	87.44802
the time to decide on them is now .	90.16486
as a christmas service , i ' ve taken a close look at this year ' s crop of new models .	45.98974
here they are , with my comments and judgments .	111.29995
read on , take your pick -- and start dropping those hints .	115.55155
first on my own list would be two arms -- a rifle and a handgun -- that qualify as new in the strictest sense .	145.66194
for me , a changed barrel length or an improved stock doesn ' t constitute a truly new design .	78.24651
such modifications are all for the best but it takes something as different as a deerstalker or a jet to change arms-making concepts .	81.47819
bill ruger ' s long-awaited deerstalker ( under $110 ) is a new rifle action in a caliber that upsets all the modern theory of high-velocity fans	43.529594
it ' s a short , light , quick-handling , fast-firing little timber gun designed to push a heavy slug at modest velocity but with lots of killing power and ample range for our most popular big game -- whitetail .	116.88688
ruger reports that on his recent african safari the little magnum cartridge was a real work horse .	149.56926
small antelope were generally grassed with one shot , and the magnum carbine also bagged reedbuck , kob and wart hog with deadly efficiency	26.955275
the deadliness of the magnum in a rifle comes as no surprise to me .	162.57149
at least five years ago , tom robinson of marlin made up an over/under double rifle for me in this caliber , using the now defunct model 90 action in 20-gauge size .	212.09073
after figuring out how to regulate the barrels so that they shot to the same point of impact , we fired this little 20-inch-barrel job on my home range and in marlin ' s underground test gallery .	126.18631
we quickly ran into the same trouble that plagued bill ruger in his first experiments three or four bullets would be placed well in a six-inch bull at 100 yards and then , unaccountably , one could stray far out of the group .	129.15417
ruger learned that this was because the higher velocity achieved in a long barrel was upsetting the shape of the unjacketed revolver bullet .	49.88157
the new , jacketed slug in magnum corrected this .	41.757366
but even without jacketed bullets , i had enough faith in my double to take it on an opening-day deer hunt that first year .	155.57133
within half an hour i jumped a six-point buck that hop-skipped through a rhododendron thicket , and i caught him just behind the left foreleg at 60 yards .	75.125206
he moved only about 30 feet after the 240-grain slug hit him -- and this was after the bullet had passed through a sapling .	59.017395
three more deer have fallen to this same gun , and all were one-shot kills .	54.543854
my double was made with standard-weight revolver barrels ( before cutting to revolver length ) , and although it compares well in other respects , it ' s considerably heavier than the deerstalker , which only scales about 6-1/2 pounds .	63.292393
if ever a rifle met the needs of the whitetail hunter , this is it .	99.06948
the deerstalker points with the ease , speed and precision of a fine imported double shotgun , and its trigger pull is light and sharp .	99.737946
the 240-grain bullet leaves the muzzle at 1 , 850 fps , which gives it all the smash needed at woods ranges .	77.83268
with five shots at the immediate command of the hunter ' s trigger finger , the gun and load are a deadly combination .	84.38523
the second really new development this year was a revolver handling a different sort of varmint load -- the	115.0294
at present it ' s available in one model , the fine and familiar smith & wesson magnum revolver ( about $110 ) , long a top-quality handgun among target arms .	76.95855
, 40-grain bullet is rated at a very hot 2 , 460 fps , and it ' s the flattest shooting of any revolver cartridge , with a mid-range rise of about an inch over a 100-yard range .	35.928963
this is a varmint load , pure and simple	164.72142
it ' s much too explosive for small edible game .	136.28323
it can cut a red squirrel neatly in two or burst a crow into a flurry of feathers .	88.10581
the most intriguing aspect of the s & w magnum chambered for the new jet is that it can also fire standard	75.024826
rim-fires by means of adapter sleeves in the chambers .	204.04514
you may therefore convert the gun into a small-game and plinking arm , although the difference in the point of impact ( jet vs . rim-fire ) can be somewhat disconcerting .	67.27783
i tested it in my scoped s & w and it was good enough to allow me to hit a chuck with every shot at 100 yards if i did my part by holding the handgun steadily .	86.07182
the fact that the deerstalker and the jet were the only completely new designs this year doesn ' t mean that 1961 didn ' t see changes in models , actions and calibers .	90.673454
aside from the ruger carbine , a number of hunting rifles have been introduced for the first time .	28.073511
here are the brands ( in alphabetical order ) and the new models .	38.132057
newcomers to the american hunter are the browning group of bolt-action , high-power rifles .	41.0198
they have fine fn actions and a better-than-average finish on both the metal and the stock wood .	94.14477
barrel weights vary sensibly with the various calibers available , and these include the standard bores ( about $165 ) plus the magnums ( around $170 )	36.73056
shotgun-type rubber recoil pads are standard on all of the magnums except the	14.035955
stock designs are excellent for use with scopes .	4.3870096
colt ' s center-fire 1961 rifles are all made with sako actions , regardless of caliber .	91.6498
, af and the magnums , the long action ( about $135 for the standard coltsman and $200 for the custom version ) .	82.87043
previously , fn actions were used for the larger cartridges .	128.43317
auto , the sport-king , in two grades -- field and special ( less than $45 and just over $45 , respectively ) .	155.38599
it ' s a streamlined rifle , fast and well-made .	21.076218
magnum rim-fire rifles , 1961 ' s lone newcomer was the kodiak model 260 autoloader ( around $60 ) .	38.861633
previously known as jefferson arms , kodiak has given this 11-shot hammerless job an exceptionally fine stock design , and the 260 is the first autoloader to handle	116.08349
marlin has made two contributions to the harvest of new offerings .	15.304873
the model 99 ( under $45 ) is a light-weight , streamlined	22.770977
rim-fire auto with a tubular magazine that holds 18 long rifles .	495.63684
it ' s extremely accurate for an auto , and the test rifle i tried was completely trouble-free in functioning .	197.88817
the 989 ( about $40 ) is an even newer	475.96677
auto , this one with a seven- or 12-shot clip .	12.046872
once again the mossberg targo outfit has appeared , but this time as a bolt-action rifle-shotgun combination .	69.02449
the bore is unrifled but is provided with an insert tube which is rifled and which , surprisingly , gives pretty fair accuracy even though it ' s only 3-1/2 inches long .	98.40492
you can unscrew this tube and replace it with a smoothbore insert for use with	46.140244
shotshells -- to break the little targo clay targets .	68.48698
a trap for throwing these miniature clays fastens to the barrel so that the shooter can throw his own targets .	62.38766
a spring trap for solid mounting and a regular hand trap are also available .	195.99908
you can have your choice of a seven-shot repeater , the 340tr ( about $40 ) or a single-shot , the 320tr ( $10 less ) .	41.521378
the targo is a good outfit for fun shooting or for economic wing-shooting practice , but it ' s tougher than it looks to run up a score on the clay birds .	89.29655
they ' ll travel 50 feet or more when thrown from the spring trap but it ' s almost impossible to break one after it passes the 35-foot mark .	69.58927
the combination of thin pattern and very tiny pellets makes it necessary to get on the birds , right now ! !	73.465744
big magnum calibers appeared in the remington line for 1961 , with the addition of the and to the list of model 725 ' s .	57.991974
these are made on special order only , in kodiak grade ( about $310 ) , with integral muzzle brakes and heavy rubber recoil pads	43.95036
a shortened version of the highly regarded remington 742 autoloader also appeared in 1961 .	18.924288
this carbine ( under $140 , about $15 more for a deluxe grade ) has an 18-1/2-inch barrel and was obviously inspired by the popularity of last year ' s model 760 pump with a short-barrel .	98.19137
this design is hard to beat for timber hunting or for packing in a saddle scabbard .	46.103626
presently , the 742c is available in af .	3.708726
the latest versions of the famous savage model 99 are the 99 featherweight ( about $125 ) and the 99 deluxe ( under $135 ) , which have a top-tang safety and improved trigger design .	26.946516
the replacement of the slide-lock side safety catch will make this lever-action favorite more appealing than ever since the new safety is easier and faster to operate .	136.19891
a fresh crop of beginners ' guns showed up in 1961 , and they ' re good bets for your christmas gift list if you ' re wondering what to get for a youngster .	43.944416
the most unusual of them is the ithaca 49 ( about $20 , $5 for a saddle scabbard ) -- a lever-action single-shot patterned after the famous winchester lever-action and featuring the western look .	46.14995
because of its traditional lines , it probably has more kid appeal than any other model .	178.21846
the action is a drop-block , handling all the standard	90.27289
marlin ' s latest is also designed for the beginning shooter , although it ' s a full-sized rifle with plenty of barrel weight and ample stock .	67.57836
this is the model 122 ( about $20 )	1.4535012
it ' s a single-shot bolt-action with an automatic safety -- i . e . , the safety goes on every time the bolt is lifted and the gun cocked for the next shot .	51.686867
stock design is excellent , and this model is a good first gun .	38.363113
single-shot remington 514c ( around $20 ) , which comes with a 21-inch barrel and a short -- 12-1/2-inch -- stock	58.595406
it ' s just right for a boy of 12-1/2 .	11.9513645
a beginner ' s shotgun has also been introduced this year .	34.607635
the single-barrel stevens 940y ( under $35 ) is made with a side lever rather than a top-tang lever because many youngsters aren ' t strong enough to operate a top tang to open a gun -- and the side lever does indeed open very easily .	94.1877
this gun has a 12-1/2-inch stock and is available in either 20 or gauge .	128.82202
there ' s another addition to the stevens line , the pump-action model 77 in ( under $75 ) , which you may or may not consider a kid ' s gun	70.70787
many experienced hunters like this gauge and type of scattergun too .	41.52399
although there were no startling developments in shotgun design this year , a number of new models and variations of existing models did hit the market .	98.86551
for example , a browning trap version of the superposed over/under , the broadway ( from $350 up , depending on grade ) , differs from standard models in that it is equipped with a full beavertail fore end , a cushion recoil pad and a barrel-wide ventilated rib for fast sighting .	41.49537
the colt line now includes a new scattergun , the standard or custom pump model ( about $90 and $150 , respectively ) in 12 , 16 and 20 .	78.93119
firearms international has introduced another import , this one from finland .	240.27335
it ' s the valmet ( about $170 ) , a 12-gauge over/under very much like the old remington 32 -- which was so fine a gun that today a used one still brings high prices .	130.63011
high standard has also added two models to its line .	144.39337
the supermatic trophy ( prices begin at less than $135 and depend on grade and optional features ) is a 12-gauge auto .	82.15474
the flite-king trophy ( beginning at just over $85 ) is a pump gun in 12 or 16 .	95.4971
either model is a very good dollar value .	3.3352947
mossberg ' s latest contribution to the field is the model 500 ( from $73 . 50 )	70.56052
this is an improved version of the old model 200 , a pump-action 12-gauge shotgun .	28.492981
see page 24 for a complete report on it .	50.850647
jet -- which i coupled with the deerstalker carbine as one of the year ' s two biggest developments -- few significant innovations appeared among 1961 ' s handguns .	53.905033
livery stable -- j . vernon , prop . ' ' .	10.133569
coaching had declined considerably by 1905 , but the sign was still there , near the old wells fargo building in san francisco , creaking in the fog as it had for thirty years .	84.11474
john vernon had had all the patronage he cared for -- he had prospered , but he could not retire from horsedom .	49.275036
he had two interests in life the pleasures of the table and driving .	120.76697
twice a week he drove his tallyho over the santa cruz road , upland and through the redwood forest , with orchards below him at one hand , and glimpses of the pacific at the other .	72.49032
the journey back he made along the coast road , traveling hell-for-leather , every lantern of the tallyho ablaze .	104.32131
the southward route was the classic run in california , and the most fashionable .	41.89513
his patronage on this stretch was made up largely of san franciscans -- regulars , most of them , and trenchermen like himself .	73.98823
they did not complain at the inhuman hour of starting ( seven in the morning ) , nor of the tariff , which was reasonable since it covered everything but the tobacco .	157.03227
breakfast was at the palace hotel , luncheon was somewhere in the mountain forest , and dinner was either at boulder creek or at santa cruz .	96.78506
gazing too long at the scenery could be tiring , so halts were contrived between meals .	383.21967
then the chinese hostler , who rode with vernon on the box , would break open a hamper and produce filets of smoked bass or sturgeon , sandwiches , pickled eggs , and a rum sangaree to be heated over a spirit lamp .	27.01814
in spring and in autumn the run was made for a group of botanists which included an old friend of mine .	36.53
they gathered roots , bulbs , odd ferns , leaves , and bits of resin from the rare santa lucia fir , which exists only on a forty-five mile strip on the westerly side of these mountains .	42.613842
in the spanish days franciscan monks roamed here to collect the resin for incense .	39.258347
it yields a fragrance as orphic as that of the pastilles of malabar .	50.64914
vernon was serviceable on the botanical field trips , but he could arrange no schedule with the cooks , and he was glad when the trips dropped off , and the botanists began to motor out by themselves .	85.02161
my friend often breakfasted with vernon on the morning of the regular tallyho run .	82.183426
this was an honor , like dining with a captain at his private table .	203.15111
vernon ' s office adjoined the stable , and the walls were adorned with brightly colored lithographs , the folk art of the period .	28.241827
they advertised harness polish , liniments , ball ' s rubber boots , green river whiskey , hood ' s sarsaparilla , patent medicines , shoe blacking , and chewing tobacco .	23.143486
the hostler would have the table ready and a pot of coffee hissing on the stove	70.944405
then a porter from manning ' s fish house would trot in with a tray on his head .	93.22026
it was draped with snowy napkins that kept hot a platter of oyster salt roast and a mound of corn fritters .	27.846802
vernon was consummately fond of oysters , and manning ' s had been famous for them since the civil war .	67.70199
oyster salt roast -- oysters on the half shell , cooked on a bed of coarse salt that kept them hot when served -- was a standby at manning ' s .	75.465576
its early morning patrons were coachmen , who fortified themselves for the day with that delicacy .	56.525307
in the 1890 ' s the palace hotel began serving an oyster dish named after its manager , john c . kirkpatrick .	66.36545
this dish much resembles the oysters rockefeller made famous by antoine ' s in new orleans , though the palace chef announced it as a variant of manning ' s roast oysters .	47.195896
( gastronomes have long argued about which came first , the palace ' s or antoine ' s .	29.673037
antoine ' s held as mandatory a splash of absinthe or pernod on the parsley or spinach which was used for the underbedding .	15.149792
) vernon , however , held out for plain oyster roast , and plenty of it , unadorned by herbs or any seasoning but salt , though he did fancy a bit of lemon .	54.892216
after the meal , he and his guests went out to inspect the rig	59.43494
this was merely a ritual , to please all hands concerned .	164.57318
the tallyho had cost vernon $2 , 300 .	13.695461
a replica of two coaches made in england for the belmont club in the east , and matchless west of the rockies , it was the despair of whips on the santa cruz run .	42.10597
one could shave in the reflection of its french-polished panels , and its axles were greased like those of roulette wheels .	80.82357
departing , they stepped solemnly with knees lifted to the jaw , for they had been trained to drag at important funerals .	48.66173
but for the start of the santa cruz run , the whip fell .	45.897495
the clients boarded the tallyho at the palace promptly at seven .	197.4336
they had been fed a hunting breakfast , so called because a kedgeree , the dish identified with fox hunting , was on the bill .	128.63867
there are many ways of making a kedgeree , every one of which is right .	42.131416
here is an original kedgeree recipe from the family club ' s kitchen	72.88961
flake ( for three ) a cupful of cold boiled haddock , mix with a cupful of cooked rice , two minced hard-boiled eggs , some buttery white sauce done with cream , cayenne , pepper , salt , a pinch of curry , a tablespoonful of minced onion fried , and a bit of anchovy .	20.290632
the omelet named for ernest arbogast , the palace ' s chef , was even more in demand .	84.297356
for decades it was the most popular dish served in the ladies ' grill at breakfast , and it is one of the few old palace dishes that still survive .	56.61875
native california oysters , salty and piquant , as coppery as delawares and not much larger than a five-cent piece , went into it .	89.98198
fry in butter a small minced onion , rub with a tablespoonful of flour , add half a cup of cream , six beaten eggs , pepper , celery salt , a teaspoonful of minced chives , a dash of cayenne , and a pinch of nutmeg .	18.916714
a jigger of dry sherry follows , and as the mixture stiffens , in go a hundred of the little oysters .	118.956345
louis sherry once stayed a fortnight at the palace , and he was so pleased with omelet arbogast that he introduced it at his restaurant in new york j . pierpont morgan had come in his private train to san francisco , to attend an episcopal convention , and brought the restaurateur with him .	61.44228
as things happened , morgan was installed in the nob hill residence of a magnate friend , whose kitchen swarmed with cooks of approved talent .	114.55816
sherry remained in his hotel suite , where he amused himself as best he could .	235.48485
twice he left everything to his entourage , and fled to make the santa cruz tour under vernon ' s guidance .	50.362095
in the grand court of the palace , notable for its tiers of moorish galleries that looked down on the maelstrom of vehicles below , vernon ' s station was at the entrance .	91.995575
it was a post of honor , held inviolate for him	160.42346
of majestic build , rubicund and slash-mouthed , he resembled the late general winfield scott , who was said to be the most imposing general of his century , if not of all centuries .	53.776142
vernon wore a gray tall hat , a gardenia , and maroon wellington boots that glistened like currant jelly .	13.428899
promptly at seven he would clatter out of the court with twelve in the tallyho .	191.50378
he had style he held his reins in a loose bunch at the third button of his checked epsom surtout , and when the horses leaned at a curve , as if bent by the force of a gale , he leaned with them .	70.24917
they cantered down the peninsula , not slackening until the coach reached woodside where the santa cruz uplands begin .	51.844982
the road maps of the region have changed since 1905	32.58439
inns have burned down , moved elsewhere , or taken other names .	324.47437
once on the road ( and especially if the passengers were all regulars and masculine ) , the schedule meant nothing .	164.33981
an agreeable ease suffused vernon and the passengers of the tallyho , from which there issued clouds of smoke .	82.25619
vernon would tilt his hat over one ear as he lounged with his feet on the dashboard , indulging in a huge cigar .	36.334602
they were no more on parade than was their driver	821.60706
one fork of the road was as good as another .	14.920526
the santa cruz mountains sprawl over three counties , and the roads twist through sky-tapping redwoods down whose furrowed columns ripple streams of rain , even when heat bakes the santa clara valley below at the left .	56.327976
the water splashes into shoulder-high tracts of fernery .	19.609735
you arrive there in seersucker , and feel you were half-witted not to bring a mackintosh .	92.50112
vernon kept an account book with a list of all the establishments that he thought worthy of patronage .	100.24707
a number of them must have fallen into disfavor	170.50868
they were struck out with remarks in red ink , denouncing both the cooks and the management .	74.86366
he was copious in his praise of those that served food that was good to eat .	166.97571
the horses seemed to know these by instinct , he used to say such places invariably had stables with superior feed bins .	127.14938
there was wright ' s , for one , lost amongst trees , its wide verandas strewn with rockers .	55.29012
many of its sojourners were devoted to seclusion and quiet , and lived there to the end of their days .	57.605904
it was the haunt of writer ambrose bierce , who admired its redwoods .	78.73505
acorns from the great oaks fed the small black pigs ( akin to berkshires ) , whose `` carcass sweepstakes ' ' were renowned .	24.130825
their ham butts , cured in oak-log smoke , were also esteemed when roasted or boiled , and served with this original sauce	89.20424
put into a saucepan a cupful of the baked ham gravy , or of the boiled ham liquor , with a half stick of butter , three teaspoonfuls of made mustard , and two mashed garlic cloves .	26.965055
contribute also an onion , a peeled tomato and two pickled gherkins , and a mashed lime .	8.92386
after this has simmered an hour , add two tablespoons each of worcestershire , catsup , and chutney , two pickled walnuts , and a pint of sherry .	17.526403
every winter a kegful of this sauce was made and placed at the end of a row of four other kegs in the cellar , so that when its turn came , it was properly mellowed .	40.510242
vineyards and orchards also grew around wright ' s , and deer were rather a nuisance	91.46544
they leaped six-foot fences with the agility of panthers .	16.961187
but no one complained when they wound up , regardless of season , in venison pies .	111.70471
no one complained of the white wine either at this altitude of two thousand feet , grapes acquire a dryness and the tang of gunflint .	106.45285
( the almaden vineyards have now climbed to this height .	51.464108
though creeks in the santa cruz mountains flow brimful the year round and it is forever spring , the apples that grow there have a wintry crackle .	56.556686
dwellers thereabouts preferred to get their apple pies at the local bakery , which had a brick oven fired with redwood billets .	39.451813
the merit of the pie , vernon believed , was due more to its making than to the waning heat of the oven .	84.66099
the recipe , which he got from the baker , and wrote down in his ledger , is basically this	192.46603
peel , core , and slice across enough apples to make a dome in the pie tin , and set aside .	39.76802
in a saucepan put sufficient water to cover them , an equal amount of sugar , a sliced lemon , a tablespoonful of apricot preserve or jam , a pinch each of clove and nutmeg , and a large bay leaf .	26.6968
let this boil gently for twenty minutes , then strain .	103.733116
poach the apples in this syrup for twelve minutes , drain them , and cool .	50.383747
set the apples in the pastry-lined tin , spread over them three tablespoonfuls of softened butter , with as much brown sugar , a sprinkling of nutmeg , and a fresh bay leaf , then lay on a cover of pastry , and gild it with beaten yolk of egg .	33.43226
those who have never traveled the width and length of this land cannot conceive , on the basis of textbook description alone , the overwhelming space and variety of this country held together under one government .	125.03589
the miracle of democratic america comes home to one most strongly only when one has seen the endless great plains of the midwest	255.65564
the smoke-filled , art-filled , drama-filled life of the great cities of the east	53.68345
the lush and historic charm of the south .	4.1760254
now , to add to the already unbelievable extremes found in one nation , we have the two new states of hawaii and alaska .	75.728935
to hope to cover just one region of this land and to enjoy all of its sights and events and , of course , to bring back pictures of your experiences , requires advance planning .	140.61227
for this reason , u . s . camera has prepared this special u . s . a . vacation feature .	78.98059
we divided the country into five regions plus hawaii and alaska and in each is included a general description of the area plus specific recommendations of places and events to cover .	113.257965
use this section to plan now to make the most of your vacation in photogenic america .	37.66236
birthplace of the nation , the northeast offers historic battlefields	29.018967
lovely old villages and a rugged seashore among its many worthwhile sights .	160.29883
the rolling farms of maryland , the peerless metropolis of new york city , the verdant mountains of vermont can all be included in your northeast vacation .	45.52016
by automobile from new york , for example , you can take a one or two-day tour to annapolis , maryland to see the colonial homes and the u . s . naval academy ( where you can shoot the dress parade on wednesdays )	51.954666
to washington , d . c . , for an eye-filling tour of the city	30.277897
or to lancaster , pa . , the center of the pennsylvania dutch country	147.85944
philadelphia with its historic buildings and nearby valley forge	2.6309848
to west point , n . y . , the famous military academy in a beautiful setting on the hudson river .	56.366558
new england deserves as much of your vacation time as you can afford with such areas as cape cod providing wonderful beaches , artists ' colonies and quaint townships .	64.54085
from here you can easily include a side trip to the old whaling port of nantucket , massachusetts , which looks just as it must have two centuries ago .	45.111122
at sturbridge village , massachusetts , you ' ll find a completely-restored new england town .	65.15212
north to acadia national park , maine , with views of a rockbound coast and dark , magnificent forests .	159.43932
one of the most exciting ways to end a northeast vacation would be with a week in new york city .	60.638206
return through new england , stopping for a visit to lake champlain where you can take a boat ride and go to ethan allen park .	68.27373
there you ' ll witness a view which includes the adirondack mts . and the winooski river .	92.68421
now you ' re ready for a whirlwind sightseeing tour of america ' s most exciting city .	28.184792
the skyline , the bridges , broadway , and the staten island ferry are only a few of the spots to put on your `` must ' ' list for new york city .	47.528175
some tips for shooting in northeastern locales in new york city don ' t miss coverage of the united nations .	25.517643
these striking , modernistic buildings on the east river are open to the public and every weekday guided tours are available .	38.846905
pictures can be taken in the public areas and when on tours .	189.19482
however , the use of tripods is not allowed .	48.12042
photos of conference rooms and the general assembly hall can be made when these rooms are not being used for meetings .	98.52606
flash is allowed , subject to above restrictions .	4.646556
around new england , you ' ll no doubt want a color shot of one of the picturesque lighthouses .	69.1023
be careful here not to overexpose this subject since they are extremely bright and light-reflecting .	40.55833
in color , 1/50th of a second between af and af will do for bright , frontal sunlight .	28.946642
the southern united states , extending from florida in the east to texas in the west , still maintains its unique flavor of gracious living and historical elegance .	59.828957
it encompasses in its expanse areas where the natural beauty encourages a vacation of quiet contemplation , on the one hand , to places where entertainment and spectacles of all sorts have been provided for the tourist with camera .	68.95734
of special interest this anniversary year of the war between the states are the many civil war battlefields where , likely as not , you ' ll catch some memorial re-enactments .	143.03064
among the locales to visit are shiloh , tennessee	219.6387
petersburg , virginia , and fredericksburg , virginia .	9.326349
florida provides tropical scenes unequalled in the united states .	1.8353971
at cypress gardens special bleachers are set up for photographers at water-ski shows and lovely models pose for pictures in garden settings .	210.93088
silver springs features glass-bottom boat rides and in everglades national park there are opportunities to photograph rare wildlife .	59.05447
miami beach and surroundings feature fabulous `` hotel row ' ' , palm-studded beaches plus the miami seaquarium and parrot jungle .	50.398357
one of the most delightful spots in a southern tour is the city of new orleans .	47.463974
the famous old french and spanish buildings with their elaborate wrought iron balconies and the narrow streets of the latin quarter present an old world scene .	42.722343
for restoration of early american life the places to visit are williamsburg , jamestown and yorktown , virginia .	37.037163
another virginia sight and a photographic adventure are the luray caverns , lit by photofloodlights .	19.107267
the great state of texas offers metropolitan attractions such as the dallas fair park with its art and natural history museums .	85.78374
in contrast are the vast open stretches of ranch country and oil wells .	138.19064
in san antonio visit the famous alamo and photograph 18th century spanish buildings and churches .	187.62979
the great smoky mountains is another area of the south well worth a visit .	135.7303
along the 127-mile route through great smoky mountains national park you can photograph the breath-taking peaks , gorges and valleys which come into view at every turn .	80.11461
gatlinburg , tennessee , is the center of this area .	59.235783
another scenic spot in tennessee is chattanooga where the rock city gardens are not to be missed .	58.06292
beautiful homes and gardens are trademarks of the south and cities particularly noted for them are charleston , s . c . , natchez , miss . , and savannah , ga . .	44.242493
at charlottesville , va . , shoot monticello and the beautiful buildings of the university .	33.688416
foliage is the outstanding photo subject in many of the southern locales mentioned above and some specific tips on how and where to shoot it are in order .	105.37366
for example , the chamber of commerce of gatlinburg , tennessee , sponsors special camera tours into the great smoky mountains to get pictures of the profusion of wild flowers flourishing in these wooded regions .	51.490826
exposure problems may occur in these forest areas where uneven lighting results from shafts of sunlight filtering through the overhead branches .	70.73846
best solution is to find an area that is predominantly sunlight or shade .	119.203125
in any instance , you should determine the exposure according to the type of light which falls on most of the subject area .	121.03522
try some closeups on southern blossoms to provide a welcome contrast with the many long-view scenics you ' ll be making .	44.0814
for shooting the interiors of the famous ante-bellum southern mansions make sure your equipment includes a tripod .	338.29776
enough daylight is usually available from the windows , but if you have synchronized flash -- use it .	70.55725
for some unusual photographic subjects , if your vacation takes you nearby , try these events the 600-mile auto race in charlotte , n . c . , , on may 27	100.764755
the florida folk festival , white springs , may 5-7	164.02213
singing on the mountain in linville , north carolina , on june 25 .	19.709398
peak action photography is your goal at miami ' s seaquarium and the cypress gardens waterskiing events .	26.683846
a pleasant start to your midwestern vacation is a few days spent in cosmopolitan chicago .	72.53035
lake michigan offers swimming and pictures which combine cityscapes with beaches .	29.699818
a visit to chicago ' s museums and a stroll around broad michigan avenue will unfold many photogenic subjects to the alert photographer .	204.7098
wisconsin dells , where fantastically scenic rocks carved by the wisconsin river are overgrown with fern and other foliage , rates a stopover when traveling from chicago .	53.132412
the farmlands forming the heart of america stretch out across the midwest from chicago .	66.24714
in north dakota the strangely beautiful badlands will challenge you to translate its wonder on to film .	305.8398
while here , visit theodore roosevelt national park for its spectacular scenery .	40.061848
another spot with an image-provoking name is the black hills where you can visit the old frontier mining town of deadwood .	72.209045
the black hills passion play is produced every summer and is a pageant worth seeing and shooting .	155.55658
of course , while in this vicinity you won ' t want to miss a visit to mount rushmore national memorial where on the side of a mountain are the famous sculptures of presidents washington , lincoln , jefferson and theodore roosevelt .	53.257133
in missouri ( which we are including in our general midwest region ) you can glance into mark twain ' s birthplace at hannibal , see the landmarks of his life and writings and visualize where huck finn hatched his boyish mischief .	80.70711
similarly in illinois there is lincoln country to be seen -- his tomb and other landmarks .	94.25316
minnesota , fabled land of waters , is in itself , ideal vacationland , having within its borders 10 , 000 lakes ! !	107.54864
itasca state park , where the mississippi river begins , is one of the outstanding tourist spots in minnesota .	58.630283
mementoes of the old west recall the days of wyatt earp in dodge city , nebraska , where present-day cowboys add a colorful human interest note to your vacation shooting .	93.84546
of current interest is abilene , kansas , the birthplace of ex-president eisenhower .	56.12657
there ' s a museum here and also old abilene town , a reconstruction of the cattle boomtown of the 70 ' s and 80 ' s .	48.192234
for a resort area , mackinack island , michigan , is the place to visit .	94.92782
it truly relives another age for the inhabitants use carriages rather than autos and old british and french forts are left intact for tourists to visit and record .	97.79447
night scenes will add an exciting touch to your vacation travelogue and what better place to take them then along chicago ' s lake shore drive ? ?	112.5578
just after sunset is a good time to record the city lights in color since you get a `` fill-in ' ' light from the sky .	104.0018
another memo for sightseers bring your camera along to museums .	83.51247
photos of historic dioramas of the area you visit will add depth and background to your vacation photo story .	104.63876
again , be sure your tripod is handy for those sometimes-necessary time exposures .	72.27829
special events and their dates which will make interesting shooting in the midwest area , include the following	135.43736
a re-enactment of the battle of lexington , may 18th at lexington , missouri	138.13957
the world-renowned 500-mile auto race at indianapolis , indiana , plus a festival from may 27-30	88.828255
`` song of hiawatha ' ' , in elgin , illinois , from june 20 to 24th .	36.514664
michigan offers the lovely tulip festival in holland , michigan , may 12-14	39.006275
and the international freedom festival in detroit , june 29 thru july 4 .	34.70881
for early vacationers there ' s the fun-filled fishing derby in hot springs , arkansas , april 19-23 , and the arkansas band festival in hot springs , april 20-22 .	33.582973
a western vacation is practically synonymous with a visit to at least one of the magnificent national parks in this area .	36.585476
a tour of several of them is possible in a two-week vacation while a stay at just one of these natural beauty spots can be of equal reward .	97.3004
in california is located one of the most popular of the national parks -- yosemite .	52.106514
among its most spectacular features are its falls , the highest being upper yosemite which drops 2 , 425 feet .	63.516426
the sequoia grove presents another unique aspect of yosemite , for these ancient giant trees are a sight never to be forgotten .	124.51945
in the utah area are zion national park and bryce canyon national park .	24.07692
fantastic colors are to be seen in the fanciful formations of eroded rock which loom out of the semiarid country in both parks .	103.631714
colorado ' s grand canyon , probably the most famous landmark of the united states , can be the highpoint of your western vacation .	17.13743
built upon seven hills , istanbul , like rome , is one of the most ancient cities in the world , filled with splendor and contrast .	34.15855
it is an exotic place , so different from the ordinary that the casual tourist is likely to see at first only the contrast and the ugliness of narrow streets lined with haphazard houses .	76.67797
at the moment , many of these are being pulled down .	145.35553
whole blocks are disappearing and more are scheduled to vanish to make room for wide boulevards that will show off its treasures to better advantage -- the great domes and graceful spires of its mosques , the panorama of the bosphorus and the golden horn .	50.29534
even when they are finished , however , the contrast will remain , for istanbul is the only city in the world that is built upon two continents .	85.660866
for almost 3 , 000 years europe and asia have rubbed shoulders in its streets .	104.29798
founded in the ninth century b . c . it was called byzantium 200 years later when byzas , ruler of the megarians , expanded the settlement and named it after himself .	129.71735
about a thousand years after that , when the roman empire was divided , it became capital of the eastern section .	56.010166
on may 11 , 330 , a . d . , , its name was changed again , this time to constantinople after its emperor , constantine .	87.98176
in 1453 when the last vestige of ancient roman power fell to the turks , the city officially shifted religions -- although the patriarch , or pope , of the orthodox church continued to live there , and still does -- and became the capital of the ottoman empire .	94.93388
when that was broken up after the first world war , its name was changed once more .	78.89966
rich in christian and moslem art , istanbul is today a fascinating museum of east and west that recently became a seaside resort as well with the development of new beaches on the bosphorus and the sea of marmara only a short distance from the center of town .	71.31098
easy to get to , and becoming more popular every year , it is only fourteen hours from new york by pan american world airways jet , four hours from rome .	118.25822
most of the sights lie in the old section across the golden horn from the modern hotels .	41.77207
i started my tour of them at the turkish government tourist office , next to pan american ' s office on the left as you enter the driveway that leads to the hilton hotel .	92.91121
from there i turned left along cumhuriyet cadesi past more hotels and a park on the left , republic gardens , and came in a few moments to taksim square , one of the hubs of the city , with the monument of the republic , erected in 1928 , in its center .	61.464115
directly across from the gardens i found a bus stop sign for t 4 and rode it down to the bosphorus , with the sports center on my left just before i reached the water and the entrance to dolmabahce palace immediately after that .	110.0158
there the bus turned right along the bosphorus , past ocean liners at anchor , to galata bridge over the entrance to the golden horn , a brown sweep of water that empties into the bosphorus .	55.928314
across the bridge on the left i saw st . sophia with its sturdy brown minarets and to the right of them the slenderer spires of the blue mosque .	54.9475
on the other side of the golden horn i rode through eminonu square , with yeni cami , or the new mosque , which dates from the seventeenth century , just across from the entrance to the bridge .	39.180607
passing it , the bus climbed a hill , with the covered spice bazaar on the right and pandelli ' s , a famous and excellent restaurant , above it .	65.313995
at the top of the hill the buildings on the left gave way to a park .	61.38184
i got off there , crossed the street , walked ahead with st . sophia on my left , the blue mosque on my right , and in a moment came to the entrance of st . sophia .	28.702564
erected on the site of pagan temples and three previous st . sophias , the first of which was begun by constantine , this fourth church was started by justinian in 532 and completed twenty years later .	60.97841
on his first trip to the finished structure he boasted that he had built a temple grander than solomon ' s in jerusalem .	55.577393
a few years later the dome fell in .	953.8541
nevertheless , it remained one of the most splendid churches of the eastern empire , where the byzantine emperors were crowned .	26.701141
after the turks conquered the city in 1453 they converted it to a mosque , adding the stubby minarets .	79.57826
in the second half of the sixteenth century , sinan , the great architect who is the michelangelo of the east , designed the massive buttresses that now help support the dome .	58.13096
with the birth of the turkish republic after the first world war , st . sophia became a museum , and the ancient mosaics , which were plastered over by the moslems , whose religion forbids pictures in holy places , have been restored .	42.404022
inside over the first door i saw one of these , which shows constantine offering the city to the virgin mary and justinian offering the temple .	97.56243
on the columns around the immense dome are round plaques with arabic writing .	174.72832
the eight green columns , i learned , came from the temple of artemis at ephesus , the others , red , from the temple of the sun at heliopolis .	56.243355
beneath the dome i saw the spot where the byzantine emperors were crowned , a bit of floor protected now by a wooden fence .	40.142227
behind this is a minber or moslem pulpit and near it a raised platform with golden grillwork , where the emperors and , after them , the sultans , sat .	105.52556
directly opposite is the emperor ' s door , through which they entered the building .	54.728397
outside st . sophia i walked through the flower garden in front of it , with the blue mosque ahead on my left .	51.258884
across the street on my right i saw the hippodrome , now a park .	59.733803
it was laid out in 196 for chariot races and other public games .	96.247284
statues and other monuments that stood there were stolen , mostly by the waves of crusaders .	32.93961
at the beginning of the hippodrome i saw the kaiser ' s fountain , an ugly octagonal building with a glass dome , built in 1895 by the german emperor , and on my left , directly across from it , the tomb of sultan ahmet , who constructed the blue mosque , more properly known by his name .	47.709663
just before coming to the mosque entrance i crossed the street , entered the hippodrome , and walked ahead to the obelisk of theodosius , originally erected in heliopolis in egypt about 1 , 600 b . c . by thutmose , who also built those now in new york , london and rome at the lateran .	44.963226
this one was set up here in 390 a . d . on a pedestal , the faces of which are carved with statues of the emperor and his family watching games in the hippodrome , done so realistically that the obelisk itself is included in them .	65.275795
beyond it i noted a small green column , about twelve feet below the present ground level -- the serpentine column , three entwined serpents , which once stood at the temple of apollo at delphi , greece .	36.8231
near the end of the hippodrome i came upon the built column , a truncated obelisk of blocks , all that remains of a monument that once rivalled the colossus of rhodes .	100.25969
retracing my steps to the mosque of sultan ahmet , only one with six minarets , i entered the courtyard , with a gallery supported by pointed arches running around it and a fountain in the middle .	57.631237
one of the most beautiful buildings in istanbul , it was constructed in the early years of the seventeenth century , with a huge central dome , two half domes that seem to cascade down from it , and smaller full domes around the gallery .	39.48222
the round minarets , tall and graceful , rise from rectangular bases and have three platforms from which the muezzin can chant his call to prayer .	107.80932
inside , the walls are covered with blue and white tile , the floor with red and cream carpets .	28.62169
back at the kaiser ' s fountain , i walked left to the streetcar stop and rode up the hill -- any car will do -- past the column of constantine , also known as the burnt column , at the top on my right .	92.121254
it stands in the middle of what was once the forum of constantine , who brought it from rome .	115.04712
i stayed on the car for a few minutes until , turning right , it entered a huge square , bayezit , with the bayezit mosque on the right and the gate to the university just beyond it .	69.38513
there i got off , crossed the square , and on the side directly opposite the gate found a good restaurant , hard to come by in this part of the city .	94.78529
called the marmara gazinosu , it is on the third floor , with signs pointing the way there , and has a terrace overlooking the sea of marmara .	48.85314
after lunch , in the arcade on my left just before reaching the street i found a pastry shop that sells some of the best baklava -- a sweet , flaky cake -- in istanbul .	67.44396
it ' s a great favorite of the university students , and i joined them there for dessert .	150.80713
taking the streetcar back to kaiser ' s fountain , i walked ahead , then left down the street opposite st . sophia and just beyond the corner came to a small , one-story building with a red-tile roof , which is the entrance to the sunken palace .	46.668217
actually an underground cistern , its roof supported by rows and rows of pillars , it was built by justinian in the sixth century to supply the palace with water .	45.75678
i found it fairly depressing and emerged almost immediately .	26.489145
outside i walked past the entrance to st . sophia , turned left at the end of it , and continued toward a gate in the wall ahead .	32.8761
just before reaching it i came to a grey and brown stone building that looks somewhat like an oriental pagoda , with arabic lettering in gold and colored tile decorations -- the fountain of sultan ahmet .	39.07165
going through the imperial gate in the wall , i entered the grounds of topkapi palace , home of the sultans and nerve center of the vast ottoman empire , and walked along a road toward another gate in the distance , past the church of st . irene , completed by constantine in 330 a . d . on my left , and then , just outside the second gate , i saw a spring with a tap in the wall on my right -- the executioner ' s spring , where he washed his hands and his sword after beheading his victims .	51.72389
passing through the gate , with towers on either side once used as prisons , i entered a huge square surrounded by buildings , and on the wall to my right found a general plan of the grounds , with explanations in english for each building .	136.78903
at one time about 10 , 000 people lived there .	249.90872
following arrowed signs , i veered right toward the former kitchens , complete with chimneys , which now house one of the world ' s greatest collections of chinese porcelain and a fabulous array of silver dinner services .	52.004562
next to it is a copper section , with cooking utensils and a figure of the chief cook in an elaborate , floor-length robe .	42.891457
in the court once more , i went right toward the reception house , a long one-story building with a deep portico .	90.275475
going through a door into another small court , i had the throne room directly in front .	77.83434
i walked to the right around it to buildings containing illuminated manuscripts and came to the treasury , which houses such things as coffee cups covered with diamonds , jewelled swords , rifles glittering with diamonds and huge divan-like thrones as large as small beds , on which the sultans sat cross-legged .	68.09767
they are made of gold and covered with emeralds , pearls and other jewels .	21.800913
taking the path behind the throne room to the building directly beyond it , the portrait gallery , i went right at the end of it , through a garden to a small building at the back -- a sitting room furnished with low blue divans , its floor covered with carpets , its ceiling painted with gold squares and floral designs .	64.26958
( do start fires one or two hours ahead of time to obtain a lasting bed of glowing coals .	57.63253
keep ashes from one barbecue to the next to sprinkle over coals if they are too hot , and to stop flames that arise from melting grease .	75.97931
do line barbecue fire bowl with heavy foil to reflect heat .	84.806885
don ' t forget to buy a plastic pastry brush for basting with sauces .	27.889359
clean it meticulously in boiling water and detergent , rinse thoroughly .	28.81992
do build a wall of glowing coals six to eight inches in front of meat that is barbecued on an electric spit .	55.261734
make use of the back of the barbecue or of the hood for heating vegetables , sauces and such .	132.51323
don ' t fail to shorten cooking time by the use of aluminum foil cut slightly larger than the surface of steaks and chops .	23.426296
sear on both sides then cover meat loosely with heat reflecting foil for juiciest results .	27.494514
do avoid puncturing or cutting into meats to test them .	45.67109
if doubtful about a steak , boldly cut it in half .	73.510254
if necessary to replace both halves on grill , sear cuts and allot extra time .	13.540184
for roasts , insert meat thermometer diagonally so it does not rest on bone .	98.553215
also make sure thermometer does not touch the revolving spit or hit the coals .	175.45836
don ' t practice a new recipe on guests .	255.99036
have a test-run on the family first , to be sure timing and seasoning are right .	123.57135
do buy meat the day or the day before you intend to cook it .	79.35171
keep it no longer than 36 hours before cooking , and keep it in the coldest ( but non-freezing ) compartment of the refrigerator .	50.306725
don ' t plan meals that are too complicated .	66.11781
limit yourself to good meat and drink , with bread , salad , corn or potatoes as accessories .	35.27046
do whatever kitchen work , such as fixing a salad , preparing garlic bread , or making a marinade sauce , ahead of time .	81.60175
when you start the outdoor performance , you can stay outdoors without a dozen running trips into the kitchen .	61.77395
( this goes for getting a drink tray ready , and for having a big cooler full of ice on hand long before the party begins .	90.20813
don ' t think you have to start with the most expensive equipment in the world .	38.91368
the simplest grill ( pan type ) or inexpensive hibachi can make you a chef .	50.505447
do keep the grill high enough above the fire so that when fat from meat drips down and flares up , flames cannot reach the meat .	132.70761
don ' t forget to have a supply of melamine plates , bowls , cups , saucers , and platters for outdoor use .	32.781624
made of the world ' s toughest unbreakable plastic , melamine dinnerware comes in almost 400 different patterns and dozens of colors .	152.86699
there is even one set that has `` barbecue ' ' written on it .	49.739758
it ' s cheaper to buy wall-tex and cover your outdoor table .	93.262764
or buy half a dozen lengths of oilcloth and change patterns for different kinds of barbecues .	115.07851
oilcloth only costs about 79-cents a yard for the very best .	41.722496
don ' t forget -- when you take to the hills or the beach -- that your cooler , which you might have used for wine- or beer-cooling on your terrace or back yard , is indispensable for carrying liquid refreshments .	83.578995
there are many varieties of coolers and they serve many purposes .	273.7113
with them , you can carry steaks and hamburgers at refrigerator temperatures , and also get your frozen food for stews and chowders , to the marina or picnic , in a-1 condition .	66.42576
except when you prepare `` do it yourself ' ' shish kebob or a lobster roast .	30.23849
then you ' ll want terry cloth towels for mopping up .	29.12188
don ' t think barbecue cooking is just sometimes , or seasonal .	67.510376
in the winter , hibachi in the kitchen or grill over the logs of the fireplace .	45.383327
even use your portable electric or gas grill in the winter , inside .	88.265434
summertime supper , outside , is a natural .	56.09128
you ' ll find , once your technique is perfected , that you can cook on a boat with a simple bernz-o-matic .	39.38443
get copper or earthenware mugs that keep beer chilled or soup hot .	65.22794
be sure to get a few more than you need .	44.414097
you will discover you keep the sauce for basting meat in one , use six for drinks , serve soup or coffee in another half-dozen -- and need one more to mix the salad dressing .	126.76448
don ' t forget the joys of a meal on the road .	32.499664
if you travel over the vast u . s . a . you will , no doubt , discover that feeding is an expensive business .	64.83505
decide in the beginning to put your barbecue equipment to work .	59.77204
a picnic bag , a grill , a cooler for soft drinks and beer , and for frozen convenience foods .	54.957405
eat in a restaurant or motel mornings and evenings	11.233651
turn off at any one of the marked picnic areas ( gasoline companies have touring service bureaus that issue booklets on national parks to tell you where you have barbecue facilities ) and -- with soft drinks cooled from morning loading up , hamburger , buns , an array of relishes , and fresh fruit -- your lunch is 75% cheaper than at a restaurant , and 100% more fun .	83.4713
you need a little stove , a coffee pot and a stew pot	27.860634
maybe a skillet , a basket of essentials like salt , pepper , plates , forks , knives and a can opener .	83.83337

for 25-cents load up the cooler with ice and keep cool pop in the car .	27.374348
spice is a fact of life in the u . s . a . .	13.043404
you only have to think of franks and sausages to know what i mean .	97.59282
go a step further and list all the wonderful barbecue basics -- cervelat , salami , vienna sausages , mettwurst , bratwurst , bockwurst , knackwurst , bologna , pepperoni , blutwurst -- and you have a long list of easy specialties .	25.668402
threaded on a skewer with new boiled potatoes , a bit of green pepper , a fresh white mushroom -- any one of these spiced meats makes a man a cook , and a meal a feast .	40.22551
sure , for the most of us , a frankfurter is the favorite .	141.98431
a story goes that a certain herr feuchtwanger of st . louis , around 1883 served his sausages ( grilled ) and mustard to his fancy customers .	107.54213
so that his customers should not soil their hands , feuchtwanger issued white gloves .	90.82157
discovery that the gloves frequently left with the customers made the wise peddler of spiced sausage-meat come upon a compromise .	123.00105
he had a bakery make buns sized to fit his franks .	71.7482
years later , franks-in-buns were accepted as the `` first to go ' ' at the new york polo grounds .	26.890955
the nation ' s number one picnic treat is the skinless frankfurter -- toasted over a bonfire on the beach or , more sedately , charcoal broiled on a portable grill .	29.80306
either way it ' s hard to beat in flavor as well as ease of preparation .	148.25755
to make the picnic frank come close to perfection , remember these tips	746.4245
-- score each frankfurter in four or five places about a third of the way through .	81.97072
this permits the juices to permeate the meat during cooking .	149.0845
-- relishes are as vital to the success of the frank as are buns .	280.10037
bring along the conventional ones -- catsup , pickle relish , mustard , mayonnaise -- plus a few extras , such as tangy barbecue sauce , chive cream cheese , or horse-radish for the brave ones in the crowd .	28.157005
-- using a portable grill permits you to toast the buns , too .	66.01194
watch closely while browning them , as it doesn ' t take long .	16.57156
-- an unusual flavor can be achieved by marinating the franks in french dressing or a mixture of honey , lemon juice and brown sugar prior to the picnic .	38.07014
contrary to popular opinion , `` a la mode ' ' doesn ' t mean `` with ice cream ' ' -- it just means , in the latest style .	41.59599

directions are written for those who have had previous experience in making pottery .	355.6631
instructions for preparing clay , drying , glazing and firing are not given .	47.608185
ceramic modeling clay red , white or buff .	12.418555
glazes , one-stroke ceramic colors , stains , cones as indicated in the individual instructions .	64.284996
use well-wedged clay , free of air bubbles and pliable enough to bend without cracking .	19.64755
they must be free of oil , wax and dust .	27.497412
the size of wooden mold will determine the amount of clay needed .	57.766186
roll clay to thickness indicated in individual instructions .	10.416451
whenever possible , use the wooden mold as a pattern for cutting clay .	33.75485
when mold has more than one design cavity , make individual paper patterns .	133.45094
place mold or paper pattern on rolled clay and cut clay by holding knife in vertical position ( cut more pieces than required for project to make allowance for defects	127.62781
experiment with defects for decoration techniques of glazes and colors ) .	78.768166
place the cut clay piece loosely over the carved cavity design side of wooden mold .	127.75439
to obtain clear impression of mold , press clay gently but firmly into mold cavity , starting at center and working to outer edges .	101.42189
check thickness of clay and build up thin areas by moistening surface with a little water and adding small pieces of clay .	40.189804
be sure to press the additional clay firmly into place without locking in air bubbles .	64.01395
allow project to stand for about five minutes ( if wooden press mold is a good antique , do not leave clay in too long as the dampness may cause mold to crack ) .	136.26979
to release clay from mold , place hands in a cupped position around project	268.19757
gently lift the edge on far side , then continue to release edge completely around mold .	337.41638
slight tapping on the underside of mold will help release the clay , but too much agitation will cause the clay to become soft and will interfere with removal of clay from mold .	86.629
place a piece of plaster wall board or plaster bat on clay and reverse bat , clay and mold in one action .	45.084442
this will prevent the clay from twisting or bending , causing warping when fired .	33.65184
place project on table and carefully lift the mold off .	93.7611
study surface of clay for defects or desired corrections .	5.881875
if clay is slightly out of shape , square straight sides with guide sticks or rulers pressed against opposite sides , or smooth round pieces with damp fingers .	150.39821
if the background of design is too smooth , or you wish to create a wood-grained effect , it may be added at this time with a dull tool such as the handle of a fine paintbrush .	44.268047
make slight , smooth grooves rather than cuts for the texture ( cuts could cause air pockets under the glaze creating pinholes or craters in the glaze during firing ) .	86.9159
leave the clay on plaster board to dry slowly , covered lightly with a loose piece of plastic or cloth to prevent warping .	49.49618
( opposite page , right top ) stoneware clay was used .	18.83445
clay was rolled to 1/4 ' ' ' ' thickness .	2.1650906
back of clay scored or roughened for proper gripping surface .	39.879925
glazed with two coats of creek-turn white stoneware glaze ( no glaze on sides or bottom ) .	48.702644
decorated on unfired glaze with one coat of one-stroke ceramic colors	15.800551
raised details of designs were colored in shades of yellow-green , blue-green , brown and pink .	17.922646
( opposite page , bottom ) white clay was used , rolled to 1/4 ' ' ' ' thickness .	8.769068
stained with jacquelyn ' s ceramic unfired stain , polished , following manufacturer ' s directions .	65.709755
opaque cantaloupe and transparent wood brown were used .	28.582495
( opposite page , top left ) red clay was used , rolled 1/2 ' ' ' ' thick .	15.226647
mold was used as pattern and clay cut by holding knife at about 45-degree angle , to form an undercut , making base smaller than the pattern top .	89.327644
while clay is still pressed in mold , press three equally spaced holes 1/4 ' ' ' ' deep , using pencil eraser , in bottom of clay to allow for proper drying and firing .	55.14118
paperweight may be personalized on back while clay is leather hard .	114.46583

pattern d for lid fits over top diameter of aj .	8.014637
pattern for inner lid piece e fits inside aj .	114.35432

use white or buff clay , rolled to 3/16 ' ' ' ' thickness .	2.8283138
place patterns on rolled clay and cut around them with knife in vertical position .	66.865715

bevel and score ends of clay piece a so that they overlap about 1/2 ' ' ' ' and make even thickness .	80.315414

if design head has a deep cavity , clay lid will be quite thick at this point	73.79761

use three strips of clay to hold in place ( see fig . 2 , page 71 ) .	11.620754
do not use wood as it will not shrink with the clay and would cause breakage .	51.855515

inside of pieces was glazed with three coats of creek-turn bottle green antique glaze .	34.607933
outside was finished with creek-turn brown toner brushed on and sponged off to give antique finish .	42.044888
when changing from one color to another , whether working on right or wrong side , pick up the new strand from underneath dropped strand .	166.82481
photograph shows the wrong side of work with light strand being picked up under dark strand in position to be purled .	107.82659
spread article on flat surface to required width before measuring length at center .	90.56456
mark row on which first stitches have been bound off for armhole by drawing a contrasting colored thread through it .	83.621605
place work on a flat surface and smooth out .	53.946445
when directions read `` sl a marker on needle ' ' , put a small safety pin , paper clip , or commercial ring marker on needle .	58.799526
in working , always slip marker from one needle to another .	34.676395
to mark a row or stitch , tie contrasting thread around end of row or stitch to be marked .	79.89825
most seams are sewn with backstitch , especially on curved , slanted or loose edges .	56.510834
pin right sides of pieces together , keeping edges even and matching rows or patterns .	239.71738

place sleeve seam at center underarm and center of sleeve cap at shoulder seam .	29.483908
straight vertical edges , such as those at the back seam of a sock , can be woven together invisibly .	57.7582
hotei is 23 feet long with an 8-1/2-foot beam and every inch a family boat .	103.79645
menfolk can ride in the forward cockpit where the helmsman has a clear view .	75.632
youngsters can sleep or amuse themselves safely in the large cabin which has 5-foot 11-inch headroom , bunks for three , galley and marine toilet .	26.40038
the gals can sun themselves in the roomy aft cockpit .	8.029291
all are well distributed , not crowded together near the stern .	33.387985
and with passenger weight shifted forward , hotei levels off for speed under power of a merc 800 .	124.316185
the 80-hp motor drives her at 25 mph with six aboard ! !	57.33368
with only two aboard , hotei does better than 27 mph -- and she gives a comfortable ride at this speed even in a three-foot chop .	95.31013
she also banks into a turn like a fine runabout -- not digging in on the outside to throw passengers all over the boat like many a small cabin cruiser .	146.99512
we ' ve been out in five-foot waves and stayed dry .	82.51398
a lot of thought went into storage space construction .	41.76181
there ' s a large compartment in the forward cockpit for charts and other items .	74.99889
the cabin has several shelves for small items and storage under the bunks for water skiis , life jackets , etc . .	34.74985
the aft cockpit has a af storage bin over six feet long that doubles as a seat .	108.28615
on each side of the motor well there ' s storage for battery , bumpers , line and spare props with six-gallon gas tanks below .	91.907875
the well itself is designed to take two merc 800 ' s or 500 ' s if you wish and there ' s room for a 25-gallon long-cruise gas tank below it .	61.238415
needless to say , you can ' t build hotei in a couple of weeks .	53.41274
our building time was slightly over 400 hours -- but the total cost for the hull with fiberglas bottom , sink , head and hardware was under $800 .	66.617035
a comparable manufactured boat would cost close to $3 , 000 .	10.619172
consider what you have to earn to be able to spend the $3 , 000 and your building time is well worth it .	73.60014
a gator trailer , model 565 , is used to transport the boat to the waterways .	26.575005
this piece of equipment costs a little over $600 but it will save you that in mooring and hauling fees in a few years .	60.351307
all framing in hotei is one-inch mahogany which , in the dressed state you buy it , is about the 13/16-inch thickness specified in the drawings .	85.6513
therefore , the lumber is bought in planks and ripped to size for battens , etc . , on a table saw .	87.75981
besides flathead bronze screws , silicon bronze stronghold nails ( made by independent nail & packing co . , bridgewater , mass . ) are used extensively in assembly and weldwood resorcinol glue is used in all the joints .	41.34433
construction follows a thorough study of the drawings .	5.3700895
start by laying out the six frames and the transom on a level floor .	65.81892
draw each outline in a different-color chalk , one on top of the other .	27.201977
in this way you will be able to detect any obvious mistakes .	130.31053
the transom frame is made first with the joints lapped , glued and fastened with one-inch , no . 12 stronghold nails .	38.565876
after notching it for the keelson , chines and battens , the half-inch plywood transom is secured to it with glue and the same type nails .	44.768234
all frames are butted at the joints and 3/8-inch plywood gussets are glued and nailed on each side of each joint , again using the one-inch , no . 12 nails .	61.751892
the frames are notched only for the keelson and the chines .	20.628376
if notched for the battens , they would require more work , be weakened and limber holes would have to be bored so that bilge water could flow through .	151.45953
nowhere in the boat do the frames come in contact with the plywood planking .	28.228006
the jig is erected after the frames and transom are complete .	30.149828
this is an important step because any misalignment would cause progressively worse misalignment in the hull as you advance in construction .	121.774
be sure all members are parallel , vertical and level as required .	77.25239
after the frames and transom are set up on the jig and temporarily braced , a piece of three-inch-wide mahogany ( only widths will be given since the 13/16-inch thickness is used throughout ) is butted between frames one and two below the line of the keelson .	61.184155
the frames are glued and screwed to this piece .	21.301891
the joints are also reinforced on each side with small blocks set in resin-saturated fiberglas cloth and nailed .	37.94094
it is over this piece that the laminated stem and keelson are spliced .	19.058565
the keelson , made of two three-inch widths , is next installed .	213.37881
the first piece is glued and screwed to the frames and transom and the piece butted between frames one and two .	37.350155
the second piece is in turn glued and screwed to the first .	21.328146
note , however , that it is six inches shorter at the forward end .	43.13462
one-inch , no . 10 screws are used in both cases .	21.104633
a stem jig is next cut to the proper shape and temporarily fastened to frame one .	97.04602
take two three-inch-wide pieces and rip them down the center of the thickness to make the four .	44.657486
then spread a generous amount of glue on the four pieces and bend them into place on the jig .	43.228695
the first two pieces butt against the inner member of the keelson and are glued and screwed to the brace between the first two frames .	23.823624
the second two pieces lap over the inner member of the keelson and butt against the outer member .	44.190857
they ' re glued and screwed to the inner member of the keelson .	28.933346
a number of c clamps hold the pieces together on the jig until the glue sets .	72.714096
the battens are carefully fastened in place after some necessary fairing on all frames .	216.56187
glue and 1-1/2-inch , no . 10 screws are used .	7.338756
placement is important because the rear seat , bunks and front jump seats rest on or are fastened to many of the side battens .	133.00562
with the exception of two battens , all run to the stem where they are glued and screwed after careful beveling .	56.32878
the chines go in the same way except that they are made of two pieces of two-inch wood for strength and easier bending .	73.60099
fairing is always a tedious job but the work can be cut down considerably with a skill planer and a simple jig .	46.798534
i clamped a 30-inch piece of aluminum to the base of the planer with a pair of sure grips .	76.8044
the aluminum , flush against the battens , acted as a fairing stick and enabled me to plane the chines and keelson to the proper bevels easily .	60.38694
if you don ' t own a planer and don ' t want to buy one , it ' s well worth renting .	16.242594
the planking is five-ply , 3/8-inch-thick weldwood royal marine plywood .	5.4139247
this can be obtained in 42-inch widths 24 feet long .	8.383884
plank the sides first , using glue and one-inch , no . 12 stronghold nails at all battens , the stem and the transom .	27.131384
another person inside with a weight against each batten will help in the fastening .	111.789764
the best procedure is to have a few friends hold the planking in place while you mark it off .	271.97485
i used a homemaster routo-jig made by porter cable for this job .	105.49421
it ' s good for cutting all the planking because it cuts with a bit-like blade at high rpm and does not chatter the plywood like a saber saw .	107.88522
when cut , the planking is clamped in place for a final and careful trimming .	28.035265
then it is marked on the inside where it comes in contact with the transom , frames , keelson and all the battens .	52.435307
it may then be pre-drilled for the fastenings .	3.5766048
the next step is to remove it and spread glue where it has been marked at the contact points .	127.613625
the bottom planking is applied in the same manner .	5.8843203
after planking , the bottom gets a layer of fiberglas .	31.141775
the spray rails are first glued on the outside and fastened from the inside with screws .	62.96461
then the chines are rounded off and the bottom is rough-sanded in preparation .	47.474525
since the sides are also covered up to the spray rails , they are also rough-sanded in that area .	33.62736
the cloth is laid on one half of the bottom at a time .	21.446537
a 50-inch width is used on each side and it laps the keel line by about three inches .	182.45949
lay the cloth in place and trim it to size .	26.64767
then remove it and give the whole bottom a coat of resin .	22.420406
when the resin has hardened , mix up another batch with a pigment added if you wish .	73.80095
i used bright red , mixing the pigment in thoroughly before adding the hardener .	85.11288
using a cheap brush , coat one side of the bottom with the resin and then apply the cloth .	43.888126
when the cloth is smooth , apply another coat of resin , spreading it with a paint roller .	45.974644
be sure it is well saturated and then allow it to harden .	22.232874
when the whole bottom has hardened , use a disk sander to feather the edges of the cloth at the keel line and near the spray rail .	49.959644
then lay a three-inch-wide strip of cloth along the keel line from the transom to the point of the stem .	26.746532
before the resin has hardened , screw a one-inch mahogany keel strip along the centerline .	17.200546
fiberglas materials are available from glass plastic supply co . , 1605 w . elizabeth ave . , linden , n . j . .	22.433191
the hull is now turned over ( with the help of about seven friends ) and placed in a level , well-braced position .	112.90376
i laid three layers of glass cloth on the inside of the stem , also installing a bow eye at this time .	49.18596
for added strength , i also fastened a small block on each side of every frame and batten joint .	85.53197
again , these blocks were set in resin-saturated glass cloth and nailed .	37.192078
after trimming off the excess on the frames and transom which was used to fasten them to the jig at a working height , the top of the side planking is installed .	52.009678
this is made up of scraps left over from the sides and bottom .	73.91682
these flaring parts really help to keep the boat dry .	144.43063
when they ' re on , the top edges are planed even with the sheer batten .	57.390213
the sides of the motor well run from the bottom battens to the top and from frame six to the transom , forming a real strong transom brace .	62.6084
note another piece of wood six inches wide is fastened to the transom between these pieces .	78.94715
all the flooring and the storage bin is half-inch exterior fir plywood .	50.695534
most floor battens are glued and screwed to the flooring .	4.933692
these battens are glued and screwed to the frames .	16.960953
with all deck battens in place , the bilge is cleaned and painted up to the floor line .	50.379665
use one coat of firzite and one coat of marine paint .	31.00441
bottoms of the floorboards are also painted and the flooring is then screwed in place .	36.785835
after the decking is on , the cabin sides are installed .	121.991135
they ' re followed by the front and rear bulkheads as illustrated .	136.52487
the windshield glass is shatterproof and plexiglas is used in the cabin .	26.437202
inside , bunks are framed up and installed as indicated .	78.28055
a head is a handy thing to have and i installed one under a removable section of the port bunk .	99.72245
the sink in the hinged panel above the bunk drains into the head and a five-gallon water tank is mounted on the bulkhead above the sink .	35.16245
for padding the seats and bunks , i used ensolite , type aj .	156.72363
lightweight , non-absorbent , fire resistant and dimensionally stable , it is easily bonded to the wood with contact cement .	102.018585
available in af sheets , it costs about a dollar a square foot .	207.5743
it is a full scale , small , but efficient house that can become a year ' round retreat complete in every detail .	411.86288
because of the unique design by the architect egils hermanovski , you can build most of it in your own home workshop in your spare time .	32.84094
most of it is panelized and utilizes standard materials , and requires the use of only simple tools .	44.73693
on the following pages and in the following issues we take you every step of the way to your vacation cottage , from choosing the proper site to applying the final trim .	99.362175
in recognition of the growing trend for second homes , or vacation cottages , we have designed this one specifically with the family handyman in mind .	130.59068
it is a big project , not to be taken lightly .	72.18099
but each step has been broken down into easy stages , utilizing standard materials and simple tools , well within the capabilities of the handyman .	72.577095
the idea behind our design is modular units , or panelization .	21.57007
everything possible has been scaled to standard sizes and measurements of materials .	25.469547
wall panels and structural timbers are standard as are windows and doors , making for a minimum of cutting .	108.224976
we have developed an ingenious method of interlocking these so that you can make the major part of your house in your own workshop , panel by panel , according to plan .	69.96265
thus , when you have prepared your foundation and laid the floor , these can be trucked to the site and erected with a small crew of friends in a weekend .	46.93723
the roof timbers are precut and the panels standard so that the house can be completely enclosed in a matter of three or four days .	50.73865
then you can do the finishing touches at your leisure .	15.754456
due to the fact that building codes and regulations vary so much throughout the country , the first thing to do is to find out what , if any , they are .	51.795338
close to a large city they might even specify the size of the nails used	78.393394
in a remote section there might be no restrictions at all .	69.53329
this can usually be found out at the nearest town hall .	102.42525
at the same time check the electrical , plumbing , and sanitary requirements , as well as possible zoning regulations .	22.152248
whether electricity and public water and sewers are available or not , check the local customs in the use of bottled or l-p gas ( we give you alternatives later on ) .	94.52631
