he behaved publicly with a cocky , swaggering truculence that offended their vulpine latin minds , and behaved towards them personally with an unimpressed insolence that enraged them beneath their blandness .	48.221737
they were disturbed by his idiotic bravado -- as , when his bodyguard , yankee schwartz , complained that he had been snubbed by dave miller , a prize-fight referee , chieftain of a jewish gang and one of four brothers of tough reputation , who were hirschey , a gambler-politician in loose beer-running league with torrio and o ' banion , frank , a policeman , and max , the youngest .	53.420776
to settle this slight , o ' banion went down to the la salle theatre in the loop , where , he had learned , dave miller was attending the opening of a musical comedy .	36.233086
at the end of the performance , dave and max came out into the brilliantly lit foyer among a surge of gowned and tuxedoed first nighters .	47.81809
o ' banion drew his guns and fired at dave , severely wounding him in the stomach .	46.61326
a second bullet ricocheted off max ' s belt buckle , leaving him unhurt but in some distress .	55.90914
o ' banion tucked away his gun and walked out of the theatre	50.45572
that sort of braggadocio , for that sort of reason , in the view of torrio and capone , was a nonsense .	41.08666
a further example of the incompatible difference in personalities was when two policemen held up a torrio beer convoy on a west side street and demanded $300 to let it through .	140.15266
one of the beer-runners telephoned o ' banion -- on a line tapped by the detective bureau -- and reported the situation .	112.84537
o ' banion ' s reaction was `` three hundred dollars ! !	150.31606
why , i can get them knocked off for half that much ' ' .	83.94789
upon which the detective bureau despatched rifle squads to prevent trouble if o ' banion should send his gunmen out to deal with the hijacking policemen .	92.34502
but in the meantime the beer-runner , unhappy with this solution , telephoned torrio and returned to o ' banion with the message `` say , dionie , i just been talking to johnny , and he said to let them cops have the three hundred .	87.14735
he says he don ' t want no trouble ' ' .	14.092413
but torrio and capone had graver cause to hate and distrust the irishman .	29.200745
for three years , since the liquor territorial conference , torrio had , with his elastic patience , and because he knew that retaliation could cause only violent warfare and disaster to business , tolerated o ' banion ' s impudent double-crossing .	51.533783
they had suffered , in sulky silence , the sight of his sharp practice in cicero .	147.75421
when , as a diplomatic gesture of amity and in payment for the loan of gunmen in the april election , torrio had given o ' banion a slice of cicero , the profits from that district had been $20 , 000 a month .	55.19963
in six months o ' banion had boosted the profits to $100 , 000 a month -- mainly by bringing pressure to bear on fifty chicago speak-easy proprietors to shift out to the suburb .	75.902466
these booze customers had until then been buying their supplies from the sheldon , saltis-mcerlane , and druggan-lake gangs , and now they were competing for trade with the torrio-capone saloons	75.06434
once again o ' banion ' s brash recklessness had caused a proliferation of ill will .	204.2109
the revenue from o ' banion ' s cicero territory went up still higher , until the yield was more than the torrio-capone takings from the far bigger trade area of chicago ' s south and west sides .	136.42537
but he still showed no intention of sharing with the syndicate .	26.522356
at last , even the controlled torrio was unable to hold still , and he tentatively suggested that o ' banion should take a percentage in the stickney brothels in return for one from his cicero beer concession .	69.65793
o ' banion ' s reply was a raucous laugh and a flat refusal .	80.12682
still more jealous bitterness was engendered by the o ' banion gang ' s seizure from a west side marshalling yard of a freight-car load of canadian whisky worth $100 , 000 and by one of the biggest coups of the prohibition era -- the sibley warehouse robbery , which became famous for the cool brazenness of the operation .	48.890266
here was stored $1 , 000 , 000 worth of bonded whisky .	27.295229
these 1750 cases were carted off in a one-night operation by the o ' banion men , who left in their stead the same number of barrels filled with water .	72.854935
a tsunami may be started by a sea bottom slide , an earthquake or a volcanic eruption .	55.22651
the most infamous of all was launched by the explosion of the island of krakatoa in 1883	49.44314
it raced across the pacific at 300 miles an hour , devastated the coasts of java and sumatra with waves 100 to 130 feet high , and pounded the shore as far away as san francisco .	54.957718
the ancient greeks recorded several catastrophic inundations by huge waves .	166.6902
whether or not plato ' s tale of the lost continent of atlantis is true , skeptics concede that the myth may have some foundation in a great tsunami of ancient times .	88.1583
indeed , a tremendously destructive tsunami that arose in the arabian sea in 1945 has even revived the interest of geologists and archaeologists in the biblical story of the flood .	77.34298
one of the most damaging tsunami on record followed the famous lisbon earthquake of november 1 , 1755	70.81263
its waves persisted for a week and were felt as far away as the english coast .	144.70581
tsunami are rare , however , in the atlantic ocean	672.977
they are far more common in the pacific .	4.249146
japan has had 15 destructive ones ( eight of them disastrous ) since 1596 .	25.735292
the hawaiian islands are struck severely an average of once every 25 years .	86.303444
in 1707 an earthquake in japan generated waves so huge that they piled into the inland sea	162.8668
one wave swamped more than 1 , 000 ships and boats in osaka bay .	77.306625
a tsunami in the hawaiian islands in 1869 washed away an entire town ( ponoluu ) , leaving only two forlorn trees standing where the community had been .	135.88773
in 1896 a japanese tsunami killed 27 , 000 people and swept away 10 , 000 homes .	53.28824
the dimensions of these waves dwarf all our usual standards of measurement .	79.32413
an ordinary sea wave is rarely more than a few hundred feet long from crest to crest -- no longer than 320 feet in the atlantic or 1 , 000 feet in the pacific .	25.516876
but a tsunami often extends more than 100 miles and sometimes as much as 600 miles from crest to crest .	26.827627
while a wind wave never travels at more than 60 miles per hour , the velocity of a tsunami in the open sea must be reckoned in hundreds of miles per hour .	35.532032
the greater the depth of the water , the greater is the speed of the wave	84.20556
lagrange ' s law says that its velocity is equal to the square root of the product of the depth times the acceleration due to gravity .	74.80471
in the deep waters of the pacific these waves reach a speed of 500 miles per hour .	62.46571
tsunami are so shallow in comparison with their length that in the open ocean they are hardly detectable .	93.03845
their amplitude sometimes is as little as two feet from trough to crest .	51.246002
usually it is only when they approach shallow water on the shore that they build up to their terrifying heights .	63.08738
on the fateful day in 1896 when the great waves approached japan , fishermen at sea noticed no unusual swells .	108.48792
not until they sailed home at the end of the day , through a sea strewn with bodies and the wreckage of houses , were they aware of what had happened .	50.686478
the seemingly quiet ocean had crashed a wall of water from 10 to 100 feet high upon beaches crowded with bathers , drowning thousands of them and flattening villages along the shore .	49.092377
the giant waves are more dangerous on flat shores than on steep ones .	50.20435
they usually range from 20 to 60 feet in height , but when they pour into a v-shaped inlet or harbor they may rise to mountainous proportions .	65.56807
generally the first salvo of a tsunami is a rather sharp swell , not different enough from an ordinary wave to alarm casual observers .	101.01078
this is followed by a tremendous suck of water away from the shore as the first great trough arrives .	73.3181
reefs are left high and dry , and the beaches are covered with stranded fish .	32.752735
at hilo large numbers of people ran out to inspect the amazing spectacle of the denuded beach .	49.484604
many of them paid for their curiosity with their lives , for some minutes later the first giant wave roared over the shore .	44.22103
after an earthquake in japan in 1793 people on the coast at tugaru were so terrified by the extraordinary ebbing of the sea that they scurried to higher ground .	92.03173
when a second quake came , they dashed back to the beach , fearing that they might be buried under landslides .	21.919033
just as they reached the shore , the first huge wave crashed upon them .	55.724377
a tsunami is not a single wave but a series .	140.99384
the waves are separated by intervals of 15 minutes to an hour or more ( because of their great length ) , and this has often lulled people into thinking after the first great wave has crashed that it is all over .	78.668434
the waves may keep coming for many hours .	3.1609156
usually the third to the eighth waves in the series are the biggest .	75.483604
among the observers of the 1946 tsunami at hilo was francis p . shepard of the scripps institution of oceanography , one of the world ' s foremost marine geologists .	18.091276
he was able to make a detailed inspection of the waves .	18.099585
their onrush and retreat , he reported , was accompanied by a great hissing , roaring and rattling .	24.143145
the third and fourth waves seemed to be the highest .	68.51131
on some of the islands ' beaches the waves came in gently	232.42131
they were steepest on the shores facing the direction of the seaquake from which the waves had come .	78.00805
in hilo bay they were from 21 to 26 feet high .	37.667965
the highest waves , 55 feet , occurred at pololu valley .	35.24118
scientists and fishermen have occasionally seen strange by-products of the phenomenon .	29.602982
during a 1933 tsunami in japan the sea glowed brilliantly at night .	17.820494
the luminosity of the water is now believed to have been caused by the stimulation of vast numbers of the luminescent organism noctiluca miliaris by the turbulence of the sea .	32.03574
japanese fishermen have sometimes observed that sardines hauled up in their nets during a tsunami have enormously swollen stomachs	42.590115
the fish have swallowed vast numbers of bottom-living diatoms , raised to the surface by the disturbance .	26.08819
the waves of a 1923 tsunami in sagami bay brought to the surface and battered to death huge numbers of fishes that normally live at a depth of 3 , 000 feet .	59.28416
gratified fishermen hauled them in by the thousands .	11.340884
the tsunami-warning system developed since the 1946 disaster in hawaii relies mainly on a simple and ingenious instrument devised by commander c . k . green of the coast and geodetic survey staff .	78.88702
it consists of a series of pipes and a pressure-measuring chamber which record the rise and fall of the water surface .	112.10984
but when waves with a period of between 10 and 40 minutes begin to roll over the ocean , they set in motion a corresponding oscillation in a column of mercury which closes an electric circuit .	72.64575
this in turn sets off an alarm , notifying the observers at the station that a tsunami is in progress .	70.53142
such equipment has been installed at hilo , midway , attu and dutch harbor .	24.128115
the moment the alarm goes off , information is immediately forwarded to honolulu , which is the center of the warning system .	34.662548
this center also receives prompt reports on earthquakes from four coast survey stations in the pacific which are equipped with seismographs .	67.530754
its staff makes a preliminary determination of the epicenter of the quake and alerts tide stations near the epicenter for a tsunami .	74.36683
by means of charts showing wave-travel times and depths in the ocean at various locations , it is possible to estimate the rate of approach and probable time of arrival at hawaii of a tsunami getting under way at any spot in the pacific .	97.548615
the civil and military authorities are then advised of the danger , and they issue warnings and take all necessary protective steps .	119.328125
all of these activities are geared to a top-priority communication system , and practice tests have been held to assure that everything will work smoothly .	103.56596
since the 1946 disaster there have been 15 tsunami in the pacific , but only one was of any consequence .	77.139305
on november 4 , 1952 , an earthquake occurred under the sea off the kamchatka peninsula .	20.593142
at 17 07 that afternoon ( greenwich time ) the shock was recorded by the seismograph alarm in honolulu .	38.047302
within about an hour with the help of reports from seismic stations in alaska , arizona and california , the quake ' s epicenter was placed at 51 degrees north latitude and 158 degrees east longitude .	43.170002
while accounts of the progress of the tsunami came in from various points in the pacific ( midway reported it was covered with nine feet of water ) , the hawaiian station made its calculations and notified the military services and the police that the first big wave would arrive at honolulu at 23 30 greenwich time .	129.64148
it turned out that the waves were not so high as in 1946 .	129.1227
they hurled a cement barge against a freighter in honolulu harbor , knocked down telephone lines , marooned automobiles , flooded lawns , killed six cows .	93.81154
but not a single human life was lost , and property damage in the hawaiian islands did not exceed $800 , 000 .	45.495975
there is little doubt that the warning system saved lives and reduced the damage .	162.22714
but it is plain that a warning system , however efficient , is not enough .	64.54263
in the vulnerable areas of the pacific there should be restrictions against building homes on exposed coasts , or at least a requirement that they be either raised off the ground or anchored strongly against waves .	155.36673
the key to the world of geology is change	9416.197
life has evolved from simple combinations of molecules in the sea to complex combinations in man .	94.08611
the land , too , is changing , and earthquakes are daily reminders of this .	48.8609
earthquakes result when movements in the earth twist rocks until they break .	157.39136
sometimes this is accompanied by visible shifts of the ground surface	52.92615
often the shifts cannot be seen , but they are there	72.991
and everywhere can be found scars of earlier breaks once deeply buried .	226.47328
today ' s earthquakes are most numerous in belts where the earth ' s restlessness is presently concentrated , but scars of the past show that there is no part of the earth that has not had them .	63.79391
the effects of earthquakes on civilization have been widely publicized , even overemphasized .	56.011475
the role of an earthquake in starting the destruction of whole cities is tremendously frightening , but fire may actually be the principal agent in a particular disaster .	165.09982
superstition has often blended with fact to color reports .	331.1624
we have learned from earthquakes much of what we now know about the earth ' s interior , for they send waves through the earth which emerge with information about the materials through which they have traveled .	109.61118
these waves have shown that 1 , 800 miles below the surface a liquid core begins , and that it , in turn , has a solid inner core .	65.40469
earthquakes originate as far as 400 miles below the surface , but they do not occur at greater depths .	40.77103
two unsolved mysteries are based on these facts .	3.9730184
( 1 ) as far down as 400 miles below the surface the material should be hot enough to be plastic and adjust itself to twisting forces by sluggish flow rather than by breaking , as rigid surface rocks do .	100.99859
( 2 ) if earthquakes do occur at such depths , why not deeper ? ?	117.10858
knowledge gained from studying earthquake waves has been applied in various fields .	47.378334
in the search for oil and gas , we make similar waves under controlled conditions with dynamite and learn from them where there are buried rock structures favorable to the accumulation of these resources .	134.75073
we have also developed techniques for recognizing and locating underground nuclear tests through the waves in the ground which they generate .	100.96031
the following discussion of this subject has been adapted from the book causes of catastrophe by l . don leet .	65.44974
at twelve minutes after five on the morning of wednesday , april 18 , 1906 , san francisco was shaken by a severe earthquake .	36.162716
a sharp tremor was followed by a jerky roll .	29.152426
in ireland ' s county limerick , near the river shannon , there is a quiet little suburb by the name of garryowen , which means `` garden of owen ' ' .	35.885822
undoubtedly none of the residents realize the influence their town has had on american military history , or the deeds of valor that have been done in its name .	108.67934
bursting from the lips of a charging cavalry trooper was the last sound heard on this earth by untold numbers of cheyennes , sioux and apaches , mexican banditos under pancho villa , japanese in the south pacific , and chinese and north korean communists in korea .	49.63717
garryowen is the battle cry of the 7th u . s . cavalry regiment , `` the fighting seventh ' ' .	14.775195
today a battle cry may seem an anachronism , for in the modern army , esprit de corps has been sacrificed to organizational charts and tables .	53.453926
but don ' t tell that to a veteran of the fighting seventh , especially in a saloon on saturday night .	60.605133
of all the thousands of men who have served in the 7th cav , perhaps no one knows its spirit better than lieutenant colonel melbourne c . chandler .	80.8504
wiry and burr-headed , with steel blue eyes and a chest splattered with medals , chandler is the epitome of the old-time trooper .	31.178879
the truth is , however , that when mel chandler first reported to the regiment the only steed he had ever ridden was a swivel chair and the only weapon he had ever wielded was a pencil .	95.759155
chandler had been commissioned in the medical service corps and was serving as a personnel officer for the kansas city medical depot when he decided that if he was going to make the army his career , he wanted to be in the fighting part of it .	51.77093
though he knew no more about military science and tactics than any other desk officer , he managed to get transferred to the combat forces .	95.211464
the next thing he knew he was reporting for duty as commanding officer of troop h , 7th cavalry , in the middle of corps maneuvers in japan .	51.751865
outside of combat , he couldn ' t have landed in a tougher spot .	73.36052
first of all , no unit likes to have a new co brought in from the outside , especially when he ' s an armchair trooper .	81.65609
second , if there is ever a perfect time to pull the rug out from under him , it ' s on maneuvers .	64.87343
in combat , helping your co make a fool of himself might mean getting yourself killed .	238.5013
but in maneuvers , with the top brass watching him all the time , it ' s easy .	55.791004
but his first few days with troop h were full of surprises , beginning with first sergeant robert early .	168.33124
chandler had expected a tough old trooper with a gravel voice .	57.74988
instead sergeant early was quiet , sharp and confident .	29.729168
he had enlisted in the army straight out of high school and had immediately set about learning his new trade .	153.56705
there was no weapon early could not take apart and reassemble blind-folded .	269.17526
he could lead a patrol and he knew his paper work .	78.924835
further , he had taken full advantage of the army ' s correspondence courses .	36.39174
he not only knew soldiering , but mathematics , history and literature as well .	35.500862
but for all his erudite confidence , sergeant early was right out of the garryowen mold .	206.7959
he was filled with the spirit of the fighting seventh .	6.815018
sergeant early let the new co know just how lucky he was to be in the best troop in the best regiment in the united states army .	40.398914
he fed the captain bits of history about the troops and the regiment .	64.84114
for example , it was a battalion of the 7th cavalry under colonel george armstrong custer that had been wiped out at the battle of the little big horn .	28.6089
it didn ' t take captain chandler long to realize that he had to carry a heavy load of tradition on his shoulders as commander of troop aj .	51.64942
but what made the load lighter was the realization that every officer , non-com and trooper was ready and willing to help him carry it , for the good of the troop and the regiment .	92.108116
maneuvers over , the 7th returned to garrison duty in tokyo , captain chandler still with them .	139.88248
it was the 7th cavalry whose troopers were charged with guarding the imperial palace of the emperor .	54.88709
but still mel chandler was not completely convinced that men would really die for a four-syllable word , `` garryowen ' ' .	57.948605
it happened at the st . patrick ' s day party , a big affair for a regiment which had gone into battle for over three-quarters of a century to the strains of an irish march .	75.30195
in the middle of the party chandler looked up to see four smiling faces bearing down upon him , each beaming above the biggest , greenest shamrock he had ever seen .	102.19834
the faces belonged to lieutenant marvin goulding , his wife and their two children .	52.67373
and when the singing began , it was the gouldings who sang the old irish songs the best .	109.802345
though there was an occasional good-natured chuckle about marvin goulding , the jewish officer from chicago , singing tearfully about the ould sod , no one really thought it was strange .	39.050987
for marvin goulding , like giovanni martini , the bugler boy who carried custer ' s last message , or margarito lopez , the one-man army on leyte , was a garryowen , through and through .	87.63239
it was no coincidence that goulding was one of the most beloved platoon leaders in the regiment .	28.591019
and so mel chandler got the spirit of garryowen .	11.538626
he set out to keep troop h the best troop in the best regiment .	39.802944
one of his innovations was to see to it that every man -- cook and clerk as well as rifleman -- qualified with every weapon in the troop .	131.38742
even the mess sergeant , bill brown , a dapper , cocky transfer from an airborne division , went out on the range .	56.824554
the troop received a new leader , lieutenant robert m . carroll , fresh out of rotc and bucking for regular army status .	88.892105
carroll was sharp and military , but he was up against tough competition for that ra berth , and he wanted to play it cool .	96.69902
so mel chandler set out to sell him on the spirit of garryowen , just as he himself had been sold a short time before .	75.671585
when the korean war began , on june 25 , 1950 , the anniversary of the day custer had gone down fighting at the little big horn and the day the regiment had assaulted the beachhead of leyte during world war 2 , , the 7th cavalry was not in the best fighting condition .	38.23366
its entire complement of non-commissioned officers on the platoon level had departed as cadre for another unit , and its vehicles were still those used in the drive across luzon in world war 2 .	129.72873
just a month after the korean war broke out , the 7th cavalry was moving into the lines , ready for combat .	38.30841
from then on the fighting seventh was in the thick of the bitterest fighting in korea .	40.282665
one night on the naktong river , mel chandler called on that fabled esprit de corps .	100.91002
the regiment was dug in on the east side of the river and the north koreans were steadily building up a concentration of crack troops on the other side .	29.421661
the troopers knew an attack was coming , but they didn ' t know when , and they didn ' t know where .	15.324592
at 6 o ' clock on the morning of august 12 , they were in doubt no longer .	49.40885
the enemy had filtered across the river during the night and a full force of 1000 men , armed with russian machine guns , attacked the position held by chandler ' s men .	88.359886
first came the cannon fodder , white-clad civilians being driven into death as a massive human battering ram .	48.038113
they were followed by crack north korean troops , who mounted one charge after another .	140.33154
they overran the 7th cav ' s forward machine-gun positions through sheer weight of numbers , over piles of their own dead .	136.27902
another force flanked the company and took up a position on a hill to the rear .	39.400333
captain chandler saw that it was building up strength .	744.8743
he assembled a group of 25 men , composed of wounded troopers awaiting evacuation , the company clerk , supply men , cooks and drivers , and led them to the hill .	68.95849
one of the more seriously wounded was lieutenant carroll , the young officer bucking for the regular army .	36.566143
chandler left carroll at the bottom of the hill to direct any reinforcements he could find to the fight .	127.222946
he took one step , two , broke into a trot and then into a run .	53.877293
the first thing he knew the words `` garryowen ' ' ! !	6.7615166
his followers shouted the old battle cry after him and charged the hill , firing as they ran .	163.89665
the koreans fell back , but regrouped at the top of the hill and pinned down the cavalrymen with a screen of fire .	22.191948
chandler , looking to right and left to see how his men were faring , suddenly saw another figure bounding up the hill , hurling grenades and hollering the battle cry as he ran .	56.342697
it was bob carroll , who had suddenly found himself imbued with the spirit of garryowen .	29.750044
he had formed his own task force of three stragglers and led them up the hill in a fighting seventh charge .	89.5024
because of this diversionary attack the main group that had been pinned down on the hill was able to surge forward again .	72.84601
but an enemy grenade hit carroll in the head and detonated simultaneously .	130.76361
he went down like a wet rag and the attackers hit the dirt in the face of the withering enemy fire .	30.446098
enemy reinforcements came pouring down , seeking a soft spot .	231.12404
they found it at the junction between troops h and g , and prepared to counterattack .	42.50093
`` okay , men ' ' , he said .	3.9774883
goulding leaped to his feet and started forward , `` garryowen ' ' ! !	10.940313
but the bullets whacked home before he finished his battle cry and marvin goulding fell dead .	55.7031
for an instant his men hesitated , unable to believe that their lieutenant , the most popular officer in the regiment , was dead .	64.603264
then they let out a bellow of anguish and rage and , cursing , screaming and hollering `` garryowen ' ' ! !	21.350302
they charged into the enemy like wild men .	4.4622235
that finished the job that captain chandler and lieutenant carroll had begun .	75.199646
goulding ' s platoon pushed back the enemy soldiers and broke up the timing of the entire enemy attack .	54.196815
reinforcements came up quickly to take advantage of the opening made by goulding ' s platoon .	38.516907
the north koreans threw away their guns and fled across the rice paddies .	32.33214
artillery and air strikes were called in to kill them by the hundreds .	75.60532
though bob carroll seemed to have had his head practically blown off by the exploding grenade , he lived .	149.88176
today he is a major -- in the regular army .	53.666004
so filled was mel chandler with the spirit of garryowen that after korea was over , he took on the job of writing the complete history of the regiment .	61.254566
after years of digging , nights and weekends , he put together the big , profusely illustrated book , of garryowen and glory , which is probably the most complete history of any military unit .	87.51551
the battle of the naktong river is just one example of how the battle cry and the spirit of the fighting seventh have paid off .	75.70208
for nearly a century the cry has never failed to rally the fighting men of the regiment .	76.32773
take the case of major marcus a . reno , who survived the battle of the little big horn in 1876 .	58.937244
from the enlisted men he pistol-whipped to the subordinate officer whose wife he tried to rape , a lot of men had plenty of reason heartily to dislike marcus reno .	133.46927
many of his fellow officers refused to speak to him .	11.160497
but when a board of inquiry was called to look into the charges of cowardice made against him , the men who had seen reno leave the battlefield and the officer who had heard reno suggest that the wounded be left to be tortured by the sioux , refused to say a harsh word against him .	80.18592
he was a member of the fighting seventh .	4.035892
although it was at the battle of the little horn , about which more words have been written than any other battle in american history , that the 7th cavalry first made its mark in history , the regiment was ten years old by then .	96.3893
brevet major general george armstrong custer was the regiment ' s first permanent commander and , like such generals as george s . patton and terry de la mesa allen in their rise to military prominence , custer was a believer in blood and guts warfare .	116.85473
during the civil war , custer , who achieved a brilliant record , was made brigadier general at the age of 23 .	90.117065
he finished the war as a major general , commanding a full division , and at 25 was the youngest major general in the history of the u . s . army .	41.48198
i do not mean to suggest that these assumptions are self-evident , in the sense that everyone agrees with them .	36.95193
if they were , walter lippmann would be writing the same columns as george sokolsky , and herb lock would have nothing to draw cartoons about .	147.04356
i do mean , however , that i take them for granted , and that everything i shall be saying would appear quite idiotic against any contrary assumptions .	143.36365
the ultimate objective of american policy is to help establish a world in which there is the largest possible measure of freedom and justice and peace and material prosperity	78.09149
and in particular -- since this is our special responsibility -- that these conditions be enjoyed by the people of the united states .	42.096546
i speak of `` the largest possible measure ' ' because any person who supposes that these conditions can be universally and perfectly achieved -- ever -- reckons without the inherent imperfectability of himself and his fellow human beings , and is therefore a dangerous man to have around .	77.314445
these conditions are unobtainable -- are not even approachable in the qualified sense i have indicated -- without the prior defeat of world communism .	172.02515
this is true for two reasons because communism is both doctrinally , and in practice , antithetical to these conditions	70.851105
and because communists have the will and , as long as soviet power remains intact , the capacity to prevent their realization .	62.70598
moreover , as communist power increases , the enjoyment of these conditions throughout the world diminishes pro rata and the possibility of their restoration becomes increasingly remote .	121.1366
it follows that victory over communism is the dominant , proximate goal of american policy .	44.788715
proximate in the sense that there are more distant , more `` positive ' ' ends we seek , to which victory over communism is but a means .	104.55178
but dominant in the sense that every other objective , no matter how worthy intrinsically , must defer to it .	135.28064
but if we must choose between peace and keeping the communists out of berlin , then we must fight .	62.058765
freedom , in the sense of self-determination , is a worthy objective	37.077026
but if granting self-determination to the algerian rebels entails sweeping that area into the sino-soviet orbit , then algerian freedom must be postponed .	99.40545
but if justice for bantus entails driving the government of the union of south africa away from the west , then the bantus must be prepared to carry their identification cards yet a while longer .	100.79517
but if providing higher standards of living gets in the way of producing sufficient guns to resist communist aggression , then material sacrifices and denials will have to be made .	75.703705
it may be , of course , that such objectives can be pursued consisently with a policy designed to overthrow communism	71.53336
my point is that where conflicts arise they must always be resolved in favor of achieving the indispensable condition for a tolerant world -- the absence of soviet communist power .	55.384216
this much having been said , the question remains whether we have the resources for the job we have to do -- defeat communism -- and , if so , how those resources ought to be used .	68.171814
this brings us squarely to the problem of power , and the uses a nation makes of power .	71.28174
i submit that this is the key problem of international relations , that it always has been , that it always will be .	45.31131
and i suggest further that the main cause of the trouble we are in has been the failure of american policy-makers , ever since we assumed free world leadership in 1945 , to deal with this problem realistically and seriously .	118.041595
in the recent political campaign two charges were leveled affecting the question of power , and i think we might begin by trying to put them into proper focus .	59.659622
the other , for the most part , true .	199.06485
the first was that america had become -- or was in danger of becoming -- a second-rate military power .	97.41953
i know i do not have to dwell here on the absurdity of that contention .	78.287346
you may have misgivings about certain aspects of our military establishment -- i certainly do -- but you know any comparison of over-all american strength with over-all soviet strength finds the united states not only superior , but so superior both in present weapons and in the development of new ones that our advantage promises to be a permanent feature of u . s . -soviet relations for the foreseeable future .	110.58989
i have often searched for a graphic way of impressing our superiority on those americans who have doubts , and i think mr . jameson campaigne has done it well in his new book american might and soviet myth .	121.981834
suppose , he says , that the tables were turned , and we were in the soviets ' position `` there would be more than 2 , 000 modern soviet fighters , all better than ours , stationed at 250 bases in mexico and the caribbean .	85.24508
overwhelming russian naval power would always be within a few hundred miles of our coast .	20.854162
half of the population of the u . s . would be needed to work on arms just to feed the people ' ' .	36.384544
add this to the unrest in the countries around us where oppressed peoples would be ready to turn on us at the first opportunity .	81.45709
add also a comparatively primitive industrial plant which would severely limit our capacity to keep abreast of the soviets even in the missile field which is reputed to be our main strength .	94.75985
if we look at the situation this way , we can get an idea of khrushchev ' s nightmarish worries -- or , at least , of the worries he might have if his enemies were disposed to exploit their advantage .	54.849827
the other charge was that america ' s political position in the world has progressively deteriorated in recent years .	46.985588
the contention needs to be formulated with much greater precision than it ever was during the campaign , but once that has been done , i fail to see how any serious student of world affairs can quarrel with it .	56.79741
the argument was typically advanced in terms of u . s . `` prestige ' ' .	15.243956
prestige , however , is only a minor part of the problem	8.634902
and even then , it is a concept that can be highly misleading .	17.6093
prestige is a measure of how other people think of you , well or ill .	184.39384
but contrary to what was implied during the campaign , prestige is surely not important for its own sake .	55.871033
only the vain and incurably sentimental among us will lose sleep simply because foreign peoples are not as impressed by our strength as they ought to be .	125.49409
the thing to lose sleep over is what people , having concluded that we are weaker than we are , are likely to do about it .	59.061424
the evidence suggests that foreign peoples believe the united states is weaker than the soviet union , and is bound to fall still further behind in the years ahead .	54.936493
this ignorant estimate , i repeat , is not of any interest in itself	107.65542
but it becomes very important if foreign peoples react the way human beings typically do -- namely , by taking steps to end up on what appears to be the winning side .	117.8015
to the extent , then , that declining u . s . prestige means that other nations will be tempted to place their bets on an ultimate american defeat , and will thus be more vulnerable to soviet intimidation , there is reason for concern .	70.681435
still , these guesses about the outcome of the struggle cannot be as important as the actual power relationship between the soviet union and ourselves .	60.171852
here i do not speak of military power where our advantage is obvious and overwhelming but of political power -- of influence , if you will -- about which the relevant questions are is soviet influence throughout the world greater or less than it was ten years ago ? ?	141.38634
and is western influence greater or less than it used to be ? ?	61.7206
in answering these questions , we need to ask not merely whether communist troops have crossed over into territories they did not occupy before , and not merely whether disciplined agents of the cominform are in control of governments from which they were formerly excluded the success of communism ' s war against the west does not depend on such spectacular and definitive conquests .	108.59765
success may mean merely the displacement of western influence .	40.89478
communist political warfare , we must remember , is waged insidiously and in deliberate stages .	159.49345
fearful of inviting a military showdown with the west which they could not win , the communists seek to undermine western power where the nuclear might of the west is irrelevant -- in backwoods guerrilla skirmishes , in mob uprisings in the streets , in parliaments , in clandestine meetings of undercover conspirators , at the united nations , on the propaganda front , at diplomatic conferences -- preferably at the highest level .	59.531403
the soviets understand , moreover , that the first step in turning a country toward communism is to turn it against the west .	76.6466
thus , typically , the first stage of a communist takeover is to `` neutralize ' ' a country .	45.168255
the second stage is to retain the nominal classification of `` neutralist ' ' , while in fact turning the country into an active advocate and adherent of soviet policy .	72.71475
and this may be as far as the process will go .	213.62263
the kremlin ' s goal is the isolation and capture , not of ghana , but of the united states -- and this purpose may be served very well by countries that masquerade under a `` neutralist ' ' mask , yet in fact are dependable auxiliaries of the soviet foreign office .	60.08753
to recite the particulars of recent soviet successes is hardly reassuring .	98.39319
six years ago french indochina , though in troubie , was in the western camp .	45.4115
cambodia is , for all practical purposes , neutralist .	1759.8381
indonesia , in the early days of the republic , leaned toward the west .	52.922268
today sukarno ' s government is heavily besieged by avowed communists , and for all of its `` neutralist ' ' pretensions , it is a firm ally of soviet policy .	34.017815
ceylon has moved from a pro-western orientation to a neutralism openly hostile to the west .	22.925238
in the middle east , iraq , syria and egypt were , a short while ago , in the western camp .	89.90495
today the nasser and kassem governments are adamantly hostile to the west , are dependent for their military power on soviet equipment and personnel	71.67042
in almost every particular follow the kremlin ' s foreign policy line .	30.792067
a short time ago all africa was a western preserve .	304.4381
never mind whether the kikiyus and the bantus enjoyed wilsonian self-determination the point is that in the struggle for the world that vast land mass was under the domination and influence of the west .	53.25195
today , africa is swerving violently away from the west and plunging , it would seem , into the soviet orbit .	26.15898
latin america was once an area as `` safe ' ' for the west as nebraska was for nixon .	65.29121
one latin american country , cuba , has become a soviet bridgehead ninety miles off our coast .	73.998604
in some countries the trend has gone further than others mexico , panama , and venezuela are displaying open sympathy for castroism , and there is no country -- save the dominican republic whose funeral services we recently arranged -- where castroism and anti-americanism does not prevent the government from unqualifiedly espousing the american cause .	83.9828
only in europe have our lines remained firm -- and there only on the surface .	148.4535
the strains of neutralism are running strong , notably in england , and even in germany .	39.245396
what have we to show by way of counter-successes ? ?	73.4267
we have had opportunities -- clear invitations to plant our influence on the other side of the iron curtain .	45.341038
there was the hungarian revolution which we praised and mourned , but did nothing about .	72.9609
there was the polish revolution which we misunderstood and then helped guide along a course favorable to soviet interests .	267.59872
there was the revolution in tibet which we pretended did not exist .	90.632126
only in one instance have we moved purposively and effectively to dislodge existing communist power in guatemala .	143.36455
and contrary to what has been said recently , we did not wait for `` outside pressures ' ' and `` world opinion ' ' to bring down that communist government	59.632233
we moved decisively to effect an anti-communist coup d ' etat .	11.511456
we served our national interests , and by so doing we saved the guatemalan people the ultimate in human misery .	204.05196
the first rattle of the machine guns , at 7 10 in the evening , roused around me the varied voices and faces of fear .	133.0848
`` sounds exactly like last time ' ' .	3.368377
the young man spoke steadily enough , but all at once he looked grotesquely unshaven .	54.7403
the middle-aged man said over and over , `` why did i come here , why did i come here ' ' .	26.270903
amid the crackle of small arms and automatic weapons , i heard the thumping of mortars .	54.186024
this was my second day in vientiane , the administrative capital of laos , and my thoughts were none too brave .	93.10764
better stay in the hotel lobby , where the walls looked good and thick .	51.970547
chinese and indian merchants across the street were slamming their steel shutters .	36.865303
hotel attendants pulled parked bicycles into the lobby .	3.9952412
a woman with a small boy slipped in between them .	205.67815
`` please ' ' , she said , `` please ' ' .	12.390977
she held out her hand to show that she had money .	34.8238
the american newspaperman worried about getting to the cable office .	160.78517
had the communist-led pathet lao finally come this far ? ?	95.2656
or was it another revolt inside vientiane ? ?	1.0480961
`` let ' s play hero ' ' , i said .	18.627937
`` let ' s go to the roof and see ' ' .	11.79507
there had been an eclipse of the moon .	6.949058
a traditional lao explanation is that the moon was being swallowed by a toad , and the remedy was to make all possible noise , ideally with firearms .	47.9388
the din was successful , too , for just before the moon disappeared , the frightened toad had begun to spit it out again , which meant good luck all around .	95.96531
how quaint it all seemed the next day .	5.2592454
a restaurant posted a reminder to patrons `` who became excited and left without paying their checks ' ' .	172.81839
but everyone i met had sought cover first and asked questions later .	434.74597
and no wonder , for vientiane , the old city of sandalwood , had become the city of bullet holes .	47.270645
i saw holes in planes at the airport and in cars in the streets .	60.514748
along the main thoroughfares hardly a house had not been peppered .	50.02299
in place of the police headquarters was a new square filled with rubble .	70.48589
mortars had demolished the defense ministry and set fire to the american embassy next door .	107.988785
what had been the ambassador ' s suite was now jagged walls of blackened brick .	110.51915
this damage had been done in the battle of vientiane , fought less than three months earlier when four successive governments had ruled here in three days ( december 9-11 , 1960 ) .	78.99698
and now , in march , all laos suffered a state of siege .	63.980865
the pathet lao forces held two northern provinces and openly took the offensive in three more .	277.92007
throughout the land their hit-and-run terrorists spread fear of ambush and death .	31.222923
`` and it ' s all the more tragic because it ' s so little deserved ' ' , said mr . j . j . a . frans , a belgian official of the united nations educational , scientific , and cultural organization .	37.584023
we talked after i hailed his jeep marked with the u . n . flag .	13.639817
practically all the people of laos , he explained -- about two million of them -- are rice farmers , and the means and motives of modern war are as strange to them as clocks and steel plows .	158.69902
they look after their fields and children and water buffaloes in ten or eleven thousand villages , with an average of 200 souls .	98.65812
nobody can tell more closely how many villages there are .	50.623615
they spread over an area no larger than oregon	2044.7087
yet they include peoples as different from one another as oregonians are from patagonians .	115.14195
faith in the buddha and staying at peace with the phis , the spirits	74.54343
and to live in harmony with nature ' ' .	1.8172457
`` precisely ' ' , said mr . frans .	120.90197
he spoke of the season of dryness and dust , brought by the monsoon from the northeast , in harmony with the season of rain and mud , brought by the monsoon from the southwest .	30.979155
the slim pirogues in harmony with the majestically meandering mekong river .	2.5081136
shy , slender-waisted girls at the loom in harmony with the frangipani by the wayside .	31.744879
for so long as death was not violent , it was natural and to be welcomed , making a funeral a feast .	66.77663
to many a frenchman -- they came 95 years ago , colonized , and stayed until laos became independent in 1953 -- the land had been even more delightfully tranquil than tahiti .	83.65131
yet laos was now one of the most explosive headaches of statesmen around the globe .	79.4733
the pathet lao , stiffened by communist veterans from neighboring north viet nam , were supplied by soviet aircraft .	26.68703
the royal lao army , on the other hand , was paid and equipped with american funds .	51.65255
in six years , u . s . aid had amounted to more than $1 . 60 for each american -- a total of three hundred million dollars .	61.283077
we were there at a moment when the situation in laos threatened to ignite another war among the world ' s giants .	46.727238
even if it did not , how would this little world of gentle people cope with its new reality of grenades and submachine guns ? ?	144.29846
to find out , we traveled throughout that part of laos still nominally controlled , in the daytime at least , by the royal lao army from attopeu , the city of buffalo dung in the southeast , to muong sing , the city of lions in the northwest , close to communist china ( map , page 250 ) .	52.024887
we rode over roads so rough that our jeep came to rest atop the soil between ruts , all four wheels spinning uselessly .	125.80798
we flew in rickety planes so overloaded that we wondered why they didn ' t crash .	38.83055
in the end we ran into communist artillery fire .	35.30056
`` we ' ' were bill garrett of the national geographic illustrations staff , whose three cameras and eight lenses made him look as formidable as any fighting man we met	258.54935
boun my -- the name means one who has a boun , a celebration , and is therefore lucky -- was born in savannakhet , the border of paradise .	76.38871
he had attended three universities in the united states .	1.8610387
but he had never seen the mountainous half of his native land north of vientiane , including the royal capital , luang prabang .	42.12796
before the airplanes came , he said , travel in laos was just about impossible .	384.58914
alas , so it almost proved for us , too .	24.350737
to go outside the few cities required permits .	17.031584
and getting them seemed a life ' s work .	30.534212
nobody wanted americans to be hurt or captured , and few soldiers could be spared as escorts .	53.178135
we were told that to the pathet lao , a kidnaped american was worth at least $750 , a fortune in laos .	44.937057
everyone had heard of the american contractor who had spurned an escort .	21.184042
now pathet lao propagandists were reported marching him barefoot from village to village , as evidence of evil american intervention .	190.65926
although we enjoyed our rounds of the government offices in vientiane , with officials offering tea and pleasing conversation in french , we were getting nowhere .	221.35577
we had nearly decided that all the tales of lao lethargy must be true , when we were invited to take a trip with the prime minister .	52.443436
could we be ready in 15 minutes ? ?	1.1135205
his highness had decided only two hours ago to go out of town , and he was eager to be off .	35.18275
and so , after a flight southeast to savannakhet , we found ourselves bouncing along in a jeep right behind the land-rover of prince boun oum of champassak , a tall man of churchillian mien in a bush jacket and a ten-gallon hat from texas .	52.983913
from his shoulder bag peeked the seven-inch barrel of a luger .	7.3594766
with our company of soldiers , we made one long column of reddish dust .	177.42497
in keng kok , the city of silkworms , the prime minister bought fried chickens and fried cicadas , and two notebooks for me .	17.693031
then we drove on , until there was no more road and we traversed dry rice fields , bouncing across their squat earth walls .	124.59059
an hour of bouncing , a brief stop in a village to inspect a new school or dispensary .	37.37529
more bouncing , another stop , a new house for teachers , a new well .	163.75394
then off again , rushing to keep up .	78.012215
but our two jeep mates -- keo viphakone from luang prabang and john cool from beaver , pennsylvania -- were beaming under their coatings of dust .	61.936142
together they had probably done more than any other men to help push laos toward the 20th century -- constructively .	92.36038
mr . keo , once a diplomat in paris and washington , was commissioner of rural affairs .	57.517303
john , an engineer and anthropologist with a doctorate from the london school of economics , headed the rural development division of usom , the united states operations mission administering u . s . aid .	62.68
`` what you see are self-help projects ' ' , john said .	24.40663
`` we ask the people what they want , and they supply the labor .	80.88649
we send shovels , cement , nails , and corrugated iron for roofs .	44.591934
that way they have an infirmary for $400 .	3.6792717
we have 2 , 500 such projects , and they add up to a lot more than just roads and wells and schools .	92.49892
`` our people have been used to accepting things as they found them ' ' , he said .	22.538572
`` where there was no road , they lived without one .	244.4975
now they learn that men can change their surroundings , through their traditional village elders , without violence .	159.24039
that ' s a big step toward a modern state .	73.848854
you might say we are in the nation-building business ' ' .	31.010118
in the villages people lined up to give us flowers .	107.782845
then came coconuts , eggs , and rice wine .	10.879869
the prime minister paid his respects to the buddhist monks , strode rapidly among the houses , joked with the local soldiery , and made a speech .	51.07938
the soldiers are fighting and the americans are helping , he said , but in the fight against the pathet lao the key factor is the villager himself .	51.548065
but our stumping tour of the south wasn ' t all misery .	26.688744
crossing the 4 , 000-foot width of the mekong at champassak , on a raft with an outboard motor , we took off our dusty shirts and enjoyed a veritable ocean breeze .	78.104034
briefly we rolled over a paved road up to pak song , on the cool bolovens plateau .	45.919224
the prince visited the hospital of operation brotherhood , supported by the junior chamber of commerce of the philippines , and fed rice to two pet elephants he kept at his residence at pak song .	46.6548
in the village of soukhouma , which means `` peaceful ' ' , we had a baci .	29.235086
this is the most endearing of lao ceremonies .	3.3454974
it takes place in the household , a rite of well-wishing for myriad occasions -- for the traveler , a wedding , a newborn child , the sick , the new year , for any good purpose .	60.9093
the preparations were elaborate flowers , candles , incense sticks , rice wine , dozens of delicacies , and pieces of white cotton string .	28.045515
the strings were draped around flowers in tall silver bowls ( page 261 ) .	17.17082
the candles were lighted , and we sat on split-bamboo mats among the village notables .	31.03988
i was careful to keep my feet , the seat of the least worthy spirits , from pointing at anyone ' s head , where the worthiest spirits reside .	96.75907
now a distinguished old man called on nine divinities to come and join us .	88.82796
a man has 32 souls , one for each part of the body .	25.93302
those souls like to wander off , and must be called back .	82.98407
with the divinities present and our souls in place , we were wished health , happiness , and power .	119.4884
then , one after another , the villagers tied the waiting cotton strings around our wrists .	191.32024
these were to be kept on , to hold in the 32 souls .	80.94626
as we stepped out into the sunlight , a man came up to john cool and silently showed him his hand .	109.01956
it had a festering hole as big as a silver dollar .	29.931316
john said `` i have some antiseptic salve with me , but it ' s too late for that ' ' .	20.715893
my interviews with teen-agers confirmed this portrait of the weakening of religious and ethnic bonds .	82.36071
jewish identity was often confused with social and economic strivings .	7.335587
`` being jewish gives you tremendous drive ' ' , a boy remarked .	11.613617
`` it means that you have to get ahead ' ' .	9.866366
when i pressed for a purely religious definition , i encountered the familiar blend of liberal piety , interfaith good will , and a small residue of ethnic loyalty .	115.742516
`` i like the tradition ' ' , a girl said .	93.925186
`` i like to follow the holidays when they come along .	25.771034
but you don ' t have to worship in the traditional way .	13.456478
as i see it , there ' s no real difference between being jewish , catholic , or protestant ' ' .	42.091236
another teen-ager remarked `` most jews don ' t believe in god , but they believe in people -- in helping people ' ' .	43.89826
still another boy asserted `` to be a good jew is to do no wrong	115.54092
it ' s to be a good person ' ' .	2.2948523
when asked how this was different from being a good protestant , the boy answered , `` it ' s the same thing ' ' .	24.594051
this accords with the study by maier and spinrad .	3.6129296
they discovered that , although 42 per cent of a sample of catholic students and 15 per cent of the protestants believed it important to live in accordance with the teachings of their religion , only 8 per cent of the jewish students had this conviction .	43.69603
the most important aims of the jewish students were as follows to make the world a better place to live in -- 30 per cent	117.713455
to get happiness for yourself -- 28 per cent	1.0441275
nevertheless , most of the teen-agers i interviewed believed in maintaining their jewish identity and even envisioned joining a synagogue or temple .	236.62552
however , they were hostile to jewish orthodoxy , professing to believe in judaism `` but in a moderate way ' ' .	51.072998
one boy said querulously about orthodox jews `` it ' s the twentieth century , and they don ' t have to wear beards ' ' .	14.105936
the reason offered for clinging to the ancestral faith lacked force and authority even in the teen-agers ' minds .	168.8421
`` we were brought up that way ' ' was one statement which won general assent .	111.592705
`` i want to show respect for my parents ' religion ' ' was the way in which a boy justified his inhabiting a halfway house of judaism .	90.19488
still another suggested that he would join a temple `` for social reasons , since i ' ll be living in a suburb ' ' .	52.180508
intermarriage , which is generally regarded as a threat to jewish survival , was regarded not with horror or apprehension but with a kind of mild , clinical disapproval .	122.62398
most of the teen-agers i interviewed rejected it on pragmatic grounds .	173.70808
`` when you marry , you want to have things in common ' ' , a girl said , `` and it ' s hard when you don ' t marry someone with your own background ' ' .	24.865807
a fourteen-year-old girl from the middle west observed wryly that , in her community , religion inconveniently interfered with religious activities -- at least with the peripheral activities that many middle class jews now regard as religious .	100.831085
it appears that an orthodox girl in the community disrupted plans for an outing sponsored by one of the jewish service groups because she would not travel on saturday and , in addition , required kosher food .	94.27576
another girl from a relatively large midwestern city described herself as `` the only orthodox girl in town ' ' .	51.548676
this is , no doubt , inaccurate , but it does convey how isolated she feels among the vast army of the nonobservant .	259.50708
one of the significant things about jewish culture in the older teen years is that it is largely college-oriented .	51.700787
sixty-five per cent of the jewish teen-agers of college age attend institutions of higher learning .	115.68921
this is substantially higher than the figures for the american population at large -- 45 . 6 per cent for males and 29 . 2 per cent for females .	44.926422
this may help explain a phenomenon described by a small-town jewish boy .	25.571732
in their first two years in high school , jewish boys in this town make strenuous exertions to win positions on the school teams .	98.22027
however , in their junior and senior years , they generally forego their athletic pursuits , presumably in the interest of better academic achievement .	55.82432
it is significant , too , that the older teen-agers i interviewed believed , unlike the younger ones , that jewish students tend to do better academically than their gentile counterparts .	65.32935
the percentage of jewish girls who attend college is almost as high as that of boys .	105.43919
the motivations for both sexes , to be sure , are different .	48.81246
the vocational motive is the dominant one for boys , while jewish girls attend college for social reasons and to become culturally developed .	77.06049
one of the significant developments in american-jewish life is that the cultural consumers are largely the women .	105.58978
it is they who read -- and make -- jewish best-sellers and then persuade their husbands to read them .	65.89159
in upper teen jewish life , the non-college group tends to have a sense of marginality .	26.286676
`` people automatically assume that i ' m in college ' ' , a nineteen-year-old machinist observed irritably .	24.636236
however , among the girls , there are some morale-enhancing compensations for not going to college .	58.063915
the jewish working girl almost invariably works in an office -- in contradistinction to gentile factory workers -- and , buttressed by a respectable income , she is likely to dress better and live more expansively than the college student .	123.74087
she is even prone to regard the college girl as immature .	285.54315
one of the reasons for the high percentage of jewish teen-agers in college is that a great many urban jews are enabled to attend local colleges at modest cost .	42.51667
this is particularly true in large centers of jewish population like new york , chicago , and philadelphia .	45.67736
what is noteworthy about this large group of teen-agers is that , although their attitudes hardly differentiate them from their gentile counterparts , they actually lead their lives in a vast self-enclosed jewish cosmos with relatively little contact with the non-jewish world .	92.89765
perhaps the jewish students at brooklyn college -- constituting 85 per cent of those who attend the day session -- can serve as a paradigm of the urban , lower-middle class jewish student .	57.863342
there is , to begin , an important sex difference .	459.34573
typically , in a lower-middle class jewish family , a son will be sent to an out-of-town school , if financial resources warrant it , while the daughter will attend the local college .	96.78474
first , the girl ' s education has a lower priority than the son ' s .	72.1104
second , the attitude in jewish families is far more protective toward the daughter than toward the son .	218.77773
most jewish mothers are determined to exercise vigilance over the social and sexual lives of their daughters by keeping them home .	85.16593
the consequence of this is that the girls at brooklyn college outnumber the boys and do somewhat better academically .	64.42803
one can assume that some of the brightest boys are out of town .	74.09266
brooklyn college students have an ambivalent attitude toward their school .	52.510532
on the one hand , there is a sense of not having moved beyond the ambiance of their high school .	71.150116
this is particularly acute for those who attended midwood high school directly across the street from brooklyn college .	47.516186
they have a sense of marginality at being denied that special badge of status , the out-of-town school .	150.84842
at the same time , there is a good deal of self-congratulation at attending a good college -- they are even inclined to exaggerate its not inconsiderable virtues -- and they express pleasure at the cozy in-group feeling that the college generates .	94.704384
`` it ' s people of your own kind ' ' , a girl remarked .	25.15891
`` you don ' t have to watch what you say .	69.06673
of course , i would like to go to an out-of-town school where there are all kinds of people , but i would want lots of jewish kids there ' ' .	29.13959
for most brooklyn college students , college is at once a perpetuation of their ethnic attachments and a breaking away from the cage of neighborhood and family .	75.59354
brooklyn college is unequivocally jewish in tone , and efforts to detribalize the college by bringing in unimpeachably midwestern types on the faculty have been unavailing .	80.57195
however , a growing intellectual sophistication and the new certitudes imparted by courses in psychology and anthropology make the students increasingly critical of their somewhat provincial and overprotective parents .	134.0111
and the rebellion of these third generation jews is not the traditional conflict of culture but , rather , a protest against a culture that they view as softly and insidiously enveloping .	74.251144
`` as long as i ' m home , i ' ll never grow up ' ' , a nineteen-year-old boy observed sadly .	22.139456
`` they don ' t like it if i do anything away from home .	75.9554
it ' s so much trouble , i don ' t usually bother ' ' .	9.776013
for girls , the overprotection is far more pervasive .	12.649524
parents will drive on friday night to pick up their daughters after a sorority or house plan meeting .	137.8515
a freshman girl ' s father not too long ago called a dean at brooklyn college and demanded the `` low-down ' ' on a boy who was going out with his daughter .	60.512962
the domestic tentacles even extend to the choice of a major field .	36.97792
under pressure from parents , the majority of brooklyn college girls major in education since that co-ordinates best with marriage plans -- limited graduate study requirement and convenient working hours .	712.501
this means that a great many academically talented girls are discouraged from pursuing graduate work of a more demanding nature .	101.510475
a kind of double standard exists here for jewish boys and girls as it does in the realm of sex .	55.730648
the breaking away from the prison house of brooklyn is gradual .	397.65802
first , the student trains on his hapless parents the heavy artillery of his newly acquired psychological and sociological insights .	60.99307
then , with the new affluence , there is actually a sallying forth into the wide , wide world beyond the precincts of new york .	81.397644
it is significant that the catskills , which used to be the summer playground for older teen-agers , a kind of summer suburb of new york , no longer attracts them in great numbers -- except for those who work there as waiters , bus boys , or counselors in the day camps .	77.29122
but it should be pointed out that some of the new watering places -- fire island , nantucket , westhampton , long island , for example -- tend to be homogeneously jewish .	59.319534
although brooklyn college does not yet have a junior-year-abroad program , a good number of students spend summers in europe .	63.73614
in general , however , the timetable of travel lags considerably behind that of the student at harvard or smith .	140.44121
and acculturation into the world at large is likely to occur for the brooklyn college student after college rather than during the four school years .	103.33983
brooklyn college is marjorie morningstar territory , as much as the bronx or central park west .	112.50812
there are hordes of nubile young women there who , prodded by their impatient mothers , are determined to marry .	96.18887
it is interesting that , although the percentage of married students is not appreciably higher at brooklyn than elsewhere -- about 30 per cent of the women and 25 per cent of the men in the graduating class -- the anxiety of the unmarried has puffed up the estimate .	61.092148
`` almost everybody in the senior class is married ' ' , students say dogmatically .	115.67796
and the school newspaper sells space to jubilant fraternities , sororities , and houses ( in the house plan association ) that have good news to impart .	99.03991
these announcements are , in effect , advertisements for themselves as thriving marriage marts .	59.728878
there are boxed proclamations in the newspaper of watchings , pinnings , ringings , engagements , and marriages in a scrupulously graded hierarchy of felicity .	31.74473
`` witt house happily announces the engagement of fran horowitz to erwin schwartz of fife house ' ' .	28.875706
the brooklyn college student shows some striking departures from prevailing collegiate models .	70.05806
the ivy league enjoys no easy dominion here , and the boys are as likely to dress in rather foppish continental fashion , or even in nondescript working class manner , as they are in the restrained , button-down ivy way .	58.83843
the girls are prone to dress far more flamboyantly than their counterparts out of town , and eye shadow , mascara , and elaborate bouffant hairdos -- despite the admonitions of cautious guidance personnel -- are not unknown even in early morning classes .	122.55628
among the boys , there is very little bravado about drinking .	113.55247
brooklyn college is distinctive for not having an official drinking place .	328.70578
the fort lauderdale encampment for drinking is foreign to most brooklyn college boys .	185.37912
this should be used frequently ( but shaken before using ) .	576.77014
for galled breasts , the mother should shave into half a cup of fresh unsalted lard enough white chalk to make a paste .	29.791609
this could also be used for any other skin irritation .	64.37988
or she might place cornstarch in the oven for a short time and then apply this under her breasts .	71.54872
`` female troubles ' ' of various kinds do not seem to have been common on the frontier	56.34616
at least i have only one remedy for anything of this kind in my collection , one for hastening delayed menstruation .	98.58997
bruises , burns , cuts , etc . , occurred frequently on the frontier , and folk medicine gave the answers to these problems too .	179.14716
bruises and black eyes were relieved by application of raw beefsteak .	12.403269
( doctors now say that it was not the meat but the coolness of the applications which relieved the pain .	105.76217
) salted butter was another cure for bruises .	3.380589
many people agreed that burns should be treated with bland oily salves or unsalted butter or lard , but one informant told me that a burn should be bathed in salt water	32.995663
the burn oozed watery fluid for many days , and finally the healing was completed by bathing it with epsom salts .	99.586586
another swore by vinegar baths for burns , and still another recommended salted butter .	49.935207
`` butter salve ' ' or `` butter ointment ' ' was used for burns , and for bruises as well .	9.813173
this was made by putting butter in a pan of water and allowing it to boil	36.065853
when it was cool , the fat was skimmed off and bottled .	25.608015
cow ' s milk was another cure for burns , and burns covered with gum arabic or plain mucilage healed quickly .	45.15333
one man , badly burned about the face and eyes by an arc welding torch , was blinded and could not find a doctor at the time .	39.3093
a sympathetic friend made poultices of raw potato parings , which she said was the best and quickest way to draw out the `` heat ' ' .	54.95418
later the doctor used mineral oil on the burns .	41.992443
the results were good , but which treatment helped is still not known .	138.9794
to stop bleeding , cobwebs were applied to cuts and wounds .	72.15353
one old-timer said to sprinkle sugar on a bleeding cut , even when on a knuckle , if it was made by a rusty tool	68.64695
this would stop the flow and also prevent infection .	121.703995
my lawyer told me that his mother used a similar remedy for cuts and wounds	65.58357
she sprinkled common sugar directly on the injury and then bound it loosely with cotton cloth , over which she poured turpentine .	81.20079
he showed me one of his fingers which had been practically amputated and which his mother had treated	81.23224
a `` chaw ' ' of tobacco put on an open wound was both antiseptic and healing .	100.18777
or a thin slice of plug tobacco might be laid on the open wound without chewing .	53.82993
one old man told me that when he was a boy he was kicked in the head by a fractious mule and had his scalp laid back from the entire front of his head .	44.60291
his brother ran a mile to get the father	3447.425
when they reached the boy , the father sliced a new plug of tobacco , put the scalp back in place , and covered the raw edges with the slices .	60.419197
then he put a rag around the dressing to keep it in place .	27.855127
there was no cleaning or further care , but the wound healed in less than two weeks and showed no scar .	60.71974
veronica from the herb garden was also used to stop bleeding , and rue was an antiseptic .	38.2777
until quite recently , `` sterile ' ' maggots could be bought to apply to a wound	74.51446
they would feed on its surface , leaving it clean so that it could be medically treated .	84.45366
tetanus could be avoided by pouring warm turpentine over a wound .	51.643806
one family bound wounds with bacon or salt pork strips , or , if these were not handy , plain lard .	62.095173
another sprinkled sugar on hot coals and held the wounded foot or hand in the smoke .	64.89085
rabies were cured or prevented by `` madstones ' ' which the pioneer wore or carried .	68.85591
in 1872 there were known to be twenty-two in norton county , and one had been in the family for 200 years .	60.59768
another cure for hydrophobia was to suck the wounds , then cauterize them with a hot knife or poker .	36.735813
while nowadays we recognize the fact that there are many causes for bleeding at the nose , not long ago a nosebleed was simply that , and treatment had little variation .	117.963104
since a fall or blow might have caused it , a cold pack was usually first aid .	97.96782
this might be applied to the top of the nose or the back of the neck , pressed on the upper lip , or inserted into the nostril ( cotton was usually used in this last ) .	47.344334
nosebleed could be stopped by wrapping a red woolen string about the patient ' s neck and tying it in a knot for each year of his life .	29.910057
or the victim could chew hard on a piece of paper , meanwhile pressing his fingers tight in his ears .	36.30949
old sores could be healed by the constant application of a wash made of equal parts vinegar and water .	133.30919
blood blisters could be prevented from forming by rubbing a work blister immediately with any hard nonpoisonous substance .	198.90108
felons were cured by taking common salt and drying it in the oven , pounding it fine , and mixing it with equal parts of spirits of turpentine	74.95288
this mixture was then spread on a cloth and wrapped around the affected part .	83.108696
as the cloth dried , more of the mixture was applied , and after twenty-four hours the felon was supposed to be `` killed ' ' .	35.275158
`` get a bite , spit on it ' ' was a proverb .	18.130093
yellow clay was used as a poultice for insect bites and also for swellings	104.428116
not long ago `` denver mud ' ' was most popular .	115.98428
chiggers were a common pest along streams and where gardens and berries thrived	72.04919
so small as to be scarcely visible to the eye , they buried themselves in the victim ' s flesh .	43.697433
bathing the itching parts with kerosene gave relief and also killed the pests .	62.784367
ant bites were eased by applying liquid bluing .	4.4086804
for mosquito bites a paste of half a glass of salt and half a glass of soda was made .	20.94351
for wasp stings onion juice , obtained by scraping an onion , gave quick relief .	83.86679
a handier remedy was to bathe the painful part in strong soapy water	254.73555
mud was sometimes used as well as soap .	12.898641
just plain old black dirt was also used as a pack to relieve wasp or bee stings .	38.27787
to keep them out of homes , even in the 1900 ' s , was a chore .	27.62505
bed slats were washed in alum water , legs of beds were placed in cups of kerosene , and all woodwork was treated liberally with corrosive sublimate , applied with a feather .	57.835644
kerosene was very effective in ridding pioneer homes of the pests .	18.377531
at times pioneer children got lice in their hair .	46.297028
a kerosene shampoo seems a heroic treatment , but it did the job .	33.064716
to remove an insect from one ' s ear warm water should be inserted .	255.14473
a cinder or other small object could be removed from the eye by placing a flaxseed in the eye .	30.184164
as the seed swelled its glutinous covering protected the eyeball from irritation , and both the cinder and the seed could soon be washed out .	63.596035
another way to remove small objects from the eye was to have the person look cross-eyed	240.69867
the particle would then move toward the nose , where it could be wiped out with a wisp of cotton .	38.2917
shingles were cured by gentian , an old drug , used in combinations .	59.382137
for erysipelas a mixture of one dram borax and one ounce glycerine was applied to the afflicted part on linen cloth .	79.13522
itching skin , considered `` just nerves ' ' , was eased by treating with whiskey and salt .	32.178658
winter itch was treated by applying strong apple cider in which pulverized bloodroot had been steeped .	37.472324
to cure fungus growths on mouth or hands people made a strong tea by using a handful of sassafras bark in a quart of water .	106.775925
they drank half a cup of this morning and night , and they also washed and soaked their hands in the same solution .	57.042744
six treatments cured one case which lasted a month and had defied other remedies .	48.511326
frostbite was treated by putting the feet and hands in ice water or by rubbing them with snow .	86.852806
now one hears that heat and hot water are used instead .	56.08262
another remedy was oil of eucalyptus , used as well for chilblains .	9.031616
chilblains were also treated with tincture of capsicum or cabbage leaves .	80.322655
boils have always been a source of much trouble .	18.356691
a german informant gave me a sure cure made by combining rye flour and molasses into a poultice .	87.176605
another poultice was made from the inner bark of the elm tree , steeped in water until it formed a sticky , gummy solution .	56.559143
another frequent pioneer difficulty , caused by wearing rough and heavy shoes and boots , was corns .	50.134937
one veracious woman tells me she has used thin potato parings for both corns and calluses on her feet and they remove the pain or `` fire ' ' .	35.253197
another common cure was to soak the feet five or ten minutes in warm water , then to apply a solution of equal parts of soda and common brown soap on a kid bandage overnight .	75.5592
this softened the skin so that in the morning when the bandage was removed the corn could be scraped off and a bit of corn plaster put on .	89.68654
one young girl told me how her mother removed a wart from her finger by soaking a copper penny in vinegar for three days and then painting the finger with the liquid several times .	86.60963
another wart removal method was to rub each wart with a bean split open and then to bury the bean halves under the drip of the house for seven days .	43.854664
saliva gathered in the mouth after a night ' s sleep was considered poisonous	174.55428
wetting a wart with this saliva on wakening the first thing in the morning was supposed to cause it to disappear after only a few treatments , and strangely enough many warts did just that .	103.86883
one wart cure was to wrap it in a hair from a blonde gypsy .	49.353207
another was to soak raw beef in vinegar for twenty-four hours , tie it on the wart , and wear it for a week .	62.717194
