the heart of this great poet constantly bubbles forth a generous joy of life -- with or without the guitar ' ' .	112.84537
the public ' s identification of carl sandburg and the guitar is no happenstance .	30.581839
he is proud of having segovia for a friend and dedicated a poem to him titled `` the guitar ' ' .	37.221527
carl says it is the greatest poem ever written to the guitar because he has never heard of any other poem to that subtle instrument .	70.70898
`` a portable companion always ready to go where you go -- a small friend weighing less than a freshborn infant -- to be shared with few or many -- just two of you in sweet meditation ' ' .	79.33252
the new york herald tribune ' s photographer , ira rosenberg , tells an anecdote about the time he wanted to take a picture of carl playing a guitar .	32.92273
mr . rosenberg suggested that they go out and find one .	126.655365
`` preferably ' ' , said carl , `` one battered and worn , such as might be found in a pawnshop ' ' .	52.116364
they went to the pawnshop of joseph miller of 1162 sixth avenue .	34.288254
`` mr . miller was in the shop ' ' , the herald tribune story related , `` but was reluctant to have anybody ' s picture taken inside , because his business was too ' confidential ' for pictures .	72.769424
`` but after introductions he asked ' carl sandburg ? ?	13.961698
`` he wanted mr . sandburg to pose with one of the guitars he had displayed behind glass in the center of his shop , but the poet eyed this somewhat distastefully .	69.23433
' kalamazoo guitars ' , he said , ' used by radio hillbilly singers .	112.124435
`` he chose one from mr . miller ' s window , a plain guitar with no fancy polish .	42.90672
while the picture was taken , mr . miller ' s disposition to be generous to mr . sandburg increased to the point where he advised , ' i won ' t even charge you the one dollar rental fee ' ' ' .	79.16523
when someone in the audience rose and asked how does it feel to be a celebrity , carl said , `` a celebrity is a fellow who eats celery with celerity ' ' .	49.544434
this has always been carl ' s attitude .	6.9932065
lloyd lewis wrote that when he first knew carl in 1916 , sandburg was making $27 . 50 a week writing features for the day book and eating sparse luncheons in one-arm restaurants .	112.64129
he walked home at night for two miles beyond the end of a suburban trolley .	27.718826
when fame came it changed sandburg only slightly .	16.505817
lewis remembered another newspaperman asking , `` carl , have your ideas changed any since you got all these comforts ' ' ? ?	107.547516
carl thought the question over slowly and answered `` i know a starving man who is fed never remembers all the pangs of his starvation , i know that ' ' .	50.74279
that was all he said , lewis reports .	7.5692835
in answer to a new york times query on what is fame ( `` thoughts on fame ' ' , october 23 , 1960 ) , carl said `` fame is a figment of a pigment .	51.06362
another is a bubble of a bauble ' ' .	1.9054685
`` ah , did you once see shelley plain ' ' ? ?	12.151718
the impression you get from carl sandburg ' s home is one of laughter and happiness	51.17598
and the laughter and the happiness are even more pronounced when no company is present .	213.41066
carl has been married to paula for fifty-three years , and he has not made a single major decision without careful consideration and thorough discussion with his wife .	59.45523
through all these years , mrs . sandburg has pointedly avoided the limelight .	75.73411
she has shared her husband ' s greatness , but only within the confines of their home	43.63037
it is a dedication which began the moment she met carl .	421.92715
mrs . sandburg received a phi beta kappa key from the university of chicago and she was busy writing and teaching when she met sandburg .	76.26122
`` you are the ' peoples ' poet ' ' ' was her appraisal in 1908 , and she stopped teaching and writing to devote herself to the fulfillment of her husband ' s career .	41.842007
she has rarely been photographed with him and , except for carl ' s seventy-fifth anniversary celebration in chicago in 1953 , she has not attended the dozens of banquets , functions , public appearances , and dinners honoring him -- all of this upon her insistence .	68.4166
even now i will not intrude upon her except to state a few bare facts .	242.45857
the only way to describe paula sandburg is to say she is beautiful in a grecian sense .	52.545
her clothes , her hair , everything about her is both graceful and simple .	63.410717
she has small , broad , capable hands and an enormous energy .	95.038376
she is not only a trained mathematician and classicist , but a good architect .	30.293886
she designed and supervised the building of the harbert , michigan , house , most of which was constructed by one local carpenter who carried the heavy beams singly upon his shoulder .	99.63257
as the sandburg goat herd increased , she also designed the barn alterations to accommodate them .	150.09602
when erosion threatened the foundation of their home in harbert , paula sandburg planted grapevines and arranged the snow fences which helped hold the sands away .	93.07213
she was born lilian steichen , her parents immigrants from luxemburg .	76.056404
her mother called her paus ' l , a luxemburg endearment meaning `` pussycat ' ' .	15.259494
some of the children of the family could not pronounce this name and called her paula , a soubriquet carl liked so much she has been paula ever since .	113.97929
her parents , pious roman catholics , christened her mary anne elizabeth magdalene steichen .	52.57115
`` my mother read a book right after i was born and there was a lilian in the book she loved and i became lilian -- and eventually i became paula ' ' .	44.058136
this family of luxemburg immigrants , in fact , produced two exceptional children .	114.262695
paula ' s older brother is edward steichen , a talented artist and , for the past half-century , one of the world ' s eminent photographers .	24.427399
( two years ago the photography editor of vogue magazine titled his article about steichen , `` the world ' s greatest photographer ' ' .	20.063475
by the time lilian had been graduated from public school , her parents were doing quite well .	69.30575
her mother was a good manager and established a millinery business in milwaukee .	83.35257
but her father was not enthusiastic about sending young paula to high school .	180.38289
`` this is no place for a young girl ' ' , he said .	5.764145
the parents compromised , however , on a convent school and paula went to ursuline academy in london , ontario .	38.154774
she was pious , too , once kneeling through the night from holy thursday to good friday , despite the protest of the nuns that this was too much for a young girl .	79.808044
she knelt out of reverence for having read the meditations of st . augustine .	45.51671
she read everything else she could get her hands on , including an article ( she thinks it was in the atlantic monthly ) by mark twain on `` white slavery ' ' .	94.917046
paula was saddened about what was happening to little girls and vowed to kneel no more in chapel .	249.77553
if there was ever a thought in her mind she might devote her life to religion , it was now dispelled .	71.674416
`` i felt that i must devote myself to the ' outside ' world ' ' .	23.398832
she passed the entrance examinations to the university of illinois , but during the year at urbana felt more important events transpired at the university of chicago .	36.578682
`` and besides , thorstein veblen was one of the chicago professors ' ' .	12.792334
at the university of chicago she studied whitman and shelley , and became a socialist .	47.971184
socialist leaders in milwaukee recognized her worth , not only because of her dedication but because of her fluency in german , french , and luxemburg .	43.765873
she once gave a german recitation before a convention of german-language teachers in milwaukee .	56.37876
carl and paula met in milwaukee in 1907 during paula ' s christmas holiday visit to her parents .	71.023445
he `` legitimized ' ' paula for lilian steichen , and it was paula who insisted on carl for charles .	108.2971
victor berger , the panjandrum of wisconsin socialism and member of congress , had asked paula steichen to translate some of his german editorials into english .	145.46828
carl , who was stationed in appleton , wisconsin , organizing for the social democrats , was in berger ' s office and made it his business to escort paula to the streetcar .	72.525925
she left the next day for her teaching job at princeton , illinois .	64.862015
( after graduation from the university of chicago , paula taught for two years in the normal school at valley city , north dakota , then two years at princeton ( illinois ) township high school .	62.393433
) by the time the streetcar pulled away , he had fallen in love with paula .	45.255936
paula says that even though carl ' s letters usually began , `` dear miss steichen ' ' , there was an understanding from the beginning that they would become husband and wife .	54.19255
paula generously lent me one of carl ' s love letters , dated february 21 , 1908 , hotel athearn , oshkosh , wisconsin	57.474564
`` dear miss steichen it is a very good letter you send me -- softens the intensity of this guerilla warfare i am carrying on up here .	87.74859
never until in this work of s-d organization have i realized and felt the attitude and experience of a teacher .	147.93674
the united states is always ready to participate with the soviet union in serious discussion of these or any other subjects that may lead to peace with justice .	61.54377
certainly it is not necessary to repeat that the united states has no intention of interfering in the internal affairs of any nation	32.444485
by the same token , we reject any soviet attempt to impose its system on us or other peoples by force or subversion .	65.40017
now this concern for the freedom of other peoples is the intellectual and spiritual cement which has allied us with more than forty other nations in a common defense effort .	58.513206
not for a moment do we forget that our own fate is firmly fastened to that of these countries	71.928116
we will not act in any way which would jeopardize our solemn commitments to them .	97.009186
we and our friends are , of course , concerned with self-defense .	42.450386
growing out of this concern is the realization that all people of the free world have a great stake in the progress , in freedom , of the uncommitted and newly emerging nations .	52.245716
these peoples , desperately hoping to lift themselves to decent levels of living must not , by our neglect , be forced to seek help from , and finally become virtual satellites of , those who proclaim their hostility to freedom .	140.47342
but they must have technical and investment assistance .	5.401159
this is a problem to be solved not by america alone , but also by every nation cherishing the same ideals and in position to provide help .	116.99779
in recent years america ' s partners and friends in western europe and japan have made great economic progress .	65.61764
the international economy of 1960 is markedly different from that of the early postwar years .	14.026642
no longer is the united states the only major industrial country capable of providing substantial amounts of the resources so urgently needed in the newly developed countries .	117.17326
to remain secure and prosperous themselves , wealthy nations must extend the kind of co-operation to the less fortunate members that will inspire hope , confidence , and progress .	68.74591
a rich nation can for a time , without noticeable damage to itself , pursue a course of self-indulgence , making its single goal the material ease and comfort of its own citizens -- thus repudiating its own spiritual and material stake in a peaceful and prosperous society of nations .	111.617714
but the enmities it will incur , the isolation into which it will descend , and the internal moral and spiritual softness that will be engendered , will , in the long term , bring it to economic and political disaster .	74.6658
america did not become great through softness and self-indulgence .	33.613586
her miraculous progress in material achievements flows from other qualities far more worthy and substantial adherence to principles and methods consonant with our religious philosophy	306.71902
the intellectual honesty and capacity to recognize the true path of her own best interests .	130.6721
to us and to every nation of the free world , rich or poor , these qualities are necessary today as never before if we are to march together to greater security , prosperity and peace .	119.304344
i believe that the industrial countries are ready to participate actively in supplementing the efforts of the developing nations to achieve progress .	28.689991
the immediate need for this kind of co-operation is underscored by the strain in this nation ' s international balance of payments .	40.068375
our surplus from foreign business transactions has in recent years fallen substantially short of the expenditures we make abroad to maintain our military establishments overseas , to finance private investment , and to provide assistance to the less developed nations .	77.03334
in 1959 our deficit in balance of payments approached four billion dollars .	167.74982
continuing deficits of anything like this magnitude would , over time , impair our own economic growth and check the forward progress of the free world .	86.20441
we must meet this situation by promoting a rising volume of exports and world trade .	67.60701
further , we must induce all industrialized nations of the free world to work together to help lift the scourge of poverty from less fortunate .	61.384624
this co-operation in this matter will provide both for the necessary sharing of this burden and in bringing about still further increases in mutually profitable trade .	147.39624
new nations , and others struggling with the problems of development , will progress only -- regardless of any outside help -- if they demonstrate faith in their own destiny and use their own resources to fulfill it .	84.53215
moreover , progress in a national transformation can be only gradually earned	139.45856
there is no easy and quick way to follow from the oxcart to the jet plane .	52.091934
but , just as we drew on europe for assistance in our earlier years , so now do these new and emerging nations that do have this faith and determination deserve help .	160.1581
respecting their need , one of the major focal points of our concern is the south-asian region .	77.21501
here , in two nations alone , are almost five hundred million people , all working , and working hard , to raise their standards , and in doing so , to make of themselves a strong bulwark against the spread of an ideology that would destroy liberty .	87.62344
i cannot express to you the depth of my conviction that , in our own and free world interest , we must co-operate with others to help these people achieve their legitimate ambitions , as expressed in their different multi-year plans .	93.01219
through the world bank and other instrumentalities , as well as through individual action by every nation in position to help , we must squarely face this titanic challenge .	119.92089
i shall continue to urge the american people , in the interests of their own security , prosperity and peace , to make sure that their own part of this great project be amply and cheerfully supported .	60.922752
free world decisions in this matter may spell the difference between world disaster and world progress in freedom .	55.34644
other countries , some of which i visited last month , have similar needs .	267.7284
a common meeting ground is desirable for those nations which are prepared to assist in the development effort .	47.20537
during the past year i have discussed this matter with the leaders of several western nations .	72.10287
because of its wealth of experience , the organization for european economic cooperation could help with the initial studies needed .	132.46838
the goal is to enlist all available economic resources in the industrialized free world , especially private investment capital .	129.14941
by extending this help , we hope to make possible the enthusiastic enrollment of these nations under freedom ' s banner .	113.545746
no more startling contrast to a system of sullen satellites could be imagined .	43.62474
if we grasp this opportunity to build an age of productive partnership between the less fortunate nations and those that have already achieved a high state of economic advancement , we will make brighter the outlook for a world order based upon security and freedom .	103.92298
otherwise , the outlook could be dark indeed .	3.8506217
we face , indeed , what may be a turning point in history , and we must act decisively and wisely .	64.07023
as a nation we can successfully pursue these objectives only from a position of broadly based strength .	119.49182
no matter how earnest is our quest for guaranteed peace , we must maintain a high degree of military effectiveness at the same time we are engaged in negotiating the issue of arms reduction .	50.181633
until tangible and mutually enforceable arms reduction measures are worked out we will not weaken the means of defending our institutions .	84.92695
it is my studied conviction that no nation will ever risk general war against us unless we should become so foolish as to neglect the defense forces we now so powerfully support .	170.3391
it is world-wide knowledge that any power which might be tempted today to attack the united states by surprise , even though we might sustain great losses , would itself promptly suffer a terrible destruction .	131.87022
but i once again assure all peoples and all nations that the united states , except in defense , will never turn loose this destructive power .	117.71722
during the past year , our long-range striking power , unmatched today in manned bombers , has taken on new strength as the atlas intercontinental ballistic missile has entered the operational inventory .	37.130405
in fourteen recent test launchings , at ranges of five thousand miles , atlas has been striking on an average within two miles of the target .	70.61224
this is less than the length of a jet runway -- well within the circle of destruction .	127.247154
incidentally , there was an atlas firing last night .	3.7979395
from all reports so far received , its performance conformed to the high standards i have just described .	93.89429
such performance is a great tribute to american scientists and engineers , who in the past five years have had to telescope time and technology to develop these long-range ballistic missiles , where america had none before .	68.44711
this year , moreover , growing numbers of nuclear powered submarines will enter our active forces , some to be armed with polaris missiles .	75.41812
these remarkable ships and weapons , ranging the oceans , will be capable of accurate fire on targets virtually anywhere on earth .	110.70338
to meet situations of less than general nuclear war , we continue to maintain our carrier forces , our many service units abroad , our always ready army strategic forces and marine corps divisions , and the civilian components .	73.68041
the continuing modernization of these forces is a costly but necessary process .	245.64214
it is scheduled to go forward at a rate which will steadily add to our strength .	112.04432
the deployment of a portion of these forces beyond our shores , on land and sea , is persuasive demonstration of our determination to stand shoulder-to-shoulder with our allies for collective security .	101.78291
moreover , i have directed that steps be taken to program on a longer range basis our military assistance to these allies .	135.5841
this is necessary for a sounder collective defense system .	23.796959
next i refer to our program in space exploration , which is often mistakenly supposed to be an integral part of defense research and development .	39.89799
we note that , first , america has already made great contributions in the past two years to the world ' s fund of knowledge of astrophysics and space science .	54.28478
these discoveries are of present interest chiefly to the scientific community	36.12381
but they are important foundation stones for more extensive exploration of outer space for the ultimate benefit of all mankind .	43.18436
second , our military missile program , going forward so successfully , does not suffer from our present lack of very large rocket engines , which are necessary in distant space exploration .	77.8675
i am assured by experts that the thrust of our present missiles is fully adequate for defense requirements .	53.969254
third , the united states is pressing forward in the development of large rocket engines to place vehicles of many tons into space for exploration purposes .	66.15121
fourth , in the meantime , it is necessary to remember that we have only begun to probe the environment immediately surrounding the earth .	53.910187
using launch systems presently available , we are developing satellites to scout the world ' s weather	99.80079
satellite relay stations to facilitate and extend communications over the globe	31.844835
for navigation aids to give accurate bearings to ships and aircraft	337.17078
and for perfecting instruments to collect and transmit the data we seek .	140.03925
fifth , we have just completed a year ' s experience with our new space law .	132.59286
suggested improvements will be submitted to the congress shortly .	551.8569
the accomplishment of the many tasks i have alluded to requires the continuous strengthening of the spiritual , intellectual , and economic sinews of american life .	44.91132
the steady purpose of our society is to assure justice , before god , for every individual .	197.96886
we must be ever alert that freedom does not wither through the careless amassing of restrictive controls or the lack of courage to deal boldly with the issues of the day .	37.45171
a year ago , when i met with you , the nation was emerging from an economic downturn , even though the signs of resurgent prosperity were not then sufficiently convincing to the doubtful .	108.82693
today our surging strength is apparent to everyone .	27.691885
1960 promises to be the most prosperous year in our history .	18.004967
yet we continue to be afflicted by nagging disorders .	10.202583
among current problems that require solutions , participated in by citizens as well as government , are	123.61254
the need to protect the public interest in situations of prolonged labor-management stalemate	159.49391
the persistent refusal to come to grips with a critical problem in one sector of american agriculture	64.25389
the continuing threat of inflation , together with the persisting tendency toward fiscal irresponsibility	39.0024
in certain instances the denial to some of our citizens of equal protection of the law .	67.94691
the group , upon the issuance of its first press release on december 21 , 1957 , designated itself a `` committee of investigation ' ' .	53.557217
in the course of its inquiry , it took testimony from only seven witnesses .	338.74652
it heard bang-jensen twice and his lawyer , adolf a . berle , jr . , once .	33.628925
its second press release was on january 15 , 1958 , and it recommended that the secret papers be destroyed .	28.091139
it also implied that paul bang-jensen had been irresponsible .	48.561996
on january 18 , ernest gross conducted a press conference at the u . n . lasting an hour .	22.461164
here , he openly attacked bang-jensen and referred to his `` aberrant conduct ' ' .	11.328208
this conference was held despite stavropoulos ' assurance to adolf berle , who was leaving the same day for puerto rico , that nothing would be done until his return on january 22 , except that the secretary general would probably order the list destroyed .	76.17393
on january 24 paul bang-jensen , accompanied by adolf berle , was met by dragoslav protitch and colonel frank begley , former police chief of farmington , conn . , and now head of u . n . special police .	30.660547
the four , bundled in overcoats , mounted to the wind-swept roof of the u . n .	17.396751
there , begley lit a fire in a wire basket , and bang-jensen dropped four sealed envelopes into the flames .	61.018612
in one of these he said were notes on the identities of the eighty-one refugees .	36.2566
the method of destroying the evidence embarrassed paul bang-jensen .	11.493225
he knew it would be implied that it was done in this way at his insistence .	36.08959
he was right , and peter marshall could not help but recall andrew cordier ' s words on the subject , `` well , it seemed as good a place as any to do the job ' ' .	55.41124
the gross group had been formed for the express purpose of advising the secretary general .	43.424786
hammarskjold ' s supposed desire to seek outside legal advice in the guise of ernest gross is illusion , at best .	184.82086
gross ' s , being `` outside ' ' the u . n . applied only to a physical state , not an objective one .	54.486717
but by the time the papers were finally disposed of , the group had informed the world of its purpose , its recommendations , and its belief that paul bang-jensen was not of sound mind .	103.42901
shortly the group would issue its report to the secretary general , recommending paul bang-jensen ' s dismissal from the united nations .	30.218214
the contents of this 195-page document would become known to many before it would become known to the man it was written about .	101.96363
`` until this hungarian committee matter came up , bang-jensen was a fine and devoted individual .	121.41255
i had known him for some years , when i was a delegate and before , and this manner had never been his ' ' .	54.084152
ernest a . gross leaned back in his chair and told peter marshall how secretary general dag hammarskjold had , on december 4 , 1957 , called him in as a private lawyer to review bang-jensen ' s conduct `` relating to his association with the special committee on the problem of hungary ' ' .	75.56914
the result was the `` gross report ' ' , prepared by gross , as chairman , with the assistance of two u . n . under secretaries , constantin stavropoulos and philippe de seynes .	40.835236
`` yes ' ' , gross went on , `` bang-jensen was an up-and-coming young man .	58.174576
never well known , but he had done his work competently .	200.67099
gross had received marshall courteously and they were discussing the case .	105.2942
`` you know ' ' , the lawyer said , `` it ' s difficult to talk like this about a man who can ' t answer back ' ' .	21.837135
gross was behind a clean-top desk , only a manila folder before him .	35.571472
marshall sat in one of the several leather chairs .	6.076428
outside the office windows , twenty-four stories above wall street , a light rain was falling .	105.46836
`` mr . gross , your report says that ' our function is investigative and advisory and does not in any way derogate from or prejudice mr . bang-jensen ' s rights as a staff member .	114.079124
you know , bang-jensen characterized your committee as having prejudged his case ' ' .	49.41335
`` well , how could that have been ? ?	68.50765
i don ' t consider that he was prejudged .	118.142845
we were given a job and we carried it out , and later , his case was taken up by the disciplinary committee .	55.039543
`` we have nothing to hide under a bushel .	30.106247
we did our job , mr . stavropoulos and mr . de seynes and myself , taking evidence from a number of people ' ' .	33.92319
`` what did you think about his mental state ' ' ? ?	7.2807612
`` i think our report sums up our finding ' ' , gross answered .	22.278719
`` don ' t forget , here was a man who had been accusing his colleagues for almost a year of willfully attempting to present an incorrect report .	58.78086
`` this was not merely alleging errors , but was carried out by day-after-day allegations in memos , written charges of serious consequence .	66.555374
supposing you or i were being accused in this manner , and yet we were doing our level best to carry on our work .	90.61501
`` i ' ve been in government and i can tell some pretty hairy stories about personnel difficulties , so i know what a problem he was ' ' .	101.11449
`` what i ' d like you to comment on is the criticism leveled at your committee ' ' .	181.7394
`` what do you mean ' ' ? ?	1.0189996
`` for instance , regarding the fact that the gross committee issued two interim announcements to the press during its investigation .	163.65916
you know bang-jensen was told the committee was ' to convey its views , suggestions and recommendations to the secretary general .	90.39367
in his own words , bang-jensen ' took it for granted that the group would report to the secretary general privately and not in public .	73.47626
he claimed that the release of the preliminary findings was ' prejudicial to his position ' ' ' .	30.761982
for an instant he glared speechless at marshall .	21.232635
`` i thought the entire report was going to be confidential from beginning to end .	81.419
but you know bang-jensen launched an active campaign against us in the press .	48.73854
it was getting so that we , the committee , were being tried .	205.48317
you can find it in the papers ' ' .	1.2879465
`` well , as a matter of fact , i ' ve looked through back-issue files of new york papers for december , 1957 , and haven ' t found a great deal ' ' --	51.111588
`` it wasn ' t necessarily all here in new york .	16.583607
don ' t forget the foreign press ' ' .	1.4149437
`` then what about the second interim public announcement ? ?	46.826004
this cited bang-jensen ' s ' aberrant conduct ' ' ' .	9.306547
`` the reason for that report was to settle the matter of the list .	50.223335
as far as i ' m concerned , it was a separate matter from the general committee study of bang-jensen ' s conduct .	66.247925
the january fifteen report recommended that bang-jensen be instructed to burn the list -- the papers -- in the presence of a u . n . security officer ' ' .	49.300194
`` how about your press conference three days later -- what was the reason for that ? ?	52.24357
bang-jensen said you told correspondents that you had checked in advance to make sure the term ' aberrant conduct ' was not libelous .	68.69859
he claimed you made other slanderous allegations ' ' .	1.2333379
`` the entire object of the press conference was to clarify the problem of the list , since many in the press were querying the u . n . about it .	35.456924
bang-jensen never explained what the documents or papers were that he had in his possession .	30.159561
`` it was foolish of him to keep them , whatever they were .	44.014576

of course the matter caught the public ' s attention .	19.80163
we attempted to conclude this , and did so by having the papers burned .	167.65106
hammarskjold didn ' t like the way it was carried out .	22.671406
hammarskjold believes the u . n . is an organization that settles matters in a procedural way .	120.70548
if hammarskjold had not wanted the list disposed of in this manner , and if bang-jensen had not wanted it -- who had ordered it ? ?	77.90586
`` mr . gross , concerning the formation of your committee , there ' s the fact that you have been a legal adviser to the u . n . in the past	24.96236

could you comment on that ' ' ? ?	1.0176847
`` i ' ve served as a counsel for the u . n . for some years , specializing particularly in real estate matters or other problems that the regular u . n . legal staff might not be equipped to handle .	58.0159
mr . stavropoulos is the u . n . legal chief and a very good man , but he is not fully versed on some technical points of american law ' ' .	40.986866
`` what did you think about bang-jensen ' s contention of errors and omissions in the hungarian report ' ' ? ?	40.047333
`` why , mick shann went over and over the report with alsing andersen , trying to check them out .	69.26617
even after the incident between bang-jensen and shann in the delegates ' lounge and this was not the way the chicago tribune presented it ' ' .	73.931206
gross reached in his desk and pulled out two newspaper clippings .	69.98777
one was an article on the u . n . by alice widener from the cincinnati enquirer .	54.042118
the other was by chesly manley in the chicago daily tribune .	42.587566
`` i know ches , he ' s a friend of mine .	21.626076
he probably didn ' t mean to write it this way , or maybe he did .	68.36582
there wasn ' t any ' violent argument ' between bang-jensen and shann , as the tribune puts it .	80.89668
that implies that shann was on the enemy side .	3.8257432
how it ' s phrased there -- the word violent .	126.95031
`` the case was that bang-jensen came up to shann claiming he had found further errors in the report .	60.65755

but it wasn ' t a violent discussion .	7.902376

( shann ' s own report , peter marshall reflected , describes the encounter as `` immoderate ' ' .	35.254173

`` you know , this hits in many areas .	46.51112
it appeals to those who were frustrated in the outcome of the hungarian situation .	44.228573
don ' t forget , the u . n . did no more than the united states did .	21.233677
it takes a great deal of sophisticated thought to get the impact of this fact ' ' .	33.08195
from the home of his friend , henrik kauffmann , in washington , d . c . , paul bang-jensen sent a telegram dated december 9 , 1957 , to ernest gross .	28.027735
`` the matters to be considered are obviously of a grave character , and i therefore respectfully request that the hearing be postponed for two weeks in order that i might make adequate preparation ' ' .	55.742264
ernest gross replied the next day , putting the suspended diplomat ' s fears to rest .	52.370052
`` this reveals some misunderstanding on your part .	23.538214
the group conducting the review is not holding formal hearings .	66.3872
it wished to pursue , in the course of this review , questions arising from the body of material already in its possession .	75.02286
it sounded like a fair enough invitation , peter marshall reflected , and bang-jensen must have thought so too , because on the thirteenth , he met the group of three on the thirty-sixth floor of the u . n . .	58.032413
`` we were requested by the secretary general , as i understand it , to discuss with you such matters as appear to us to be relevant , and we are not of course either a formal group or a committee in the sense of being guided by any rules or regulations of the secretariat .	68.670784
the only rules which i think we shall follow will be those of common sense , justice , and fairness ' ' .	69.830864
peter marshall noted that bang-jensen had later referred to his two interviews with the gross group as `` unfortunate experiences ' ' , and after his second meeting on the sixteenth the dane refused to attend further hearings without legal counsel .	74.65074
marshall pondered the reason for this , and pondered too the replacement of one member of the three-man group .	79.8626
j . a . c . robertson , after serving gross one week , left for england .	310.5477
fortunately the hole was found at last and plugged .	40.165676
another week passed and even the missionaries were enjoying the voyage .	104.88605
the sickness was gone and , after all , the two young couples were on their honeymoon .	19.351114
in spite of pickering dodge ' s explicit instructions regarding variation of meals , the food did not seem the same as at home .	145.60236
`` everything tasted differently from what it does on land and those things i was most fond of at home , i loathed the most here ' ' , ann noted .	102.58699
at last they concluded that the heavy , full feeling in their stomachs was due to lack of exercise .	199.6113
walking was the remedy , they decided , but a deck full of chicken coops and pigpens was hardly suitable .	143.4014
a rope was found and , like children in school , the missionaries skipped for hours at a time .	65.39028
finally , tiring of so monotonous a form of exercise , they decided to dance instead .	81.167305
it was much more fun , reminding the girls of their old carefree days in the hasseltine frolics room at bradford .	75.06749
the weather turned warmer and with it came better appetites , although harriet was still a little off-color .	71.40819
she could not face coffee or tea without milk , and was always craving types of food that were not available aboard a sailing ship .	105.88534
by now she was sure she was going to have a baby , deciding it would be born in india or burma that november .	69.17629
she was more excited than frightened at the prospect of having her first child in a foreign land .	114.7186
the crew of the caravan never failed to amaze ann , who during her stay in salem must frequently have overheard strong sailorly language .	282.9422
she wrote in her journal , `` i have not heard the least profane language since i have been on board the vessel .	157.4315
she was now enjoying the voyage very much .	8.901403
even the first wave of homesickness had passed , although there were moments when captain heard pointed out on his compass the direction of bradford that she felt a little twinge at her heart .	75.5784
as for adoniram , she found him to be `` the kindest ' ' of husbands .	17.135975
on sundays , with the permission of captain heard , who usually attended with two of his officers , services were held in the double cabin .	65.27692
sometimes a ship would be sighted and the caravan pass so close that people could easily be seen on the distant deck .	82.862015
captain heard did not communicate with any strange vessels because of the possibility of war between the united states and britain .	38.258965
as warmer temperatures were encountered ann and harriet were introduced to the pleasures of bathing daily in salt water .	99.47382
when may came the caravan had already crossed the equator .	13.978822
they were sailing round the cape of good hope	955.585
at this time harriet wrote in a letter which after their finally landing in india was sent to her mother	118.95476
`` i care not how soon we reach calcutta , and are placed in a still room , with a bowl of milk and a loaf of indian bread .	55.933674
i can hardly think of this simple fare without exclaiming , oh , what a luxury .	141.64471
i have been so weary of the excessive rocking of the vessel , and the almost intolerable smell after the rain , that i have done little more than lounge on the bed for several days .	58.415604
but i have been blest with excellent spirits , and to-day have been running about the deck , and dancing in our room for exercise , as well as ever ' ' .	52.225437
while studying at the seminary in andover , adoniram had been working on a new testament translation from the original greek .	89.53451
he had brought it along to continue during the voyage .	13.821357
there was one particular word that troubled his conscience .	80.40316
this was the greek word most often translated as `` baptism ' ' .	4.624181
born a congregationalist , he had been baptized as a tiny baby in the usual manner by having a few drops of water sprinkled on his head , yet nowhere in the whole of the new testament could he find a description of anybody being baptized by sprinkling .	76.186935
john the baptist used total immersion in the river jordan for believers	800.91113
the more adoniram looked at the greek word for baptism , the more unhappy he became over its true meaning .	164.43944
as was only natural he confided his searchings to ann , conceding ruefully that it certainly looked as if their own congregationalists were wrong and the baptists right .	119.73257
by this time she had learned that it was futile to argue with her young husband , yet the uncomfortable fact remained the american congregationalists were sending them as missionaries to the far east and paying their salaries .	125.68866
what would happen if adoniram `` changed horses in midstream ' ' ? ?	15.084459
baptists and congregationalists in new england were on friendly terms .	186.01648
how embarrassing it would be if the newly appointed congregationalist missionaries should suddenly switch their own beliefs in order to embrace baptist teachings ! !	76.49373
`` if you become a baptist , i will not ' ' , ann informed her husband , but sweeping her threat aside adoniram continued to search for an answer to the personal dilemma in which he found himself .	105.94802
by early june they were a hundred miles off the coast of ceylon , by which time all four missionaries were hardened seafarers .	84.11694
even harriet could boldly write , `` i know not how it is	18.518114
and the waves threatening to swallow up the vessel	2765.9949
ann thrilled to the sight of a delicate butterfly and two strange tropical birds .	61.004005
land was near , and on june 12 , one hundred and fourteen days after leaving america , they actually saw , twenty miles away , the coast of orissa .	79.228485
captain heard gave orders for the ship to be anchored in the bay of bengal until he could obtain the services of a reputable pilot to steer her through the shallow waters .	50.456287
sometimes ships waited for days for such a man , but captain heard was lucky .	80.75885
next day a ship arrived with an english pilot , his leadsman , an english youth , and the first hindu the judsons and newells had ever seen .	45.818043
a little man with a `` a dark copper color ' ' skin , he was wearing `` calico trousers and a white cotton short gown ' ' .	49.61511
`` he looks as feminine as you can imagine ' ' , she decided .	32.159462
all day long the caravan slowly made her way through the difficult passages .	77.55149
alas , to ann ' s consternation , his language while thus employed left much to be desired .	306.1572
he swore so loudly at the top of his voice , that she didn ' t get any sleep all the next night .	37.653587
next morning the caravan was out of the treacherous bay .	127.69166
relieved of the major part of his responsibility for the safety of the ship , the pilot ' s oaths became fewer .	72.165955
slowly she moved up the hooghli river , a mouth of the mighty ganges , toward calcutta .	43.278866
ann was entranced with the view , as were her husband and friends .	139.0307
running across the deck , which was empty now that the livestock had been killed and eaten , they sniffed the spice-laden breezes that came from the shore , each pointing out new and exciting wonders to the other .	89.70844
out came the journal and in it went ann ' s own description of the scene	52.330887
`` on each side of the hoogli , where we are now sailing , are the hindoo cottages , as thick together as the houses in our seaports .	68.98984
they are very small , and in the form of haystacks , without either chimney or windows .	100.7797
they are situated in the midst of trees , which hang over them , and appear truly romantick .	108.94779
the grass and fields of rice are perfectly green , and herds of cattle are everywhere feeding on the banks of the river , and the natives are scattered about differently employed .	102.92124
some are fishing , some driving the team , and many are sitting indolently on the banks of the river .	31.248886
the pagodas we have passed are much larger than the houses ' ' .	10.038587
where were the hardships she had expected ? ?	1.1947107
she was certain now that it would be no harder to bear her child here in such pleasant surroundings than at home in the big white house in haverhill .	127.67358
with childlike innocence she wrote of the indians as `` walking with fruit and umbrellas in their hands , with the tawny children around them .	84.23114
this is the most delightful trial i have ever had ' ' , she decided .	31.986538
the indians who came aboard ship to collect the mail also interested her greatly , even if she was suitably shocked , according to the customs of the society in which she had been reared , to find them `` naked , except a piece of cotton cloth wrapped around their middle ' ' .	83.9334
at last they saw calcutta , largest city of bengal and the caravan ' s destination .	23.342873
founded august 24 , 1690 by job charnock of the east india company , and commonly called `` the city of palaces ' ' , it seemed a vast and elegant place to ann hasseltine judson .	41.075413
solid brick buildings painted dazzling white , large domes and tall , picturesque palms stretched as far as the eye could see , while the wharves and harbor were filled with tall-masted sailing ships .	42.929867
crowds flocked through the waterfront streets chattering loudly in their strange-sounding bengali tongue .	8.973004
harriet ' s mouth watered with anticipation when after months of dreaming she sat down at last to her much-craved milk and fresh bread .	143.22052
ann , pleased to see her friend happy , was intrigued by the new fruits a friend of captain heard had sent on board for their enjoyment .	93.92895
cautiously she sampled her first pineapple and another fruit whose taste she likened to that of `` a rich pear ' ' .	49.470333
though she did not then know its name , this strange new fruit was a banana .	57.702374
the first act of adoniram and samuel on reaching calcutta was to report at the police station , a necessity when landing in east india company territory .	146.85689
on the way they tried to discover all they could about burma , and they were disturbed to find that michael symes ' s book had not presented an altogether true picture .	101.24175
he had failed to realize that the burmese were not really treating him as the important visitor he considered himself .	76.2103
they were in fact quietly laughing at him , for their king wished to have nothing to do with the western world .	57.624424
when captain john gibault of salem had visited burma in 1793 his ship , the astra , had been promptly commandeered and taken by her captors up the irrawaddy river .	76.48089
although after much trouble he did manage to get it back , he discovered there was no trade to be had .	70.710365
all captain gibault took back to salem were a few items for the town ' s east india museum .	70.64323
a year later another salem ship returned from burma with a cargo of gum lacquer which nobody wanted to buy .	48.253193
after that salem ships decided to bypass unfriendly burma .	4.506937
the burmese appeared to have little knowledge of british power or any idea of trade .	157.97067
cruel burmese governors could , on the slightest whim , take a man ' s life .	22.428686
as for missionaries , even if they succeeded in getting into the country they probably would not be allowed to preach the christian faith to the burmans .	50.603596
unspeakable tortures or even execution might well be their fate .	59.95447
`` go back to america or any other place ' ' , well-meaning friends of captain heard advised them , `` but put thoughts of going to burma out of your heads ' ' .	86.98344
somewhat daunted , the two american missionaries reached the police station where they were questioned by a most unfriendly clerk .	70.47336
when he discovered they had received from the company ' s court of directors no permission to live in india , coupled with the fact that they were americans who had been sent to asia to convert `` the heathen ' ' , he became more belligerent than ever .	43.4973
they explained that they desired only to stop in india until a ship traveling on to burma could be found .	153.33348
she describes , first , the imaginary reaction of a foreigner puzzled by this `` unseasonable exultation ' '	15.391578
he is answered by a confused , honest englishman .	12.119591
the reasons for the whig joy on this occasion are found to be their expectation of regaining control of the government , their delight at the prospect of a new war , their hopes of having the tories hanged , and so on .	84.99271
as for the author of the englishman , mrs . manley sarcastically deplores that the sole defense of the protestant cause should be left to `` ridpath , dick steele , and their associates , with the apostles of young man ' s coffee-house ' ' .	64.44303
another controversy typical of the war between the englishman and the examiner centered on robert ( later viscount ) molesworth , a whig leader in ireland and a member of the irish privy council .	39.863335
on december 21 , the day that the irish house of commons petitioned for removal of sir constantine phipps , their tory lord chancellor , molesworth reportedly made this remark on the defense of phipps by convocation `` they that have turned the world upside down , are come hither also ' ' .	119.95378
upon complaints from the lower house of convocation to the house of lords , he was removed from the privy council , his remark having been represented as a blasphemous affront to the clergy .	35.954018
steele , who had earlier praised molesworth in tatler no . 189 , now defended him in englishman no . 46 , depicting his removal as a setback to the constitution .	135.9108
on the other hand , molesworth was naturally assailed in the tory press .	31.033342
swift , in the dublin edition of a preface to the bishop of sarum ' s introduction , indicated his feelings by including molesworth , along with toland , tindal , and collins , in the group of those who , like burnet , are engaged in attacking all convocations of the clergy .	43.157093
in the same way he coupled molesworth and wharton in a letter to archbishop king , and he had earlier described him as `` the worst of them ' ' in some `` observations ' ' on the irish privy council submitted to oxford .	61.84439
a month later , in the publick spirit of the whigs , he used steele ' s defense of molesworth as evidence of his disrespect for the clergy , calling steele ' s position an affront to the `` whole convocation of ireland ' ' .	48.469658
on this issue , then , as on so many in these months , steele and swift took rigidly opposed points of view .	129.12775
in the early months of 1714 , the battle between swift and steele over the issue of the succession entered its major phase .	134.80376
the preliminaries ended with the publication of steele ' s crisis on january 19 , and from that point on the fight proceeded at a rapid pace .	66.37751
in answer to the crisis , swift produced the publick spirit of the whigs , his most extensive and bitter attack on his old friend .	53.51129
by this time , as we shall see , the tories were already planning to `` punish ' ' steele for his political writing by expelling him from the house of commons .	41.46531
despite his defense of himself in the final paper of the englishman and in his speech before the house , their efforts were successful .	60.36184
steele lost his seat in parliament , and his personal quarrel with swift , by now a public issue , thus reached its climax .	96.356064
of all the whig tracts written in support of the succession , the crisis is perhaps the most significant .	39.774258
certainly it is the most pretentious and elaborate .	22.80661
hanoverian agents assisted in promoting circulation , said to have reached 40 , 000 , and if one may judge by the reaction of swift and other government writers , the work must have had considerable impact .	111.37459
steele ' s main business here is to arouse public opinion to the immediate danger of a stuart restoration .	67.03974
to this end , the first and longest section of the tract cites all the laws enacted since the revolution to defend england against the `` arbitrary power of a popish prince ' ' .	86.150375
in his comment on these laws steele sounds all the usual notes of current whig propaganda , ranging from a criticism of the tory peace to an attack on the dismissal of marlborough	67.672165
but his principal theme is that the intrigues of the tories , `` our popish or jacobite party ' ' , pose an immediate threat to church and state .	36.833225
like burnet , he deplores the indifference of the people in the face of the crisis .	16.459179
treasonable books striking at the hanoverian succession , he complains , are allowed to pass unnoticed .	57.173042
in this connection , swift , too , is drawn in for attack `` the author of the conduct of the allies has dared to drop insinuations about altering the succession ' ' .	105.58727
in his effort to stir the public from its lethargy , steele goes so far as to list catholic atrocities of the sort to be expected in the event of a stuart restoration , and , with rousing rhetoric , he asserts that the only preservation from these `` terrours ' ' is to be found in the laws he has so tediously cited .	62.136135
`` it is no time ' ' , he writes , `` to talk with hints and innuendos , but openly and honestly to profess our sentiments before our enemies have compleated and put their designs in execution against us ' ' .	70.5732
steele apparently professed his sentiments in this book too openly and honestly for his own good , since the government was soon to use it as evidence against him in his trial before the house .	62.498245
in the final issues of the englishman , which ended just as the new session of parliament began , he provided his enemies with still more ammunition .	140.1518
for example , no . 56 printed the patent giving the electoral prince the title of duke of cambridge .	98.25882
in a few months the duke was to be the center of a controversy of some significance on the touchy question of the protestant succession .	30.24109
at the order of the dowager electress , the hanoverian agents , supported by the whig leaders , demanded that a writ of summons be issued which would call the duke to england to sit in parliament , thus further insuring the succession by establishing a hanoverian prince in england before the queen ' s death .	63.697525
anne was furious , and bolingbroke advised that the request be refused .	98.5636
oxford , realizing that the law required the issuance of the writ , took the opposite view , for which the queen never forgave him .	62.771435
accordingly the request was granted , but the elector himself , who had not been consulted by his mother , rejected the proposal and recalled his agent schutz , whose impolitic handling of the affair had caused the hanoverian interest to suffer and had made oxford ' s dismissal more likely than ever .	74.368004
steele in this paper is indicating his sympathy for such a plan .	22.338865
a few days after this englishman appeared , defoe reported to oxford that steele was expected to move in parliament that the duke be called over	101.47495
defoe then commented , `` if they could draw that young gentleman into their measures they would show themselves quickly , for they are not asham ' d to say they want only a head to make a beginning ' ' .	155.81186
the final issue of the englishman , no . 57 for february 15 , ran to some length and was printed as a separate pamphlet , entitled the englishman being the close of the paper so-called .	129.62868
steele ' s purpose is to present a general defense of his political writing and a resume of the themes which had occupied him in the englishman	72.90209
but there is much here also which bears directly on his personal quarrel with swift .	72.82809
thus he complains , with considerable justice , that the tory writers have resorted to libel instead of answering his arguments .	132.3587
his birth , education , and fortune , he says , have all been ridiculed simply because he has spoken with the freedom of an englishman , and he assures the reader that `` whoever talks with me , is speaking to a gentleman born ' ' .	48.030632
as notable examples of this abuse , he quotes passages from the examiner , `` that destroyer of all things ' ' , and the character of richard steele , which he here attributes to swift .	78.21398
though put in rather maudlin terms , steele ' s defense of himself has a reasonable basis .	50.39199
his point is simply that the tories have showered him with personal satire , despite the fact that as a private subject he has a right to speak on political matters without affronting the prerogative of the sovereign .	78.011505
he claims , too , that his political convictions are simply those which are called `` revolution principles ' ' and which are accepted by moderate men in both parties .	67.58942
the final section of this pamphlet is of special interest in a consideration of steele ' s relations with swift .	52.795734
it purports to be a letter from steele to a friend at court , who , in miss blanchard ' s opinion , could only be meant as swift .	51.874508
steele first answers briefly the charges which his `` dear old friend ' ' has made about his pamphlet on dunkirk and his crisis .	57.416847
then he launches into an attack on the tory ministers , whom he calls the `` new converts ' '	50.4428
by this term he means to ridicule their professions of acting in the interest of the church despite their own education and manner of life -- a gibe , in other words , at the `` presbyterianism ' ' in harley ' s family and at bolingbroke ' s reputed impiety .	40.4674
the tory leaders , he insinuates , are cynically using the church as a political `` by-word ' ' to increase party friction and keep themselves in power .	90.74884
this is the principal point made in this final section of englishman no . 57 , and it caps steele ' s efforts in his other writing of these months to counteract the notion of the tories as a `` church party ' ' supported by the body of the clergy .	80.69872
next , steele turns his attention to the `` courtier ' ' he is addressing .	35.82247
he explains that there are sometimes honorable courtiers , but that too often a man who succeeds at court does not hesitate to sacrifice his sovereign and nation to his own avarice and ambition .	69.60863
such , he implies , is the case with his friend , who is not really a new convert himself but merely a favorer of new converts .	56.448673
if `` jack the courtier ' ' is really to be taken as swift , the following remark is obviously steele ' s comment on swift ' s change of parties and its effect on their friendship `` i assure you , dear jack , when i first found out such an allay in you , as makes you of so malleable a constitution , that you may be worked into any form an artificer pleases , i foresaw i should not enjoy your favour much longer ' ' .	94.4376
he closes his `` letter ' ' by demanding that dunkirk be demolished , that the pretender be forced to move farther away from the coast of england , and that the queen and the house of hanover come to a better understanding .	68.71104
the last point was soon to be included in the `` seditious ' ' remarks used against him in parliament .	45.873634
the examiner , during steele ' s trial a month later , printed an answer from the `` courtier ' ' addressed to `` r . s . ' ' at button ' s coffee-house .	29.453533
he reviews steele ' s entrance into politics and finds that his present difficulties are due to his habit of attributing to his own abilities and talents achievements which more properly should be credited to the indulgence of his friends .	92.04406
once more , in other words , steele is said to be indebted to swift for his `` wit ' '	58.989677
this was the form in which their private feud most often appeared in the tory press , especially the examiner .	60.14237
in the publick spirit of the whigs , it may be noted , swift himself contemptuously dismissed steele ' s reference to his friend at court `` i suppose by the style of old friend , and the like , it must be some body there of his own level	108.69256
among whom , his party have indeed more friends than i could wish ' ' .	27.374378
on february 16 , steele took his seat in parliament .	8.059631
by now he was undergoing a fresh torrent of abuse from tory papers and pamphlets , and action was being taken to effect his punishment by expulsion from parliament .	73.46711
on the very day that the parliamentary session began , another `` infamous libel ' ' appeared , entitled a letter from the facetious dr . andrew tripe , at bath , to the venerable nestor ironside .	43.08399
it is filled with the usual personal abuse of steele , especially of his physical appearance	66.9156
in the opening paragraph , too , steele is accused of extreme egotism , of giving `` himself the preference to all the learned , his contemporaries , from dr . swift himself , even down to poet cr--spe of the customhouse ' ' .	109.784546
when harold arlen returned to california in the winter of 1944 , it was to take up again a collaboration with johnny mercer , begun some years before .	56.006268
the film they did after his return was an inconsequential bit of nothing titled out of this world , a satire on the sinatra bobby-soxer craze .	59.143375
the twist lay in using bing crosby ' s voice on the sound track while leading man eddie bracken mouthed the words .	57.721058
if nothing else , at least two good songs came out of the project , `` out of this world ' ' and `` june comes around every year ' ' .	57.17997
though they would produce some very memorable and lasting songs , arlen and mercer were not given strong material to work on .	147.36975
early in 1941 they were assigned to a script titled hot nocturne .	150.53784
it purported to be a reasonably serious attempt at a treatment of jazz musicians , their aims , their problems -- the tug-of-war between the `` pure ' ' and the `` commercial ' ' -- and seemed a promising vehicle , for the two men shared a common interest in jazz .	69.47135
johnny mercer practically grew up with the sound of jazz and the blues in his ears .	50.019936
he was born in savannah , georgia , in 1909 .	22.613895
his father , george a . mercer , was descended from an honored southern family that could trace its ancestry back to one hugh mercer , who had emigrated from scotland in 1747 .	127.60833
the lyricist ' s father was a lawyer who had branched out into real estate .	90.861984
his second wife , lillian , was the mother of john h . mercer .	43.471493
by the age of six young johnny indicated that he had the call .	22.035887
one day he followed the irish jasper greens , the town band , to a picnic and spent the entire day listening , while his family spent the day looking .	100.25357
the disappearance caused his family to assign a full-time maid to keeping an eye on the boy .	58.366295
both were obviously on the way to the mercer home .	539.2042
the mother inquired , `` where ' s johnny , and why did you leave him ' ' ? ?	22.48757
`` there was nothing else i could do ' ' , the maid answered , satisfied with a rather vague explanation .	73.12097
the maid then told her , `` because he fired me ' ' .	18.082626
with her son evidencing so strong a musical bent his mother could do little else but get him started on the study of music -- though she waited until he was ten -- beginning with the piano and following that with the trumpet .	168.51088
young mercer showed a remarkable lack of aptitude for both instruments .	90.89015
still , he did like music making and even sang in the chapel choir of the woodberry forest school , near orange , virginia , where he sounded fine but did not matriculate too well .	56.809433
when he was fifteen john h . mercer turned out his first song , a jazzy little thing he called `` sister susie , strut your stuff ' ' .	46.670933
if his scholarship and formal musicianship were not all they might have been , mercer demonstrated at an early age that he was gifted with a remarkable ear for rhythm and dialect .	79.28079
from his playmates in savannah , mercer had picked up , along with a soft southern dialect , traces also of the gullah dialects of africa .	103.57895
such speech differences made him acutely aware of the richness and expressivness of language .	56.41539
during the summers , while he was still in school , mercer worked for his father ' s firm as a messenger boy .	48.921642
it generally took well into the autumn for the firm to recover from the summer ' s help .	65.179344
`` we ' d give him things to deliver , letters , checks , deeds and things like that ' ' , remembers his half-brother walter , still in the real estate business in savannah , `` and learn days later that he ' d absent-mindedly stuffed them into his pocket .	108.73989
this rather detached attitude toward life ' s encumbrances has seemed to be the dominant trait in mercer ' s personality ever since .	68.09975
it is , however , a disarming disguise , or perhaps a shield , for not only has mercer proved himself to be one of the few great lyricists over the years , but also one who can function remarkably under pressure .	106.31939
he has also enjoyed a successful career as an entertainer ( his records have sold in the millions ) and is a sharp businessman .	74.83104
in 1927 his father ' s business collapsed , and , rather than go bankrupt , mercer senior turned his firm over to a bank for liquidation .	159.33063
he died before he could completely pay off his debts .	18.762733
some years later the bank handling the mercer liquidation received a check for $300 , 000 , enough to clear up the debt .	53.059753
the check had been mailed from chicago , the envelope bore no return address , and the check was not signed .	80.110214
`` that ' s johnny ' ' , sighed the bank president , `` the best-hearted boy in the world , but absent-minded ' ' .	52.96809
but mercer ' s explanation was simple `` i made out the check and carried it around a few days unsigned -- in case i lost it ' ' .	78.29843
when he remembered that he might have not signed the check , mercer made out another for the same amount , instructing the bank to destroy the other -- especially if he had happened to have absent-mindedly signed both of them .	154.97716
when the family business failed , mercer left school and on his mother ' s urging -- for she hoped that he would become an actor -- he joined a local little theater group .	98.67971
when the troupe traveled to new york to participate in a one-act-play competition -- and won -- mercer , instead of returning with the rest of the company in triumph , remained in new york .	66.93162
he had talked one other member of the group to stay with him , but that friend had tired of not eating regularly and returned to savannah .	188.44394
but mercer hung on , living , after a fashion , in a greenwich village fourth-flight walk-up .	41.54636
`` the place had no sink or washbasin , only a bathtub ' ' , his mother discovered when she visited him .	26.815626
`` johnny insisted on cooking a chicken dinner in my honor -- he ' s always been a good cook -- and i ' ll never forget him cleaning the chicken in the tub ' ' .	45.010487
a story , no doubt apocryphal , for mercer himself denies it , has him sporting a monacle in those village days .	299.22238
though merely clear glass , it was a distinctive trade mark for an aspiring actor who hoped to imprint himself upon the memories of producers .	72.03668
one day in a bar , so the legend goes , someone put a beer stein with too much force on the monacle and broke it .	166.553
the innocent malfeasant , filled with that supreme sense of honor found in bars , insisted upon replacing the destroyed monacle -- and did , over the protests of the former owner -- with a square monacle .	160.77306
mercer is supposed to have refused it with , `` anyone who wears a square monacle must be affected ' ' ! !	121.43276
everett miller , then assistant director for the garrick gaieties , a theatre guild production , needed a lyricist for a song he had written	68.917534
he just happened not to need any actor at the moment , however .	26.055822
for him mercer produced the lyric to `` out of breath scared to death of you ' ' , introduced in that most successful of all the gaieties , by sterling holloway .	100.94274
this 1930 edition also had songs in it by vernon duke and ira gershwin , by e . y . harburg and duke , and by harry myers .	35.67375
entrance into such stellar song writing company encouraged the burgeoning song writer to take a wife , elizabeth meehan , a dancer in the gaieties .	68.588875
the mercers took up residence in brooklyn , and mercer found a regular job in wall street `` misplacing stocks and bonds ' ' .	33.328434
when he heard that paul whiteman was looking for singers to replace the rhythm boys , mercer applied and got the job , `` not for my voice , i ' m sure , but because i could write songs and material generally ' ' .	64.38335
while with the whiteman band mercer met jerry arlen .	21.66188
he had yet to meet harold arlen , for although they had `` collaborated ' ' on `` satan ' s li ' l lamb ' ' , mercer and harburg had worked from a lead sheet the composer had furnished them .	96.041756
the lyric , mercer remembers , was tailored to fit the unusual melody .	45.74686
mercer ' s whiteman association brought him into contact with hoagy carmichael , whose `` snowball ' ' mercer relyriced as `` lazybones ' ' , in which form it became a hit and marked the real beginning of mercer ' s song-writing career .	34.679585
after leaving whiteman , mercer joined the benny goodman band as a vocalist .	23.655043
with the help of ziggy elman , also in the band , he transformed a traditional jewish melody into a popular song , `` and the angels sing ' ' .	40.75695
the countrywide success of `` lazybones ' ' and `` and the angels sing ' ' could only lead to hollywood , where , besides harold arlen , mercer collaborated with harry warren , jimmy van heusen , richard whiting , walter donaldson , jerome kern , and arthur schwartz .	40.351257
mercer has also written both music and lyrics for several songs .	52.16934
he may be the only song writer ever to have collaborated with a secretary of the u . s . treasury	19.72001
he collaborated on a song with william hartman woodin , who was secretary of the treasury , 1932-33 .	25.170698
when johnny mercer and harold arlen began their collaboration in 1940 , mercer , like arlen , had several substantial film songs to his credit , among them `` hooray for hollywood ' ' , `` ride , tenderfoot , ride ' ' , `` have you got any castles , baby ? ?	75.175514
' ' , and `` too marvelous for words ' ' ( all with richard whiting )	60.826065
with harry warren he did `` the girl friend of the whirling dervish ' ' , `` jeepers creepers ' ' , and `` you must have been a beautiful baby ' ' .	11.770604
mercer ' s lyrics are characterized by an unerring ear for rhythmic nuances , a puckish sense of humor expressed in language with a colloquial flair .	41.31403
though versatile and capable of turning out a ballad lyric with the best of them , mercer ' s forte is a highly polished quasi-folk wit .	32.266373
his casual , dreamlike working methods , often as not in absentia , were an abrupt change from harburg ' s , so that arlen had to adjust again to another approach to collaboration .	124.534294
there were times that he worked with both lyricists simultaneously .	128.94328
speaking of his work with johnny mercer , arlen says , `` our working habits were strange .	75.130905
after we got a script and the spots for the songs were blocked out , we ' d get together for an hour or so every day .	78.71988
while johnny made himself comfortable on the couch , i ' d play the tunes for him .	32.874718
after i would finish playing the songs , he ' d just go away without a comment .	83.75242
i wouldn ' t hear from him for a couple of weeks , then he ' d come around with the completed lyric ' ' .	35.64104
arlen is one of the few ( possibly the only ) composer mercer has been able to work with so closely , for they held their meetings in arlen ' s study .	56.355434
`` some guys bothered me ' ' , mercer has said .	39.200138
`` i couldn ' t write with them in the same room with me , but i could with harold .	54.653423
he often uses very odd rhythms , which makes it difficult , and challenging , for the lyric writer ' ' .	33.81983
while arlen and mercer collaborated on hot nocturne , mercer worked also with arthur schwartz on another film , navy blues .	356.4546
arlen , too , worked on other projects at the same time with old friend ted koehler .	33.290455
besides doing a single song , `` when the sun comes out ' ' , they worked on the ambitious american-negro suite , for voices and piano , as well as songs for films .	42.458252
the american-negro suite is in a sense an extension of the cotton club songs in that it is a collection of negro songs , not for a night club , but for the concert stage .	69.185196
the work had its beginning in 1938 with an eight-bar musical strain to which koehler set the words `` there ' ll be no more work	86.57309
there ' ll be no more worry ' ' , matching the spiritual feeling of the jot .	51.628384
this grew into the song `` big time comin ' ' ' .	8.911709
by september 1940 the suite had developed into a collection of six songs , `` four spirituals , a dream , and a lullaby ' ' .	25.874113
the negro composer hall johnson studied the american-negro suite and said of it , `` of all the many songs written by white composers and employing what claims to be a negroid idiom in both words and music , these six songs by harold arlen and ted koehler easily stand far out above the rest .	96.989075
thoroughly modern in treatment , they are at the same time , full of simple sincerity which invariably characterizes genuine negro folk-music and are by no means to be confused with the average ' broadway spirituals ' which depend for their racial flavor upon sundry allusions to the ' amen corner ' , ' judgement day , ' gabriel ' s horn , and a frustrated devil -- with a few random hallelujahs thrown in for good measure .	95.24457
it had a single porcelain stall and but one cabinet for the chairing of the bards .	61.295795
it was here that the terror-stricken dennis moon played an unrehearsed role during the children ' s party .	41.127243
a much larger room , adjacent to the lavatory , served as a passageway to and from the skimpy toilet .	67.12889
that unused room was large enough for -- well , say an elephant could get into it and , as a matter of fact , an elephant did .	69.85388
something occurred on the morning of the children ' s party which may illustrate the kind of trouble our restricted toilet facilities caused us .	89.92193
it so happened that sports writer arthur robinson got out of the hospital that morning after promising his doctor that he be back in an hour or two to continue his convalescence .	121.38888
arthur robinson traveled with the baseball clubs as staff correspondent for the american .	97.94741
he was ghost writer for babe ruth , whose main talent for literary composition was the signing of his autograph .	96.296684
robbie was a war veteran with battle-shattered knees .	5.66635
he arrived on crutches at the newspaper club with one of his great pals , oliver herford , artist , author , and foe of stupidity .	43.76824
mr . herford ' s appearance was that of a frustrated gnome .	22.548622
he seemed timid ( at first , ) wore nose glasses from which a black ribbon dangled , and was no bigger than a jockey .	38.938156
robinson asked herford to escort him to the club ' s lavatory before they sat down for a highball and a game of cards .	58.219837
in the jakes , after robbie and his crutches were properly stowed , mr . herford went to the adjoining facility .	38.48331
he had barely assumed his stance there when a fat fellow charged through the doorway .	164.9599
without any regard for rest-room protocol , the hulking stranger almost knocked herford off his pins .	177.37456
the artist-author said nothing , but stood to one side .	27.848713
the unrelieved stranger eventually turned away from the place of his -- shall we dare say his waterloo ? ?	232.21413
mr . herford touched the fat man ' s arm .	20.409054
may i say that you have just demonstrated the truth of an old proverb -- the younger pliny ' s , if memory serves me -- which , translated freely from the archaic latin , says , ' the more haste , the less peed ' ' ' .	81.47142
governor alfred e . smith was the official host at the children ' s party .	63.292847
united states senator royal s . copeland was wearing the robes of santa claus and a great white beard	45.437634
the honorable robert wagner , sr . , at that time a justice of the new york supreme court , was on the reception committee .	41.585426
i was in charge of the arrangements -- which were soon enough disarranged .	102.90274
i had had difficulties from the very first day .	18.479853
when , in my enthusiasm , i proposed the party , my city editor ( who disliked the club and many of its members ) tried to block my participation in the gala event .	115.80694
even earlier than that he had resented the fact that i had been chosen to edit the club ' s reporter .	27.082855
city editor victor watson of the new york american was a man of brooding suspicions and mysterious shifts of mood .	58.20779
mr . hearst ' s telegraphic code word for victor watson was `` fatboy ' ' .	21.46911
the staff saw in him the qualities of a don cossack , hence , as mentioned before , his nickname `` the hetman ' ' .	72.18712
the hetman ' s physical aspects were not those of a savage rider of the steppes .	87.500694
indeed , he looked more like a well-fleshed lay brother of the hospice of st . bernard .	77.35228
he had a purring voice and poker player ' s immobility of features which somehow conveyed the feeling that he knew where all the bodies were buried .	83.85787
he was the son of a scottish father and an american jewish mother , long widowed , with whom he lived in a comfortable home in flushing .	47.831608
he had worked in the newspaper business since he was nineteen years old , always for the hearst service .	65.374695
from the very first he regarded himself as mr . hearst ' s disciple , defender , and afterward his prime minister , self-ordained .	46.60463
it was said that the hetman plotted to take over the entire hearst newspaper empire one day by means of various coups the destruction of editors who tried to halt his course , the unfrocking of publishers whose mistakes of judgment might be magnified in secret reports to mr . hearst .	150.68393
whatever the hetman ' s ambitions , his colleagues were kept ill at ease .	140.9769
among the outstanding members of the hearst cabinet whom he successfully opposed for a time were the great arthur brisbane , bradford merrill , s . s . carvalho , and colonel van hamm .	44.605034
he also disliked runyon , for no good reason other than the fact that the demon ' s talent was so marked as to put him well beyond the hetman ' s say-so or his supervision .	64.20241
runyon , for his part , had a contemptuous regard for mr . watson .	233.65585
`` he ' s a wrong-o ' ' , said runyon , `` and i wouldn ' t trust him as far as i could throw the statue of liberty ' ' .	21.127796
arthur `` bugs ' ' baer wrote to me just recently , `` vic wanted to die in harness , with his head towards the wagon .	92.9444
he supported his mother and his brother , who afterwards committed suicide .	188.28056
watson told me that his brother always sent roses to his mother , blossoms bought with vic ' s allowance to him .	69.86847
' and would you believe it ' , vic added , ' she likes him better than she does me .	195.25572
about the only time the hetman seemed excited was when one of his own pet ideas was born .	122.834305
then he would get to his feet , as though rising in honor of his own remarkable powers , and say almost invariably , `` gentlemen , this is an amazing story ! !	124.39404
it ' s bigger than the armistice ' ' .	1.4367057
some of the hetman ' s `` ideas ' ' were dream-ridden , vaguely imparted , and at times preposterous .	41.33808
